eng: But he said he had things to do in the city.
pcm: But e tok say e get sometin to do for inside di city.

eng: Nigerians knock FG, political actors over killing
pcm: Naija pipo don carry knock give FG, and oda politics pipo concerning di kilin

eng: Nigerians on social media berated the federal government and political actors for his killing.
pcm: Naija pipo wey dey for inside social media sef don put hand for ear give federel goment and polical leader dem ova di kilin.

eng: A commentator on the Facebook link of the story published by Daily Trust, Ifeanyi Maduako, while describing Gulak death as distasteful, linked the incident with politics.
pcm: One pesin wey comment for di Facebook link wey carry di tori wey Daily Trust publish, Ifeanyi Maduako, as e tok say di death of Gulak dey bitter, kom link am with politics.

eng: This killing is very distasteful to me.
pcm: Di kilin bitter for my mouth welwel.

eng: It appears political and those behind it should be unraveled.
pcm: E be like say na politiks dem take am do, and di pipo wey do, make we open dem face.

eng: The killing will expose those behind the current insecurity in Imo State.
pcm: Di killin go expose pipo wey behind di security wahala for Imo state.

eng: Who invited him and why killing a northerner in Imo State?
pcm: Na who invite am kom, and why dem go kill northerner for Imo state.

eng: I am very afraid what fate awaits innocent Imo State people in the coming days in the hands of northern controlled security agencies, he wrote.
pcm: I dey fear wetin go do innocent Imo pipo in some days for di hand of security people wey north dey control, na so he write am.

eng: Another commentator on the thread, Oloruntobi Micheal Omo, noted:  The police report proves that this killing is political and hence calls for an in-depth investigation.
pcm: Another pesin wey comment for di thread, Olurombi Micheal Omo, tok say as police report don prove say na political kilin, say dem suppose investigate am welwel.

eng: Police I guess have some questions to answer.
pcm: E dey thingk say police pipo sef get question to nswer to.

eng: On his part, Comr Umar Hassan Ahmad wrote, The soul of our innocent people is more important than this scam which is called Nigeria unity.
pcm: For im own part, Comr Hassan Ahmad write say di soul of innocent pipo dey important pass di scam wey dem dey call Unity for naija.

eng: This illiteracy will not be acceptable to us, enough is enough we are peacemakers
pcm: We no go gree dis illiteracy, enof is enof, na peacemaker we be

eng: but those are pushing us to the wall that this peacemaking can no longer be sustained.
pcm: but doe wey dey push us go meet wall dey see say we no fit kontinu wit di peace

eng: I am warning our retaliation will be worst.
pcm: I dey send warning, we go retaliate and e go worst.

eng: Buhari you failed us woefully, am urging Imo police to confront the culprit
pcm: Buhari you don fail us woefully, and we face di Imo police pipo to follow di jaguda pipo.

eng: Nasiru Inuwa wrote, A wake up call to the northern elites, they've started with the innocent Fulani herders & now turned to northern govt officials & prominent politicians
pcm: Nasiru Inuwa sef write say na wake up call to di big pipo wey dey for north, dem begin wit innocent Fulani herders, now dem don turn to northern goment officials, plus prominent politicians.

eng: The outlawed IPOB, in a statement by its secretary, Emma Powerful, faulted reports linking it to the murder of Gulak, noting that the assassination of politicians is not part of its agenda.
pcm: Emma Powerful wey be secretary for IPOB joinbodi wey government no support, don tok for statement say make dem no link IPOB to di murder of Gulak. E tok say to kill politician dem no dey di agenda of di joinbodi

eng: We, therefore, state without equivocations that IPOB knows nothing about the said assassination.
pcm: So, we tok am say IPOB no sabi anytin about di killin wey apun.

eng: In the first place, what threat did the late Gulak constitute to our cause to warrant his elimination?
pcm: To beging with sef, how Gulak dey take threatin awa mission wey don warrant make we kill am.

eng: We had nothing in common with him and could not have in any way killed him.
pcm: We no get anytin with am, and we no for don kill am.

eng: Pointing accusing fingers at IPOB for this barbaric act is only meant to divert attention away from the real masterminds.
pcm: To dey point hand for IPOB for dis kin barbaric act na just to divert attention away from di real pipo wey do am.

eng: This is the same way terrorists in security uniform commit various atrocities in South East and turn around to blame IPOB for their crimes just to tarnish our global reputation.
pcm: Na di same way wey terrorist wey wera security uniform dey take komit atrocities for inside south east, and dem go kom IPOB for dem crime, sekk of say dem wan spoil awa reputation.

eng: This is purely a smokescreen to justify their long-awaited plan to declare another special military operation in the Eastern region to kill more innocent Biafrans.
pcm: Na opportunate wey dem don dey find for long be dis to take start anoda special military operation for inside Eastern Region to take more Biafra pipo wey dey innocent.

eng: Instead of the security agencies to properly investigate the incident and possible factors, they switch to accuse IPOB of a crime we know nothing about.
pcm: Instead make scurity pipo for do proper investigate on top di incident and things wey cause am, dem don face IPOB ova crime wey dem no do.

eng: Did IPOB have the itinerary of the late Gulak to have waylaid him at the airport?
pcm: Shey IPOB get di informate for di movement of di late Gulak reach say make dem stop am for airport road?

eng: The group said security agencies should first investigate Gulak's host, Hope Uzodinma, as well as his political opponents to establish their possible involvement.
pcm: Di group tok say make security pipo first investigate pesin wey host Gulak, dat one na Hope Uzordinma, and im political opponent, to establish if dem dey involve.

eng: Those behind Gulak's murder won't go unpunished
pcm: Dos wey kill Gulak no go escape punishment.

eng: President Muhammadu Buhari has said that those behind the murder of Gulak and other incidents across the country will not go scot free.
pcm: Presido, Muhammadu Buhari don tok say di pipo wey kill Gulak and oda wahala for inside we obodo no go go scot free.

eng: President Buhari, in a statement issued Sunday by his spokesman, Garba Shehu, expressed outrage and disgust over the heinous murder.
pcm: Presido, Buhari, for one statement wey in toktok persin, Garba Shehu, don express im outrage and disgust ova di heinous murder.

eng: The president, who expressed sadness over the incident, said: I'm repulsed by such premeditated and gruesome murder of Gulak by evil people who are determined to undermine the peace, unity and territorial integrity of our country.
pcm: Di president, wey don show say di incident make am sad, tok say: I dey repulsed by di gruesome murder of Gulak wey dey premeditated by evil pipo, wey be say dem don detrmine to dabaru di peace, unity and teritorial integriti of awa kontri.

eng: Let me warn however that nobody or group of people who engages in such despicable acts should expect to go free.
pcm: Make I kom warn say nobodi, or joinbodi wey dey do dat kind thing wey dey despicable go expect to go free.

eng: We will deploy all resources at our disposal to ensure that such callous and criminal elements are brought to justice.
pcm: We go use evritin wey we get to see say pipo wey do dis kind calous and criminal thing go face justice.

eng: Gulak's killing unacceptable Akeredolu
pcm: Akeredolu tok say di kilin of Gulak dey unacceptable.

eng: Ondo State Governor, Oluwarotimi Akeredolu described the news of the assassination as very shocking and disturbing.
pcm: Governor for Ondo state wey be Olwarotimi akeredolu be describe di news of di kilin as shockin and disturbin

eng: In a statement personally signed by the governor, he said this is one murder too many, describing the action as senseless and wicked.
pcm: Inside one statement wey di Governor imsef sign, he tok say dis one na murder too many, say do thing dey senseless and wicked.

eng: The perpetrators of this heinous act are enemies of this country.
pcm: Di pipo wey do dis kind bad thing na enemy of di kontri dem be.

eng: This contrivance is meant to mislead, confuse and destroy.
pcm: Di corner-corner way na to mislead, confuse and destroy.

eng: It bears the unmistakable, despicable imprints of fifth columnists bent on setting the country on the path of conflagration.
pcm: he get di  unmistakable, despicable imprints of fifth columnists bent on setin di kontri on di path of conflagration.

eng: These criminals must not be allowed to succeed.
pcm: dey must not allow dis criminal dem to succeed.

eng: We want to use this medium to express our solidarity with our brother, Governor of Imo State, Hope Uzodinma.
pcm: We wan use dis medium to tell awa brother, Governor of Imo state, Hope Uzordinma say we dey with am.

eng: We admonish him and other governors in the South Eastern States to brace up, and confront the current security challenge to put an end to the bloodbath in the land.
pcm: We encourage am and oda Governor dem for South Eastern states to brace up, make dem confront di security wahala to take end bloodbath for dem lan.

eng: The enemies of the people always employ the weapon of fear to create disaffection in the polity.
pcm: Di enemy of di pipo dey always use weapon of fear to create disaffection.

eng: This cowardly act is calculated to instigate Nigerians against each other, particularly Northerners, against the Igbo living outside the South East.
pcm: Di coward act na to instigate Naija pipo make dem for face each oda, make northerners for face Igbo pipo wey dey live outside South East

eng: We must confront the enemies of the people with a view to neutralising them.
pcm: We must face di enemy of di pipo, to see say we komot power for dem hand.

eng: This is definitely not the time for political correctness.
pcm: Dis one no be time to dey argue who sabi politiks pass.

eng: Banditry should not be allowed to subvert the legitimacy of the current government at all levels.
pcm: We no suppose allow bandit waka spoil di legitimacy of dis goment for all level.

eng: We call on all security agencies to collaborate with a view to unveiling the criminal elements sponsoring and undertaking terrorist acts.
pcm: we dey call on all security pipo dem to kolabo to see say dem show di criminal pipo wey dey sponsor, and dos wey dey do terorist waka.

eng: They must be punished, severely.
pcm: Dey must to punish dem severely.

eng: Lewandowski scores 41st goal, breaks 49-year-old record
pcm: Lewandowski don score 41 goals, e break 49 year old record.

eng: Robert Lewandowski, on Saturday, broke Gerd Muellera's 49-year-old record when he bagged a 41st Bundesliga goal of the campaign seconds before the final whistle on the last weekend of the season.
pcm: Robert Lewandowski, for Sunday, don break Gerd Muellera 49 year old record wen e score hin 41st Bundesliga goal for the season small seconds before refree blow final whistle for last week of di season.

eng: Mueller, 75, is suffering from severe dementia, but The Bomberâ remains an iconic figure in German football as the Bundesliga's all-time top scorer with 365 goals, well ahead of Lewandowski's tally of 277.
pcm: Mueller, wey be 75 year old, dey suffer from severe dementia, but The Bombera still dey among di iconic figure for German football as di Bundesliga all time top scorer wit 365 goals, e dey ahead of Lewandowski tally of 277

eng: Many thought
pcm: plenty thinking

eng: Mueller's record of 40 goals for Bayern Munich in 1971/72 would never be matched until Lewandowski rounded the goalkeeper to score in the same club
pcm: Mueller 40 goals for Bayern Munich wey be record for 1971/72 neva dey match until Lewandowski rounded di goalkeeper to score for di same club

eng: Lewandowski broke the record on Saturday after equalling the record last weekend.
pcm: Lewandowski break di record on Saturday afta equalling di record last week

eng: It was tense until the last second, I would have liked to have scored earlier,a relieved Lewandowski told Sky.
pcm: E dey serious until the last second, I go like to don score tey-tey, Lewandowski tell Sky

eng: Sometimes you also have to stay patient, which was difficult.
pcm: Sometimes you need to dey patient, wey dey difficult

eng: I always believed that a chance would come.
pcm: I dey always believe say chance go kom

eng: That was a special and historic moment.
pcm: dat be one special and historic moment

eng: Halilu Mohammed is the Secretary of Onions Dealers Association in Imo State.
pcm: Halilu Mohammed na im be di Secretary of di joinbodi of Onion dealer dem for Imo.

eng: In this interview, he narrated how suspected members of the outlawed Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) attacked and confiscated two trucks transporting onions to the eastern part of the country.
pcm: For Inside dis tori, he yan how pipo wey dem suspect say dem be member of Indigenous Pipo of Biafra (IPOB) take attack and marsh-leg ontop two truck wey carry onion go east of di kontri.

eng: Can you tell us how the incident happened?
pcm: You go fit yan us how di mata take hapun?

eng: Well, there were two trucks conveying onions from Kano State.
pcm: Well, e get two trucks weykari onion from Kano State.

eng: These people stopped the vehicles and seized the drivers and the vehicles and they later drove the vehicles to one side where they ransacked and sold all the onions before we could get the security agencies to get to the area.
pcm: Di pipo stop di moto, kom hold driver and di moto for hand, dem kom drive di moto go one corner wia dem dey rebag and dem sell di onions finish before security pipo rish di area.

eng: Each bag of the onion costs at least N15,000 at market price but they sold each of the bags at N9,000.
pcm: One bag of onions be, e small patapata N15,000 for market but dem sell dem N9,000 for one bag.

eng: Who are those people that carried out the attacked?
pcm: Na which pipo do di attack?

eng: Of course they were Biafran militants (IPOB), who were marching with their flags.
pcm: Na Biafria Area-bois (IPOB), wey dey wakawaka wit dia flag.

eng: They carried out the attack, looted the goods and sold each and every of the onions conveyed in the vehicle.
pcm: Dem attack, tif and sell all di market, all di onion wey dey inside di moto.

eng: Where did they carry out the attack?
pcm: Na wia dem take do di attack?

eng: The attack was carried out at the market where these vehicles were stopped and ransacked.
pcm: Na market dem do di attack, wey dem stop and tiftif for di moto.

eng: They gave out a price and sold each bag of the onions at the price of N9,000 and went away with the money.
pcm: Dem tok price kom sell all di onion N9,000 for one bag and dem carry di moni japa.

eng: Before security agencies arrived, they have already sold out all the onions in one vehicle.
pcm: Before security pipo come, dem don sell all di onion inside di moto finish.

eng: It was after security agencies have arrived then we moved the other vehicle to a safer place so that they do not attack again and possibly go with the vehicle.
pcm: Na wen security pipo kom na im we shift di second moto go corner wey gbege nor dey, make dem nor attack again or carry d moto japa patapata.

eng: Who owns the goods?
pcm: Who get di market?

eng: The onions belonged to one Alhaji Bello who also owned the trucks conveying the onions loaded from Kano to Imo state.
pcm: Na Alhaji Bello get di onion plus di truck wey carry am from Kano to Imo state.

eng: What is the estimated value of all the onions in each vehicle?
pcm: Wetin di onion wey dey inside di moto fit rish?

eng: We have estimated each of the vehicles was conveying at least 470 bags of onions.
pcm: We don calcu say e small patapata one moto dey carry 470 bag of onion.

eng: Almost 500 bags of onions looted from attacked Imo truck — Market leader
pcm: Almost 500 bags of onions na im dem tifitif for inside Imo Market oga-patapata truck wey dem attack.

eng: Fintiri mourns
pcm: Fintiri dey mourn

eng: The Governor of Adamawa State, Ahmadu Umaru Fintiri described as shocking the gruesome murder of Gulak who was a former Speaker of the Adamawa State House of Assembly.
pcm: Di Governor for Adamawa state, dat na Umara Ahmadu Fintiri don tok say di way dem kill Gulak shock am, say e be former speaker for Adamawa state.

eng: Governor Fintiri said the death was painful and a reflection of the wickedness of the wicked.
pcm: Governor Fintiri tok say di death dey painful, how wicked pipo take wicked reach.

eng: Governor Fintiri described the late Gulak as a witty, determined and practical politician whose rise in life was as a result of sheer hard work.
pcm: Governor Fintiri tok say Late Gulak na pesin wey dey witty, determined, and politician wey dey practical, wey be say as im take rise, na result of im hardwork.

eng: It is unfortunate that death has taken from us
pcm: E dey unfortunate say di death don kolekt from us

eng: Hon Ahmed Gulak in such a gruesome manner.
pcm: Hon Ahmed Gulak in day kind gruesome manner.

eng: He was a lively politician who loved and worked with everyone, and always held the interests of the country at heart.
pcm: Gulak be dis kind lively politicin wey follow evribodi work, and he dey always get di interest of di kontri for im mind.

eng: Recalling his interactions with the late Gulak, Governor Ahmadu Umaru Fintiri said, He was a brother and a mentor, and a fighter for human rights as a lawyer.
pcm: As he dey remember im interaction with late Gulak, Governor Ahmadu Umaru Fintiri tok say na broda and mentor e be, and seek of say na lawter, na human right fighter e be.

eng: Madagali community has lost a true son.
pcm: Madagali community don loss better son.

eng: In a statement issued yesterday in Yola through his Chief Press Secretary, Hunwashi Wanisoukou, the governor noted that Our country has lost an astute fighter for human rights.
pcm: For inside one statement wey im Chief Press Secretary Hunwashi Wanisoukou release for inside Yola yesterday, di governor tok say we kontri don loss one of di strong persin wey dey fight for human right.

eng: We all remember how passionate he fought for the plight of those displaced by insurgency and the downtrodden.
pcm: We all remember how passionate he fight for di pipo wey insurgency jaguda don send komot for house,  and pipo wey no too get means.

eng: ACF condemns assassination
pcm: ACF condenm di kilin

eng: The Arewa Consultative Forum (ACF) has condemned Gulak's assassination, describing it as a monumental loss to the nation.
pcm: Arewa Consultative Forum (ACF) don condenm di kilin of Gulak, dem tok say na big loss for we kontri.

eng: The ACF in a statement issued by its National Publicity Secretary, Emmanuel Yawe, said it was sad to receive news on the assassination of Ahmed Gulak describing him as a dynamic and progressive politician from the north.
pcm: Di ACF for one statement wey di national publicity secretary, Emmanuel Yawe carry komot, tok say dem dey sad to hear di kilin of Gulak, dem describe as one politician wey dey dynamic, and progressive politician wey from notrth komot.

eng: You liked or hated him that was your business.
pcm: If you like am, or you no like am, na your business be dat.

eng: May God bless him and give his family and his state, Adamawa the strength to bear this monumental loss, it stated.
pcm: Make God bless, and make he give im family and state, Adamawa, di ability to take bear di loss.

eng: Assassination part of plans to replicate 1966 coup CNG
pcm: Di kilin na part of di plan to take repeat do coup wey apun for 1966 CNG

eng: The Coalition of Northern Groups (CNG) has described Sunday's assassination of Ahmed Gulak, a prominent northern leader and former Political Adviser to former President Goodluck Jonathan as coordinated and as well as incessant attacks on police formations in Nigeria's southeast as part of a wider plan to replicate the coup of 1966.
pcm: Di coalition for Norther Groups (CNG) don describe di kilin of northern politician Ahmed Gulak wey be before before political adviser to former presido Goodluck Jonathan, say na sometin wey dem plan, and all di attack wey dem dey attack police pipo for inside Southeast of Naija, na to try repeat di coup wey apun for 1966.

eng: The CNG in a statement signed by its Spokesperson, Abdul-Azeez Suleiman said it was the reason why the northern part of the country cannot be reasonably expected to live with the south east as a nation alleging that the violent rascality by the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), the Eastern Security Network (ESN) and other armed Igbo gangs are funded, fully supported and emboldened by every component of the Igbo society at home and in the diaspora.
pcm: Di CNg for inside one statement wey dem toktok pesin Abdul-Azeez Suleiman sign tok say  na di reason why norther part of di kontri no fit live with southeast as one kontri, as dem allege say di violent way of di Indigenous Pipo of Biafra, Di eastern Security network (ESN), and oda Igbo gand dey fund, get confidence, by everi part of di Igbo society, both pipo wey home and di one wey dem dey obodo oyinbo.

eng: While Mueller scored his 40 goals over 34 league games in 1971/72, injury and squad rotation meant Lewandowski broke the record in just 29 matches.
pcm: As Mueller score hin 40 goal for 34 league games for 1971/72, injury and squad rotation mean say Lewandowski break di record for just 29 matches.

eng: Bayern scored 101 goals in the league in 1971/72 and 99 this season.
pcm: Bayern score 101 goals for league for 1971/72 and dem score 99 dis season.

eng: Physically, the 32-year-old Lewandowski is very different to Mueller, who was 26 in the 1971/72 season.
pcm: Physically, di 32 year old Lewandowski dey very different to Mueller, wey be 26 for di 1971/72 season.

eng: What is your name?
pcm: wetin be your name?

eng: Robert is an athlete, Gerd was an artist, Mueller's wife Uschi Mueller told magazine Sport Bild.
pcm: Robert be athlete, Gerd be artist, Mueller wife Uschi Mueller tell magazine wey name be Sport Bild

eng: At 1.84m and 79kgs, Lewandowski is a model athlete, renowned for his strict diet and training programme.
pcm: For 1.84m and 79kgs, Lewandowski be model athlete, e dey renowned for hin strict diet and programme.

eng: Mueller, at 1.76m and 80kgs in his prime, was nicknamedshort fat Mueller by former Bayern coach Zlatko Cajkovski.
pcm: Mueller, for 1.76m and 80kgs wen e dey young, get di nickname short fat Mueller by hin former Bayern cochi Zlatko Cajkovski

eng: The pair share an insatiable appetite for goals.
pcm: Di pair share dey always dey hungry for goals.

eng: Lewandowski has hit the net on average every 60 minutes this season, while The Bomber scored every 77 minutes in 1971/72.
pcm: Lewandowski don score on average of 60 minutes for dis season, Te Bomber score evri 77 minutes for 1971/72

eng: Lewandowski is a star player
pcm: Lewandowski be one ogbonge star player.

eng: Mueller was a copybook penalty box striker, who could transfer the ball from his right to left foot with bewildering speed.
pcm: Mueller be ogbonge role model striker, wey fit pass ball from hin right leg to left leg sharperly.

eng: His low centre of gravity helped Mueller steal an edge over defenders in the first few metres.
pcm: Hin low centre of gravity help Mueller dey ahead of defenders for di first few meters

eng: Given a sniff of goal, he was an ice-cool finisher.
pcm: Wen hin see chance to score, hin be ogbonge finisher.

eng: Lewandowski is just as dynamic, but in contrast to Mueller, he is happy to shoot from outside the box or use the space to outsprint defenders.
pcm: Lewandowski dey dynamic, but hin also dey different from Mueller, hin dey always dey hapi to shoot from outside box eighteen or make hin use speed pass defenders.

eng: They share the killer instinct when the ball is near goal, often being alert to a rebound and waiting until the last second to pounce, as Lewandowski demonstrated on Saturday.
pcm: Dem share same sense wen ball don reach level wey e fit turn goal, dem always dey dey alert for rebound and dey ready for pounce, like how Lewandowski do am on Saturday

eng: How it started
pcm: How e take start.

eng: Lewandowski started 2020/21 with a bang, converting a penalty and providing two assists in an 8-0 thrashing of the Schalke, a record result for the opening game of a Bundesliga season.
pcm: Lewandowski start 2020/21 wit a bang, hin score a penalty and provide two assit for dia 8-0 win over Schalke, a record result for first game for Bundesliga season.

eng: He failed to score in the next game, a shock 4-1 loss at Hoffenheim, but provided all four goals, including a late match-winning penalty in a nervy 4-3 home win over Hertha Berlin last October.
pcm: Hin no score for the next game, dem scock as dem lose 4-1 for Hoffenheim, but hin score all di four goals, plus di late match-winning penalty for dia 4-3 home win against Hertha Berlin for October.

eng: He was rested for one game in late October after scoring ten goals in his first five games, then hit a purple patch with 25 in 20 league games.
pcm: Dem rest am for one game, for last October afta scoring ten goals for hin first five games, before hin kom reach 25 goals for 20 league games.

eng: A knee injury playing for Poland in late March left Lewandowski on 35 goals after a hat-trick against Stuttgart.
pcm: Lewandowski get knee injury wen hin dey play for poland wen hin dey 35 goals afta hat-trick against Stuttgart.

eng: After three weeks out, he returned with a goal in the shock loss at Mainz before hitting a hat-trick in the 6-0 home win over Moenchengladbach which won Bayern the title.
pcm: Afta three weeks out, hin kom back wit a goal in shock loss for Mainz before hin hit hat-trick of 6-0 for home against Moenchengladbach wey win Bayern the title.

eng: While Lewandowski has scored consistently, Mueller had sporadic purple patches, netting just three goals in the first nine games of the 1971/72 season.
pcm: While Lewandowski don score consistently, Mueller get sporadic purple patches, dey score just three goals for di first nine games for 1971/72 season.

eng: However, he had scored 18 goals by the halfway point, including four in an 11-1 thrashing of Dortmund in November 1971.
pcm: Hin don score 18 goals by halfway point, plus four for 11-1 thrashing of Dortmund for November 1971

eng: He then hit five goals in a 7-0 thrashing of Oberhausen which sparked a run of 16 goals in just seven games, finishing the season with six goals in three games.
pcm: Hin den score 5 goals for 7-0 beating of Oberhausen wey reach 16 goals for just seven games, finishing di season wit six goals for three games.

eng: BPE, education ministry among 20 outstanding MDAs
pcm: BPE, education ministry wey dey among 20 outstanding MDAs

eng: The Bureau of Public Enterprises (BPE), Ministry of Education, and the Ministry of Transportation are among the Ministries, Departments and Agencies (MDAs) named as the 20 Most Outstanding MDAs in Nigeria this year.
pcm: Di Bureau of Public Enterprises (BEP), Ministry of Education, and di Ministry of Transpotation dey among di Ministries, Departments and Agencies (MDAs) wey dem name as di 20 Most Outstanding MDAs for Nigeria dis year.

eng: This was disclosed by the CEO, Profiles & Biographies, Mr. Kammonke Abam, in a statement in Abuja, as an update on the firm's research and compilation of the accomplishments of MDAs to mark the sixth anniversary of the current administration.
pcm: Na di CEO, Profiles & Biographies, Mr. Kammonke Abam, tok am, for one statement for Abuja, as part of update on the company research and compilation of di accomplishments of MDAs to celebrate di sisth anniversary.

eng: He said the assessment result is relative to the MDAs fulfilling their ministerial mandate in line with the administration's 9-point development agenda, and his firm's evaluation benchmark.
pcm: Hin tok say di assessment result dey relative to di MDAs fulfiling dia ministerial mandate in line wit di administration 9-point development agenda, and him firm evaluation benchmark.

eng: Abam said the firm adopted an evaluation benchmark based on five criteria of relevance, efficiency, effectiveness, impact and sustainability in assessing all the MDAs in line with best practice.
pcm: Abam tok say di firm adopt an evaluation benchmark based on five criteria of relevance, efficiency, effectiveness, impact and sustainability in assessing all di MDAs in line wit best practice.

eng: It is pointed out, with some justification too, that because this control and dominance work to their advantage, Fulani political aristocracy always works against the attempts by other ethnic groups for the enthronement of a just, equitable and inclusive Nigeria for all.
pcm: Dem don point am out, wit som justification too, say sake of say dis kontrol and dominance work to dia advantage, Fulani political aristocracy dey always work against di attempt of oda  ethnic group for di enthronement of a just, equitable and inclusive Nigeria for all.

eng: Although this accusation against the Fulani has been on for years now, at no time has it become more pronounced than in the present time under the administration of President Muhammadu Buhari who happens to be a Fulani man.
pcm: Even say dis accusation against Fulani don dey for years now, no time wey e dey more pronounced pass dis present time unda di administration of President Muhammadu Buhari wey be Fulani man.

eng: Although some will dismiss this as part of the stuff of politics in Nigeria, the claim that Fulani wield and retain a disproportionate slice of political power to the detriment and exclusion of others is not totally unfounded, nor is it untrue that the Fulani political aristocracy has sought to perpetuate this control through a subtle agenda of exclusive empowerment and appointment into the strategic areas of the countrys polity and economy.
pcm: Even say som go troway dis as part of di stuff of politiks for Nigeria, di claim say Fulani dey kontrol and retain large amount of political power in a way wey e affect and komot odas, no dey totally wrong. No be lie say di Fulani political aristocracy don find way to prolong dis kontrolthroughmago-mago agenda of exclusive empowerment and appointment for di strategic areas of di kontri polity and economy.

eng: This fulanisation agenda has predictably turned the other ethnic groups including even the closest, the Hausa, against the Fulani especially as the latter are fingered as being responsible for the banditry, kidnapping and other violent crimes in the North west of the country.
pcm: Dis fulanisation agenda, as we expect, don turn oda ethnic group includin Hausa wey be di closest, against di Fulani, especially as dem don point am say na Fulani bin dey responsible for di banditry, kidnappin and oda violent crimes for North-West of di kontri.

eng: In the current situation that Nigeria finds itself, it is no longer feasible for the Fulani to continue to exercise the skewered and disproportionate control of political power.
pcm: In di current situation wey Nigeria dey, e no dey feasible again for Fulani to kontinue dey exercise di skewered and large kontrol of political power.

eng: This not only creates a dangerous imbalance in the polity; it also fosters a feeling and tendency by politically excluded ethnic groups to seek ways of disrupting the polity as we are having it now.
pcm: Dis no go only create a dangerous imbalance in di polity; e go also bring up a feelin, and tendency by di ethnic groups wey dem komot for politiks, to find ways wey dem go take disrupt di polity as we dey get am now.

eng: For Nigeria to get out of the dangerous quagmire of uncertainty currently building up, we must address the issue of a skewered political and economic control of Nigeria exercised by the powerful and influential ethnic groups to the exclusion of others.
pcm: For Nigeria to kommot for di dangerous situation of doubt wey dey build up currently, we must to address di issue of a bias political and economic kontrol of Nigeria, wey di powerful and influential ethnic groups dey show, to di exclusion of odas.

eng: Another issue that hangs around Nigerian politics and governance like an albatross has to do with our dangerous attachments to ethnic and religious leanings and seeking to interpret everything in our country along those lines.
pcm: Anoda mata wey hang around Nigerian politiks and governance like burden wey dey pesin neck, get to do wit awa dangerous attachment to ethnic and religious ways, and awa effort to interpret evritin for awa kontri along dose lines.

eng: We are not Nigerians in the true sense of the word.
pcm: We no be Nigerians for di true sense of di word.

eng: Our sense of ourselves as Nigerians is defined to a large extent only by the geographical area covering the country rather than by shared values and identities.
pcm: Awa sense of togedaness as Nigerians to a large extent dey defined only by di land wey join all of us togeda rada dan by di value and identity wey we share togeda.

eng: We identify ourselves more from our ethnic and religious perspective at the expense of the Nigeria we all belong.
pcm: Na base on my-pipo, una-pipo and my-religion una-religion level we take dey relate wit eachoda, rada dan as Nigerians wey we all be.

eng: The proclivity to play the ethnic and religious card has become so pervasively self-perpetuating that where it is not even necessary, we try to invoke it just to assure ourselves that this is the normal thing to do.
pcm: Di proclivity to play di ethnic and religious card don becom so pervasively sef-perpetuatin to di extent say wia e no even dey necessari, we go try to invoke am jus to assure awaself say dis na di normal tin to do.

eng: If the ethnic card does not apply, we reach for the religious card and where the religious card does not, we apply the ethnic card.
pcm: If my-pipo, una-pipo card no wok, we go use my-religion, una-religion card, and for wia dat wan no work, we go use di my-pipo una-pipo own.

eng: We have come to believe so much in these factors as a yardstick for just about everything we do that, like an addict hooked on the self-deceiving exhilaration of the substance, we just cannot muster the courage to kick the habit even as we know how injurious it is to our body politic.
pcm: We don too biliv dis factors as yardstick for almost evritin wey we do, sotey like addict wey dey deceive e sef on di happiness of takin substance, we just fit no gada di courage to kick di habit. Even say we sabi how harmful e be to awa bodi politic.

eng: Swiatek to face ex-champ Pliskova in Rome final
pcm: Swiatek go face befor-befor champion Pliskova for Rome final.

eng: French Open champion Iga Swiatek warned she was ready for anyone as she takes on former winner Karolina Pliskova in the Italian Open final on Sunday.
pcm: French Open champion Iga Swiatek don yarn say she dey ready for anybodi, as she and befor-befor winner Karolina Pliskova go face each-oda for Italian Open final for Sunday.

eng: Ex-world
pcm: Befor-befor world.

eng: Pliskova saw off Croatia
pcm: Pliskova beat Croatia.

eng: Petra Martic 6-1, 3-6, 6-2 to return to the final of a tournament she won in 2019 and finished runner-up last year.
pcm: Petra Martic 6-1, 3-6, 6-2 don qualify for anoda final of di tournament wey she win for 2019 and finish second last year.

eng: Ninth seed Pliskova is the only top 10 player remaining but faces a battle with 19-year-old Swiatek, who continued her Roland Garros warm-up with back-to-back wins on Saturday.
pcm: Ninth seed Pliskova na di only top 10 player wey remain wey go face battle wit 19-year-old Swiatek, wey kontinue her Roland Garros warm-up wit back-to-back win for Saturday.

eng: Swiatek first ousted fifth seed Elina Svitolina, a two-time Rome winner, 6-2, 7-5 in 1hr 36min in their quarterfinal match which had been pushed back from Friday because of rain.
pcm: Swiatek first komot fifth seed Elina Svitolina, wey be two-time Rome winner, 6-2, 7-5 for 1hr 36min in dia quarterfinal match wey dem postpone from Friday becos of rain.

eng: She then saw off 17-year-old American Coco Gauff 7-6 (7/3), 6-3 in the semifinals in 1hr 45min.
pcm: She kom win 17-year-old American Coco Gauff 7-6 (7/3), 6-3 in di semifinals for 1hr 45min.

eng: I knew it was going to be tough, said the 15th-seed of her marathon day.
pcm: I sabi say e go tough, na di numba 15-seed of her marathon day tok am.

eng: I played with no expectations.
pcm: I no get mind to win or loose as I dey play.

eng: I was taking it step by step.
pcm: I dey take am step by step.

eng: Beating Elina shows that my game is here, Im ready for anyone.
pcm: Beatin Elina show say my game dey hia, I ready for anybodi.

eng: It really gave me a confidence boost.
pcm: E really gimme confidence.

eng: If my game is going to be there tomorrow, I can do anything.
pcm: If my game go dey dere tomorro, I fit do anytin.

eng: Politicians with analogue ideas should not rule Nigeria again  Sowore
pcm: Make Politicians wey get analogue ideas no rule Nigeria again - Sowore

eng: A former presidential aspirant of the African Action Congress (AAC), Omoyele Sowore, said the inability of President Muhammadu Buhari to meet up with his campaign promises to make Nigeria a better nation is a wake-up call to stop electing leaders with analogue ideas.
pcm: Befor-befor presidential aspirant of di Afrikan Action Congress (AAC), Omoyele Sowore, don tok say di inability of President Muhammadu Buhari to meet up wit him campaign promises to make Nigeria a beta nation na wake-up call for us to stop to dey elect leaders wit analogue ideas.

eng: Sowore, during the 3rd NEC meeting of AAC in Abuja, said the presidents inaction while the security situation of the country persisted indicated that he lacked novel ideas to confront the situation facing the country.
pcm: Sowore, durin di 3rd NEC meetin of AAC for Abuja, tok say di inaction of di president on top security mata for di kontri show say e lack new ideas on how to confront di situation wey dey face di kontri.

eng: For the progress of the country, people with absolutely old and analogue ideas cannot continue to run a digital country like Nigeria.
pcm: For di progress of di kontri, pipo wey get completely old and analogue ideas no fit kontinue to rule a digital kontri like Nigeria.

eng: Nigeria is going down in the hands of incompetent leaders that have no compassion for its citizenry and refused to deliver on their duties, he said
pcm: Nigeria dey go down for di hand of incompetent leaders wey no get compassion for im citizens and kom refuse to deliver on dia duties,  e tok.

eng: No public access to Capitol grounds during Biden inauguration  Police
pcm: Police don yarn say members of di public no go get access to di Capitol floor durin Biden inauguration.

eng: There will be no public access to the Capitol grounds during Joe Bidens inauguration as U.S. president on Jan. 20, acting Capitol Police chief Yogananda Pittman said.
pcm: Actin oga pata-pata of Capitol Police, Yogananda Pittman tok say public access no go dey to di Capitol floor durin Joe Biden inauguration as U.S. president on Jan. 20.

eng: Pittman took over the leadership from Steven Sund after he stepped down amid criticism of the forces handling of rioters who breached the Capitol building last week.
pcm: Pittman take over leadership from Steven Sund afta Sund step down becos of plenti criticism on how police take handle pipo wey riot for di Capitol building last week.

eng: She said law enforcement from the federal, state and local levels were working together and comprehensive, coordinated plans were in place to ensure safety.
pcm: She tok say law enforcement agents from di federal, state and local level dey work togeda, and comprehensive, coordinated plan don dey ground to ensure safety.

eng: Several police officers have been suspended as investigations into the January 6 riot continue, she said.
pcm: She tok say dem don suspend plenti police officers as dem continue to dey investigate di January 6 riot.

eng: Why Zuba fruit market needs urgent intervention
pcm: Reason why Zuba fruit market need kia-kia intervention.

eng: For traders and farmers of fruits and vegetables in the country, the Zuba international market, as it is called, is a major selling hub.
pcm: For traders and farmers wey dey sell fruit and vegetables in di kontri, di Zuba international market, as dem dey call am, na major selling place.

eng: The market serves not only the Federal Capital Territory (FCT) but neighbouring states as well.
pcm: No be only di Federal Capital Territory (FCT) dis market dey serve but all di states wey dey around too.

eng: No doubt, the market is a source of income for thousands of people, mostly women and young ones trading in fresh produce in and around Abuja, the nations capital.
pcm: No be lie say di market na wia thouands of pipo dey see moni, most of dis pipo be women and small pikin wey dey buy and sell fresh produce inside and around Abuja wey be di nation capital.

eng: Hundreds of tonnes of fruits like oranges, pawpaw, banana, plantain, pineapple, coconut, watermelon and others, as well as vegetables, make it to the market daily.
pcm: Na plenti tonnes of fruits like orange, pawpaw, banana, plantain, pineapple, coconut, watermelon, vegetable and odas, dey enta di market evriday.

eng: Our reporter who visited the market on Tuesday witnessed increased activities around imported apple and coconut businesses as a major wholesale ground for retailers.
pcm: Awa tori-pesin wey go di market on Tuesday see say buying and selling plenti for imported apple and coconut business, and di market na major wholesale ground for people wey wan re-sell.

eng: Over 70 percent of the fruits consumed in the FCT and neighbouring states come from this market, where thousands congregate as early as 5am every day to do business.
pcm: Na dis market over 70 percent of di fruits wey dem dey chop inside di FCT and states wey dey around dey from kom. Pipo gada as earli as 5am evriday to do business.

eng: Tonnes of plantain displayed for sale in the market on Tuesday.
pcm: Plenti tonnes of plantain na im dem display to sell in di market on Tuesday.

eng: However, despite the huge potentials of the market to strengthen the horticultural business locally and internationally, there are challenges that have remained for many years.
pcm: Even say dis market get big potentials to strengthen di agric business locally and internationally, e get plenti challenges wey don dey for many years.

eng: The market is still very much unorganized, and the fruits are mostly placed on dirty grounds, raising serious public health concern, especially as the country joins the rest of the world to combat the COVID-19 pandemic.
pcm: Di market still dey very rough, and na dirty ground dem dey put all di fruits. Dis dey make pipo worri on di health implication, especially as di kontri dey follow di rest of di world fight COVID-19  disease.

eng: Also, fresh fruits share common ground with rotten ones and wastages that are already infested with germs and diseases.
pcm: Also, na di same place dem dey pack fresh fruits and rotten ones put, and even di ones wey be wastage wey don get germs and diseases.

eng: Dusts from thousands of legs walking around the filthy environment also expose many people to germs, making them vulnerable to diseases.
pcm: Plenti pipo also dey open to germs wey dey cause diseases becos of di dust from many legs wey dey walk for di dirty environment.

eng: Again, the absence of necessary infrastructures like cold rooms, good road network, water, standard shops, clean ground facilities for placing fruits, and a host of other factors heighten major safety concern and place everyone eating fruits in Abuja and its environs at high risk.
pcm: Again, di lack of necessary tins like cold room, gud road, water, standard shops, clean ground wey dem go dey put di fruits, and odas dey increase pipo concern on how safe di fruits dey, and e dey put evribodi wey dey chop fruits for Abuja and nearby at high risk.

eng: But despite these challenges, activities in the market put money in the pockets of many and generate revenue for the government too.
pcm: But even as dis challenges dey so, activities for di market dey put moni for many pipo pocket, and e dey generate revenue for di government too.

eng: Our reporter spoke to a number of farmers and dealers who have been doing business in the area for many years.
pcm: Awa tori-pesin follow som farmers and dealers who don dey do business for di area for plenti years tok.

eng: Tarsoo Alex, who has orange orchards in Vandikya, Benue State, said he supplied over 60 bags of oranges to the market on Tuesday.
pcm: Tarsoo Alex, who get orange farm for Vandikya, Benue State, tok say e supply more dan 60 bag of orange to di market on Tuesday.

eng: But he lost about five bags to excessive heat, occasioned by scorching sun.
pcm: But na about five bag e loose becos of too much heat, wey di plenti sun cause.

eng: He was afraid that if buyers did not come early, he could lose more.
pcm: E dey fear say if buyers no kom early, e fit loose more.

eng: According to him, a bag of oranges costs between N6,000 and N7,500, but his income is significantly reduced by huge cost of transportation from his farm in Benue to Zuba.
pcm: As e tok, 1 bag of orange na between N6,000 and N7,500, but im profit don too reduce becos of transportation wey cost from im farm for Benue to Zuba.

eng: To address the issue of wastages, he said many of the farmers were embracing jute bags, which allow air to penetrate instead of polythene bags that generate excessive heat for the fruits.
pcm: To stop di issue of wastage, e tok say plenti of di farmers don dey use jute bags, wey go allow air enter, instead of nylon bag wey go cause plenti heat for di fruits.

eng: Unlike oranges, plantains are everywhere now because this is its season, a young man who preferred to be simply called Pastor told our reporter.
pcm: Unlike orange, plantain dey evriwia now becos na di season be dis, one young man wey go like make dem call am just Pastor na im tell awa tori-pesin dis.

eng: He said that before noon, all the plantains would have been bought.
pcm: E tok say befor aftanoon, dem go don buy all di plantain finish.

eng: He helps farmers to sell their produce.
pcm: E dey help farmers sell dia market.

eng: It is usually sold in dozens (12 bunches), which cost between N5,000 and N8,000, depending on the size of the bunches on each unit of 12.
pcm: Na for dozen  (12 bunch) dem dey sell am, and na between N5,000 and N8,000, as each one big reach.

eng: Watermelons are sorted as grades 1, 2 and 3, with 50 pieces in each dozen.
pcm: Na grade by grade dem dey select Watermelons, from grade 1, 2 and 3, and na 50 pieces dey for each dozen.

eng: Their prices also depend on grades, with the least costing as low as N9,000.
pcm: Dia price also depend on d grade, u fit get di smallest one for N9,000.

eng: Regular customers can get lower prices.
pcm: Regular customer fit get am for lower price.

eng: The same selling pattern goes for pawpaw and pineapples, but coconut is sold in bags while apples are graded and sold in cartons.
pcm: Na di same way dem dey sell pawpaw and pineapple, but na for bag dem dey sell coconut, while na for carton dem dey sell apple, but na grade dem dey grade am too.

eng: In 2018, Daily Trust on Sunday uncovered a massive use of carbide to ripen fruits in the market, which health experts said could cause cancer.
pcm: On one Sunday for 2018, Daily Trust discover plenti place wia dem dey use carbide to make fruit ripe for di market. Plenti health expert don yarn say dis fit cause cancer.

eng: The report eventually led to a crackdown on perpetrators by the market union leaders through their task force.
pcm: Di report na im make di market union leaders go use dia task force arrest di culprits.

eng: Our reporter observed a significant improvement as the chemical is no longer seen to be used as was the previous practice.
pcm: Awa tori-pesin observe say big improvement dey, as dem no see anybodi dey use di chemical like befor again.

eng: After the conclusion of the committee's sitting, Gulak stayed back while other members of the committee departed the city on Friday.
pcm: As di committee be don conclude dem sitting, Gulak be saty back when oda member of di committee be komot di city for Friday.

eng: A source close to Senator Orji Uzor Kalu, who chaired the public hearing in Owerri said the deceased was offered to fly on Kalu's private jet after the public hearing, but he declined.
pcm: Pesin wey dey close to Senator Orji Uzor kalu, wey be chairman for di public hearing wey apun for inside Owerri, tok say dem offer di deceased private wey be Kalu own afta di siddon tok, but e refuse am.

eng: According to the source, Kalu's team left Owerri on the day the public hearing ended but Gulak stayed behind saying he had things to do in the city.
pcm: According to di source, Kalu team be leave di city di day wey di public hearin end, but Gulak stay back, tok say e get things to do for di city.

eng: The source said:  We left Owerri on the day the public hearing ended and we asked him to join us on our private jet and we had enough security with us.
pcm: Di source tok say " we komot Owerri di day wey di publik hearin finish, and we tell am say make e join us inside awa private jet, say we get enough security with us.

eng: How corpse of missing Civil Defence officer was discovered in a shallow grave
pcm: How dem take see dedi bodi of pesin wey be civil defence officer for grave wey no deep.

eng: The remains of a female officer of the Nigerian Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) who went missing 18 months ago has been discovered in a shallow grave in Obi Local Government Area of Benue State.
pcm: di dead bodi of woman officer wey dey work for Nigeria  Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) wey dem don dey find for 18 month, na im dem don see for grave wey no deep inside Obi Local Goment area for inside Benue state.

eng: Until she went missing, the deceased, Josephine Cynthia Inalegwu Onche, was serving at an NSCDC post in the Otukpo area of the state.
pcm: until by di time wey dem no see am again, Josephine Cynthia Inalegwu Onche, dey work for NSCDC office wey dey for Otukpo.

eng: Cynthia, an Idoma native of Otukpo origin, suddenly went missing while her wedding plans were underway.
pcm: Cynthia na Idoma, and na Otukpo she for come, just miss wen dem be dey plan her marriage.

eng: Some of her colleagues who didn't want their names on print, narrated that the family of the deceased had reported her disappearance few days to her wedding in December 2019.
pcm: some of her work pipo wey no want make we write dem name tok say na her family pipo kom report say dem no fit find am again when her marriage remain small days.

eng: She was said to have gone to the market to buy some items in preparation for her wedding but never made it back home.
pcm: Wetin dem tok be say she be go market go buy things as she dey prepare for her marriage, but she no return home since.

eng: One of the deceased colleagues said several efforts to locate her did not yield results until a commercial motorcyclist disclosed where she was buried.
pcm: one of di office pipo of di pesin wey die tok say as dem try to find am reach, dem no see am until one okada man kom show dem wia dem burry am.

eng: The cyclist was said to have told the family of the deceased that their daughter was allegedly killed and buried by her husband-to-be for ritual purposes.
pcm: Di okadaman na im tell di family pipo say na di oga wey wan marry dem pikin kill am, use am do rotual for money.

eng: Thereafter, he (cyclist) had led the family and security operatives to arrest the groom who in turn led the police to Ogun State where they arrested the native doctor alleged to have performed the ritual at Obi LGA before his relocation to a south west state.
pcm: Afta na im di okadaman carry di family pipo and security dem go arrest di man, di man kom carry dem go the baba wey do the ritual for Obi local goment, before im waka enter South-West state.

eng: While the suspected killer groom and the native doctor had been allegedly held by the police in Otukpo, the family of the late security personnel exhumed her remains and organised a burial on Tuesday, June 1st, 2021.
pcm: wen police don catch di husband and im herbalist for Otukpo, di family pipo of di pesin wey die don go komot di bodi for wia dem bury am, kom organise burial for am on to June 1, 2021.

eng: Spokesperson of the Benue Police command, DSP Catherine Anene, did not answer calls or react to messages sent to her over the development.
pcm: Call, or answer message wey dem sent give am on top di thing wey apun. DSP Catherine Anene, wey be toktok pesin for Benue police dem no gree carry.

eng: Contacted, the State Command Public Relations Officer of NSCDC, ASC Ejelikwu Michael, declined comments, promising that he would speak on the issue at a later date.
pcm: Di toktok persin for NSCDC for di state, Asc Ejelikwu Micheal no gree tok anytin when we meet am, he tok sya he go tok when time reach.

eng: But an insider said the news of Cynthia's corpse being found has thrown the command into mourning again.
pcm: But persin wey be insider tok say di news of di dedibodi wey dem find don put sadness for di security pipo mind again.

eng: Constitution review: Shariah was in south west before Christianity MURIC
pcm: For di review wey wan do for constitution: MURIC tok say sharia don dey for SouthWest  before Christianity enter.

eng: The Muslim Rights Concern (MURIC) has asked the Pentecostal Fellowship of Nigeria (PFN) to mind its business and stop opposing the Muslims right to operate Shariah.
pcm: Di joinbodi wey be Muslim Right Concern don tell di Penticostal Fellowship of Nigeria (PFN) say make dem stop to dey oppose muslim, make dem mind dem business.

eng: MURIC Director, Prof. Ishaq Akintola, said this in a statement on Sunday.
pcm: Di director of MURIC, Professor Ishaq Akintola na im tok  am on Sunday.

eng: This followed a warning the PFN  issued against the move by any group to introduce Sharia law to the South-West through the ongoing constitutional review being carried out by the Senate.
pcm: He tok dis one afa di warnin wey  PFN give say make any group no use di review of constitution wey senate dey do carry shariah law enter south-west.

eng: PFN and other Christian groups are fully aware that Shariah was in the South West decades before the arrival of Christianity in 1842.
pcm: PFN and oda Christian joinbodi know say shariah be dey for south-west before christianity enter for 1842.

eng: Shariah was practiced in Ede under Oba Abibu Olagunju (Habeeb, a Muslim name) and
pcm: Dem be dey practice shariah for Ede, during by di time of oba Abeeb Olagunju (Abbeb na muslim name) and say

eng: the Ede Shariah Court operated up till 1913 at Agbeni area of the town.
pcm: Di shariah court for Ede still dey work enter 1913, for Agbeni inside di town.

eng: It was moved to Agbongbon area in 1914.
pcm: Dem carry am go Agbongbon for 1914.

eng: Shariah was applied in Iwo under Oba Momodu Lamuye (Muhammad Lamuye) who died in 1906.
pcm: Dem use shariah for Iwo durin by Di time of Oba Momodu Lamuye (Muhammad Lamuye), wey die for 1906.

eng: Even the seventh Akirun of Ikirun, Oba Aliyu Oyewole (died 1912), instituted Shariah in Ikirun in 1910.
pcm: Even sef, di nomba svevn Akirun of Ikirun, wey be oba Aliyu Oyewole (wey die for 1912) carry shariah enter Ikirun for 1910.

eng: These are just examples of the existence and spread of Shariah in Yorubaland and the Christian leaders are not oblivious of the fact that it was the British Christian colonialists who stopped Shariah in Yorubaland and imposed Christian common law, Akintola said.
pcm: All dis na example say shariah don dey, and e don dey spread for Yorubaland, and to tok say di christian people sef sabi say na christian people stop shariah for Yorubaland, wey dem comeimpose christian common law. As Akintola tok am.

eng: He added that the PFN and other Christians are equally aware of the rising tide of Islamic awareness in the same South West and that they were only afraid that the sleeping giant is waking up to take back what belongs to it.
pcm: He tok say PFN and some oda christian joinbodi sef sabi say islamic waka don dey grow for south west, and na fear dey catch dem say di giant wey dey sleep don wake to kom carry wetin belong to am.

eng: He said, Our Christian neighbours know well that Shariah is the Allah-given fundamental human right of Muslims.
pcm: He tok say di christian dem know say shariah na di right wey Allah don carry dash Muslims.

eng: But they are determined to deprive us of it using unorthodox methods.
pcm: But dem don determin say dem no go allow Muslims use am, say na di new way dem go dey use.

eng: They believe they are at war with Muslims and to them, everything is fair in war.
pcm: Dem get am for mind say na war dem dey follow muslim people fight, and say nothingg bad for war.

eng: They are using both fair and foul means to achieve their objective.
pcm: Dem dey use both good and bad ways to take do wetin dey dem mind.

eng: We call on Nigerians to understand the siege mentality of our Christian neighbours.
pcm: Dem don dey call Naija pipo say make dem follow understand di mentality of di Christian pipo wey dey here.

eng: Like all aggressors, they believe that attack is the best form of defence.
pcm: As e dey be for evribodi wey dey quick vex, dem belif say na to dey attack pipo, na di only way wey dem fit take defend be dat.

eng: As the benefactors and inheritors of colonial rampage that lasted more than a century, they are determined to keep all the loot which their principal bequeathed to them.
pcm: As per say na dem gain from di colonial jaguda wey reach a century that time,  dem wan kip all di things wey dem colonial oga fit carry give dem.

eng: They are determined to keep the Muslims in a concentration camp into which the colonial masters drove them.
pcm: dem don get am for mind say dem go put muslim pipo inside di place wey colonial dem dem be chase dem put.

eng: The Constitution Review Panel asked Nigerians to forward their views regarding what they want in the constitution.
pcm: Di joinbodi wey dey review constitution don tok say make Nigeria pipo write wetin dem want for inside constitution kom.

eng: Each group is supposed to submit its needs.
pcm: Each group suppose bring di things wey dem need kom.

eng: But instead of telling the panel what the Christians want, PFN has gone ahead to say what they do not want Muslims to ask for.
pcm: Instead make PFN tell di joinbodi wetin  di christians dem want, na wetin dem think say make di christians no ask dem dey tok.

eng: It is an attempt to gag Muslims in the South West and it will not work.
pcm: Dem wanuse am block muslim pipo wey dey for south, but e no go work.

eng: He said that the claim of religious tolerance in the South-West is a sham and a mantra designed to keep Yoruba Muslims in perpetual slavery.
pcm: E tok say as dem dey tok say religious tolerance dey for south, say na lie, and dem dey tok am to put Yoruba pipo wey be muslim for inside slavery.

eng: Muslims in the region are waking up and asking for freedom.
pcm: Muslim pipo wey dey for di region don dey open eye, kom dye ask for freedom.

eng: We demand a halt to the forceful use of Christian school uniform, Christian education, Christian law.
pcm: we deamnd say make dem stop as dem dey force us to dey wear christian school uniform, to dey go christian school, to dey use christian law.

eng: We demand civil Shariah, not criminal Shariah that involves the cutting of hands but civil Shariah to regulate Muslim marriages, inheritance, family affairs.
pcm: we want shariah wey no dey cut pipo hand, but di shariah wey go dey regulate muslim marriage dem, inherritance and family affair dem.

eng: It has nothing to do with Christians.
pcm: Di thing no concern christians at all.

eng: We will use every peaceful and constitutional means available to attain this objective,he added.
pcm: We go use all di way wey no go kos fight, wey follow law, to do di thing. As e take tok am.

eng: Stakeholders in Edo South affirm Obaseki as party leader
pcm: stakeholder dem for Edo don tok say Obaseki na parti leader.

eng: Following the internal crisis rocking the Edo State chapter of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) over who controls the party structure, members of the Edo South Senatorial district of the party Sunday passed a vote of confidence on the state Governor, Godwin Obaseki and his Deputy, Philip Shaibu.
pcm: As di People's Democratic Party for Edo state get crisis of who go dey control di parti, member or Edo South of the parti, dem don tok say na di state govnro, Godwin Obaseki and im deputy, Philip Shaibu dey good.

eng: Edo South PDP in a communique issued at the end of its stakeholders meeting in Benin City, at the weekend, also affirmed Governor Obaseki as the leader of the party in the state.
pcm: Edo South PDP for iside one communique wey dem issue at di end of di stakeholder meetin for weekend inside Benin city, tok say Godwin Obaseki na leader of di parti for inside di state.

eng: The communiqu read by its Secretary, Wilson Evbuomwan, also said the stakeholders supported harmonisation and integration of new entrants into the executive committee of the party for effective development of the state.
pcm: For di communiques wey di secretary, Wilson Evbuonwam read, he tok say dem support di harmonization and integration of new pipo into di executive committee of di parti, say make di state for develop welwel.

eng: Police nab suspected kidnappers, recover guns in Abuja
pcm: police don catch persin wey dem thingk say na kidnapper for Abuja, dem even kolekt guns.

eng: The FCT Police Command has arrested eight suspected kidnappers along Shenegu-Tunga Maje, Gwagwalada, Kabusa village and Durumi axis of Abuja.
pcm: Di Police komand wey dey for FCT don arrest eight suspected kidnappers for Shenegu-Tunga Maje, Gwagwalada, Kabusa village and Durumi axis of Abuja.

eng: Spokesperson of the command, ASP Maryam Yusuf, who disclosed this in a statement in Abuja, yesterday, gave the names of the  suspects as Yakubu Ahmadu, Ibrahim Mallam Musa, and Bello Haruna.
pcm: Di toktok persin for di comand, dat ona na ASP Maryam Yusuf, wey tok am one siddon tok for inside Abuja, tok say di name of di suspect na Yakubu Ahmadu, Ibrahim Mallam Musa, and Bello Haruna.

eng: She said the suspects were  members of a syndicate also linked to the kidnap attempt on the Vice President of the Nigerian Bar Association (NBA)
pcm: She tok say di suspect dem be  member of a syndicate wey dem  also link join the kidnap attempt on di Vice President of di Nigerian Bar Association (NBA)

eng: Gwagwalada branch, Barrister David Aigbefoh.
pcm: Gwagwalada branch, Barrister David Aigbefoh.

eng: She said the suspects were arrested during a coordinated intelligence operation by police operatives from the command anti-kidnapping squad at Shenegu mountain on the border of the FCT and Niger State.
pcm: She tok say dem be arrest di suspect during one coordinated intelligence operation wey police pipo from di command anti-kidnapping squad for Shenegu mountain on di border of di FCT and Niger State.

eng: She said the suspects have provided useful information on the activities of their syndicate.
pcm: She tok say di  suspect dem don give beta informate on di things wey dem do for dem group..

eng: Yusuf  further disclosed that one Nwite Jideofor was arrested for staging his own kidnap along Durumi axis, saying the suspect confessed to conniving with his abductors to defraud his sister of the sum of N5 million which he demanded as ransom.
pcm: Yusuf later tok say dem arrest one Nwite Jideofor wey stage im kidnap from Durumi area, sey di suspect confess say im conive with pipo wey come kidnap am to collekt reach 5 million from im sister as ransom.

eng: She said exhibits recovered from all the suspects included three Dane guns, seven cutlasses, one black painted Honda Accord, four mobile phones and other items, adding that effort was on to arrest other members of the syndicates now at large.
pcm: she tok some of di exhibit wey dem kolekt from di suspect na three dane guns, seven cutlas, one Honda Accord wey dem paint bleck, four mobile fone and oda item dem. She add am say dem don dey work on top how dem go arrest other member of di group wey don run.

eng: She said all the suspects would be arraigned in court upon conclusion of investigation, while she urged residents of the FCT, particularly parents and guardians to prevail upon their wards to desist from engaging in any form of criminality.
pcm: she tok say dem go carry all di suspect go court when dem don investigate welwel, as she dey warn pipo wey dey stay for FCT, especially parent and guardian say make dem draw ear fro dem children not do crime.

eng: Suarez strikes as Atletico win La Liga title
pcm: Suarez strike, Atletico sef kom  win La Liga title

eng: Luis Suarez's goal has secured a 2-1 victory for Atletico Madrid over Real Valladolid on Saturday that clinched his team another remarkable La Liga title.
pcm: Di goal wey Luiz Suarez score don make Athletico Mardrid beat Real Valladolid 2-1 on Saturday, na im make di team get anoda remarkable La Liga victory.

eng: Suarez began the season crying after being forced out of Barcelona but ended it with his 21st goal of the season earning Atletico a first league triumph since 2014, this one at the expense of Real Madrid.
pcm: Suarez be dey crying for di begiing of di season seek of say Barcelona force am komot, but as di season go end, na im 21st goal for di season make Athleticoto win first league since 2014, dis one wey dem win ahead of Real Madrid

eng: Atletico knew victory would guarantee them the title regardless of what Real Madrid did at home to Villarreal
pcm: Athletico know say if dem, dem go win di trophy, e no matter wetin Madrid do for Villareal for dem home.

eng: but it was never comfortable, with Valladolid taking a shock early lead.
pcm: But no be say e dey comfortable, as Valladolid take early lead.

eng: Real Madrid were behind too for most of the afternoon but Karim Benzema equalised in the 87th minute and Luka Modric even scored a late winner for 2-1 at Valdebebas, leaving Atletico hanging on at the end, as they were suddenly one goal away from squandering it all.
pcm: Real Madrid sef be dey behind fr di game, before Karim Benzema kom equalize for 87 minute, and Luka Modric kom score late winner for 2-1 at Valdebebas, na dat one hang Athletico for a long time, as e remain small make dem scatter di thing with just one goal.

eng: When the final whistle blew, the players ran onto the pitch, Suarez underneath a pile of red and white shirts, with Europe's most nerve-wracking and unpredictable title race finally complete.
pcm: when dem blow final whistle, players dem run enter field, red and white shirt cover Suarez, seek of say di title race wey tight pass, wey even dey unpredictable don end.

eng: Suarez Zone
pcm: Suarez Zone

eng: Just over a week ago
pcm: E just pass one week small

eng: , coach Diego Simeone said this was the Suarez Zone
pcm: coach Diego Simone tok say na di Suarez zone be dis

eng: and so it proved, the Uruguayan scoring the winner against Osasuna last week to keep the title in Atletico's hands and then again on the last day to put their name on the trophy.
pcm: and na so e take prove am, as na di Uruguayan score di wey kip title for Athletico hand last week, na im kom score on di last day again make dem for write dem name for trophy.

eng: This is only the second time in 17 years that a team other than Barcelona or Real Madrid have won the title, with Atleti claiming the other one under Simeone in 2014.
pcm: dis na di second time in 17 years wey anoda team apart from Barcelona or Real Madrid don win di league, na Athleti still win di oda one under Simeone for 2014.

eng: Atletico went into the game having been top since December and on the back of beating Osasuna with two goals in the last eight minutes, a victory that was so dramatic it felt like it would prove decisive.
pcm: Athletico start di game, say na dem dey top table since December, and as dem take score two goals for inside di last eight minutes to beat Osasuna,

eng: But Atletico have done nothing the easy way this season, with their 10-point lead in February cut to two in May and their position at the top of the table relying on numerous slip-ups from both Real Madrid and Barcelona.
pcm: But di thhing no easy for Athletico dis season, as dem get 10 point lead for February, and di point reduce to 2 for May, and dem position as nomba one for table dey rely on top make Real Madrid and Barcelona slip.

eng: So it was apt that faced with beating Real Valladolid, who were 19th on the table, they still had to scrape over the line.
pcm: So e no surprise pesin say as dem wan face Valladolid wey dey 19 for table, na still patch patch dem do.

eng: Several hundred Atletico fans gathered in Valladolid's Plaza Mayor in the hours before kick-off to sing songs and a similar number made it outside the stadium, where they were cordoned off in a cess-pit of nerves and anticipation.
pcm: Plenty Athletico fan dem don gather for Valladolid Plaza Mayor to dey sing song, and plenty fan dem also reach outside of di stadium, wia dem komot dem make e for no kos wahala.

eng: Gulak's assassination sparks outrage
pcm: Di kilin wey dem kil Gulak don kos make pipo dey shout.

eng: There was outrage and mourning Sunday over the assassination of Barr.
pcm: people dey shout and mourn on sunday as dem take kill barr.

eng: Ahmed Gulak, a former political adviser to President Goodluck Jonathan, by gunmen in Imo State.
pcm: Ahmed Gullak, wey be before before adviser to former presido Goodluck Jonathan on top  politiks matter, by pipo wey carry gun.

eng: Gulak was shot dead by assailants who trailed him to Obiangwu village as he made way to Sam Mbakwe Airport, in Owerri, the Imo State Capital, on his way to Abuja.
pcm: Na pipo wey dey follow Gulak shoot am for Obiangwu village as e dey try enter Sam Mbakwe airport for Owerri, wey be capital of Imo state, say e wan enter Abuja.

eng: Funeral prayers for the Adamawa-born politician were conducted yesterday evening at the National Mosque, Abuja, after which his remains were interred at the Gudu Cemetry at around 8 pm.
pcm: Na yesterday evening dem do funeral paryer for di politician wey from Adamawa kom inside national mosque for Abuja, na afta dat one dem burry im bodi for inside Gudu cemetary around 8pm

eng: Police in Imo last night said they had tracked down suspected killers of the of the All Progressives Congress (APC) chieftain, and killed at least six of them, after a fierce encounter.
pcm: Police pipo for inside Imo state tok say dem don kill at least six of di pipo wey kill di All Progressives Congress (APC) oga, afta dem follow dem fight.

eng: A statement signed by the Police Public Relations Officer, SP Bala Elkana, said that On 30th May, 2021 following a distress received by the Command on the gruesome murder of Ahmed Gulak, Police Special Forces made up of Intelligence Response Team (IRT), Police Mobile Force (PMF) and Tactical Units from the command were deployed to the scene at Obiangwu Junction at Ngorokpala LGA of Imo state.
pcm: One statement wey Police Public Relation Officer, SP Bala Elkana, tok say on 30 may, 2021, as police pipo receive call say jaguda pipo don kill Ahmed Gulak, special force for police pipo, wey include Intellingence Response Team (IRT), Police Mobile Force (PMF), and tactical unit wey from di command kom, na im dem send go di place for Obiagwu junction, for Ngorokpala LGA of Imo state.

eng: The teams were given a clear instruction to identify and apprehend the perpetrators of the act with a view of bringing them to justice.
pcm: DI instruction wey dem give di team be say make dem catch di pipo wey do di thing, make dem fit face justice.

eng: Vehicles belonging to the suspected killers of Ahmed Gulak intercepted by Police in Imo yesterday
pcm: Di mot wey dem thingk say na pipo wey kill Gulak get am, na im Imo police pipo don stop since yesterday.

eng: Eyewitnesses account, especially the account given by the Driver of the vehicle that was conveying Ahmed Gulak to the Airport before the attack, gave a vivid description of the assailants and the vehicles they used in carrying out the attack.
pcm: wetin pipo wey dey dere tok, especially di driver of di moto wey Gulak dey inside, wey dey carry am go airport, don describe di jaguda pipo, and di kin moto wey dem use carry out di jaguda waka.

eng: The assailants were said to have used a Toyota Camry 2005 model with silver color; Toyota Sienna 1998 Model with golden color;
pcm: Dem tok say na Toyota Camry wey be 2005 model, wey be silver color di jaguda pipo use, with sienna wey be 1998 medel and  golden color.

eng: Toyota Hilux with white color; and a Lexus RX 330 with golden Color.
pcm: Toyota Hilux wey dem paint white, and one Lexus 330, wey dem paint gold.

eng: (Registration numbers are withheld for security reasons).
pcm: (Dem no put registration number, because of security matter)

eng: Having established the identity of the assailants and the description of the vehicles used in carrying out the attack, the teams further got details of the direction the hoodlums have taken.
pcm: As dem don sabi di kind pipo wey di killer be, and di kind motor wey dem carry out di attack, dem later tell dem di way wey di killer pipo follow komot.

eng: With further leads, the team was able to establish the location of suspects.
pcm: with some kind lead, di team kom later establish wia di killer pipo dey.

eng: The suspects were rounded up at Afor Enyiogugu junction in Aboh-Mbaise Local Government Area.
pcm: Na for Afor Enyiogugu dem for catch di suspect dem, inside Anoh-Mbaise local goment area.

eng: The hoodlums where met distributing onions to locals from a trailer they confiscated.
pcm: na as di jaguda pipo dey dustribute onion wey dey inside trailer wey dem confisticate dem catch dem.

eng: The trailer was loaded with Onions from the Northern region of Nigeria.
pcm: Na onions full inside di trailer wey from Northern Naija kom.

eng: On sighting the Police, the hoodlums providing security coverage to those sharing the onions opened fire on the Police teams.
pcm: as dem see di police pipo, di jaguda pipo wey dey protect dem fellow jaguda begin shoot gun to polic pipo,

eng: The Gallant and battle ready
pcm: Di gallant and one wey don ready for battle

eng: Police Officers swiftly returned the fire.
pcm: police officer sef return with gun shoot too.

eng: The six hoodlums who carried out the killings and four other members of their gang were fatally injured.
pcm: Di six jaguda pipo wey follow do di killin, and four other member of di group get serious injury.

eng: Three out of the four vehicles used in attacking Gulak were recovered.
pcm: dem don kolekt three out of di four moto wey dem take attack Gulak.

eng: Three AK 47 Rifles, one Pistol, five AK 47 magazines with ninety two rounds of live ammunition and criminal charms were recovered.
pcm: Three Ak47 riffle, one pistol, five AK47 magazine wey get 92 round of live amunation, and criminal charm na im dem kolekt from dem.

eng: The assailants were identified as members of the proscribed IPOB and ESN.
pcm: Dem identify di jaguda pipo as member of IPOB and ESN wey dem don ban.

eng: The driver who drove late Ahmed Gulak and a co- victim who survived have all identified the dead body of the IPOB/ESN members positively as their attackers and also identified the three vehicles recovered as those used by the attackers.
pcm: Di driver wey drive late Ahmed Gulak, and di victim wey survive don identify di dedi bodi of di IPOB/ESN member as say na dem attack dem, and di motor wey dem kolekt as di same motor wey dem use.

eng: During the encounter, two of the police armored personnel carriers (APC) were riddled with bullets but survived the gun battle.
pcm: During di face to face with di jaguda pipo, two armored personel carriers wey belong to police pipo na im dem take gun scater, but dem no spoil finish.

eng: A video clip on the aftermath of the attack shows Gulak in a pair of Jean trousers and a blue T-shirt lying in a pool of his own blood, besides the abandoned car.
pcm: and Di video wey dem make afta di afta di attack show say Gulak wear jean trouser, and a blue shirt as im dey sleep inside im own blood, near di car wey dem abandon.

eng: Gulak was the chairman of the controversial Imo All Progressives Congress (APC) governorship primary election that produced Hope Uzodinma as the party's flagbearer.
pcm: Na Gulak be di chairman of di Imo All Progressives Congress (APC) governorship primary election wey carry Hope Uzodinma enter as persin wey go represent di parti.

eng: He was also said to have remained close to the governor visiting the state frequently.
pcm: Dem even tok say e close to di governor, e dey visit di state welwel.

eng: Why he was in Owerri
pcm: Why im dey for Owerri

eng: Though Gulak is said to be a regular visitor to Owerri since the ascension of Uzodinma, his last trip was however to attend the public hearing of the constitution review committee held in the city.
pcm: Though dem tok say Gulak dey visit Owerri welwel since Uzodinma don enter sit, na to attend di public hearing of review of constitution wey dem do for di city carry am go di last time.

eng: West Ham top-four hopes dented by loss to Everton
pcm: Westham hope make dem fit reach top-four don spoil wit how dem lose to Everton

eng: West Ham United blew their chance to apply real pressure in the race for a Premier League top-four finish as they slumped to a 1-0 home defeat by an Everton side who maintained their European qualification hopes on Sunday.
pcm: Westham hope to reach top-four don spoil bikos dem no play wella against Everton wey dey hope to enta European league for Sunday

eng: Dominic Calvert-Lewins 24th-minute goal proved decisive against a West Ham side who huffed and puffed but never really hit their stride on a crucial afternoon.
pcm: Di goal wey Dominic Caivert-Lewin score for di 24th minute of dia game show say dey don determine to win Westham wey don make mouth finish say dem go score for dat serious afternoon

eng: The closest West Ham came to an equaliser was when Vladimir Coufals shot hit the post and Jarrod Bowen could not bundle in the rebound from point-blank range.
pcm: Di closest wey Westham reach to equalize na wen Vladmir Coufal go shoot ball wey chop bar and Jerron Bowenno no fit hit am back enta post upon say hin dey the goal post front.

eng: Supporters of the Vice-President Yemi Osinbajo have shown support for him by portraying him as a presidential candidate come next election.
pcm: Pipo wey dey support Vice-president Yemi Osinbajo don show say dey still dey hin back as dem dey showcase am as pesin wey go be presidential candidate for di election wey dey kom.

eng: Osinbajo has not declared interest in presidential race, says spokesman
pcm: Osinbajo tok tok pesin say hin no tok say he wan be president
