eng: Turkeys endeavours for developing vaccines against COVID-19 is also continuing.
pcm: Turkey work do develop vaccines against COVID-19 still dey continue.

eng: We are determined to complete our vaccine activities in autumn and offer these to the service of all humanity, especially to African countries.
pcm: We hold am for mind to finish awa  vaccine tin for autumn make we kom offer am as service give pipo especially give Africa countries dem.

eng: The theme of Silencing the Guns: Creating Conducive Conditions for Africas Development and Intensifying the Fight Against the COVID-19 Epidemic set for Africa Day celebrations to be held online this year due to the pandemic is in harmony with Turkeys humanitarian and entrepreneurial foreign policy agenda.
pcm: The topic To silence di Gun: To Create beta condition for development for Africa and put power join to fight against COVID-19 Epidemic wey dem set for Africa Day celebrations wey dem go do online dis year becos of di pandemic dey join-join wit Turkey humanitarian and entrepreneur foreign policy agenda.

eng: Standing against all kinds of violence, advocating the resolution of disputes through dialogue, and conducting mediation activities when needed, our country strongly supports the goal of silencing the guns.
pcm: To tanda wit various violence, tok to settle wahala jejeli and to do program wey go dey remain for brain wen e need, awa  kontri support goal of silencingdiguns wit power.

eng: Turkey, along with its different mediation and facilitation roles undertaken across the world, is also the Co-Chair of the Group of Friends of Mediation established under the UN, the OSCE and the OIC.
pcm: Turkey wit im program wey go dey remain for brain and facilitation role wey dem dey do for di whole world still be Co-Chair for program wey go dey remain for brain wey dem establish put for under UN, di OSCE and di OIC.

eng: We believe that our joint effort with the AU, which is a member of the friends group in UN, will contribute to security and stability in Africa.
pcm: We believe say awa  joinbody effort wit di AU, wey be member fordifriends group in UN, go contribute put security and strong leg inside Africa.

eng: With its innovative steps, Turkey shapes not only the diplomacy of today, but also that of the future.
pcm: With dis betabeta, nor be only today diplomacy Turkey dey shape, dem dey shape for di future too.

eng: In 2019, we announced the Digital Diplomacy initiative by taking advantage of the transformative power of technology.
pcm: For 2019, we announce di Digital Diplomacy initiative as we take chance of di transformative power of technology.

eng: We believe Africas recent focus on digitalisation for sustainable development is spot-on.
pcm: We believe di focus of Africa ontop digitalization for development wey go last dey correct.

eng: Within this context, we have observed with pleasure that digital transformation is recommended to achieve Agenda 2063 targets and to ensure sustainable economic recovery in the Africas Development Dynamics:
pcm: Inside dis mata, we donkari eyes look wit pleasure  say digital transformation be koko to take achieve target for agenda 2063 and to see say economic wey im leg strong  dey kampe for di Africas Development Dynamics:

eng: Digital Transformation for Quality Jobs report published by the AU this year despite COVID-19.
pcm: Digital Transformation for Quality Jobs dis tori dey publish by di AU dis year despite say COVID-19 dey.

eng: We are ready to work with our African friends in the field of digital transformation.
pcm: We dey redi to work wit awa  Africa friends inside field for  digital transformation.

eng: We will continue to be in unity and solidarity with African countries and the AU with the strength and inspiration we derive from our centuries-old historical, cultural and human relations with Africa.
pcm: We go continue to dey cooperate and stand wit Africa pipo countries dem anddiAU wit di power and inspiration wey dey see from inside awa  old history, culture and human relation wit Africa.

eng: I avail myself of this opportunity to congratulate Africans on this day with heartfelt feelings.
pcm: I hapi  on my own to take congratulate Africa pipo today wit sweet mind.

eng: Çavusoglu is the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Turkey
pcm: Çavusoglu be di Minister for Foreign Affairs for di Republic of Turkey

eng: Blackmail counterproductive to development, economic growth  — Gov Emmanuel
pcm: Blackmail dey kill development and economic growth —  Gov Emmanuel

eng: Akwa Ibom State Governor, Mr Udom Emmanuel, has urged the people to shun blackmail as such vices is inimical and counterproductive to economic growth and development with huge undesirable consequences.
pcm: Governor of Akwa Ibom state Mr. Udom Emmanuel don urge di pipo say make dem throwway eyes for Blackmail say dat kain na evil and dey kill economic growth and development wit many things wey nor go sweet body.

eng: The Governor gave this charge when he led top government functionaries to a special Inter-Denominational Thanksgiving Service to mark the 6th anniversary of his administration on Sunday at Believers Assembly of Nigeria, Uyo.
pcm: Di Governor give dis beta spirit wen he front bigbig pipo for goment go one church thankgiving service wey be for every church denomination to take mark 6years of im tenure on Sunday for  Believers Assembly of Nigeria, Uyo.

eng: Governor Emmanuel who reflected on the mercies of God which he acknowledged gave him wisdom to lead the state through a turbulent economic time occasioned by the outbreak of Covid-19, appreciated the support of Akwa Ibom people, and described them as partners in the success story of the state.
pcm: Governor Emmanuel wey dey tok about mercy of God wey im say e give am wisdom to take lead di state tru economic palava we Covid-19 cos, appreciate di support of Akwa Ibom pipo say dem be partner for him success tori for di state

eng: We are standing here to give God all the glory, the psalmists will tell you, O give thanks unto the Lord for He is good for His Mercies endureth forever.
pcm: We stand here to dey give God glory, psalmist go tell you say, Oya give thanks to di Lord for im mercy go dey forever

eng: We are thanking God for extremely tough six years economically, weve been challenged on all sides but we are not depressed.
pcm: We dey thank God for strong tough six years for economic, we don dey shallenge for every corner but we nor lose mind.

eng: So we want to give God thanks for those six challenging years God has led us, he has helped us to keep faith, he stated.
pcm: So we wan give thanks to God for di six tough year wey God bin lead us put, he don help us keep faith na so im yarn am.

eng: He assured the people of delivering on all his promises, pointing out that his commitment to the development of the state remains absolute as he will continue to serve passionately and diligently.
pcm: He make am sure give di pipo ontop to deliver im promises dem, say im commitment to take to development for di state na number one and e go continue to serve beta and wit mind.

eng: I want to assure my people that we will continue to serve God through all of you and please we need everyones cooperation just to pray with us
pcm: I wan make am sure to my pipo say I go continue to serve God tru all of una and abeg we need every to join us cooperate to dey pray wit us.

eng: let God take us to where we are going.
pcm: Make Godkari usrish wia  we dey go.

eng: Let me sound a bit of warning, stop castigating the Governor that he has built an International Worship Center, you dont understand what I am doing, I am raising an altar that will negate every other speaking.
pcm: Make I wan una small, stop to dey spoil Governor name say im bin don build International Worship Center, you nor understand wetin I dey do, I dey raise altar wey go cancel all oda talk.

eng: I am raising an altar that will take us to where we are going to, he stated.
pcm: I dey raise di altar wey gokari us go wia  we dey go. Na so he yarn.

eng: Speaking earlier on Saturday, in a state broadcast to mark his 6th anniversary, the Governor listed the many positive impact his economic and industrialization policy has had on the economy of the state, reiterating the determination of his administration to fulfill his campaign promises to the people with more vigour and determination, noting that he is in a hurry to industrialize and change the narratives of the state from being a purely civil service State to an industrialized entity.
pcm: As e dey speak morning for Saturday, for inside a state broadcast to take mark im 6th anniversary, di Governor list many beta impact wey im economy and industrialization policy don get ontop di economy for di state, as im still tok wetin him admistration get for mind to do im campaign promises dem to di pipo wit power and strong mind, say im dey hurry to industrialize and change watin di statekari for mind wey be goment  worker state to place wey dey industrialize.

eng: Giving a sectoral breakdown of his achievements in office, the Governor said in the agricultural sector, he has kept his promise to ensure that the state produce enough food at affordable prices to feed the people.
pcm: As e dey tok im achievements for office one one, di Governor say for agricultural sector, im bin don do all wetin im promise to see say di state dey produce food for shekel moni to feed di pipo.

eng: He recalled that his inauguration of the Technical Committee on Agriculture and Food Sufficiency have borne incredible fruits.
pcm: Im tok back say ontop im inauguration of di Technical Committee on Agriculture and Food Sufficiency don bring beta fruit.

eng: Our staple food items such as garri, rice, yam etc are produced mostly by our people here.
pcm: Our own food like garri, rice, yam etc dey dey produce by awa  pipo for here.

eng: From the rice mill in Ini Local Government Area, to the numerous garri processing mills scattered all over the three senatorial districts, to our low interest loans given to farmers, to the cassava plantation through the FADAMA 3 scheme, we are working to ensure that our people have enough food to eat at quite affordable prices
pcm: For di rice mill wey dey Ini Local goment  Area, enta plenty garri mill wey scatter put for di three senatorial district wey dey di area, enta small interest loan wey we give farmers to take plant casava through FADAMA 3 program, we dey work ontop make awa  pipo get food to dey chop wit sekele money.

eng: Our investments in this critical sector goes beyond making food available for all, we are also leveraging in on our comparative advantage in agriculture through the establishment of a fully functional Directorate of Agriculture and Agro-Allied Investments, he stated.
pcm: Our investment for dis kind wahala time pass to see say food dey for everybody, we still dey try for di big change wey we don get for agriculture to take create Directorate of Agriculture and Agro-Allied Investments wey go dey function. Naso e yarn.

eng: In the health sector, the Governor noted with delight that when he came in, most of the general hospitals were derelict as patients and hospital staff were battling snakes and other reptiles every day.
pcm: For health sector, di Governor tok wit joy say wen in bin kom in, many of di general hospitals dey very bad as sick pipo and staff dem for hospital dey digga snake and other animal wahala everyday.

eng: He stated that his administration has equipped the Ibom Specialist Hospital with the most modern medical facilities compete with an ICU and these huge investments came in handy during the challenging months of the Covid-19 pandemic as the highly trained medical professionals performed exceedingly well to stem the spread of the deadly virus.
pcm: He tok say im tenure don buy material put for Ibom Specialist Hospital and most of dis new-school material  bin dey shallenge ICU and dis big moni work kom inside Covid-19 pandemic asdimedical pipo dem wey sabi work do well to see say dem cut di hand of dis dangerous virus.

eng: Listing the achievements of his industrialization policy, Governor Emmanuel said, through the efforts of the Technical Committee on Foreign Direct Investments, he has attracted over twenty economically viable and employment – generating Industries to the state including the Coconut Virgin Oil Refinery, a digitalized flour mill which produces the flour we need for our confectioneries industry, the Metering company, the commencement of the Liberty Oil and Gas Free Zone, the Ground breaking ceremony for the construction of Sterling petrochemicals and Fertilizer production factory, the $1.4 billion Ammonia and Fertilizer plant, and Ibom Air which he noted has become a national sensation.
pcm: As in bin dey list di achievement of im industrialization policy, Governor Emmanuel tok say, through di effort of di Technical Committee on Foreign Direct Investments, im don get over twenty economic company pipo wey redi to work and employ — wey create industries for di state including di Coconut Virgin Oil Refinery, one digital flour mill wey dey produce flour wey we need for awa  small small foods industry, company wey dey measure, Liberty Oil and Gas Free Zone wey dem start,diopen ceremony wey shake ground to take construct Sterling petrochemicals and Fertilizer production factory, di $1.4 billion Ammonia and Fertilizer plant and Ibom Air wey im tok say everybody for di kontri dey tok am

eng: Explainer: What you should know about cattle-ranching
pcm: Explainer: Wetin you suppose sabi konsain cattle-ranching.

eng: With the incessant attacks between farmers and herders, state governments, mostly in the South, have resolved to ban open grazing and adopt ranching as an alternative to the age-long practice of herders roaming with their cattle to seek pasture for their herd.
pcm: With evri day attack between farmers and heldmen, state goment dem, especially from South don conclude to ban open grazing and to kolet ranching as watin dem go dey use instead of di wakawaka of herdsmen wit their cattle wey don long.

eng: As the call for the adoption of ranching grows, herders, who are mostly drawn from the Fulani ethnic group, have expressed lack of knowledge on how the new system would work for them.
pcm: As dem say put voice out ontop to dey grow ranch, herdsmen wey be say na Fulani pipo plenty dia pass don tok open mouth ontop how di tin go work for dem as dem nor take abi.

eng: This is evident in a statement made by the Sarkin Fulani of Iwo in Osun State, Alhaji Momodu Adamu, during a summit in which he stated that most Fulani are unaware of what ranching means.
pcm: Dis one dey inside one tori wey di Sarkin Fulani of Iwo for Osun State Alhaji Momodu Adamu yarn for inside one summit wia im bin dey tok say Many Fulani nor sabi watin ranching mean

eng: Ranching is strange to us.
pcm: Ranching dey strange to us

eng: We are willing to learn.
pcm: We bin wan learn.

eng: We want the government to teach us about it.
pcm: We wan make goment teach us about am.

eng: We will continue to live in peace.
pcm: We go continue to dey live wit peace.

eng: What is ranching
pcm: Wetin be ranching

eng: The National Geographic said ranching involves rearing livestock, especially cattle, on a vast area of land.
pcm: Di National Geographic pipo tok say ranching na to dey rear livestocks, especially cattle ontop big land

eng: This activity, which is business oriented, enable livestock to graze in a controlled land for pastures, fodders and water provided for consumption through purchase of hays and growing of pasture.
pcm: This thing, weykari business sense go, go make livestocks dey chop for a land wey get control for grass and water  ontop contract and to dey plant grass

eng: The practice is not a sedentary mode of grazing since the spacious land allows herders to walk around with their herd to consume grown fodder in a confined area.
pcm: This way nor dey function as grazing mode as chance dey for herdsmen to dey waka up and down wit dia cow to dey chop things wey dey any area wey dem go.

eng: However, growing fodder in the grazing area might not be sustainable as lack of rainfall or water to grow it would result in shortage.
pcm: But, to dey grow grass for area fit dey easy because rain shortage or water shortage nor go make am do well.

eng: Overgrazing is another factor making it unsustainable.
pcm: Overgrazing sef dey among wetin nor go make am deyrish.

eng: The concentration of livestock in an area, as ranching offers, reduces the proclivity of fat reduction among cattle as well as contributes to the livestock subsector.
pcm: To focus on livestock for one area, ranching dey give, reduce di reduce hunger among cattle dem sef and to add join livestock subsector.

eng: National Geographic notes that Ranching is an efficient way to raise livestock to provide meat, dairy products, and raw materials for fabrics.
pcm: National Geographic pipo tok say Ranching na di beta way to take dey raise livestock to provide meat, milk and raw material for fabrics.

eng: It is a vital part of economies and rural development around the world.
pcm: Na ogbonge part for economies and rural development around di world.

eng: But the livestock industry has effects on the environment through contributing to air and water pollution.
pcm: But di livestock industry dey get effects on di environment for contribute put for air and water pollution.

eng: Harmful products from ranches can include manure, antibiotics and hormones given to the animals, as well as fertilizers and pesticides.
pcm: Harmful product wey dem fit see for ranches fit be manure, antibiotics, and hormones wey dem dey give animals dem join wit fertilizer and pesticides.

eng: Similarly, chemicals from tanneries that treat animal hides can also seep into water.
pcm: Like dat one, chemical from wia  animal dey sleep put wey fit treat animal fit good to put inside water for dem.

eng: Facilities
pcm: Material

eng: In an article, Encyclopedia Britannica states that barns, which serve as shelters, are the most important elements in a ranch.
pcm: For inside one tori for Encyclopedia Britannica e tok say barn wey be wia  animal dey live be di koko inside all wetin join ranch.

eng: This facility is enclosed thus wouldnt be suitable for a nomadic herder who has developed a strong relation with his herd.
pcm: This material still closed for dis, e nor go sweetbodi for herdsmen dem wen wakawaka don master.

eng: As such, a pen would be more suitable to keep a close eye on them.
pcm: For this, wia  animal go dey stay don do so eyes go dey dia bodi.

eng: Other facilities are a milk parlour, mowers, tractors, hay barns, water irrigation system and a stall barn for the animals to rest, feed, milk and watered.
pcm: Oda facilities na wetin take dey do milk, watin dem take dey cut grass, wetin dem take dey pour water and small barn for animal to dey rest, chop kotet dia milk and put water.

eng: With electricity not reliable, components of solar can be a feature in ranches in Nigeria.
pcm: As light leg nor strong, solar fit dey beta for ranches for Nigeria .

eng: Ranching and the National Livestock Transformation Plan
pcm: Ranching and di National Livestock Transformation Plan

eng: A human rights lawyer Femi Falana said that ranching is not a new development in Nigeria with the first ranch in Nigeria established in Cross River State at Obudu in 1951 by the British, but was taken over by Eastern Regional Government after independence.
pcm: One human right lawyer Femi Falana said dat ranching nor be new development for Nigeria as dem establish di first ranch fro Nigeria for Obudu, Cross River State in 1951 by British dem but by Eastern Regional goment  take over am after independence.

eng: He added that the Awolowo regime had a ranch in Akunnu, now Ondo State with Ahmadu Bello establishing one in Mokwa, Niger State.
pcm: E add join say Awolowo regime get one rance for Akunnu wey be Ondo State now ad Ahmadu Bello sef dey establish one for Mokwa, Niger State.

eng: During Yakubu Gowons regime, Audu Bako had the best ranches in the country in Kano.
pcm: During Yakubu Gowons regime, Audu Bako get di best ranches for di kontri for Kano.

eng: Also, there are grazing reserves which are domiciled on bigger lands that house many herders and their families in some parts of the north.
pcm: And, grazing reserve wey dey permanent ontop big land wey be house for herdmen and dia family for some part of di north.

eng: With the ranches no longer functioning, the federal government in 2018 introduced the National Livestock Transformation Plan (NLTP).
pcm: As di ranches nor longer function, federal goment for 2018 introduced di National Livestock Transformation Plan (NLTP).

eng: The plan which was piloted in Adamawa in 2019 had the backing of the National Economic Council composed of the governors of the 36 States governors and chaired by the Vice President, Yemi Osinbajo.
pcm: The plan wey dem test for Adamawa for 2019 get di backing ofdiNational Economic Council wey be governors for di 36 States governors and di Vice President, Yemi Osinbajo be di chair

eng: The NLTP is a N100 billion 10-year initiative (2019-2027) that would ensure Economic growth and avert the farmers/herders crises.
pcm: The NLTP na one N100 billion 10-year initiative (2019-2027) wey ensure say Economic dey grow and prevent di farmers/herdsmen kasala.

eng: The plan will see to the creation of four ranch sizes housing 30, 60, 150 and 300 cows with feeding facilities, watering facilities, a market and a breeder ranch for a minimum of 1,000 cattle.
pcm: Di plan go see to create four ranch size wey go contain 30, 60, 150 and 300 cows wit food facilities, water facilities, and market and a breeder ranch of 1,000 cattle for minimum

eng: Osinbajo in a speech during the launch of the programme said the ranches would propel integrated business centre for commercial crop production, the supply of livestock materials and facilitation of improved access to basic services for herders.
pcm: Osinbajo wen im bin dey give speech wen dem dey launch di programme saydiranch go add put for join-join business centre for crop production for business, di supply of livestock materials and help to improved access to basic services for herdsmen.

eng: According to him, participating states will provide the land as its own contribution to the project.
pcm: As im take tok, state go provide land as dia own contribution for di project

eng: The Federal government merely supports the project.
pcm: The Federal goment only support di project.

eng: It is a plan that hopes to birth tailor-made ranches where cattle are bred, and meat and dairy products are produced using modern livestock methods.
pcm: Na plan to take design ranches wia  dem go dey raise cattle, meat and milk wey dem go produce go dey wit newschool livestock.

eng: During his presentation, he delinked the NLTP from the controversial cattle ranching colony, RUGA, which was perceived in some quarters as a land-grabbing project by the federal government to house herders and their families in a particular area.
pcm: When e present, he bin cut NLTP commot fromdidat ranching colony wey wan bring wahala, RUGA, wey some pipo see as as federal goment wan force kolet land to keep heldsmen and their families for a particular area.

eng: 2023: Disquiet in Kwara APC over governors sister
pcm: 2023: Wahala fo Kwara APC ontop governor sister.

eng: The protracted leadership crisis rocking the Kwara State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) took a new twist following calls for the removal of Senator Khairat Gwadabe, a sister to Governor Abdulrahman Abdulrazaq, from the Membership Registration Appeal Panel set up by the Governor Mai Mala Buni-led Caretaker Committee by some aggrieved founding members the party in the state.
pcm: Di teytey leadership palava wey dey hapun for Kwara  State chapter of di All Progressives Congress (APC) wear new cloth as dem some founding members wey dey vex open mouth say make dem comot  Senator Khairat Gwadabe, wey be sister to Governor Abdulrahman Abdulrazaq, from di Membership Registration Appeal Panel Caretaker Committee wey Governor Mai Mala Buni dey lead.

eng: The call for Khairats removal is coming on the heels of the fierce struggle for the control of the soul of the party in the state between the governor and some aggrieved leaders over the second term ticket for 2023 as the next electioneering campaign beckons.
pcm: Di call say make dem remove Khairat dey kom from di wahala of who go dey control di parti for di state between governor and some members wey dey vex ontop second term ticket for 2023 di next electioneering campaign beckons.

eng: The governor and some notable leaders in the party have been at loggerheads since the administration came into power in 2019 in the state over disagreement in his style of leadership.
pcm: Di governor and some leader wey get mouth for di parti don dey digger something since dis tenure enta power in 2019 for di state ontop style wey im dey take rule.

eng: But despite some spirited efforts to bring everybody on the same page, according to insiders in the party, the issue appears to have festered, with the latest imbroglio having the potential to consume the party in the race for the top seat come 2023 if the needful is not done by uniting all the forces that collectively defeated the last Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) administration in the state, led by former Senate President Bukola Saraki.
pcm: But ontop all power to take bring everybody togeda under one umbrella, as one insider for di take tok am,dimata dey hot more more wit dis new wahala wey fit chop di parti comot for dis top seat for 2023 if dem nor dom am somtin by joining alldipower wey fall Peoples Democratic parti (PDP) administration for di state, wey former Senate President Bukola Saraki dey lead.

eng: For many members of the aggrieved group, which has the support of top party leaders like the Minister of Information and Culture, Alhaji Lai Mohammed and his counterpart for transport (state), Gbemisola Saraki, under the factional caretaker chairman, Hon Bashiru Omolaja Bolarinwa (BOB), Khairats inclusion in the membership of the committee was part of a grand plan by the governor to hijack the party machinery in the state in the build-up to the 2023 elections.
pcm: Many members of di group wey dey vex wey get di support of big parti leader like di Minister of Information and Culture, Alhaji Lai Mohammed and im fellow for transport (state), Gbemisola Saraki, under di factional caretaker chairman, Hon Bashiru Omolaja Bolarinwa (BOB), Khairat wey dem put dey among plan for di governor to hijack parti man-machine for di state as im dey build-up 2023 election.

eng: Some of the top leaders and party supporters in the state, who said they had been disenfranchised from the registration/revalidation process, pointed accusing fingers at the former senator, who they accused of working with the Senator John Danbois committee which headed the last exercise in the state to disenfranchise leaders and members believed to be against the governor.
pcm: Some of di top leaders and parti supporters inside di state, wey tok say dem don do dem ojoro ontop registration/revalidation process don accuse di former senator say im bin dey work wit Senator John Danboi committee wey head di last exercise for di state to do ojoro for members wey dem believe say dem dey fight di governor.

eng: Her membership status of the committee, they argued, was to finish the work she started in the state at the national level to remove any obstacle against the second term ticket of the governor and pave the way for his smooth emergence as the partys candidate in the next gubernatorial election.
pcm: Im status for di committee, as dem dey drag am, bi to go finish work wey im bin start inside state for national level to clear road for di second term ticket ofdigovernor and open road wey roku for  im to be di parti candidate for di next governor election.

eng: In one of the press releases that have since trailed the issue, a faction of the APC in the state believed to be loyal to the camp of Lai Mohammed and other aggrieved leaders, openly rejected the inclusion of Senator Gwadabe in the 61-member committee.
pcm: One of di press release weu yarn d mata small, one faction of di APC for di state believe say dem loyal to di camp of Lai Mohammed and other members wey dey vex, and tok am korokoro say dem nor want make dem add Senator Gwadabe join di 61-member committee.

eng: The group, known as Integrity Group, in a statement signed by Comrade Abdul-Rahoof Bello, declared the appointment as unacceptable.
pcm: Di group wey pipo know as Integrity Group, inside on tok wey Comrade Abdul-Rahoof Bello sign yarn am kom outside dey dem nor acceptdiemployment.

eng: According to the group, Here was a governors sister who worked in tandem with the Danboi committee to commit all sorts of atrocities and impunities against the partys interest in Kwara State.
pcm: As di group take talk, One governor sister dey do double mind  work wit didiDanboi committee to kos many wahala and some wuruwuru against watin di parti want for inside Kwara

eng: Their call was echoed by another group believed to be fronting for the minister, Concerned APC Youth Stakeholders, which petitioned the national secretariat of the party as run by the Caretaker Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC) over the issue, alleging the over 600,000 of its members have been disenfranchised with the connivance of Senator Khairat.
pcm: Anoda voice still kom outside wey dem believe say e dey front for di minister, ontop APC Youth Stakeholder, petitioned di national secretariat of di parti wey Caretaker Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC) dey run ontop di issue, say dem don do over 600,000 of dia member ojoro wit di wuruwuru of Senator Khairat.

eng: But shortly after their positions were made known, the governors men and foot soldiers also went to town with their trumpet to drum support for the governor and his sister over the matter.
pcm: Sometime after dem tok dia own, some governor men and supporters sef scatter full town dey wit trumpet dey drum and support for di governor and im sister ontop dimata.

eng: It was the publicity secretary of the party, Alhaji Folaranmi Aro, a staunch loyalist of the governor that fired the first salvo thus, Those against the senators inclusion have no basis.
pcm: Na di publicity secretary ofdiparty, Alhaji Folaranmi Aro, a strong loyalist of di governor first fire say; pipo wey dey against say dem put di senator nor get tok.

eng: Under the aegis of the Reformist Progressive Forum, the group that supports the governor, in a rejoinder to the statement by the Integrity Group, noted that Senator Gwadabes rejection by the group of political puppets in Kwara is baseless and unfounded.
pcm: Under di supporter for di Reformist Progressive Forum, di group wey dey support governor inside one quick reply to di statement of integrity group, tok say di rejection of Senator Gwadabe by group of political small pikin for kwara nor get head and norish tok.

eng: This is unreasonable, illogical and destructive criticism.
pcm: Dis one nah mumu criticism wey nor get sense and fit destroy.

eng: When contacted for comment, Saheed Popoola, a loyalist of the minister and lawmaker in the Kwara State House of Assembly from Offa, told Daily Trust Saturday that he was not in town.
pcm: When dem go meet am for tori, Saheed Popoola, one of di pipo wey dey loyal wella todiminister and im still be lawmaker for Kwara State House of Assembly from Offa, tell Daily Trust Saturday say im nor dey town.

eng: But a top member of the party and diehard supporter of the minister from Kwara Central said although Alhaji Lai Mohammed and few others registered despite condemnation of the exercise, the action was in demonstration and solidarity with prominent national leaders of the party like Chief Bisi Akande and Bola Ahmed Tinubu, who did but still faulted the process, calling for improvement.
pcm: But one top member of di parti and diehard supporter of di minister from Kwara Central tok say though Alhaji Lai Mohammed and few odas still register despite say dem condemn di exercise. Di action na to demo and to show we dey wit you give big big leaders dem for di parti like Chief Bisi Akande and Bola Ahmed Tinubu wey still tok say di process dey wonkain, make dem do am well.

eng: But on the issue of how this might affect the partys chances in 2023, the top party official said, There is still a long way to go, and many considerations may be laid on the table before then.
pcm: But ontopmata on how di tin fit take affect di parti chance for 2023, dem Oga for di parti say; dimata long gan-an and dem fit put manymata ontop table before dat time.

eng: Our workings now are first to get the sham which the last exercise clearly was upturned and get the national leadership to approve the conduct of a fresh exercise in the state.
pcm: Our workings now na to first get di wayo wey bend di last exercise and to get di hand of National leader dem to do fresh exercise for di state.

eng: For Kunle Suleiman, a lawyer and pioneer chairman of the PDP in the state and an unrepentant apologist of the governor, what is happening is politics and the party will rise above it when the time comes.
pcm: For Kunle Suleiman, lawyer wey be pioneer chairman of PDP for di state, wey still be one pesin wey sabi vex  and beg di Governor and go still vex am, watin dey hapun na politics and di parti go grow pass am.

eng: He, however, said their concern was how to deliver good governance, which the governor promised.
pcm: Im still tok say dia konsain na  how dem go take make life beta wey di governor promise dem.

eng: However, a member of the AA group and supporter of the governor in Ilorin west told Daily Trust Saturday that those aggrieved party members kicking against the inclusion of Senator Khairat were jesters.
pcm: One member ofdiAA group wey still be Governor supporter for Ilorin west tell Daily Trust Saturday say di vexvex parti members dem wey dey tackle as dem take put Senator Khairat na playplay pipo.

eng: He added that the party had since moved on from that exercise.
pcm: He add join say di parti don move ontop di exercise.

eng: For Gods sake, those who are complaining dont know what they are doing and saying.
pcm: For God sake, pipo wey dey complain nor sabi wetin dem dey do and wetin  dem dey tok.

eng: Khairat is a member of the APC and can be made a member of any committee based on her contributions and recognition in the party.
pcm: Khairat na member of APC and fit be member for any committee onto her contributions and recognition inside di party.

eng: She is entitled to it.
pcm: She dey entitle give am.

eng: If she is a sister to the governor, should that deny her right?
pcm: If she be sister to governor, shey dat one suppose deny her right?

eng: In politics, and where you have factions, this type of thing happens.
pcm: For inside politices wey many factions dey, dis kain tin dey hapun.

eng: Somebody that is not given something always complains; and those complaining now belong to BOB and Lais group.
pcm: Person wey dem nor give somtin go complain; and pipo wey dey complain be BOB and Lai group.

eng: They thought they could control the registration exercise and party politics but now realised that it has suddenly moved out of their hands.
pcm: Dem think say dem fit controldiregistration exercise and parti politics but now kom see say e don comot for dia hand.

eng: They are complaining because they lost in the partys power game for now, he added.
pcm: Dem dey complain because dem don lost for di power game of di parti now. E add join.

eng: He, however, said the party would get its acts together in the remaining two years, adding, We came to the APC in factions.
pcm: He kom tok say di parti go get im sef for inside dis two years wey remain as im still add say  We kom inside APC faction faction

eng: These same people that are saying the governor will not get the ticket also said so during his first term and did not vote for him, yet he got it; and he will get it again.
pcm: Dis same pipo wey say di governor nor go get ticket still tok like dat for im first time and dem nor vote for am, e still get am; and e go get am again.

eng: It is about strategy and getting your politics right.
pcm: Na ontop make you use sense and get your politics koret.

eng: We are not afraid.
pcm: We nor dey fear

eng: Also, the issue of the governors kind of politics has been at the centre of the present disagreement, with notable figures like Professor Abdulraheem Shuaib Oba and Akogun Iyiola Oyedepo describing him as a featherweight politician that could be easily discarded in 2023.
pcm: Also, di mata of how d governor dey do politics don bi watin dey kos palava as big big pipo like Professor Abdulraheem Shuaib Oba and Akogun Iyiola Oyedepo dey tok about di governor say im bi politician wey im weight dey like feather wey go dey easy to blow comot for 2023.

eng: In the view of some political watchers, what has played out in the way the governor has dealt with Lais group and how he handled the registration exercise only indicate how things could get complicated in the struggle to control the party ahead of 2023.
pcm: For di eyes of some pipo wey sabi watch politics, watin don hapun ontop how governor take deal wit Lai group and how e take handle di registration exercise show how mata fit no take get head to control di parti  before 2023.

eng: Vandals cut off section of Warri-Itapke rail line
pcm: Thug pipo cut some part of Warri-Itapke rail line.

eng: Vandals have cut several sections on the Itapke-Warri rail line.
pcm: Thug pipo don cut many part comot for Warri-Itapke rail line.

eng: In a viral video, the vandals, still unknown, used what appears to be a saw to slice through the rail line to a point where the pieces could be taken thereby exposing passengers to danger.
pcm: Inside one video wey dey waka, di thug pipo, wey dem still neva sabi, use watin bi like saw take slice di rail wia  dem fit take comot some, wey kom put like of passengers dem for danger.

eng: The incident, our correspondent gathered, happened along the Warri-Itakpe standard gauge line around KM 30 Adogo, Kogi State section of the rail.
pcm: Di trouble, as awa  news pipo take gather, e hapun along di Warri-Itakpe standard gauge line around KM 30 Adogo, for Kogi State section for di rail.

eng: The managing director/CEO, the Nigerian Railway Corporation, Engr.
pcm: Di managing director/CEO, Di Nigeria Railway Corporation, Engr.

eng: Fidet Okhiria, confirmed the incident to our correspondent.
pcm: Fidet Okhiria, confirm di trouble give awa  news pipo

eng: He, however, said the train is still being operated as there is an alternative.
pcm: E, still, tok say train still dey work bicos, anoda way dey.

eng: The incident happened two days ago.
pcm: Di trouble hapun like two days ago.

eng: But we are still in operation because we have an alternative, he said.
pcm: But we still dey work because we get anoda way. Na so im tok.

eng: Pillars battle Nasarawa Utd in top of the table clash
pcm: Pillars diga wit Nasarawa Utd for clash of pipo wey dey top for di table

eng: Kano Pillars will square up with perennial rivals, Nasarawa United this afternoon in the Nigeria Professional Football League week 23 top of the table clash at the Ahmadu Bello Stadium Kaduna.
pcm: Kano Pillars go diga wit dia evritime rival, Nasarawa United dis afternoon for di Nigeria Professional Football League week 23 of  clash of pipo wey dey top for di table for Ahmadu Bello Stadium Kaduna.

eng: However, in case of a draw, the winner in the other fixture between Kwara United and Rivers United in Ilorin will go to the top of the table.
pcm: As e be, if tighttight go dey, pesin wey win inside Kwara United and Rivers United for Ilorin go go  di top of di table.

eng: While Pillars are on 41 points, Kwara United, Nasarawa United and Rivers United are on 39 points each with a chance of going to the top.
pcm: As Pillars dey 41 points, Kwara United, Nasarawa United and Rivers United dey 39 points all of dem get chance to enta top.

eng: Therefore, if the two matches in Kaduna and Ilorin end in draw, Pillars will assume leadership again pending the outcome of tomorrows match between Abia Warriors and Akwa United in Okigwe.
pcm: Mean say, If di two match for Kaduna and Ilorin go finish for draw, Pillars go enta top first before we sabi di result of tomoro match between Abia Warriors and Akwa United for Okigwe

eng: Although Pillars will be motivated by Super Eagles captain, Ahmed Musa and their influential captain Rabiu Ali, they must be wary of Nasarawa United who ended their 12-year unbeaten home record with a 2-1 victory in 2015.
pcm: Though Pillars go dey motivated wit di Captain of Super Eagles Ahmed Musa and their captain wey get influence Rabiu Ali, but dem must fear Nasarawa United wey spoil dia 12-year unbeaten for home wit wining of 2-1 for 2015.

eng: In todays match, Pillars will have to put an eye on Adamu Hassan who left them under unpleasant circumstances in 2020 to rejoin his home club and has been consistent in scoring against them.
pcm: For today match, Pillar go wan put eyes for Adamu Hassan wey as e comot go join im town club for 2020 nor sweet am and e don dey score dem evri time.

eng: It will also be recalled that the experienced striker scored a brace against Pillars when Nasarawa United trounced them 5-0 in a friendly match last year.
pcm: We go remember say dis striker wey get experience score two enta pillar wen Nasarawa United waya dem 5-0 for one friendly match last year.

eng: And when they met in the first round of the ongoing season in Lafia, it was the same player who denied Pillars victory when he scored the equaliser in the 1-1 draw.
pcm: And wen dem meet for di first round of dis season for Lafia, na dis same player no gree make Pillars win wen e score equaliser for di 1-1 tight tight .

eng: Hassan is, therefore, confident he will score against his former club as he told Daily Trust yesterday that he normally scores anytime he plays against Pillars.
pcm: Hassan now, don get mind say im go score im former club as im bin tell Daily Trust yesterday say im normally score anytime he play against Pillars.

eng: I know they must have mapped out their plan against me but it has been hard for them to stop me.
pcm: I sabi say dem go don do dia plan against me but e dey dey hard for dem to stop me.

eng: They think they know me
pcm: Dem think say dem sabi me.

eng: but I keep scoring against them.
pcm: But I still dey score dem.

eng: Tomorrows (today) match is not going to be an exception.
pcm: Tomorrows (today) match no go dey different.

eng: I know by the grace of almighty Allah, I will score again, he said.
pcm: I sabi say by di grace of almighty Allah, I go score again, Na so im tok

eng: In other week 23 matches billed for today, Adamawa United will host Katsina United in Gombe, FC IfeanyiUbah visit Dakkada in Uyo, Lobi Stars will move from Lagos where they lost 0-1 against MFM to play Wolves in Ozoro, MFM will attempt to dim Sunshine Stars in Akure while embattled Wikki Tourists battle Enyimba in Bauchi.
pcm: Inside other week 23 match wey dem put for today, Adamawa United go host Katsina United for Gombe, FC IfeanyiUbah visit Dakkada for Uyo, Lobi Stars go move from Lagos wia  they lost 0-1 against MFM to go play Wolves in Ozoro, MFM go go face Sunshine Stars wey no him light no too shine for Akure while Wikki Tourists wey get challenges go challenge Enyimba for Bauchi.

eng: Power: Nigerians spend $21bn on generators — Reps
pcm: Power: Nigeria pipo dey spend $21bn ontop generators — Reps

eng: The House of Representatives has said the manufacturing sector lost $200 billion while other Nigerians spent $21 billion on generators between 2015 and 2021 on self-generated electricity due to poor electricity supply from the national grid.
pcm: Di House of Representatives don tok say pipo wey dey manufacture lost $200 billion as other Nigeria pipo spend $21 billion ontop generators between 2015 and 2021 ontop light wey pesin generate for im sef ontop say light no good for di nation.

eng: The House also called on the Nigerian Electricity Regulatory Commission (NERC) to suspend the proposed increase in electricity tariff.
pcm: Di House also don call Di Nigeria Electricity Regulatory Commission (NERC) to suspend di increase wey dem wan do ontop price for light.

eng: According to Aniekan Umanah who moved the motion at the plenary on Thursday, NERC, working with Distribution Companies (DisCos), increased electricity tariff five times since 2015, the latest being on January1, 2021.
pcm: According to Aniekan Umanah wey moved di motion for di plenary for Thursday, NERC, dey work wit Distribution Companies (DisCos), and dem increased electricity tariff five times since 2015, di last one na January1, 2021.

eng: According to him, despite the increases, Nigerians have not enjoyed significant improvement in power generation, but grapple with epileptic supply and poor services from the DisCos.
pcm: As e take talk, despite say dem increases, Nigeria pipo neva enjoy beta ontop light, but dey suffer wit on and off light and poor service wey dem DisCos dey give.

eng: Poor services by the DisCos have impacted negatively on the socio-economic growth of the country as the International Monetary Fund (IMF) Report of 2020 on Nigeria indicated that the manufacturing sector lost over $200bn to inadequate power supply while a whopping $21bn was said to have been spent by Nigerians on generating sets within the period under review.
pcm: Poor service wey DisCos pipo dey give don get bad way ontop to grow di economy of di kontri as di International Monetary Fund (IMF) Report for 2020 ontop Nigeria show say di manufacturing sector lost moni wey pass $200bn to light wey nor good and big $21bn n aim dem say Nigeria pipo don spend on top to generator inside dat time wey dem review.

eng: The House, therefore, urged the federal government to direct NERC to rescind the decision to further increase electricity tariff proposed for June, 202l, in view of the hard times Nigerian masses were going through.
pcm: Di House, now don beg di federal goment  make dem direct NERC to cancel dia plan to still put moni join wey dem put for June 2021 bikos of dis hard time wey Nigeria pipo dey.

eng: The house mandated the committees on power, poverty alleviation and labour, employment and productivity to ensure compliance.
pcm: Di house don make di committees for power, poverty alleviation and labour, employment and productivity see say dem do am.

eng: Border reopening discourages hoarding in Katsina markets
pcm: Border wey dem open back spoil to dey keepkeep tins for Katsina markets.

eng: But theres the need to protect the health of consumers who patronise the market.
pcm: But e dey important to protect di health of pipo wey dey patronise di market.

eng: Sultan asks Nigerians to stop blaming military for Constitutional crisis
pcm: Sultan don tell Nigerians say make dem no dey blame di military for Konstitutional crisis.

eng: Alhaji Saad Abubakar III, the Sultan of Sokoto, has asked Nigerians to stop blaming the military for constitutional crisis.
pcm: Alhaji Saad Abubakar III, di Sultan of Sokoto, don tell Nigerians say make dem stop to dey blame di military for konstitutional crisis.

eng: Social commentators, activists, government critics, among many others have at different times identified what they consider as gaps in the constitution, attributing the development to the military.
pcm: Pipo wey be social commentator, activist, government critic, and many odas for different time don see wetin dem consida as gap for di konstitution, and dem don blame di military for dis development.

eng: In his remarks at the North West Zonal Public Hearing on the Constitution Review organised by the House of Representatives for Stakeholders from Sokoto, Kebbi and Zamfara, the monarch advised Nigerians to face the reality and suggest whether to have a new constitution or amend the current one before the 2023 general elections.
pcm: Durin im tok for di North West Zonal Public Hearing on Konstitution Review wey di House of Representatives organise for Stakeholders wey com from Sokoto, Kebbi and Zamfara, na im di monarch advise Nigerians say make dem face di reality, and make dem tok weda to get a new constitution or amend di one wey we dey use befor di 2023 general election.

eng: Please, stop flogging the military, forget about what the military did and face the reality on ground.
pcm: Di monarch beg say make we stop to dey abuse di military, make we forget wetin di military don do and face di reality wey dey.

eng: We have the constitution given to us by the military and the military made the constitution; the military also created 36 states, created Abuja and moved the capital from Lagos State to Abuja.
pcm: We get di konstitution wey di military give us, and na di military create di konstitution; na dis same military create di 36 states, create Abuja, kom move di capital from Lagos to Abuja.

eng: The military had set up governments in so many states with the appointment of 99 percent civilians in the government and all of you agreed to it.
pcm: Di military don set up government for plenti state, and na 99 percent civilians dem put for inside di government, and na all of una agree laidat.

eng: So, stop flogging the military, look at the constitution, if it is good for us or not; that is all.
pcm: So, make una no dey abuse di military, look di konstitution, if e gud for us abi e no gud; Na im be dat.

eng: If you think we need to change the constitution, this is the time.
pcm: If una tink say we need change di constitution, na di time be dis.

eng: If you think we need to just amend it, this is the time; but it is just two years to 2023 elections.
pcm: If una tink say na amend we need amend am, na di time be dis; but na jus two years remain for 2023 election.

eng: Can we afford a new constitution or should we make just some amendments so that when the new governments come in, they can bring fresh faces, minds to fashion our new constitution?
pcm: Shey we fit afford a new konstitution abi make we jus do som amendment so dat when di new government enta, dey fit bring new face and mind to create awa new konstitution?

eng: Those are the questions I want you to think about here, the Sultan told the hearing.
pcm: Na di question wey I wan make una dey tink about for hia be dat, di Sultan yarn for di meeting.

eng: The monarch retired from the Nigerian Army where he rose to the rank of Brigadier General.
pcm: Na from di Nigerian Army di monarch retire afta he don reach di rank of Brigadier General.

eng: 2023: PDP, APC bicker over burning of INEC offices
pcm: 2023: PDP, APC quarrel on top INEC offices wey dem dey born.

eng: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and the All Progressives Congress (APC) are bickering over the burning of offices of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) in some parts of the country.
pcm: Di Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and di All Progressives Congress (APC) dey quarrel on top di office of di Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) wey dem dey burn for som part of di kontri.

eng: The PDP, in a statement by its spokesperson, Kola Ologbondiyan, alleged that the APC had been promoting acts of violence including the burning of INEC offices to build up an emergency situation and frustrate the smooth conduct of the 2023 general elections.
pcm: Di PDP,throughdia tok-tok pesin, Kola Ologbondiyan, yarn say di APC don dey promote different act of violence, including di burning of INEC offices to create trouble wey go scatter di easy conduct of di 2023 general election.

eng: It is despicable that having realised that it has no place in the 2023 election, given its abysmal failure in governance, APC leaders are seeking to set our country ablaze and truncate our hard-earned democracy.
pcm: E dey veri evil say becos dem don sabi say dem no get leg for 2023 election, becos of dia bad failure for governance, APC leaders wan put fire for awa kontri and block di demokracy wey we suffer for.

eng: The PDP invites Nigerians to note the failure of the APC and its leaders to forcefully condemn this clear assault on our frontline institution of democracy.
pcm: Di PDP dey call on Nigerians to note di failure of di APC and im leaders, and to seriously condemn dis violent attack on dis important institution of awa demokracy.

eng: This is also as the APC administration has failed to take decisive steps to protect INEC facilities from assailants.
pcm: Dem tok say di APC administration no take step to ensure say INEC facilities dey protected from attackers.

eng: Our party wants the APC to know that May 29, 2023 date is sacrosanct for it to leave office, free our nation from its stranglehold and fizzle out from our political firmament, it stated.
pcm: Awa party wan make di APC sabi say May 29, 2023 na unchangeable day for dem to kommot for office, free awa nation from dier grip and disapear from awa politikal space.

eng: Reacting, APC in a statement by Secretary of the Caretaker Committee, Senator John James Akpanudoedehe alleged that the PDP had undemocratic plans.
pcm: In reaction, di APC tokthroughdi Secretary of dia Caretaker Committee, Senator John James Akpanudoedehe say di PDP get undemocratik plans.

eng: The party said using lies and sponsored media attacks on the President Muhammadu Buhari-led APC government, the PDP has shown its hands as sponsors behind the politically-motivated attacks on some of our public and democratic institutions in the country, all in a clearly desperate bid to destabilise this government.
pcm: Di part tok saythroughlies and sponsored media attacks on di President Muhammadu Buhari APC government, di PDP don show say na dem dey sponsor di politikally-motivated attack on som of awa public and democratik institution for di kontri, and na clear attempt to destabilise dis government by fire by force.

eng: The APC said, Perhaps, the PDP thinks Nigerians have forgotten its long and documented penchant of eroding and destroying democratic institutions.
pcm: The APC said, Perhaps, the PDP thinks Nigerians have forgotten its long and documented penchant of eroding and destroying democratic institutions.

eng: To name one, was it not the same PDP that attempted to discredit INEC and the entire 2019 election with a bogus tale of a server that never existed and employed hackers to disrupt the communication network of the electoral body during the 2019 election?
pcm: For example, no be di same PDP wey try discredit INEC and di whole 2019 election wit fake tori of server wey no dey, na dem still employ hackers to scatter di communication network of di electoral bodi during di 2019 election?

eng: The APC cannot be at home and burn its house.
pcm: Di APC no fit dey e house com burn di house.

eng: A winner cannot destroy the process that brought it to success.
pcm: A winner no fit scatter di process wey bring am success.

eng: From the 2015 to 2019 elections, Nigerians spoke clearly through their votes for the APC by mandating us to rescue the country from the PDPs 16-year misadventure.
pcm: From di 2015 to 2019 election, Nigerians don talk clearlythroughdia vote for di APC, and dem don give us di authority to rescue di kontri from di PDP 16-year problem.

eng: The PDP should address itself to the reality that it stands rejected by the electorate.
pcm: Make di PDP accept di reality say di electorate don reject am.

eng: Its undemocratic plan is ill-fated and will fail woefully.
pcm: Dia undemocratik plan no dey favourable, and e go fail badly.

eng: Hawan Daushe: Police use teargas to foil attack in Kano
pcm: som thugs dey trow stones on top di police but di police overpower dem befor di pipo fit pass.

eng: Swift intervention by the police operatives saved thousands of spectators of Hawan Daushe, a traditional Sallah Durbar, from what would have been a massive attack by a gang of lawless youths in Kano.
pcm: Fast intervention by di police don save thousands of pipo wey go Hawan Daushe, a traditional Sallah festival, from somtin wey for don be a big attack by a gang of lawless youths for Kano.

eng: The youths in their numbers blocked the road a few meters from Kofar Kudu, the venue of the durbar to launch an attack on the retreating crowd of unsuspecting spectators before the police swiftly intervened by firing teargas.
pcm: Di plenti youths block di road som few meters from Kofar Kudu wey be di venue of di durbar to launch attack on di crowd of pipo wey dey kom back, befor di police quickly intervene wit teargas.

eng: Thugs pelted stones at the police but they were overpowered before the people were able to pass.
pcm: Som thugs dey trow stones on top di police but di police overpower dem befor di pipo fit pass.

eng: The incidents had trapped many of the durbar spectators at the emirs palace till about 7 pm.
pcm: Di incident don hold many of di pipo wey com watch di durbar for di emir palace till about 7 pm.

eng: The incident started immediately after the governors convoy had left the emirs palace after the ceremony.
pcm: Na immediately di governor convoy comot for di emir palace afta di ceremony, na im di incident start.

eng: The gang mobilized and blocked the road to rob the public and cause mayhem in the area.
pcm: Di gang mobilize and block di road to rob di pipo and cause kasala for di area.

eng: Hawan Daushe has always been characterized by thugs clashes which usually leave scores injured.
pcm: E don becom normal tin for thugs to fight and injure pipo evritime dem do Hawan Daushe.

eng: But there was no report of injury from Fridays incident.
pcm: But we no hear say anybodi injure from di incident on Friday.

eng: This is the first Sallah durbar organised by the Emir of Kano, Alhaji Aminu Ado Bayero, since his enthronement last year.
pcm: Na di first Sallah durbar wey Alhaji Aminu Ado Bayero go organise as di Emir of Kano, since wey he don climb di throne last year.

eng: The annual event was cancelled last year as a measure to curb the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic in the state.
pcm: Dem cancel di event last year as a way to stop di spread of COVID-19 pandemic for di state.

eng: Fridays event, which started around 5 pm, witnessed a large turnout from various sections of Kano society.
pcm: Na plenty pipo kom di event from different part of Kano society after e start by 5pm.

eng: Governor Abdullahi Umar Ganduje and many political elites were also in attendance.
pcm: Governor Abdullahi Umar Ganduje and plenti political big-men sef dey dere.

eng: The event as usual started from Kofar Kwaru where the emir rode on a horse alongside his royal guards in traditional regalia to Gidan Mai Babban Daki, where he paid Sallah homage to his stepmothers in the stead of his biological mother who passed on, weeks ago.
pcm: As e dey always be, di event start from Kofar Kwaru wia di emir go climb horse inside im traditional regalia, wit dem royal guard to Gidan Mai Babban Daki, wia e go pay Sallah homage to e stepmothers, as replacement for e own mama who die som weeks ago.

eng: After the visit to Gidan Mai Babban Daki, the Emir rode back to the palace through Kofar Kudu where he received homage from his district heads and other titleholders in a traditional display of horsemanship before he retreated to the palace thereby drawing the curtain for the famous Hawan Daushe.
pcm: Afta di visit to Gidan Mai Babban Daki, di Emir climb e horse back to di palacethroughKofar Kudu wia e receive homage from e district heads and oda pipo wey get title in a show of traditional horsemanship befor e go back to di palace. And dis na im be di end of di popular Hawan Daushe.

eng: Chadian rebels, government forces clash in area where Deby was shot
pcm: Chadian rebels don clash wit government forces for area wia dem shoot Deby.

eng: Government troops and rebels clashed on Thursday in a region of western Chad where president Idriss Deby Itno was killed earlier this month.
pcm: Government troops don clash wit rebels on Thursday for one place in di Western region of Chad wia dem kill president Idriss Deby Itno earlier dis month.

eng: The fight in the desert region of Kanem, near Chads border with Niger, pits Libya-based rebels against forces loyal to a new military junta led by Debys son.
pcm: Di fight for di desert region of Kanem, near Chad border wit Niger, put Libya-based rebels against forces wey dey loyal to di new military junta wey Deby son dey lead.

eng: Fiercely criticised for authoritarianism and inequality, Deby was seen as a trusty ally by many Western countries including the former colonial power France.
pcm: Na many western kontries including di former colonial power France, strongly criticise Deby for total control of power and inequality, and dem see am trusty ally.

eng: He was seen as a stabilising force in the fight against jihadism in the wider Sahel region on the southern fringes of the Sahara desert.
pcm: Dem see am as a stabilising force in di fight against jihadism in di wider Sahel region for di southern part of di Sahara desert.

eng: Fighting is continuing in Kanem  we are going to have continue to fight, otherwise they will destabilise us, junta spokesman General Azem Bermandoa Agouna told AFP.
pcm: Junta tok-tok pesin General Azem Bermandoa Agouna tell AFP say fighting go kontinue for Kanem, e tok say dem go need kontinue dey fight, if not, dem go scatta dem .

eng: The Military Transition Council (CMT) is headed by 37-year-old Mahamat Idriss Deby.
pcm: Na 37-year-old Mahamat Idriss Deby head di Military Transition Council (CMT).

eng: For now the fight against the Front for Change and Concord in Chad (FACT), drawn mainly from the Goran ethnic group, is going on about 300 kilometres (180 miles) north of the capital NDjamena.
pcm: For now, di fight against di Front for Change and Concord for Chad (FACT), wey kom mainly from di Goran ethnic group, dey go on about 300 kilometres (180 miles) north of di kapital N'Djamena.

eng: Security sources, without giving further details, said the Chadian army bombarded FACT positions.
pcm: Security pipo tok say Chadian army bombard FACT positions. Dem no give plenti tori for di matta.

eng: Deby, 68, died on April 19, from wounds he suffered fighting the Libya-based rebels, according to the authorities.
pcm: Accordin to di authorities, Deby, wey be 68 die on April 19, due to di wound wey he carry wen e dey fight di Libya-based rebels.

eng: The insurgents had launched an offensive in the northern Tibesti region on April 11 as presidential elections were unfolding.
pcm: Di insurgents don launch one offensive attack for di northern Tibesti region for April 11 as dem dey prepare for presidential election.

eng: A career soldier who seized power in 1990 and exercised it ruthlessly for 30 years, Deby died on the day that the electoral commission confirmed that he had won a landslide victory.
pcm: As a career soldier wey seize power for 1990 kom use am anyhow for 30 years, Deby die for di day wey di electoral commission confam say e win.

eng: Hundreds arrested at protests
pcm: Dem arrest ova hundred pipo for protests.

eng: FACT is led by Mahamat Mahadi Ali, a veteran insurgent who previously lived in France.
pcm: FACT leader na Mahamat Mahadi Ali wey be ogbologbo insurgent wey don live for France befor.

eng: The group vowed to pursue its offensive after a pause for Debys funeral on April 23.
pcm: Di group swear say dem go kontinue dia attack, afta dem don wait small say make dem do Deby burial on April 23.

eng: Experts believe FACT has between 1,500 and 2,000 fighters.
pcm: Experts believe say FACT get between 1,500 and 2,000 fighters.

eng: The Chadian army claimed on April 19 to have killed 300 rebels and captured 246 others, who were being taken to the capital NDjamena to stand trial but military casualties have not been made public.
pcm: Di Chadian army claim for April 19 say dem don kill 300 rebels, and dem don catch 246 odas, wey dem dey carry go di kapital for N'Djamena to go face trial. But dem neva announce au many soldiers die.

eng: The armed forces recently sent reinforcements to Kanem, security forces said.
pcm: Security forces tok say e neva tey wey di armed forces send reinforcements go Kanem.

eng: On Sunday, the CMT announced there would be no mediation or negotiation with FACT and called on Niger to help it capture the groups chief.
pcm: On Sunday, di CMT announce say mediation or negotiation no go apun wit FACT, and e don call on Niger to help dem catch di leader of di group.

eng: The CMT took over on April 20, immediately after Debys death was announced, as parliament and government were dissolved.
pcm: Di CMT take over on April 20, immediately dem announce di death of Deby, wey dem kom scatta parliament and government.

eng: It has promised an 18-month transition period before free and transparent elections.
pcm: E don promise 18-month transition period befor dem go conduct free and transparent election.

eng: At least six people died on Tuesday in banned protests against the junta, according to the authorities, while a local NGO reported nine fatalities.
pcm: As di authorities tok, up to six pipo die on Tuesday for we-no-go-gree against di junta, but as one local NGO tok, na nine pipo loose dia lives.

eng: Prosecutors said Thursday that they were interviewing over 700 people arrested at demonstrations on Tuesday and Wednesday.
pcm: Prosecutors tok on Thursday say dem dey interview ova 700 pipo wey dem arrest for we-no-go-gree on Tuesday and Wednesday.

eng: Dozens of arrested protesters were brought in police vehicles to the capitals high court Thursday from different police stations around the city.
pcm: Many dozens of protesters wey dem arrest na im dem bring inside police motor kom high court for Thursday from different police stations around di city.

eng: A majority of them have already been through and many have been released, NDjamena prosecutor Youssouf Tom told AFP.
pcm: Dem don clear many of dem, and dem don release plenti. ,N'Djamena prosecutor Youssouf Tom tell AFP.

eng: On Monday, the military junta appointed Albert Pahimi Padacke as transitional prime minister.
pcm: On Monday, di military junta appoint Albert Pahimi Padacke as di transitional prime minister.

eng: He called for a nationwide effort to speed the return to civilian rule.(AFP)
pcm: E call for a nationwide effort to make di return to civilian rule quick.(AFP)

eng: Politicians urged not to overheat polity over insecurity
pcm: Make Politicians no overheat di polity ova insecurity.

eng: A former Deputy National Chairman of the defunct Congress for Progressive Change (CPC), Alhaji Salihu Mustapha, has urged top politicians to stop making statements that will overheat the polity, ignite crises and plunge Nigeria into another civil war.
pcm: Befor-befor Deputy National Chairman of di former Congress for Progressive Change (CPC), Alhaji Salihu Mustapha, don tell top politicians make dem stop to dey tok tins wey go overheat di polity, cause crises and push Nigeria into anoda civil war.

eng: Alhaji Mustapha, who is contesting for the chairmanship of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) ahead of the partys national convention, in a statement on Sunday, said a united Nigeria should be the concern of all to enable the country to conduct a successful transition in 2023.
pcm: Alhaji Mustapha wey dey contest for di chairmanship of di ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) ahead of di party national convention, tok on Sunday say, awa consign suppose be di Nigeria wey evribodi dey united so dat di kontri go fit conduct a successful transition for 2023.

eng: He explained that no country survived civil war twice, and therefore appealed to Nigerians to support President Muhammadu Buhari-led government in proffering solutions to the challenges bedevilling the nation.
pcm: E explain say no kontri don eva survive civil war two times, so e dey beg Nigerians, make dem support di President Muhammadu Buhari government to provide solution to di problems wey dey face di nation.

eng: He said, I condemn the attempt by some groups and persons to politicise our security challenges.
pcm: E tok say make we condemn di attempt by som pipo to turn awa security matta into politiks .

eng: As Nigerians, we should learn from the ethnic crises in Rwanda and elsewhere.
pcm: As Nigerians, we suppose learn from di my-pipo, una-pipo crises wey apun for Rwanda and oda place.

eng: Violence has never solved any countrys problems.
pcm: Violence neva eva solve any kontri problem befor.

eng: War or violence does not recognise religion or tribe.
pcm: War or violence no dey recognise religion or tribe.

eng: It is a consuming fire.
pcm: Na fire wey dey destroy tins.

eng: It is not a respecter of anybody  the poor or rich, old or young.
pcm: E no respect anybodi, weda di poor or rich, old or young.

eng: Nigerians who were born after the civil war should learn lessons from Rwanda in 1994.
pcm: Make Nigerians wey dem born afta di civil war learn lesson from Rwanda in 1994.

eng: War is bad, war is evil.
pcm: War no gud, war na evil.

eng: Let us be properly guided.
pcm: Make all of us dey well guided.

eng: He that rushes to war or advocates war should know that war brings death and destruction.
pcm: Pesin wey dey rush go war, or pesin wey dey call for war suppose sabi say na death and destruction war dey bring.

eng: Serena suffers shock loss in historic 1 000th match
pcm: Serena don loose for historic 1000th match

eng: Serena Williams, playing the 1 000th Tour-level match of her glittering career, suffered a shock 7-6(6)
pcm: Serena Williams, wey play di 1000th Tour-level match of her glittering career, don suffer a shock 7-6(6)

eng: 7-5 defeat by Argentinas
pcm: 7-5 defeat by Argentina

eng: Nadia Podoroska in the the Italian Open second round on Wednesday.
pcm: Nadia Podoroska for di Italian Open second round on Wednesday.

eng: Playing her first competitive match in nearly three months, the 23-times Grand Slam champion twice came back from a break down but struggled on her first serve as Podoroska took the opening set in the tiebreak.
pcm: Na di first competitive match wey she go play for up to three months, di 23-times Grand Slam champion kom back twice from a break down but struggle for her first serve as Podoroska take di opening set in di tiebreak.

eng: Podoroska, who reached the French Open semifinals last year, produced a string of heavy topspin forehands to take control of the match with an early break in the second set.
pcm: Podoroska, wey reach di French Open semifinal last year, produce a string of heavy topspin forehands to take control of di match wit early break in di second set.

eng: Although Podoroska was broken to love on her first attempt to serve out the match, she maintained her composure to break again and secure a place in the round of 16.
pcm: Even say Podoroska brake to love for her first attempt to serve out di match, she maintain her composure to break again and secure a place in di round of 16.

eng: Defeat for Williams, who received an opening round bye in Rome, was a major blow to her preparations for the French Open, starting on 30 May.
pcm: Defeat for Williams, wey receive an opening round bye for Rome, na big blow to her preparation for di French Open, wey go start on 30 May.

eng: It was the Americans 149th defeat in her 1 000 career WTA matches.
pcm: Na di American 149th defeat wey she go get for her 1000 career WTA match.

eng: World number two Naomi Osaka also crashed out of the tournament, losing 7-6(2) 6-2 to American Jessica Pegula.
pcm: World numba two, Naomi Osaka sef don komot for di tournament, afta she loose 7-6(2) 6-2 to American Jessica Pegula.

eng: Osaka, a four-times Grand Slam winner, has often struggled on clay and her defeat in Rome followed a second-round loss at the Madrid Open this month.
pcm: Osaka, wey be four-times Grand Slam winner, dey struggle for clay most times, and her defeat for Rome kom afta she loose second-round for di Madrid Open dis month.

eng: Man nabbed over threat to employer
pcm: Dem don arrest one man, sake of say e threaten im oga

eng: The police in Edo State  have arrested a 25-year-old man, identified as  Mike Ashien, for allegedly threatening to  kidnap and murder his employer.
pcm: Di police for Edo State don arrest one 25-year-old man, wey e name be Mike Ashien, sake of say e threaten to kidnap and kill im oga.

eng: It was gathered that the suspect is an  employee of a domestic oil company located in Ugbogui community, Ovia South-West LG  of the state.
pcm: We hear say di suspect na employee of one domestic oil company wey dey Ugbogui community, for Ovia South-West LG of di state.

eng: It was further gathered that the suspect hid his phone number and called his employer demanding N10 million from him or have him kidnapped and killed.
pcm: We also hear say di suspect hide im fone number, kom call im employer begin dey ask for N10 million, if not e go kidnap and kill am.

eng: It was also gathered that after the threat, his employer reported the matter to the state police Commissioner, Philip Ogbadu,  who ordered an investigation in the matter.
pcm: We still hear say afta di threat, e oga report di matta to di state police Commissioner, Philip Ogbadu, who give order say make dem investigate di matta.

eng: Speaking with journalists, the suspect said pressing family problem forced him into the act.
pcm: Wen jurnalists dey follo di suspect yarn, e tok say na family problem wey hold am for neck force am commit di crime.

eng: My boss pays me N20,000 monthly but  it is not enough for me and l
pcm: As e tok; My oga dey pay me N20,000 evri month but e no dey reach me, and I

eng: just threatened him to get more money from him, but I have learnt my lesson and  I am now regretting, he said.
pcm: jus shakara am to get more moni from e hand. But I don learn my lesson and I don dey regret am.

eng: IAR researches on Tela maize to tackle pests, drought
pcm: IAR don dey do research on Tela maize as a way to tackle pests and drought

eng: In 2019, Nigeria joined six other African countries  Kenya, Mozambique, Tanzania, Uganda, South Africa and Ethiopia  to enter into a Tela maize project.
pcm: For 2019, Nigeria join six oda African kontri Kenya, Mozambique, Tanzania, Uganda, South Africa and Ethiopia to enta a Tela maize project.

eng: The Tela maize project is a public-private partnership to develop and commercialise the transgenic insect-protected and drought-tolerant maize varieties to boost the farmers productivity.
pcm: Di Tela maize project na public-private partnership wey go develop and commercialise di transgenic insect-protected and drought-tolerant variety  of maize to increase di productivity of farmers.

eng: Tela maize is double-dose (moderate drought and insect resistance) maize varieties designed to help farmers have better yields.
pcm: Tela maize na double-dose (moderate drought and insect resistance) maize variety wey dem design to help farmers get beta yield.

eng: At the Institute of Agricultural Research (IAR), Ahmadu Bello University (ABU), Zaria, a team of scientists are working on the maize varieties to ensure that by 2022, farmers across the country would have access to it after it has gone through all the necessary regulations.
pcm: For di Institute of Agricultural Research (IAR), Ahmadu Bello University (ABU), Zaria, a join-bodi of scientists dey work on di maize variety to ensure say by 2022, farmers all ova di kontri go fit get am afta e don follow all di necessari regulation.

eng: Professor Mohammed Faguji, a seed breeder and the executive director of the IAR, said global warming brought two adverse conditions (drought and flooding), in addition to pests that made farming difficult for many smallholder farmers.
pcm: Professor Mohammed Faguji wey be seed breeder and di executive director of di IAR, tok say na two bad condition global warming bring (drought and flooding), plus pest wey make farming difficult for many small-scale farmers.

eng: The Tela maize, he said, was to solve those problems.
pcm: He tok say na dose problem di Tela maize go solve.

eng: Daily Trust on Sunday visited the field where the varieties are undergoing confined field trials to evaluate the efficacy and efficiency of the drought and pest-resistant attributes before seeking the approval of the necessary authorities  for environmental release and subsequently, commercialisation, with 2022 as the target year.
pcm: Daily Trust visit di farm on Sunday wia dem dey do different confined field trials to evaluate di efficacy and efficiency of di drought and pest-resistant quality befor dem collect di approval of di necessari authorities to release am to di environmental and afta, begin dey sell am for 2022.

eng: Professor Rabiu Adamu is the principal investigator (lead researcher) of the genetically modified Tela maize project.
pcm: Professor Rabiu Adamu na di principal investigator (lead researcher) of di genetically modified Tela maize project.

eng: He told Daily Trust on Sunday at the trial fields in Zaria that the research had two strong aims: to produce transgenic hybrid varieties of maize for the first time in Nigeria
pcm: E tell Daily Trust on Sunday for di experiment farm wey dey Zaria say di research get two strong pupose: to produce transgenic hybrid variety of maize for di first time in Nigeria,

eng: , that are resistant to most maize pests, particularly the major pests of maize, stem borers and the fall army worms, and to produce maize hybrid
pcm: wey dey resistant to most maize pest, especially di major ones, stem borers and di fall army worms, and to produce maize hybrid

eng: that are also tolerant to drought.
pcm: wey also dey tolerant to drought.

eng: These hybrids are genetically modified, using biotechnology to make them resistant.
pcm: Dis hybrids dey genetically modified, and na biotechnology dem use make dem resistant.

eng: So they have a gene from soil-dwelling bacterial that is inserted into the maize gene that compasses resistance to insect pests, especially those that damage maize, that is the fall army worm and the complex of stem borers, which are three: the pink stem borer and the other species the maize stalk-borer -Busseolafusca and Sesamiacalamistis.
pcm: Dem get gene from bacteria we dey live for soil wey dem put inside di maize gene, and e include resistance to insect pests, especially dose ones wey dey spoil maize, di fall army worm and di complex of stem borers, wey be three: di pink stem borer and di oda specie, di maize stalk-borer -Busseolafusca and Sesamiacalamistis.

eng: These are the two key stem borers of maize in this part of the country.
pcm: Dis na di two main stem borers of maize for dis part of di kontri.

eng: These hybrids we are testing are genetically modified to resist damage by insect pests, especially stem borers and fall army worms as you have seen in the field, he explained.
pcm: Dis hybrid wey we dey test dey genetically modified to resist damage by insect pests, especially stem borers and fall army worms as u don see for di farm, e explain.

eng: He said the current crop in the field was the third Confined Field Trials (CFT).
pcm: E tok say di current crop wey dey di farm na di third Confined Field Trials (CFT).
