eng: We are hoping to environmentally realise these hybrid in Nigerian  fields in other research institutes and some out stations to test them to confirm and validate the implicating of the gene, not only here.
pcm: No be only hia we dey hope to realise dis hybrid, but for Nigerian farm, for oda research institute and some out station to test dem to confam and validate di implication of di gene.

eng: Thereafter, we will write a memo to the regulator to allow us conduct more trails outside the conferment in other farmers fields   and other research institutes, he added.
pcm: E kontinue say, afta, we go write memo to di regulator say make e allow us conduct more trails outside di conferment, for oda pipo farm and oda research institute.

eng: Speaking on when the farmers are likely to get the seeds, he said that after one year when the results are ready, they would submit the dossier to the National Biosafety Management Agency (NBMA) for permission to take it to the  farmers to do national multiplication trails.
pcm: On wen di farmers go fit get di seeds, e tok say afta one year wey di result don ready, dem go submit di report to di National Biosafety Management Agency (NBMA) for permission to take am to di farmers to do national multiplication trail.

eng: Out of the 16 entries, the best performing hybrids selected by the famers will be evaluated and reports submitted to the National Varietal Release Committee in Ibadan.
pcm: Out of di 16 entry, dem go evaluate and submit di report of di best hybrid wey di famers select to di National Varietal Release Committee for Ibadan.

eng: Once they accept that the varieties have met the minimum requirement for them to be released as hybrid, they can be released to farmers, he said.
pcm: E tok say once dem accept say di varieties don meet di minimum requirement for dem to release dem as hybrid, dem go fit release am to  di farmers.

eng: The scientists are tentatively looking at December 2022 for its release so that in about three years, farmers everywhere will have access to the seed.
pcm: If possible, di scientists dey reason December 2022 for di release so dat in about three years, farmers for evriwia go get access to di seed.

eng: Dr Muhyideen  Oyekunle, the  lead, Trials and Pipeline Testing, who took our reporter around,  explained the biotic and abiotic attributes of the ongoing  progress of the Tela maize research planted in three plots to evaluate the efficacy of the resistance to drought, fall army worm and stem borers.
pcm: Dr Muhyideen Oyekunle, di leader, Trial and Pipeline Testing, wey carry awa tori-pesin waka explain di biotic and abiotic attribute of di ongoing progress of di Tela maize research wey dem plant for three plots to evaluate di efficacy of di resistance to drought, fall army worm and stem borers.

eng: In the field, there are very clear differences, the non-GM maize, which infected pests almost completely ravaged by the fall army worm, stem borers, whereas the GM varieties were completely untouched even though the two varieties (Tela Maize and the traditional seeds that do not have biotech protection are planted in close proximity) side-by-side.
pcm: For di farm, plenty difference dey, di one wey no be GM maize, get infected wit pests, di fall army worm, stem borers, almost finish am completely, but notin touch di GM variety, even say dem plant di two (Tela Maize and di traditional seed wey no get biotech protection) side-by-side.

eng: The ongoing field results as seen by our reporter shows great prospect although the yield remains to be seen and evaluated.
pcm: Di ongoing field result wey awa tori-pesin see show say great prospect dey, even say dem go still need see and evaluate di yield.

eng: Until then, there is solution to pests and drought problems on sight.
pcm: Until then, solution to pests and drought problems dey road.

eng: Some of the varieties are yellow but most of them are white, however, in the trials, more than 90 percent are white maize because it is preferred by industry players.
pcm: Som of di varieties na yellow but most of dem be white. For di trial, more dan 90 percent na white maize becos na im industry players prefer.

eng: But the scientists major challenges are COVID-19 pandemic and the issue of misperception and misinformation about the technology.
pcm: But di scientists major problem na COVID-19 pandemic and di issue of misperception and misinformation about di technology.

eng: People who dont know how the technology works like to use the social media and other non-scientific avenues to confuse and mislead the public and other scientists, the lead researcher, Professor Adamu said.
pcm: Pipo wey no sabi how di technology dey work like to dey use social media and oda non-scientific way to confuse and mislead di public and oda scientists. Di lead researcher, Professor Adamu na im tok so.

eng: The Tela maize scheme is a collaboration between the African Agricultural Technology Foundation (AATF) and the IAR under the Tela maize project implemented in seven African countries.
pcm: Di Tela maize scheme na join-bodi between di Afrikan Agricultural Technology Foundation (AATF) and di IAR under di Tela maize project wey dey happun for seven Afrikan kontris.

eng: It builds on the success on breeding work under the Water Efficient Maize for Africa (WEMA) project designed to develop drought-tolerant and insect-protected maize varieties.
pcm: E dey build on di success on breeding work under di Water Efficient Maize for Afrika (WEMA) project wey dem design to develop different type of maize wey dey resistant to drought and wey dey protected from insect.

eng: 2023: Middle Belt, southern leaders ask APC, PDP to zone presidential ticket to South
pcm: 2023: Middle Belt and Southern leaders don tell APC and PDP say make dem zone presidential ticket to di South.

eng: The Southern and Middle Belt Leaders Forum (SMBLF) has asked the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) and the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) to zone their 2023 presidential tickets to the South.
pcm: Di Southern and Middle Belt Leaders Forum (SMBLF) don tell di ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) and di Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) say make dem zone dia 2023 presidential tickets to di South.

eng: The forum also urged the federal government to heed the genuine and reasonable nationwide calls for a transparent national dialogue and take urgent steps towards restructuring and birthing a new constitution to bring back equitable harmony to the country.
pcm: Even say Podoroska brake to love for her first attempt to serve out di match, she maintain her composure to break again and secure a place in di round of 16.

eng: The resolutions were contained in a communique signed by National Leader of the Forum and former minister of Information, Chief Edwin Clark;
pcm: Dis suggestion dey inside one statement wey di National Leader of di Forum and former minister of Information, Chief Edwin Clark;

eng: Afenifere leader, Chief Ayo Adebanjo; President General of Ohaneze.
pcm: Afenifere leader, Chief Ayo Adebanjo; President General of Ohaneze.

eng: Ndigbo Worldwide, Prof George Obiozor; National President, Middle Belt  Forum, Dr Pogu Bitrus; and National Chairman, PANDEF, Senator Emmanuel Ebok Essien, among others.
pcm: Ndigbo Worldwide, Prof George Obiozor; National President, Middle Belt  Forum, Dr Pogu Bitrus; and National Chairman, PANDEF, Senator Emmanuel Ebok Essien, and odas sign.

eng: According to the communique, the leaders demanded restructuring of the country before 2023, and asked the federal government to declare a national emergency on security.
pcm: As e dey for di statement, di leaders dey ask for restructuring of di kontri befor 2023, also dem tell di federal government say make e declare a national emergency on security.

eng: We insist that it is imperative to immediately restructure the country considering the precarious prevailing atmosphere before any further elections.
pcm: We insist say e dey very important to immediately restructure di kontri, due to di prevailing insecure atmosphere befor any further election.

eng: Reminds all leading political parties, especially the APC, PDP and other political parties, that the basis of any viable democracy, especially in a diverse and complex country such as Nigeria, rests in fair and even sharing of power
pcm: We dey remind all di leading politikal party especially di APC, PDP and odas, say di basis of any viable demokracy, especially for diverse and complex kontri like Nigeria, na equal sharing of power

eng: That the Northern part of the country would have fully enjoyed the Office of the Presidency, for the full statutory period of right years by 2023, hence, should yield to the South.
pcm: Say di Northern part of di kontri go fully enjoy di Office of di Presidency, for di full statutory period of right years, by 2023, make dem surrender to di South.

eng: Enjoins political stakeholders from the South not to be lured into the unpatriotic step of seeking such other positions as national chairmen and vice president of the main political parties, but join forces to demand and ensure that the presidency moves to the South in 2023.
pcm: Encourage politikal stakeholders from di South say make dem no for allow anybodi deceive dem to take di unpatriotic step of contesting for oda position like national chairmen and vice president of di main politikal parties, instead, make dem join hand demand and ensure say presidency move to di South for 2023.

eng: Emphasises that, if the security situation is not dealt with and banditry stopped or reduced to the barest minimum, it would not be feasible to have proper elections in 2023.
pcm: E emphasize say, if dem no deal wit di security situation to allow banditry stop or dey reduced to di barest minimum, e no go possible to hold proper election for 2023.

eng: Insists that cattle rearing is a generally, private business enterprise, as such, the federal government should avoid committing state resources to promote any particular business, beyond providing the enabling environment, in the performance of its regulatory roles.
pcm: Di statement insist say cattle rearing na private business, and so, make di federal government no try use di nation resources to promote any particular business, apart from say make e provide di enabling environment, for di performance of e regulatory roles.

eng: The leaders reaffirmed their commitment to the unity of Nigeria, adding that it can only be sustained on the principles of equity, fairness and justice.
pcm: Di leaders reaffirm dia commitment to di unity of Nigeria, dem tok say na only on di principle of equity, fairness and justice we fit sustain awa unity.

eng: But, the Ambassador Aminu Wali-led faction of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Kano State has said the North-East should produce the next president.
pcm: But, di Ambassador Aminu Wali faction of di Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) for Kano State don tok say na di North-East suppose produce di next president.

eng: Chairman of the faction, Mamina Bako Lamido, who spoke on behalf of other executive members said Bala Mohammed was fit for the job.
pcm: Di chairman of di faction, Mamina Bako Lamido, wey tok on behalf of oda executive members tok say Bala Mohammed dey fit for di job.

eng: The PDP faction gave its backing when it received executive members of a group canvassing support for the governor, known as Bala Abdulkadir Mohammed Vanguard (BAM-V), at the partys secretariat in Kano at the weekend.
pcm: Di PDP faction show dia support wen di executive members of a group wey dey gada support for di governor, wey be Bala Abdulkadir Mohammed Vanguard (BAM-V), visit dem for di party secretariat wey dey Kano durin di weekend.

eng: Lamido said for fairness and equity, the party should zone its presidential ticket to both North-East and South-East, adding that if the ticket goes to the North-East, Bala Mohammed should be given the mandate.
pcm: Lamido tok say for fairness and equity, make di party zone im presidential ticket to both North-East and South-East, say if di ticket go di North-East, make dem give Bala Mohammed di mandate.

eng: Speaking earlier, BAM-V Director-General, Mohammed Abubakar Jibo, said the group was at the partys secretariat to canvass support for Mohammed ahead 2023.
pcm: As e don tok befor, BAM-V Director-General, Mohammed Abubakar Jibo, tok say di group go di party secretariat to gada support for Mohammed ahead of 2023.

eng: Lagos-Ibadan rail tentatively for commissioning June 10  FG
pcm: We fit commission Lagos-Ibadan rail on June 10 - FG

eng: The Federal Government has fixed June 10 as tentative date for the commissioning of the flagship Lagos-Ibadan standard gauge rail.
pcm: Di Federal Government don fixed June 10 as di date wey dem fit commission di Lagos-Ibadan standard gauge rail.

eng: Minister of Information and Culture, Alhaji Lai Mohammed, announced this during an inspection of the project with the Minister of Transportation, Mr. Rotimi Amaechi, on Sunday.
pcm: Minista of Information and Culture, Alhaji Lai Mohammed, na im announce am wen e go inspect di project wit di Minista of Transportation, Mr. Rotimi Amaechi, on Sunday.

eng: Mohammed, who spoke briefly with newsmen at the Wole Soyinka Station in Abeokuta, said the inspection on Sunday was to ensure that all the Ts are crossed
pcm: Mohammed, wey tok small wit tori-pipo for di Wole Soyinka Station wey dey Abeokuta, say di inspection on Sunday na to make sure say everytin don set.

eng: and Is dotted ahead of the commissioning.
pcm: befor di commissioning.

eng: Daily Trust had earlier reported how the China Civil Engineering and Construction Corporation (CCECC), the contractor handling the project, has been pressured to deliver all the 10 stations ahead of the commissioning.
pcm: Daily Trust don tok am befor, au dem pressure di China Civil Engineering and Construction Corporation (CCECC), di kontractor wey dey handle di project, say make e deliver all di 10 stations befor di commissioning.

eng: The stations are Ebute-Metta, Apapa, Agege, Agbado, Kajola, Papalanto, Abeokuta, Omi Adio, Olodo and Moniya.
pcm: Di stations na Ebute-Metta, Apapa, Agege, Agbado, Kajola, Papalanto, Abeokuta, Omi Adio, Olodo and Moniya.

eng: Most of the stations have reached are between 90 and 100 percent completion stage.
pcm: Most of di stations wey we don reach dey between 90 and 100 percent completion stage.

eng: The Ministers as well as the Permanent Secretary in the Ministry of Transport, Dr. Magdalene Ajani, Managing Director of the Nigerian Railway Corporation (NRC), Engr.
pcm: Di Ministas and di Permanent Secretary of di Ministri of Transport, Dr. Magdalene Ajani, Managing Director of di Nigerian Railway Corporation (NRC), Engr.

eng: Fidet Okhiria and other officials of the Ministry started the inspection from the Mobolaji Johnson Station (Ebute-Metta) before heading to the Bola Tinubu Station (Apapa).
pcm: Fidet Okhiria and oda officials of di Ministri start di inspection from di Mobolaji Johnson Station (Ebute-Metta) befor dem go di Bola Tinubu Station (Apapa).

eng: The Ebute-Metta Station is the biggest station in the train corridor.
pcm: Di Ebute-Metta Station na di biggest station for di train corridor.

eng: It is reputed to be the most magnificent government building in Nigeria.
pcm: Dem see dis station as di most magnificent government building for Nigeria.

eng: According to the Transportation Minister, all the equipment and facilities have been installed ahead of the takeoff of operation.
pcm: Accordin to di Transportation Minista, dem don put all di equipment and facilities wey di place need befor di takeoff of operation.

eng: The Lagos-Ibadan standard gauge rail is the lot 2 of the 2,700km Lagos-Kano standard gauge which construction started in 2017 with extension to Nigerias
pcm: Di Lagos-Ibadan standard gauge rail na di lot 2 of di 2,700km Lagos-Kano standard gauge wey dem start di construction for 2017 wit extension to Nigeria

eng: Premier Ports in Apapa to aid massive cargo movement and decongest the ports.
pcm: Premier Port for Apapa to ensure massive cargo movement and decongest di ports.

eng: Mohammed said, Tentatively, the Lagos-Ibadan standard gauge would be commissioned on June 10.
pcm: Mohammed tok say tentatively, dem go commission di Lagos-Ibadan standard gauge on June 10.

eng: What the Honourable Minister is doing is to ensure that all the Is are dotted and the Ts are crossed before June 10.
pcm: Wetin di Honourable Minista dey do na to ensure say evritin don set befor di commissioning on June 10.

eng: You can see right from Apapa to Agege, Papalanto to this place, you have seen us go down to engage the contractor to ensure that everything is in order.
pcm: Una go see say we don waka from Apapa to Agege, Papalanto reach hia, and una see say we don go follow di contractor dem yarn say evritin must set.

eng: Because this is one of the flagships of this administration, one of the landmark achievements of this administration.
pcm: Di reason be say dis na one of di flagship of dis administration, one of di landmark achievement of dis administration.

eng: Not only this is the first time we are having a dual standard gauge but you can see the passion by which the Minister supervises the project.
pcm: No be only say na di first time wey we go get double standard gauge but una dey see di passion wey di Minista dey use supervise di project.

eng: Gunmen shoot herbalist, abduct two women
pcm: Gunmen don shoot herbalist, and kidnap two women

eng: Gunmen believed to be kidnappers have shot a popular alternative medicine producer, Alhaji Laminu Jibrin, after attacking his home located in Tafa town along Abuja-Kaduna highway, in Kaduna State.
pcm: Som gunmen wey pipo feel say dem be kidnappers don shoot one popular traditional medicine producer, Alhaji Laminu Jibrin, afta dem attack e house wey dey Tafa town along Abuja-Kaduna highway, for Kaduna State.

eng: The attackers, said to be about 20 in number, stormed into the mans residence around 1:00 am on Monday, after forcing its gate open.
pcm: Di attackers, wey be about 20 for numba, burst inside di man house around 1:00 am on Monday, afta dem force di house gate open.

eng: A resident, who sought anonymity, said the attackers met the herbalist packaging some herbal products and mistook him for a worker of the company.
pcm: One of di neighbour wey dey live for di area, wey no go like mention e name tok say di attackers meet di herbalist wen e dey package som herbal product, but dey tink say na one of di worker of di company.

eng: Some of them beat his wife up just as they were asking her of his whereabouts, the source said.
pcm: Som of dem beat e wife as dem dey ask wia her husband for dey, di neighbour tok.

eng: It was further learnt that the man had retaliated with a stick in his possession against the gunmen, who responded with the shooting that injured him on his shoulder.
pcm: We hear say di man attack di gunmen wit one stick wey dey e hand, but di men respond wit di shooting wey injure am for e shoulder.

eng: The mans wife, and another woman among his neighbours, were abducted later by the gunmen, just as he was taken to an undisclosed hospital along with his little child, who was hit on his abdomen by a bullet, where they were receiving medical attention.
pcm: Di gunmen later kindnap di man wife, and anoda woman wey be one of e neighbours. Dem don carry di man go one hospital wia e dey collect treatment wit e small pikin wey bullet nack for belle.

eng: Efforts to speak to the police area commander in Jere,
pcm: All awa effort say make we follo di police area commander for Jere,

eng: ACP Faruk Umar, were not successful, as he did not respond to the phone calls from our reporter.
pcm: ACP Faruk Umar, tok no dey successful, sake of say e no gree pick any of awa tori-pesin call.

eng: Poultry feed crisis: Why more interventions are needed
pcm: Poultry feed crisis: Why we need more intervention.

eng: The crisis in the feed industry hit its peak late last year when many poultry farmers started shutting down their farms due to a jump in operation cost, mainly caused by the high cost of feeds.
pcm: Di crisis wey dey di poultry feed industry pass be careful late last year wen many poultry farmers begin dey close down dia farms, sake of say price of feed don high, and dis don make dia cost of operation too much.

eng: The leadership of the Poultry Association of Nigeria, an umbrella body of poultry farmers in the country, held an emergency meeting in Abuja, warning that if something urgent was not done, the poultry industry might fold up.
pcm: Di leadership of di Poultry Association of Nigeria, di association wey all di poultry farmers for di kontri dey under, do emergency meeting for Abuja, to warn say if dem no do sometin kia-kia, di poultry industry fit die.

eng: The director-general of the association, Onallo S. Akpa, while calling for immediate intervention by the federal government, raised an alarm that maize that cost N80,000 per ton and soybeans N120,000 per ton in January 2020, cost N200,000 per ton (maize) and N250 per ton
pcm: Di director-general of di association, Onallo S. Akpa, wen e dey call for immediate intervention by di federal government, tok say maize wey be N80,000 per ton and soybeans wey be N120,000 per ton for January 2020, don be N200,000 per ton (maize) and N250,000 per ton

eng: (soybeans) as of January 2021.
pcm: (soybeans) for January 2021.

eng: Apparently, in a move to avert a crisis in the feed value chain, the Central Bank of Nigeria quickly moved in by agreeing to release, in tranches, about 300,000 metric tons of maize to the industry.
pcm: Clearly, as a way to prevent crisis for di feed distribution industry, di Central Bank of Nigeria put bodi quickly, as dem don agree to release about 300,000 metric ton of maize to di industry batch by batch.

eng: The gesture, which the stakeholders believe was timely, seems to have reduced tension in the sector.
pcm: Dis intervention, wey di stakeholders believe say e dey on time, be like say e don reduce di earlier tension wey dey di sector.

eng: The target, according to the bank, is to ensure the poultry industrys sustainability, job retention, circular flow of income, cheaper nutrition and poverty alleviation.
pcm: Di target, accordin to di bank, na to ensure say di poultry industry dey sustainable, job retention dey, circular flow of income kontinue, cheaper nutrition dey possible and poverty reduce.

eng: Last month, about 50,000MT was said to have been allocated to stakeholders in the feed milling industry, with others set to be released in due course.
pcm: Last month, about 50,000MT na im dem give stakeholders for di feed milling industry, and dem go release di remaining small time.

eng: Stakeholders believe the quick release of the remaining tonnages will further redress the feed challenges in the sector ahead of the forthcoming Easter celebration.
pcm: Stakeholders believe say quick release of di remaining tonnes go solve more of di feed challenges wey dey di sector befor di Easter celebration wey dey come.

eng: The ongoing intervention is being executed in collaboration with players like AFEX Commodities Exchange Ltd, which are facilitating the release of the grains.
pcm: Di current intervention na join-bodi between di CBN and partners like AFEX Commodities Exchange Ltd, wey dey kontrol di release of di grains.

eng: The shortfall in maize production has been one of the major challenges in the agricultural sector as according to the PAN DG, the produce is the most highly consumed in northern Nigeria.
pcm: Di reduction for maize production don be one of di major challenges for agricultural sector, becos as di PAN DG tok, dis na di food wey dem dey chop pass for northern Nigeria.

eng: This is why many feed producers and other stakeholders are advocating for more interventions by the apex bank in the area of maize and soybeans production.
pcm: Dis na di reason why many feed producers wit oda stakeholders dey ask for more support from di CBN in di area of maize and soybeans production.

eng: The General Manager of Premier Feeds Ltd, Austin Daylop, a beneficiary of the intervention, noted that as the new farming season for maize and soybean approaches, decisive actions needed to be taken to meet the demands of the growing population and prevent Nigeria from getting into a cycle of shortfalls.
pcm: Di General Manager of Premier Feeds Ltd, Austin Daylop, wey be one of di beneficiary of di intervention, tok say as di new farming season for maize and soybean dey kom, we go need take quick action to meet di demand of di growing population, and also ensure say e no scarce for Nigeria.

eng: The Anchor Borrowers Programme by CBN in partnership with the Rice Farmers Association of Nigeria (RIFAN) is one such solution.
pcm: Di Anchor Borrowers Programme wey CBN join bodi with di Rice Farmers Association of Nigeria (RIFAN) do na one of dat solution.

eng: A similar scheme should also be introduced for maize and soybean production.
pcm: We go need establish dat kind programme for maize and soybean production too.

eng: It will definitely help to mitigate rural-urban migration by the farmers brought on by the insecurity challenges, especially in the Northern states where maize and soybeans are cultivated.
pcm: E go surely help us reduce rural-urban migration of di farmers wey insecurity cause, especially for di Northern states wia dem dey plant maize and soybeans.

eng: Continuing the collaborative partnerships between the relevant government authorities and industry stakeholders such as the Maize Growers Association of Nigeria (MAGPAMAN) and Poultry Association of Nigeria (PAN) will help to provide critical field data so that policymakers can understand the input required to expand the yield capacity of local farmers, he said.
pcm: If we kontinue di join-bodi between di concerned government authorities and industry stakeholders like di Maize Growers Association of Nigeria (MAGPAMAN) and Poultry Association of Nigeria (PAN) we go fit provide important field data, so dat policymakers go fit undastand di input wey dem need to expand di product capacity of local farmers.

eng: Ayodeji Balogun, CEO, AFEX, said: By facilitating the release of the 300,000MT maize, leveraging support from credible players in the ecosystem, including our team at AFEX, the CBN will offer over 35,000 farmers and agro-processors a channel through which they can trade maize at a subsidized rate, and thereby reduce the adverse effect of the maize price hike, increase local demand and also improve farmers livelihoods.
pcm: Ayodeji Balogun wey be di CEO of AFEX, tok say: Wit di release of 300,000MT of maize,throughdi support from credible players for di ecosystem, plus awa team for AFEX, di CBN go fit give ova 35,000 farmers and agro processors a channel wey dem go fit dey buy and sell maize for subsidized rate, and laidat, dem go fit increase local demand, improve di way of life of di farmers and reduce di negative effect of di increase for maize price.

eng: Oil prices fall on demand, COVID-19 concerns
pcm: Oil price don fall on demand, becos of COVID-19

eng: Oil prices edged lower on Monday as climbing Coronavirus cases and tighter restrictions in Europe and China fueled worries over a slower recovery in fuel demand.
pcm: Oil price don go down on Monday as Coronavirus cases dey go up, tighter restriction of movement for Europe and China don increase di worry ontop weda improvement go dey for fuel demand.

eng: Encouraging gross domestic product (GDP) and industrial production data from China helped to limit the downside to some extent.
pcm: Industrial production data and beta gross domestic product (GDP) from China na e help to reduce di downside small.

eng: Brent crude for March delivery eased 0.2 percent to 54.98 dollars a barrel, after falling 2.3 percent on Friday.
pcm: Brent crude for March delivery don drop from 0.2 percent to 54.98 dollars per barrel, after e fall by 2.3 percent on Friday.

eng: Similarly, U.S. oil futures were down by 0.1 percent at 52.36 dollars after falling more than 2 percent in the previous session.
pcm: Also, U.S. oil future drop by 0.1 percent at 52.36 dollars afta e drop more dan 2 percent for di session befor.

eng: The total number of global Coronavirus cases topped 95 million, while the death toll surpassed 2 million.
pcm: Di total numba of Coronavirus case fo di world don pass 95 million, and di numba of death don pass 2 million.

eng: China reported more than 100 new COVID-19 cases for the sixth consecutive day, while the number of hospitalised COVID-19 patients with serious symptoms in Japan topped 970, marking a record high since the onset of the pandemic in the country.
pcm: More dan 100 new COVID-19 cases na e China don declare for di sixth consecutive day, while di numba of COVID-19 patients wey dey hospital wit serious symptom for Japan don pass 970. Dis na very high record since di pandemic start for di kontri.

eng: Portugal imposed a new nationwide lockdown, while the British government announced that it will close all travel corridors from Momday in order to restrict the spread of new Coronavirus variant cases.
pcm: Portugal don declare fresh lockdown fo di kontri, while di British government don announce say e close all di travel corridor from Monday so dat dem fit prevent di spread of new Coronavirus cases.

eng: New Coronavirus infections have been decreasing in Germany but the countrys health minister said that more needed to be done to bring it permanently under control.
pcm: New Coronavirus infection don dey reduce for Germany, but di kontri minista of health tok say dem go need to put more effort to kontrol di disease pata-pata.

eng: Chancellor Angela Merkel and Germanys 16 state premiers will discuss what to do next on Tuesday.
pcm: Di Chancellor, Angela Merkel and oda 16 state premiers for Germany go join-head tok wetin to do next on Tuesday.

eng: Ratels Sports Foundation partners MGGN to empower the girl-child
pcm: Ratels Sports Foundation don join hand wit MGGN to empower di girl-child

eng: Ratels Sports Foundation has partnered organisers of the Most Gorgeous Girl Nigeria, MGGN, to host a Women mini football tournament in Abuja to celebrate the first edition of the beauty pageant which will hold in the city of Abuja.
pcm: Ratels Sports Foundation don join hand wit di organisers of di Most Gorgeous Girl Nigeria, MGGN, to host mini football tournament for wey go be only women for Abuja. Dis na to celebrate di first edition of di beauty pageant wey go happun for di city of Abuja.

eng: Grace Ene, who is the Chief Executive Officer of  MGGN, organisers of the beauty pageant , said Barrister Paul Edehs Ratel Sports Foundation, has agreed to partner with the initiative through the mini tourney which is aimed at creating more awareness, empowerment and hope for the girl-child.
pcm: Grace Ene, di Chief Executive Officer of MGGN, wey be di organisers of di beauty pageant , tok say Barrister Paul Edeh, Ratel Sports Foundation, don agree to join hand wit di organization,throughdi mini tourney wey go be a to create more awareness, empowerment and hope for di girl-child.

eng: She said We are glad about this initiative and partnering with one of the leading Sports Foundations in the country, Ratels Sports Development Foundation.
pcm: As she tok; We dey hapi about dis programme and say we join hand wit Ratels Sports Development Foundation wey be one of di leading Sports Foundation for di kontri.

eng: Through this event, we have been able to share the belief that the girl-child deserves more in our community and with Ratels support, we are hopeful that it will create more love and awareness across all quarters.
pcm: Tru dis event, we don make pipo know say di girl-child deserve more for awa community, and wit di support of Ratels, we dey hope say e go spread more love and awareness for all di place.

eng: On his part, the founder of Ratels Sports Foundation, Barrister Edeh, said, Todays event is unique because we are doing it in partnership with a new brand that is in town, the Most Gorgeous Girl Nigeria, which is a beauty pageant.
pcm: For e side, di founder of Ratels Sports Foundation, Barrister Edeh, tok say, "Today event dey unique, unto say we dey do am join hand wit di Most Gorgeous Girl Nigeria wey beauty pageant, and a new brand wey jus dey town".

eng: They were able to identify areas that we are inclined to support.
pcm: Dem don sight areas wey we go like support.

eng: These are areas that we are happy to invest in.
pcm: And dis na tins wey we dey happy to put awa moni inside.

eng: Today we have four teams all based in Abuja playing in this tournament and as you can see, they played good football even in the rain.
pcm: Today we get four teams for Abuja wey dey play for dis tournament, and as u dey see so, dem play beta ball even for inside di rain.

eng: Edeh also spoke on the financial implication as he said the four teams were supported to participate in the epoch making event.
pcm: Edeh yarn about di financial implication too, he tok say na all di four teams dem use money support so dem go fit participate for di event.

eng: It may interest you to know that this mini tournament cost us some money because the girls had to play like eight matches within the space of four hours.
pcm: As e tok; "U fit wan know say dis mini tournament cost us money, sak of say di girls need play like eight matches within four hours.

eng: We paid match indemnities, fed and transported the teams and of course we gave quality footballs to them, he said.
pcm: We pay match damages, feed and transport di teams, and of course we give dem quality balls.

eng: 15 arrested for killing 706 cows, 75 sheep in Kaduna community
pcm: Dem don arrest 15 pipo for Kaduna community, sake of say dem kill 706 cows, and 75 sheep.

eng: Fifteen suspects have been arrested by police in Kaduna State for allegedly killing 706 cows and 75 sheep in Atyap chiefdom of Zangon Kataf Local Government Area (LGA), Kaduna State.
pcm: Police don arrest Fifteen suspects for Kaduna State say dem kill 706 cows and 75 sheep for Atyap chiefdom wey dey Zangon Kataf Local Government Area (LGA), for Kaduna State.

eng: The suspects are said to have dumped the animals in a ditch.
pcm: Dem tok say di suspects dump di dead animals for pit.

eng: The Police Public Relations Officer, ASP Muhammad Jalige, in a statement, expressed concern about the nature of crime which he said was perpetrated by agents of doom in their quest to set the state ablaze.
pcm: Di tok-tok pesin of police, ASP Muhammad Jalige, for e statement, show im concern about di type of crime wey he tok say agents of destruction wey wan scatter di state commit.

eng: He noted that the command cannot hold back and watch criminals take laws into their hands, noting that the command is not leaving anything to chance in ensuring that thorough investigation is carried out to prevent future occurrence of such dastardly act.
pcm: E tok say di police command no go fit relax dey look, make criminals take justice to dia own hand. E also yarn say di command no go kommot face for anytin we go make sure say dem do beta investigation, so dat dis kind evil act no go happun again.

eng: He added, On 24th March, 2021 at about 10:00am
pcm: He add am join say, On di 24th of March, 2021 around 10:00am

eng: some herdsmen reported at Divisional Police Headquarters Zonkwa, Kaduna, that some uncertain number of persons had attacked some of their herds killing 706 cows and 75 sheep and dumped them in a ditch.
pcm: som herdsmen report for di Divisional Police Headquarter wey dey Zonkwa, for Kaduna, say som pipo don attack, kill and dump about 706 of dia cows and 75 of dia sheep for inside pit.

eng: On getting the complaint, operatives immediately swung into action, visited the scene of the incident, took necessary photographs and expanded their investigation which led to the arrest of 15 within the following villages; Mate, Unguwan Tabo, Unguwan Rohogu, Runji, Mashan, Mashan Daji and Wawan Rafi all of Atyap chiefdom in Zangon Kataf LGA Kaduna state.
pcm: As dem get dis report, officers take action immediately, dem visit di place, take important photos and start di investigation wey later make dem arrest 15 suspects for inside dis villages; Mate, Unguwan Tabo, Unguwan Rohogu, Runji, Mashan, Mashan Daji and Wawan Rafi wey dey Atyap chiefdom for Zangon Kataf LGA of Kaduna state.

eng: Enugu Police arrest suspected rail track vandal, recover firearm, others
pcm: Enugu Police don arrest and recover some guns and oda weapon from suspected rail track thief.

eng: The Enugu Police Command has announced the arrest of one Ejike Okeke, who specialises in rail track vandalism, and recovered one locally-made pistol with one live cartridge from him.
pcm: Di Enugu Police Command don announce di arrest of one Ejike Okeke, wey be expert for rail track vandalism, dem recover one locally-made pistol an one live cartridge from e hand..

eng: Okeke, 18, of Nkwubor-Nike Village, Enugu East Local Government Area of the state, identified as a member of a syndicate of rail track vandals, was arrested on May 9 at about 11am, according to a statement yesterday by the Commands spokesperson, ASP Daniel Ndukwe.
pcm: As di police tok-tok pesin ASP Daniel Ndukwe tok yesterday, dem arrest Okeke wey be 18, from Nkwubor-Nike Village, for Enugu East Local Government Area of di state, around 11am on May 9, afta dem discover say e be member of a gang wey dey expert in removing and stealing rail track.

eng: Ndukwe said that the arrest was achieved by police operatives attached to the Enugu Metro Area Command, in conjunction with operatives of the Vigilance group of Nchatancha-Nike in Enugu.
pcm: Ndukwe tok say na join-bodi of di police officers wey dey attached to di Enugu Metro Area Command, and officers of di Vigilance group of Nchatancha-Nike for Enugu State carry out di arrest.

eng: He said that Okeke and others, who ran on sighting the operatives, were found attempting to vandalise railway tracks at Nkwubor rail-line, adding that investigation was ongoing to apprehend his other gang members that fled.
pcm: E tok say dem catch Okeke and odas wey run komot as dem see di officers, as dem dem dey try destroy railway track for Nkwubor rail-line. E add am join say, investigation dey go on to catch im oda gang members wey run komot.

eng: In another development, operatives attached to Awkunanaw Police Division on May 11 at about 7:30am, recovered one custom-coloured Toyota Camry Car with registration number:
pcm: For anoda tori, officers wey dey attached to Awkunanaw Police Division on May 11, around 7:30am, recover one Toyota Camry wey get custom colour wit registration numba:

eng: ENU 556 MH, along Amagugwu Road, Awkunanaw, Enugu.
pcm: ENU 556 MH, along Amagugwu Road, for Awkunanaw, Enugu.

eng: Preliminary investigation shows that the car was stolen from where it was parked at Abakaliki Road, Enugu, by the criminal gang, who abandoned the vehicle and fled due to intense pressure mounted by operatives.
pcm: Preliminary investigation show say na thief di gang wey abandon di car thief am from wia di owner park am for Abakaliki Road, but na di pressure form security officers make dem leave di car run.

eng: In the meantime, discreet investigation to fish out the fleeing suspects had commenced, the police said.
pcm: Meanwhile, police don tok say dem don start underground investigation to fish out di suspects wey run komot.

eng: Wave of insecurity a threat to 2023 polls  Okorie
pcm: Insecurity na threat to 2023 election -Okorie

eng: A former presidential candidate, Chekwas Okorie, has said the current wave of insecurity and spate of killings in the country are threats to the 2023 general elections.
pcm: Befor-befor presidential candidate, Chekwas Okorie, don tok say di current wave of insecurity and flood of killings in di kontri na threat to di 2023 general election.

eng: Okorie told Daily Trust in a telephone interview last night that if the situation is not nipped in the bud, future elections would be threatened.
pcm: Okorie yarn Daily Trust for fone interview yesterday night say if dem no kontrol di situation, future elections for di kontri go dey at stake.

eng: He said the National Assembly in collaboration with the executive arm of government should adopt measures that would save the nation and deepen democracy in the country.
pcm: E tok say make di National Assembly join-bodi wit di executive arm of government to adopt measures wey go save di nation and make demokracy for di kontri stand well.

eng: Danger signs are all over the place and that is why some of us are very worried.
pcm: Danger sign dey evriwia and na why som of us dey very worried.

eng: I pray very hard that it should be addressed.
pcm: I pray very well say make dem find solution.

eng: The president has a big role to play in this regard.
pcm: Di president get big role to play for hia.

eng: The National Assembly also has its own role to play in collaboration with the executive arm of government so that Nigeria can move ahead.
pcm: Di National Assembly sef get e own role to play in di join-bodi wit di executive arm of government so dat Nigeria go fit move ahead.

eng: The danger signs are all over the place; even a blind man can see it.
pcm: Di danger signs dey evriwia; even blind man fit see am.

eng: If nothing is done, we are in a big trouble, he said.
pcm: If dem no do anytin, na big trouble we dey.

eng: Asked to state the consequences in the event the situation is not addressed, the APC chieftain said, In the event it is not addressed, my fear is that we may not even get to 2023, in one peace and this means that Nigeria will disintegrate.
pcm: Wen dem tell am say make e mention di problem wey go dey if dem no address di situation, di APC leader tok say, "If e happun say dem no address di situation, my fear na say we fi no even reach 2023, and wetin dis one mean be say Nigeria go break-up.

eng: There will be warlords; Nigerian Army will not be able to even deal with the situation.
pcm: Different warlords go rise up; Nigerian Army no go fit even deal wit di situation.

eng: There will be what is called lost command because there are some soldiers with weapons which when put together will not even be up to 50 percent of what is in private hands.
pcm: We go get wetin dem dey call lost command becos som soldiers dey wey get weapon wey be say if we join dem togeda, e no go even reach 50 percent of wetin dey ordinary man hand..

eng: The way I have seen Nigeria in recent times, we are now more divided along ethnic lines than religious lines.
pcm: Di way wey I take see Nigeria dis days, we don dey more divided for ethnic line pass religious line.

eng: Even when we belong to the same religion, we are getting more ethnic conscious.
pcm: Even wen we belong to di same religion, we dey see awasef as different tribe.

eng: LCCI Agric group gets new chairman
pcm: LCCI Agric group don get new chairman

eng: The Agriculture and Agro-Allied Group of the Lagos Chamber of Commerce and Industry (LCCI) has elected Mrs. Edobong Akpabio as the new chairman to steer the ship of the group and take charge of its affairs for the next two years.
pcm: Di Agriculture and Agro-Allied Group of di Lagos Chamber of Commerce and Industry (LCCI) don elect Mrs. Edobong Akpabio as di new chairman wey go drive di ship of di group and take charge of e affairs for di next two years.

eng: This followed the expiration of the term of office of the previous executives of the group.
pcm: Dis one happun afta di term of office of di former executives of di group don expire.

eng: LCCI is the premier Chamber of Commerce and one of the leading voices in the organised private sector (OPS) in Nigeria.
pcm: LCCI na di lead Chamber of Commerce and one of di leading voices for di organised private sector (OPS) for Nigeria.

eng: Mrs. Edobong Akpabio is a Co-Founder/Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Visionage Agrotech Farms Limited and Organic Green Animalia Farms Limited, two notable Agribusiness organisations.
pcm: Mrs. Edobong Akpabio na di Co-Founder/Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Visionage Agrotech Farms Limited and Organic Green Animalia Farms Limited, wey be two respected Agribusiness organisation.

eng: She had her tertiary education at the University of Uyo, where she obtained a Bachelor of Arts Degree in English Studies in 1988 and a Post-Graduate Diploma in Logistics and Supply Chain Management from the Obafemi Awolowo University, Ile-Ife in 2005.
pcm: She graduate from di University of Uyo, wia she collect Bachelor of Arts Degree for English in 1988 and Post-Graduate Diploma for Logistics and Supply Chain Management from Obafemi Awolowo University, Ile-Ife for 2005.

eng: Akpabio has contributed immensely to the reversal of importation of agricultural products and has assisted in local content drive and sustainability.
pcm: Akpabio don contribute well well for di reversal of importation of agric products, and she don assist for local content drive and sustainability.

eng: The Director General of LCCI, Dr. Muda Yusuf said that Mrs. Akpabios election will ensure and enhance the Chambers role as leading advocate of best business policy and practice, with the view to promoting and protecting Small and Medium Enterprises, which in turn will impact positively on the economy.
pcm: Di Director General of LCCI, Dr. Muda Yusuf tok say di election of Mrs. Akpabio go ensure and improve di role of di Chamber as a leading advocate of best business policy and practice, wit di aim to promote and protect Small and Medium Enterprises, wey go also impact di economy positively.

eng: INEC fixes June 19 for Jigawa, Kaduna bye-elections
pcm: INEC don fix June 19 for Jigawa and Kaduna bye-elections

eng: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) has fixed Saturday, 19 June 2021 for the conduct of the bye-elections in Gwaram Federal Constituency, Jigawa State and Sabon Gari state constituency in Kaduna State.
pcm: Di Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) don fix Saturday, 19 June 2021 as di day wey dem go do di bye-election for Gwaram Federal Konstituency, Jigawa State and Sabon Gari state konstituency for Kaduna State.

eng: National Commissioner and Chairman, Information and Voter Education Committee (IVEC), Festus Okoye, who said this on Friday in Abuja in separate statements, said the official notifications for the elections would be published on 17 May 2021.
pcm: Di National Commissioner and Chairman for Information and Voter Education Committee (IVEC), Festus Okoye, wey tok dis for different statements on Friday for Abuja, say dem go publish di official notifications for di elections on 17th, May 2021.

eng: The developments followed the death of the member representing Gwaram Federal Constituency of Jigawa State in the House of Representatives, Hon.
pcm: Dis one happun afta di member wey dey represent Gwaram Federal Konstituency of Jigawa State for di House of Representatives, Hon.

eng: Yuguda Hassan Kila on 4 March 2021, as well as the declaration of the seat of the member representing Sabon Gari state constituency in Kaduna Assembly, Hon.
pcm: Yuguda Hassan Kila die on 4th March 2021, and di announcement say di seat of di member wey dey represent Sabon Gari state konstituency for Kaduna Assembly, Hon.

eng: Aminu Abdullahi Shagali, vacant.
pcm: Aminu Abdullahi Shagali, don vacant.

eng: According to him, political parties would conduct their primaries between May 18 and 24, 2021, adding that the access code for online submission of nomination forms will be available for collection from May 24, 2021, at the commissions headquarters in Abuja while the last day for submission of the list of nominated candidates is 28 May 2021 at 6.00 pm.
pcm: As di chairman tok, politikal parties go conduct dia primaries between May 18 and 24, 2021. E add am join say di access code for online submission of nomination forms go dey available for collection from May 24, 2021, for di commission headquarters wey dey Abuja, while di last day for submission of di list of candidates wey dem nominate na 28 May 2021 by 6.00 pm.

eng: All political parties must pay attention to Section 87 of the Electoral Act relating to the nomination processes and submit to the commission the names and particulars of candidates that scored the majority of lawful votes and emerged from valid party primaries.
pcm: All di politikal party must pay attention to Section 87 of di Electoral Act wey relate to di nomination process, and submit di name and particulars of candidates wey get di majority of lawful votes and emerge from valid party primaries to di commission.

eng: Political parties shall submit the names of their polling agents for the election to the INEC Electoral Officer for Gwaram Local Government Area on/or before June 1, 2021, and campaigns by political parties shall end on June 17, 2021.
pcm: Politikal parties must submit di name of dia polling agents for di election to di INEC Electoral Officer for Gwaram Local Government Area on/or befor June 1, 2021, and campaigns by politikal parties go end on June 17, 2021.

eng: The detailed timetable and schedule of activities for the bye-election have been uploaded on the commissions website and other social media platforms.
pcm: We don upload di details of di timetable and schedule of activities for di bye-election on di website of di commission and oda social media platform.

eng: The commission wishes to reiterate that since work on the expansion of voter access to polling units in the country is ongoing, the bye-election will hold in the existing polling units and voting points across the constituency covering Gwaram Local Government Area of Jigawa State and Sabon Gari Local Government Area of Kaduna State, Okoye said.
pcm: Di commission go like tok am again say since work dey go on di expansion of voter access to polling units for di kontri, di bye-election go hold for di existing polling units and voting points across di konstituency wey  cover Gwaram Local Government Area of Jigawa State and Sabon Gari Local Government Area of Kaduna State, - Okoye tok.

eng: He also urged all political parties to strictly adhere to the timetable and schedule of activities and avoid rancorous primaries and violence during the campaigns and throughout the electoral process.
pcm: E also encourage all di politikal parties to strictly follow di timetable and schedule of activities and make dem avoid hate primaries and violence durin di campaign and tru-out di electoral process.

eng: Explosions: Senate urges clampdown on illegal gas retailers
pcm: Explosions: Senate don call for restriction of illegal gas retailers

eng: The Senate on Tuesday urged the Department of Petroleum Resources (DPR) to clamp down on illegal roadside retailers of liquefied petroleum gas, those operating within residential areas and licensed plants who lack basic and standard minimum requirements.
pcm: Di Senate on Tuesday tell di Department of Petroleum Resources (DPR) say make dem clamp down illegal roadside retailers wey dey sell liquefied petroleum gas, dose we dey operate for residential areas and gas plants wey get license but lack di basic and standard minimum requirement.

eng: It also mandated its committees on Gas and Industries to investigate the causes of the recent cases of gas explosions across the country with a view to finding permanent and sustainable solutions that would save the lives of the people.
pcm: Di Senate also mandate im committees on Gas and Industries say make dem investigate di causes of recent cases of gas explosion across di kontri, and make dem suggest how to find permanent and sustainable solution wey go save di live of di pipo.

eng: These followed the adoption of a motion by Senator Ibikunle Amosun, who expressed sadness over the loss of at least eight lives in gas-related explosions and fire incidences in Abeokuta metropolis, Ogun State, in quick successions within two weeks last month.
pcm: Di Senate tok dis afta dem adopt di motion by Senator Ibikunle Amosun, wey express e sadness ova di loss of at least eight lives for gas-related explosion and fire incidence for Abeokuta metropolis, Ogun State, within two weeks last month.

eng: The Senate, accordingly, called on the Federal and State Fire Services to enforce the mandatory use of fire safety equipment in homes and places of work.
pcm: Di Senate, also call on di Federal and State Fire Service to enforce di compulsory use of fire safety equipment for homes and places of work.

eng: It also urged the Standards Organization of Nigeria, the DPR, the National Orientation Agency and marketers of gas and highly inflammable products to embark on aggressive, consistent sensitization and awareness campaigns on safe ways of using gas cylinders and other inflammable materials to save lives.
pcm: Dem also encourage di Standard Organization of Nigeria, di DPR, di National Orientation Agency and marketers of gas and highly inflammable products to embark on aggressive, consistent sensitization and awareness campaigns on di safe ways to use gas cylinders and oda inflammable materials.

eng: But the England captain secured the consolation prize of winning the Golden Boot as he slammed home his 23rd Premier League goal of the campaign four minutes before half-time.
pcm: But the England captain secured the consolation prize of winning the Golden Boot as he slammed home his 23rd Premier League goal of the campaign four minutes before half-time.

eng: Members of the Muslim community in Ebonyi State on Thursday urged Governor David Umahi to contest for president in 2023.
pcm: Members of di Muslim community for Ebonyi State on Thursday tell Governor David Umahi say make e contest for president for 2023.

eng: Leader of the group, Alhaji Abass Egwu, made the appeal at the state government house in Abakiliki, when he led the group members to pay this years
pcm: Di leader of di group, Alhaji Abass Egwu, beg di governor for di state government house wey dey Abakiliki, wen he carry di group members go pay dis year

eng: Eid-el-Fitr homage to the governor.
pcm: Eid-el-Fitr homage to di governor.

eng: We plead with you, Your Excellency, that you should make yourself available for national service in 2023, Insha Allah.
pcm: We dey beg u, Your Excellency, say make u make ursef available for national service for 2023, Insha Allah.

eng: If you have a good son, there is no need to canvass for him.
pcm: If u get beta son, u no need canvass for am.

eng: A good market sells itself.
pcm: Beta market dey sell esef.

eng: Your Excellency, you are a good market and we will not let you down, the group said.
pcm: Your Excellency, u be beta market and we no go let u down. Di group tok.

eng: Iheanacho, Ndidi win FA Cup as Leicester City beat Chelsea in final
pcm: Iheanacho and Ndidi win FA Cup as Leicester City beat Chelsea for final

eng: Nigerian duo, Kelechi Iheanacho and Wilfred Ndidi are FA Cup winners after helping Leicester City to beat Chelsea 1-0 in the FA Cup final played on Saturday.
pcm: Two nigerians, Kelechi Iheanacho and Wilfred Ndidi don be FA Cup winners afta dem help Leicester City beat Chelsea 1-0 for di FA Cup final wey dem play on Saturday.

eng: It is Leicester Citys
pcm: Na Leicester City

eng: first FA Cup in the clubs 137-year history.
pcm: first ever FA Cup for di club 137-year old history.

eng: Youri Tielemanss sensational strike in front of 22,000 fans at Wembley was the difference between the two teams.
pcm: Youri Tieleman amazing strike for di front of 22,000 fans for Wembley na im be di difference between di two teams.

eng: The largest crowd for a sports event in England since the coronavirus pandemic hit 14 months ago were treated to a goal worthy to win any trophy as the Belgian midfielder blasted into the top corner on 63 minutes.
pcm: Di largest sport event crowd for England since wey di coronavirus pandemic start 14 months ago enjoy a goal wey fit to win any trophy as di Belgian midfielder shoot inside di top corner for 63 minutes.

eng: Kasper Schmeichel produced a stunning save to deny Mason Mount late on and Chelsea also had a goal ruled out by a VAR review for offside.
pcm: Kasper Schmeichel show one amazing save wey deny Mason Mount a goal, and Chelsea sef get one goal wey VAR cancel as offside.

eng: Five years after the Foxes stunned the Premier Leagues giants to become champions, Leicester have now claimed English footballs other prestigious trophy at the fifth time of asking.
pcm: Five years afta Foxes shock di Premier League giants to become champions, Leicester don finally claim di English football oda prestigious trophy di fifth time since dem don dey try.

eng: Four times they had previously lost the final, but the last of those was 52 years ago.
pcm: Dem don lose di final four times, but di last one wey dem lose na 52 years ago.

eng: A historic week for Brendan Rodgerss men could get even better as they are on the verge of sealing a place in next seasons Champions League.
pcm: Di historic week fit even get beta for Brendan Rodgers players, as dem dey close to qualifying for next Champions League season.

eng: The sides meet again in three days time at Stamford Bridge in a pivotal clash to decide who secures a top-four finish in the Premier League.
pcm: Di sides go meet again in three days time for Stamford Bridge to decide who go secure di top-four finish for di Premier League.

eng: Chelsea need a quick response after losing for just the fourth time in 27 games since Thomas Tuchel replaced the sacked Frank Lampard in January.
pcm: Chelsea go need a quick comeback afta dem lose for di fourth time in 27 games since Thomas Tuchel replace Frank Lampard wey dem sack for January.

eng: The Blues also have a Champions League final to look forward to against Manchester City in two weeks time but could end the campaign without silverware or a place in Europes premier club competition next season.
pcm: Di Blues also get Champions League final wey dem dey prepare for against Manchester City in two weeks time, but dem fit end di campaign witout trophy or place for Europe premier club competition next season.

eng: Chelseas success under Tuchel has come thanks to an excellent defensive record, but their struggles at the other end were again exposed.
pcm: Chelsea success under Tuchel don kom, sake of dia beta defensive record, but dia struggle for  di oda end don show again.

eng: Tuchels men dominated before half-time but laboured to create clear-cut chances despite Leicester losing defensive lynchpin Jonny Evans to injury midway through the first half.
pcm: Tuchel men dominate befor first-half but dem struggle to create straightforward chances even afta Leicester defensive lynchpin Jonny Evans carry injury for di middle of di first half.

eng: Wayward Werner Timo Werners
pcm: Wayward Werner Timo Werner

eng: wayward finishing has characterised his first season in England since joining from RB Leipzig for Â£47 million ($66 million) and the German international had another day to forget in front of goal.
pcm: wayward finishing has characterised his first season in England since joining from RB Leipzig for Â£47 million ($66 million) and the German international had another day to forget in front of goal.

eng: Tuchel turned away in disgust after Werner blazed high and wide from the edge of the box with the Leicester defence stretched midway through the first half.
pcm: Tuchel turned away in disgust after Werner blazed high and wide from the edge of the box with the Leicester defence stretched midway through the first half.

eng: Werner then came closest to breaking the deadlock before half-time as his header drifted just wide and evaded Cesar Azpilicueta as the Chelsea captain launched himself in at the far post.
pcm: Werner then came closest to breaking the deadlock before half-time as his header drifted just wide and evaded Cesar Azpilicueta as the Chelsea captain launched himself in at the far post.

eng: The welcome return of noise echoing down from 6,000 fans of each side from both ends of the ground helped mask a general lack of quality on the field.
pcm: The welcome return of noise echoing down from 6,000 fans of each side from both ends of the ground helped mask a general lack of quality on the field.

eng: Another 10,000 local supporters, key workers and Football Association stakeholders were also in attendance as Wembley gears up for hosting matches at Euro 2020 next month at 25 percent capacity.
pcm: Another 10,000 local supporters, key workers and Football Association stakeholders were also in attendance as Wembley gears up for hosting matches at Euro 2020 next month at 25 percent capacity.

eng: One moment of magic proved decisive as Tielemans collected possession midway inside the Chelsea half and strode forward before unleashing an unstoppable strike into the top corner past Kepa Arrizabalaga.
pcm: One moment of magic proved decisive as Tielemans collected possession midway inside the Chelsea half and strode forward before unleashing an unstoppable strike into the top corner past Kepa Arrizabalaga.

eng: Tuchel flexed the strength in depth of his squad in an attempt to find an equaliser as Callum Hudson-Odoi, Ben Chilwell, Kai Havertz, Olivier Giroud and Christian Pulisic were all introduced off the bench.
pcm: Tuchel flexed the strength in depth of his squad in an attempt to find an equaliser as Callum Hudson-Odoi, Ben Chilwell, Kai Havertz, Olivier Giroud and Christian Pulisic were all introduced off the bench.

eng: But they were denied by the brilliance of Schmeichel in the Leicester goal.
pcm: But they were denied by the brilliance of Schmeichel in the Leicester goal.

eng: Chilwell, whose every touch was booed by the Leicester supporters, nearly came back to haunt his old club as his header was turned onto the post by the Dane.
pcm: Chilwell, whose every touch was booed by the Leicester supporters, nearly came back to haunt his old club as his header was turned onto the post by the Dane.

eng: Mount then could not believe his luck as his sweetly struck shot was turned behind by a brilliant stop from Schmeichel.
pcm: Mount then could not believe his luck as his sweetly struck shot was turned behind by a brilliant stop from Schmeichel.

eng: Even when the Leicester keeper was beaten, Chelsea were denied by a VAR review.
pcm: Even when the Leicester keeper was beaten, Chelsea were denied by a VAR review.

eng: A Wes Morgan own goal looked set to send the game to extra-time, but Chilwell had strayed offside in the build-up.
pcm: A Wes Morgan own goal looked set to send the game to extra-time, but Chilwell had strayed offside in the build-up.

eng: Leicester players and fans celebrated the decision like a goal and were in raptures again moments later after seeing out a nervy finale.
pcm: Leicester players and fans celebrate di decision like a goal and were in raptures again moments later after seeing out a nervy finale.

eng: Tinubu, govs, other S/West leaders reject secession
pcm: Tinubu, govs, oda S/West leaders reject secession

eng: Amidst agitation for the Oduduwa Republic in the South-West, leaders of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in the geo-political zone Sunday met in Lagos where they expressed strong opposition to the agitation.
pcm: Inside di agitation for Oduduwa Republic for South-West, leaders of di All Progressives Congress (APC) for di geo-political zone meet for Lagos on Sunday, and dem show dia strong opposition to di agitation.

eng: The meeting held in Lagos House, Marina, was at the instance of the former interim National Chairman of the APC, Chief Bisi Akande.
pcm: Di meetin wey hold for Lagos House, Marina, na base on di call of di former interim National Chairman of di APC, Chief Bisi Akande.

eng: At the meeting was a national leader of the APC, Asiwaju Bola Tinubu, governors of Lagos, Babajide Sanwo-Olu,  Dapo Abiodun (Ogun), Adegboyega Oyetola (Osun) and Chief Bisi Akande.
pcm: Dose wey dey di meetin na national leader of di APC, Asiwaju Bola Tinubu, governor of Lagos, Babajide Sanwo-Olu, Dapo Abiodun of Ogun State, Adegboyega Oyetola of Osun and Chief Bisi Akande.

eng: Others were General Alani Akinrinade (rtd), former governor of Ogun State, Aremo Segun Osoba, Minister of Industry, Trade and Investment, Otunba Niyi Adebayo and Chief Pius Akinyelure among others.
pcm: Odas wey follow dey di meetin na General Alani Akinrinade (rtd), former governor of Ogun State, Prince Segun Osoba, Minista of Industry, Trade and Investment, Otunba Niyi Adebayo and Chief Pius Akinyelure wit odas.

eng: Daily Trust learnt that the meeting was in response to the raging agitation for Yoruba nation by a section of the region with several rallies held in South-West states to agitate for Oduduwa Republic.
pcm: Daily Trust hear say di meetin na in response to di raging agitation for Yoruba nation by some pipo for di region, wit different rally wey dem don hold for South-West states to agitate for Oduduwa Republic.

eng: In a communiquÃ© read by Chief Akande, the South West leaders asked security agencies and the federal government to reduce tension in the country following the worsening security challenges bedeviling the nation.
pcm: Inside one statement wey Chief Akande read, di South West leaders tell security agencies and di federal government say make dem reduce tension for di kontri afta di worsenin security challenges wey dey torment di nation.

eng: The communique reads in part; We note with significant concern the security situation in the country.
pcm: Na part of wetin dey di statement be dis; We note wit significant concern di security situation for di kontri.

eng: Terrorism and violent criminality threaten many areas, adversely affecting the lives and livelihoods of too many innocent and peace-loving Nigerians.
pcm: Terrorism and violent criminality dey threaten many areas, badly affecting di live and livelihood of plenti innocent and peace-loving Nigerians.

eng: We urge the federal government to continue to make the necessary expenditures and allocate sufficient resources to enable the military and security agencies to tackle the difficult security challenges confronting us.
pcm: We encourage di federal government to kontinue to make di necessary expenditure and allocate sufficient resources wey go enable di military and security agencies tackle di hard security challenges wey dey face us.

eng: For Nigeria to overcome these challenges, we must do so with unity of purpose and action.
pcm: For Nigeria to overcome dis challenges, we need do so wit unity of purpose and action.

eng: The desire for peace and the chance for a prosperous and just society is universal and transcends all regional, religious or ethnic divisions.
pcm: Di desire for peace and di chance for a prosperous and just society dey universal and e pass all form of regional, religious or ethnic division.

eng: Sadly, many public figures have made statements that spark division and undermine the needed unity of purpose.
pcm: Sadly, many public figure don tok tins wey fit cause division and destroy di unity of purpose wey we need.

eng: We restate our abhorrence of violence as a means to achieve either political or economic power and influence.
pcm: We dey restate awa extreme dislike of violence as a means to achieve either politikal or economic power and influence.

eng: We strongly condemn violence of any form in any part of the country, regardless of ethnic or regional identity of the perpetrators of the violence or of the victims.
pcm: We strongly condemn any form of violence for any part of di kontri, regardless of where di victims or pipo wey cause di violence kom from.

eng: Government must do all it can to protect potential victims and to assist those who have previously been victimized by terrorism or widespread banditry.
pcm: Government need do evritin wey e fit do to protect potential victims and to help dose wey don be victims of terrorism or widespread banditry befor.

eng: We endorse the position of the Southern Governors taken at their May 11, 2021 summit in Asaba, Delta State, regarding ranching.
pcm: We support wetin di Southern Governors tok about ranching for dia May 11, 2021 summit wey happun for Asaba, Delta State.

eng: We do so because such a decision will lessen tensions between farmers and herders while also helping the long-term economic viability of both the farming and herding communities.
pcm: We support becos dat kind decision go fit reduce di tension between farmers and herdsmen, and e go also help di long-term economic development of di farming and herding communities togeda.

eng: 2023: INEC verifies voting points for conversion to polling units
pcm: 2023: INEC don verify voting points for conversion to polling units

eng: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) on Tuesday commenced a nationwide verification exercise of the voting points (VPs) proposed to be converted to polling units (PUs) across the country.
pcm: Di Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) on Tuesday begin a nationwide verification exercise of di voting points (VPs) wey dem propose say dem wan convert to pollin units (PUs) tru-out di kontri.

eng: INEC Chairman Prof. Mahmood Yakubu said this on Tuesday in Abuja, when he visited some of the proposed centres and existing PUs in the FCT and Nasarawa State.
pcm: INEC Chairman, Prof. Mahmood Yakubu na im tok am on Tuesday for Abuja, wen e visit som of di centres wey dem wan use and som current PUs for di FCT and Nasarawa State.

eng: Speaking with newsmen at the commissions Local Government office in Karu, Nasarawa State, Yakubu said the purpose of the verification exercise was to ensure the right thing was done in the conversion of the VPs to PUs.
pcm: Prof. Yakubu, wen e dey follow tori-men yarn for di commission Local Government office wey dey Karu, Nasarawa State, tok say di purpose of di verification na to make sure say dem do di right tin befor dem convert di VPs to PUs.

eng: All the national commissioners are out, visiting the states of the federation to verify the work of converting the voting points to polling units, he said.
pcm: E tok say; All di national commissioners don kommot, dem dey visit di states of di federation so dem go fit verify di work of convertin di voting points to polling units.

eng: Meanwhile, the commission yesterday said it has upgraded 956 voting points to polling units in Sokoto State.
pcm: Meanwhile, di commission tok am yesterday say dem don upgrade 956 voting points to polling units for Sokoto State.

eng: A guide to soya bean farming as planting begins June
pcm: A guide to soya bean farming as planting go begin by June

eng: Soya is a plant grown mostly for its edible bean which can be used for different purposes.
pcm: Soya na plant wey dem dey grow, mostly becos of e beans wey dem fit use do different tins.

eng: It is a legume known for its high nutritious value.
pcm: Na legume wey get high nutritious value.

eng: Our agric editor who has been monitoring the soya bean value-chain reports that despite the fact that Nigeria is said to be the largest producer of the crop in Africa, its production level has not attained its full capacity.
pcm: Awa agric editor wey don dey monitor di soya bean value-chain tok say, even say dem know Nigeria as di largest producer of soya for Afrika, di production level still neva reach im full capacity.

eng: This is because soya bean farming in the country is still largely done by small farmers who grow the crop as a minor crop alongside major crops like maize, cowpea (beans) and cassava.
pcm: Dis na becos most of dose wey dey plant soya bean for di kontri be small farmers. Dem no dey plant am as di main crop, but dem dey use am support oda major crops like corn, cowpea (beans) and cassava.

eng: Some soya bean farmers that spoke with Daily Trust believe that the crop can be grown in many states in Nigeria using low agricultural input.
pcm: Som soya bean farmers wey follow Daily Trust yarn believe say wit small agricultural tools and effort, we fit grow di crop for many states for Nigeria.

eng: Why more farmers should go into soya bean farming
pcm: Di reason why more farmers suppose enta soya bean farming

eng: Mallam Yinusa Jimoh, an Ilorin-based retired agric extension officer, told Daily Trust on phone that aside from its domestic and economical values, soya bean improved soil fertility and could be used to control striga.
pcm: Mallam Yinusa Jimoh, wey be Ilorin-based retired agric extension officer, tell Daily Trust for fone say apart from di domestic and economical values wey soya bean get, e dey also improve soil fertility and dem fit use am kontrol striga.

eng: He said the market for soya bean in Nigeria was growing fast, with opportunities for improving the income of farmers.
pcm: E tok say di market for soya bean dey grow fast for Nigeria, and opportunity dey for farmers to improve dia income.

eng: A handbook on soya bean produced by the International Institute of Tropical Agriculture (IITA) shows that the rapid growth in the poultry sector in the past five years has also increased demand for soya bean meal in Nigeria.
pcm: One handbook wey di International Institute of Tropical Agriculture (IITA) produce on soya bean show say di fast growth for poultry sector during di past five years don also increase di demand for soya bean meal for Nigeria.

eng: The IITA handbook reads in part: It is also a prime source of vegetable oil in the international market.
pcm: The IITA handbook reads in part: It is also a prime source of vegetable oil in the international market.

eng: Soya bean has an average protein content of 40 percent and is more protein-rich than any of the common vegetable or animal food sources found in Nigeria.
pcm: Soya bean get average protein content of 40 percent and e get more protein pass any of di common vegetable or animal food source wey dey for Nigeria.

eng: According to IITA, SALMA Oil Mills in Kano, Grand Cereals in Jos, ECWA Feeds in Jos, AFCOT Oil Seed Processors in Adamawa and PS Mandrides in Kano all process soya bean.
pcm: Accordin to IITA, SALMA Oil Mills for Kano, Grand Cereals for Jos, ECWA Feeds for Jos, AFCOT Oil Seed Processors for Adamawa and PS Mandrides wey dey Kano dey all process soya bean.

eng: This means that there is a ready market for interested farmers in the country.
pcm: Wetin dis one mean be say ready market dey for farmers wey get interest for soya farming for di kontri.

eng: Presently at the local market, a measure of soya bean costs around N600; depending on the area, while a 50kg bag costs around N17,000.
pcm: Right now, for di local market, one de-rica of soya bean na N600; dependin on di area, while dem dey sell 50kg bag for around N17,000.

eng: The global demand for the crop nears about 11 million tonnes, while Africas annual expenditure of soya bean is about 619 thousand tonnes.
pcm: Di global demand for di crop na about 11 million tonnes, while di yearly amount of soya bean wey dem dey chop for Afrika na about 619 thousand tonnes.

eng: Best ways to farm soya bean
pcm: Di best way wey we fit take use farm soya bean

eng: According to a long time soya bean farmer, Dr Awoniyi Joseph, planting of soya bean usually starts in June, and that it grows well on all kinds of soil, except deep soils with poor water retention.
pcm: Accordin to a long time soya bean farmer, Dr Awoniyi Joseph, soya bean planting dey always start for June, and e dey grow well on all type of soil, except deep soil wey no fit hold water.

eng: Dr Joseph informed farmers that an important factor to consider when embarking on soya bean farming in Nigeria was rainfall.
pcm: Dr Joseph yarn farmers say one important tin to consider wen pesin wan start soya bean farming for Nigeria na rainfall.

eng: He said Nigeria had a very favourable climatic condition that was ideal for soya bean to flourish.
pcm: E tok say Nigeria get very gud climate wey dey perfect for soya bean to flourish.

eng: According to him, good harvest depends mostly on adequate irrigation as the crop can also be grown in areas with lesser amounts of rainfall through irrigation.
pcm: As Awoniyi tok, gud harvest depend mostly on regular irrigation, becosthroughirrigation, di crop fit grow for areas wey no get plenti rainfall.

eng: According to IITA, soya bean should not be planted in sandy, gravelly, or shallow soils to avoid drought stress, advising that it should not be grown in waterlogged soils or soils with surfaces that can crust, as this will lead to poor seedling emergence
pcm: Accordin to IITA, make dem no plant soya bean for sandy, gravelly, or shallow soils to prevent drought stress, dem advise say make dem no plant am for soil wey get plenty water or soil wit surfaces wey fit break, cos dis no go make di seed komot well.

eng: Clear all vegetation before land preparation.
pcm: Clear all di plants wey dey, befor u prepare di land.

eng: The seedbed may be prepared manually with a hoe or an animal-drawn implement or tractor, IITA advised.
pcm: U fit prepare di seedbed manually wit a hoe or animal-drawn equipment or tractor, IITA advise.

eng: Well-prepared land ensures good germination and reduces weed infestation.
pcm: Land wey dem prepare well dey allow di seed germinate well, and e dey reduce weed infestation.

eng: You can plant on ridges or on a flat seedbed, the IITA added.
pcm: IITA add am join say; U fit plant on ridges or on flat seedbed.

eng: Experts warn that soya bean variety selection should be based on maturity, yield potential, lodging, drought tolerance and resistance to pests and diseases.
pcm: Experts don warn say to choose di type of soya bean wey u go plant, u need look at di period wey e dey take mature, di yield potential, lodging, and how well e fit tolerate drought and resist pest and disease.

eng: John Stephen, a soya bean farmer in Garam, a Niger State community neighbouring the FCT, insisted that the maturity period should be the first consideration when choosing a variety suited to your geographical zone.
pcm: John Stephen, wey be soya bean farmer for Garam, one community for Niger State, close to di FCT, insist say na di maturity period u need to consida first wen u wan choose di type of soya bean wey fit ur location.

eng: Stephen advised that, Consider varieties that are earlier maturing rather than late maturing in areas with low rainfall.
pcm: Stephen advise say, for areas wey get low rainfall, make u consida di seed wey dey mature early rada dan di one wey dey mature late.

eng: Although later maturity increases the yield potential, it is risky to grow late maturing varieties in drier environments because of late season drought.
pcm: Although seed wey dey mature late dey always get beta yield, but e dey risky to plant late maturing seed for dry environments becos of late season drought.

eng: IITA advised farmers to use high quality seeds of the selected variety as soya bean seeds easily lose their viability.
pcm: IITA advise farmers say make di type of seed wey dem go choose be of high quality becos soya bean seeds dey quick lose dia viability.

eng: According to the institute, it is common for soya bean, even when stored properly, not to germinate after 12 to 15 months in storage.
pcm: According to di institute, e dey common for soya bean not to grow afta 12 to 15 monts wey e don dey for storage, even wen dem keep am well.

eng: Therefore, use seeds that are not more than 12 months old to ensure good germination.
pcm: So, make u use seed wey never pass 12 monts so e go fit germinate well.
