eng: Sort out the good seeds for planting to ensure that they are free from insects, disease infestation and weed seeds.
pcm: Select di gud seed komot for planting so u go fit make sure say dem no get insect, disease, or weed seeds.

eng: Do not purchase seeds from the open market as the germination potential is not guaranteed.
pcm: Make u no buy seed from open market, cos di ability for di seed to germinate no guarantee.

eng: Planting poor quality seeds will not produce a good yield,
pcm: Planting seed wey get poor quality no go produce beta yield.

eng: the institute advised in the handbook.
pcm: Di institute advise for di handbook.

eng: Conducting germination test
pcm: Conducting germination test

eng: If possible, IITA recommends seed test before planting.
pcm: If e dey possible, IITA recommend say make u test di seed befor planting.

eng: The institute recommends that the germination rate should be 85 percent or more to obtain a good stand.
pcm: Di institute recommend say make di germination rate be 85 percent or more to get gud stand.

eng: According to IITA, to conduct a quick seed germination test, select 400 seeds randomly and sow 100 seeds each in four wooden or plastic boxes or a prepared seedbed.
pcm: Accordin to IITA, to conduct a quick seed germination test, make u select 400 seeds randomly, den plant 100 seeds each for four woodin or plastik boxes or seedbed wey u don prepare.

eng: Sow one seed per hole at a distance of 10cm between the seeds.
pcm: Plant one seed per hole wit a distance of 10cm between di seeds.

eng: Soak cloth or paper-lined germination boxes or the seedbed well with water before sowing and provide water every morning and evening.
pcm: Soak di woodin or plastik boxes or di seedbed well wit water befor planting and make u dey put water evri mornin and evenin.

eng: Start counting the seedlings five days after sowing and complete the counting within 10 days.
pcm: Begin dey count di seedlings five days afta planting and complete di counting within 10 days.

eng: A total count of 320 germinated seeds or more indicates a germination rate of 80 percent and above.
pcm: If u fit count a total of 320 seeds wey germinate, e mean say di germination rate of di seed na 80 percent and above.

eng: When the percentage of germination is 80 percent or less, the seed rate has to be increased accordingly to achieve 100 percent.
pcm: Wen di percentage of germination na 80 percent or less, u go need increase di seed rate to achieve 100 percent.

eng: Fertiliser application
pcm: Fertiliser application

eng: IITA advises that a good fertiliser recommendation for soya bean production depends on a good soil test.
pcm: IITA advise say to recommend beta fertiliser for soya bean production, pesin go need to do a gud soil test.

eng: Under normal conditions, soya bean as a legume should provide itself with nitrogen through biological nitrogen fixation.
pcm: For normal kondition, soya bean as legume wey e be suppose provide esef wit nitrogenthroughbiological nitrogen fixation.

eng: Until nodulation occurs, the soya bean plant depends on soil nitrogen for growth.
pcm: Until nodulation don happun, di soya bean plant go dey depend on di soil nitrogen to grow.

eng: Phosphorus is often the most deficient nutrient, therefore, apply optimum phosphorous fertiliser for good yield.
pcm: Phosphorus na im di plant dey lack pass, derefor, make u put di best phosphorous fertiliser so e go fit grow well.

eng: The institute further advises farmers to incorporate the fertiliser into the soil during harrowing and levelling of the field.
pcm: Di institute still advise farmers say make dem put di fertiliser inside di soil wen dem dey harrow and level di farm.

eng: Pests, diseases and weeds
pcm: Pests, diseases and weeds

eng: Perennial and most annual weeds are a problem to soya bean in its early growth stages.
pcm: Na problem Perennial and most annual weeds be to soya bean wen e jus dey grow

eng: A properly timed weed control programme can minimise the effects of weeds.
pcm: Gud weed kontrol programme for di proper time fit reduce di effect of weed.

eng: Weed control in soya bean could be manual or chemical, or both.
pcm: Weed kontrol for soya bean fit be manual or chemical, or both.

eng: Manual weed control
pcm: Manual weed kontrol

eng: : Carry out the first weeding at two weeks after planting and the second at five to six weeks after planting.
pcm: : Make u do di first weedin two weeks afta plantin and di second one, five to six weeks afta plantin.

eng: Avoid weeding immediately after a rainfall as this will lead to transplanting the weeds.
pcm: Make u no weed di farm immediately rain fall, becos dis go make di weed grow for anoda place.

eng: Poor hoe weeding or delay in weeding can cause significant reduction in yield.
pcm: bad weedin or delay fit make di yield reduce badly.

eng: Chemical weed control:
pcm: Chemical weed kontrol:

eng: Herbicides, if used properly, are safe and effective in controlling weeds in soya bean cultivation.
pcm: Herbicides na safe and effective way to kontrol weed for soya bean farming, if we use am wella.

eng: The choice of herbicide, however, depends on the predominant weed species and the availability of the herbicide.
pcm: Di kind herbicide wey u go use kom depend on di kind weed wey dey dere and if di herbicide dey available.

eng: Herbicides are available for pre-emergence or post-emergence weed control in soya bean.
pcm: Herbicides dey available for pre-emergence or post-emergence weed kontrol for soya bean.

eng: If herbicide is applied at planting, one weeding may be required at five to six weeks after planting.
pcm: If u use herbicide durin plantin, u go need weed di farm five to six weeks afta plantin.

eng: Several different insects infest soya bean fields, but few are normally of any economic importance, and the species that cause damage are usually not abundant enough to warrant control measures.
pcm: Na different insects dey affect soya bean farm, but na only few of dis insects no get any economic importance, and dose ones wey fit damage crops no dey plenty reach di amount wey go need kontrol measures.

eng: In the vegetative stage, the crop is very tolerant of caterpillars but very susceptible to silverleaf whitefly attack.
pcm: Durin di vegetative stage, di crop dey immune to caterpillars but e dey very weak to silverleaf whitefly attack.

eng: Harvest
pcm: Harvest

eng: Soya bean for shelling and fresh use are ready for harvest from 65 days after sowing.
pcm: Soya bean dey ready to harvest for shelling and fresh use from 65 days afta planting.

eng: However, dry soya beans require 100 or more days to reach harvest.
pcm: Howeva, dry soya beans need 100 or more days befor u fit harvest am.

eng: Soya bean farmers advise that for green shell beans, soya bean could be harvested when pods are green, full and plump.
pcm: Soya bean farmers don advise say for beans wey get green shell, u fit harvest am wen di pods dey green, full and plump.

eng: FIFA, UEFA licensed agents storm Kano in search of talented players
pcm: Agents wey get license for FIFA and UEFA don storm Kano to search for talented players

eng: A team of European scouts under the umbrella of 60 Goals Soccer Star Project has arrived the city of Kano to conduct an U-16 football talent hunt beginning from June 1.
pcm: A team of European scout, unda di umbrella of 60 Goals Soccer Star Project don arrive for Kano city to conduct one U-16 football talent hunt from June 1.

eng: Addressing a press conference Wednesday, the licensed agents said their decision to conduct the scouting programme in Kano was informed by the high number of young and talented players available for selection.
pcm: Wen dem dey follow tori pipo yarn on Wednesday, di agents tok say dia decision to conduct di scoutin programme for Kano na becos of di high numba of young and talented players wey dey available for selection.

eng: The Chief Executive Officer, 60 Goals Soccer Star Project who is also a FIFA intermediary agent, Jane Ndubuisi added that the project is introduced to empower Kano youths through football.
pcm: Di Chief Executive Officer of 60 Goals Soccer Star Project, Jane Ndubuisi, wey be FIFA middle-man agent too, add am join say dem bring di project to empower Kano youthsthroughfootball.

eng: We are here, therefore, to pick talents and to help them achieve their dreams.
pcm: We dey hia, to pick talents and to help dem achieve dia dreams.

eng: She urged parents to encourage their wards to combine football with education.
pcm: She tell parents say make dem encourage dia children to join football wit education.

eng: On his part, Miroslav Marjanovic expressed hope that as many players as possible would be given the opportunity to showcase their skills during the exercise.
pcm: For e side, Miroslav Marjanovic get hope say durin di  exercise, many players go get di opportunity to showcase dia skills.

eng: He said Youths from rural areas will be given the opportunity to showcase their talent and the best among them would be selected for trials abroad.
pcm: E tok say Youths wey kom from rural areas go get opportunity to showcase dia talent and dem go select di best among for trial abroad.

eng: My hope is that many of the players here in Kano are going to succeed for themselves and their immediate society.
pcm: My hope be say many of di players hia for Kano go succeed for demsef and dia immediate society.

eng: In a similar vein, Milan Martinovic noted that the screening is packaged to give youthful players the avenue to express themselves for opportunities to become professional footballers.
pcm: Also, Milan Martinovic yarn say dem package di screening to give youthful players di opportunity to show demsef for opportunity to becom professional footballers.

eng: For the president of 60 Goals Soccer Star Project and Ex Nigerian U-23 player Francis Ikechukwu, a level playing field will be provided for all the participants.
pcm: Francis Ikechukwu wey be di president of 60 Goals Soccer Star Project and former Nigerian U-23 player tok say dem go provide a level playing field for all di participant.

eng: What we need is talent and
pcm: Wetin we need na talent and

eng: its only your ability that will give you the chance no matter what, because we dont know corruption, he said.
pcm: na only ur ability go give u di chance no matta wat, becos we no sabi corruption, e tok.

eng: This triggered a revolution in the sector; hence the increase in rice milling in Kano.
pcm: Na wetin trigger revolution for di sector be dat, na wetin kos di increase for rice milling for Kano.

eng: In places like Kura, Gezawa, Bunkure, Garun Malam and Tudun Wada local government areas of the state, it is common to see a cluster of small-scale rice millers doing business.
pcm: For area dem like Kura, Gezawa, Bunkure, Garun Malam and Tudun Wada local goment wey dey di state, e dey common to dey see plenty small-scale rice millers wey dey do business.

eng: It is the first mega rice mill owned by a woman in Kano State.
pcm: Na di first mega rice mill wey woman be di owner be dis for Kano State

eng: This resulted in an increase in the number of rice farmers in the state as demand increased.
pcm: Di result be say di number of rice farmer dem increase for di state bikos say demand don increase

eng: It was reported that rice milling revolution in Kano started in 2014 when 70,000 farmers were mapped out to benefit from the years dry season farming programme in the states agricultural scheme.
pcm: Dem be report say rice milling revolution for Kano start for 2014 wen 70,000 farmer dem dey map out to benefit from di dry season faring programme wey dey apun for di state.

eng: It is also on record that as at 2019, Nigeria ranked as the first in Africa and the 14th largest producer of rice in the world, with China being the top producing country.
pcm: Dem don record am say for 2019, na first in Africa Nigeria rank and 14th largest producer of rice for di world, as Chine top di kontri list

eng: Suspected IPOB members attack FCID in Abia
pcm: IPOB members wey dem suspect don attack FCID wey dey for Abuja

eng: The Nigeria Police Force Criminal Investigation Department (FCID) located at Umuagu, Umuahia in Abia State is under attack by gunmen believed to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).
pcm: Di Nigeria Police Force Criminal Investigation Department (FCID) wey dey Umuagu, Umuahia for Abia State dey attack by gunmen wey dem believe to be IPOB member dem

eng: The gunmen, numbering over 50, were half-naked.
pcm: Di gunmen, wey pass 50, dey half nacked

eng: Some were seen hanging live cock around their neck while many of them are armed with AK47 rifles.
pcm: Dem see some wey hang chicken wey dem neva kil for dia neck and many of dem carry AK47

eng: They attacked the security formation and set it ablaze.
pcm: Dem attack di security place and throw fire inside

eng: A security source told our correspondent that a combined team of the military and Police engaged the hoodlums afterwards.
pcm: Security source tell awa tori pipo say military and police dem join hand to fight di gunmen later

eng: He added that stray bullets killed some people in the process of a gun battle between them.
pcm: He add say stray bullet kil some pipo for gun battle wey dey apun

eng: Meanwhile, soldiers have taken over Umuahia as of the time of this report.
pcm: Meanwhile, soldier dem don take over Umuahia as di time wey we dey report dis tori

eng: It could be recalled that Umuahia residents woke up seeing men of the Nigerian Army patrolling major streets in Umuahia and manning areas believed to be flashpoints.
pcm: We fit remember say pipo wey dey live for Umuahia wake up and sem see Nigerian Army wey dey patrol street for Umuahia and dem dey stay for area wey be flashpoint

eng: Lawan in a reaction, accused the governors ofretreating to regionalism to address a national issue that should be collectively decided upon.
pcm: Lawan for how e react, tok say di governors dey reyreate to regionalism to dey address national issue wey evribodi suppose decide upon togeda

eng: The Ogun speaker who spoke in Abeokuta at the weekend, however, said Lawans comments were not healthy.
pcm: Di Ogun Speaker dey tok for Abeokuta for weekend tok say wetin Lawan tok do dey healthy

eng: This is the first time in the history of the country when the governors of the Southern part of Nigeria would come out openly on this matter and align themselves with the request and demand of their people.
pcm: Na dis be di first time for di history of Nigeria wey governors wey kom from di southern part of Nigeria go kom out for public on dis matter and align demsef wit wetin di pipo want.

eng: The Speaker of the Ogun State House of Assembly, Olakunle Oluomo, has faulted the Senate President, Ahmed Lawans, comment over a meeting and resolutions reached by Southern governors.
pcm: Olakunle Oluomo, wey be Speaker of di Ogun State House of Assembly, don fault di Senate President, Ahmed Lawan comment ova meeting and resolution wey dem Souther Governors dem reach

pcm: Southern Governors, wey be seventeen see last week for Asaba, Delta State, wey dem call for national dialogue, dem demand make dem restructure di kontri, make dem ban open grazing totally and dem ask President Muhammadu Buhari make e tok to di nation

eng: 5 policemen on trial for extorting N200,000 from Dubai-based Nigerian
pcm: 5 policemen dey trial as dem extort N200,000 form Nigerians wey dey live for Dubai

eng: Lagos State Police Command says it has commenced orderly room trial for five policemen at FESTAC Police Station for allegedly collecting N200,000 from a Dubai-based Nigerian who was home visiting his family.
pcm: Lagos State Police Command tok say dem don start room trial for 5 policemen for FESTAC police station for  di accusation say dem collect N200,000 from Dubai-based Nigerians wey kom home kom visit hin family

eng: The policemen had allegedly followed the victim to a local Point of Sale (POS) cash point in FESTAC where the said amount was extorted from him.
pcm: Dem allege say di policemen follow di victim waka to a local point of sale cash point for FESTAC where dem tok say dem collect di moni for hin hand

eng: The policemen had accosted the victim while driving home in an Uber car.
pcm: Di policemen dey wit di victim side by side wen e dey drive home inside Uber car

eng: It was learnt that the victim who recently arrived in the country from Dubai, and was also heading home from the airport, had shared the story of how police officers in FESTAC town stopped him and extorted N200, 000 from him.
pcm: We hear say di victim wey just kom back from Dubai, wey dey go home from di airport, don share di tori of how police pipo dem for FESTAC stop and and collect N200, 000 from am

eng: #EndSARS promoter, Rinu, initially shared the story of the man on her Twitter handle.
pcm: Rinu, wey be one of di #EndSARS promoter, don share di tori of di man for her Twitter handle before

eng: A suspected explosion has hit the popular Mile 3 Park market in Diobu axis of Port Harcourt, causing panic on Monday morning.
pcm: Explosion don hit Mile 3 park market for Diobu area for Port Harcourt, wey kos panic for Monday morning

eng: The incident took place at about 6:20am when traders were bringing in their goods into the park, witnesses said.
pcm: Di incident apun around 6:20am wen trader dem dey bring dia goods inside park, witness tok

eng: One person was injured in the leg, while few others sustained injuries in a stampede that followed.
pcm: Na leg one person injure, plenty oda pipo get injury as all of dem dey run for dia life

eng: Many traders in the market quickly parked their goods and left the park after the explosion.
pcm: Many trader dem quickly park dia goods for di market and dem leave di park afta di exposion

eng: The personnel of the Nigeria Police Force believed to have come from Nkpolu Police Division, Port Harcourt immediately moved to the scene of the incident.
pcm: Nigeria Police force pipo wey e be like say dem kom from Nkpolu Police Division, Port Harcourt kom to di scene of di incident

eng: When contacted the State Police Command, spokesperson, SP Nnamdi Omoni, said that he is yet to get detailed information about the incident.
pcm: SP Nnamdi Omoni, wey be State Police Command wey dem contact am tok say e neva get detail information about di incident

eng: The man later took to Twitter to reveal his identity and also recount how the incident happened.
pcm: Di man go Twitter go reveal hin identity and tok about how di incident apun

eng: Lagos State Police Spokesman, Muyiwa Adejobi, who confirmed the incident, said all the policemen involved are being tried at the Command Headquarters, Ikeja.
pcm: Muyiwa Adejobi, wey be Lagos State Police toktok pesin wey confirm di incident tok say all di police pipo dem wey dey involve dey trial for Command Headquaters for Ikeja

eng: Adejobi said the trial would determine the level of complicity of those involved.
pcm: Adejobi tok say di trial go determine di level of complicity of pipo wey dey involve

eng: According to Adejobi,We have arrested all of them and the money recovered and returned to the man.
pcm: According to wetin Adejobi tok, dem don arrest all of dem and dem don return di moni wey dem recover back to di man

eng: The policemen will soon face trial and be punished.
pcm: Di policemen go soon face trial and dem go punish dem

eng: We have the whole team in the cell and they would be given orderly room trial, he said.
pcm: He tok say dem get di whole team for cell and dey go give dem orderly room trial

eng: Adejobi , however, did not disclose if the DPO of Festac would also be tried along with them for what people calledlack of supervision.
pcm: Adejobi no tok if DPO of FESTAC go dey di trial too wit di oda pipo as pipo dey tok say na lack of supervision

eng: Manchester City will be crowned Premier League champions if they beat Chelsea this afternoon in a game which is now a dress rehearsal for the Champions League final.
pcm: Dem go crown Manchester City Premier League champions if dem beat Chelsea dis afternoon for game wey be dress reheasal for di champions league final

eng: Victory at the Etihad Stadium would allow Pep Guardiolas City side to open up an insurmountable 16-point lead over second-placed Manchester United, who have just five matches remaining.
pcm: If City win for Etihad Stadium, Pep Guardiola side go open insurmountable 16 point lead ova second place Manchester United, wey get five matches remaining.

eng: But while the title is now a formality for City, the Chelsea game takes on extra significance after the two clubs earned their places in the May 29th Champions League final in Istanbul.
pcm: As di title be formality for City, di Chelsea game dey significant afta di two clubs enta Chanpions League final for Istanbul on May 29

eng: German coach Thomas Tuchel has had an extraordinary impact on Chelsea since joining the club three months ago and can also look forward to an FA Cup final against Leicester City on 15 May.
pcm: German coach Thomas Tuchel don make great impact for Chelsea since e join di club like three months ago and dey look forward to FA Cup final wey dem go play against Liecester City on 15 May

eng: The West London club reached that final by beating Manchester City in the semifinal and that result is fresh in Tuchels mind.
pcm: Di West London club reach final as dem beat Manchester City for semifinal and di result dey fresh for Tuchel mind

eng: This doesnt give us the upper hand but it gives us a good feeling
pcm: E no give us upper hand but e give us good feeling

eng: , it gives us self-confidence, said Tuchel, who has described City as the benchmark for his team.
pcm: Tuchel tok say e give dem good confidence, e describe Manchester City as a benchmark for hin team

eng: We wanted to close the gap to Manchester City and in this one match in the semifinal we did in a very impressive performance, and we will need exactly the same level of performance again.
pcm: We wan close di gap on Manchester City and for di match for semi final we do well and we go need di same level of performance again

eng: But it gave us belief, he said.
pcm: But e give us believe, e tok

eng: Chelsea also have plenty to play for on Saturday as they look to secure a top-four finish and guarantee a place in next seasons Champions League.
pcm: Chelsea get plenty thing to play for for Saturday as dem wan secure top-four finish and guarantee a place for next season Champions League.

eng: Tuchels side are currently in fourth place but have just a three-point advantage over fifth placed West Ham United.
pcm: Na fourth place Tuchel side dey but dem get just three-point advantage ova West Ham United wey dey fifth

eng: On Sunday, Manchester United start a run of three games in five days, with a trip to Aston Villa.
pcm: For Sunday, Manchester United start dey play three game for five days, as dem go still travel go Aston Villa

eng: An armoured vehicle belonging to the Nigerian army and two Boko Haram trucks were destroyed in the fight whileseveral jihadists wereneutralised, the second military officer said.
pcm: Armour vehicle wey belong to Nigeria Army and two truck wey be say na Boko Haram dem get am na em pafuka for fight and dem neutralise pkenty jihadist dem, na wetin di second military officer tok be dat

eng: The jihadists launched the attack from the nearby Wulgo forest, a known Boko Haram hideout.
pcm: Na for nearby Wulgo forest di jihadist launch attack, a place where we know say be hideout of Boko Haram

eng: The jihadist insurgency in northeast Nigeria has killed 36,000 people and displaced around two million from their homes since 2009, according to the United Nations.
pcm: Di jihadist insurgency wey dey apun northeast of Nigeria don send 36,000 pipo go heaven and don displace about 2 million pipo from di place wey dem dey live since 2019, according to wetin di United Nations tok

eng: The violence associated with Boko Haram and its splinter group ISWAP, the Islamic State West Africa Province, has spread to neighbouring Chad, Cameroon and Niger.
pcm: Di violence wey Boko Haram and dia splinter group, ISWAP, the Islamic State West Africa Province, don spread reach Chad, Cameroon and Niger

eng: In 2015, a regional military coalition, the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) was tasked with fighting the insurgents.
pcm: For 2015, regional military coalition, di Multinational Joint Task Force na dem dey fight di insurgency

eng: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari replaced the countrys top military commanders in January in a sudden overhaul after months of pressure over deteriorating security.
pcm: Muhammadu Buhari, wey be Nigeria president for january replace di kontri top military commanders and pressure ova deteriorating security don dey for months

eng: Foundation trains 200 Enugu entrepreneurs
pcm: 200 entrepreneurs na dem one Foundation train for Enugu

eng: At least 200 youths in Udi Local Government Area of Enugu State have graduated from a three-month Youth ICT and Skill Acquisition Project (YISAP) of the Baywood Foundation.
pcm: At least, 200 youths for Udi Local goment wey dey Enugu State don graduate for 3 months Youth ICT and Skil Acquisition Project wey Baywood Foundation organise for di area

eng: The young people were trained on entrepreneurship/vocational skills such as ICT, photography, video-editing, barbing, digital marketing, graphics design, confectionery and other small scale enterprises.
pcm: Na for vocational skil like ICT, photography, digital marketing, graphic desigh, confectionery and odas na em dey train dem on.

eng: The foundation, in January, 2021, got a $98,925 grant from the Coca-Cola Foundation to empower 600 youths in Enugu State.
pcm: For January 2021, na em di Foundation get a $98,925 grant from Coca-Cola Foundation make dem use am empower 600 youths for inside Enugu State

eng: The 200 trained youths are from Enugu West Senatorial Zone, while 200 youths will be trained in Igboeze North Council (Enugu North Senatorial Zone) and 200 youths of Enugu East Council (Enugu East Senatorial Zone).
pcm: Di 200 youth kom from inside Enugu West Sednetorial Zone, dem go train anoda 200 youth dem for inside Igboese North Council (Enugu North Senatorial Zone) and anoda 200 youth dem wey dey Enugu East Council (Enugu East Senatorial Zone).

eng: At least 100 exceptional youths will get a seed grant of N45,000 and N60,000 each from the 600 participants selected for the project.
pcm: 100 youth dem wey do well well go get seed grant of N45,000 and N60,000 each for inside di 600 pipo wey dey participate for di project

eng: In his remarks, the Country Director of Baywood, Mr Chukwudi Ojielo, said:I challenge youths of Udi Area Council, especially our graduating youths, to stand tall and project their businesses to the world through the social media marketing skills they learnt from the training.
He also said 33 out of the 200 graduating youths with outstanding performance would be given grants.
pcm: E tok say 33 of di 200 pipo wey dey graduate wey get better performance go get grant

eng: The Chairman of Udi Council, Chief Ifeanyi Agu, advised the graduating youths to put in their best and take advantage of the opportunity provided by what they had learnt.
pcm: Chief Ifeanyi Agu wey be di Chairman of Udi Council advise di youth ey dey graduate say make dem put dia best and make dem take advantage of di oppurtunity inside wetin dey don learn

eng: A beneficiary, Mrs Anthonia Ugwu, encouraged her fellow youths to utilise the skills they had learnt to double their influence and income in life.
pcm: Mrs Anthonia Ugwu, wey be one of di beneficiary dey encourage her colleage say make dem utilise di skil dem wey dem don learn to double dia influence and inkom inside life.

eng: We may not be aware that Nigeria is one of the main target markets for universities in the United Kingdom.
pcm: We fit no know say Nigeria dey one of di target market for university dem wey dey United Kingdom

eng: There is even some history to demonstrate how events in Nigeria could affect the survival of an institution of higher learning in the United Kingdom.
pcm: History sef dey wey fit show how events for Nigeria fit affect how institutions of higer learning wey dey United Kingdom fit survive.

eng: Mrs. Elizabeth Ivase (1936-2019) was the first female minister in northern Nigeria.
pcm: Mrs. Elizabeth Ivase (1936-2019) be di first minister wey be female for northern Nigeria

eng: She was minister of education in the Second Republic.
pcm: Na she be di minister of education inside Second Republic

eng: Because of the importance of her position, the University of Wales, where she once studied, invited her to Cardiff.
pcm: As her important position take be, di University of Wales, wey she don study before, be invite her kom Cardiff

eng: There, she pledged that every year, the Nigerian government would sponsor a significant number of Nigerians to study at the University College Cardiff (UCC) where a variety of social science and humanities courses were undertaken.

eng: Sometime after that, and after I had two popular cartoon strips in the now-defunct newspaper called The Democrat, and got my first four rejection letters from Marvel Comics, I somehow remained a young man full of hope.

pcm: Fast-forward to 20002, one day as I dey sit down for di post office wey dey di centre of di city to drop off my latest art sample to Marvel Submission Editor, I no fit get bus

eng: Loads of people were walking on foot, while some gathered in clusters, with worried looks on their faces.
pcm: Plenty pipo dey use leg take waka, some gada for group, dem dey worry.

eng: A bit weirded out, I walked back home, only to hear that riots had broken out.
pcm: I dey weird out, waka go home, only to hear say raiot don start.

eng: Again, many lives were lost, and families and friends were torn apart as a move by Christians to Kaduna South, and Muslims to Kaduna North from the South, began.
pcm: again, many pipo die for di riot, farmilies and friends tear apart as Christian dey beingn move to Kaduna South and Muslims begin move from Kaduna South to di North

eng: My Kaduna, my Nigeria, really was falling apart.
pcm: My Kaduna, my Nigeria, don dey fall apart.

eng: A small consolation was that some Christian friends who stayed in certain areas, like my mine, felt safe and didn't move.
pcm: Di small consolation wey I get be some Christian friend wey stay for certain areas, like me, dem feel safe and no go anywia

eng: So, while the violence raged in other parts, my friends and I would play soccer on the street, and exchange VHS tapes, and bootleg VCDs.
pcm: So,  as di violence dey intense for oda parts, I go dey play soccer for my street, dey exchange VHS tapes and bootlegs VCDs

eng: The concept of hating someone because of his ethnicity or religion, frankly, seemed incredulous to us.
pcm: Di idea to dey hate persin bikos of im religion or ethnic dey incredible for us.

eng: But a fellow teen, who had moved to my neighbourhood a couple of years earlier, would provide me with my first, bare-faced encounter with bigotry.
pcm: But one teen, wey just move to our domot some years, nah im make me get encounter with intolerance.

eng: Assuming we somehow were all Muslim, playing soccer, this new guy made a clear call for us to go and attack the infidels who lived down the road.
pcm: if to say we be Muslims, playing soccer, dis new guy call us make we go attack di infidel wey dey live down di road.

eng: We all looked at each other most comically, with puzzled expressions, after which we burst into laughter, then sternly told him to get lost.
pcm: we com look each oda jokingly, we dey confuse, afta wich we burst to laughter, we com tell say make im get out.

eng: As if that wasn't bad enough, my heartbreak would worsen with the appearance of labels and slurs from both sides.
pcm: As if dat one no bad reach, my heartbreak for don worse as I see di apprearance of labels and slur from both of dem.

eng: My perfect Kaduna was now in smoking ruins, and close-knit families and bosom friends would part ways, not because they stopped loving each other, but because it was the safest thing to do.
pcm: My perfect Kaduna don dey fall apart, and families and friends don dey part ways, no be say dem no love each oda but bikos say dat na di safest thing to do.

eng: After that end of innocence, I faced university with cautious optimism.
pcm: afta di wahala don end, I begin face university with cautious optimism.

eng: Many old friends were there, as Zaria was a stones throw from Kaduna, figuratively speaking.
pcm: literally, many old friend dey there, as Zaria no too far from Kaduna.

eng: Many new friendships were begun as well, many of them remaining till today, some even stronger.
pcm: Many pipo dey get new friend, some dey till today, some don dey stronger

eng: The best part of that part, is that none of those friendships, new or old, are coloured by religion or ethnicity.
pcm: The best part be say, all dis friend dem weda new or old, no dey base on religion or ethnicity

eng: It seemed to some us who noticed, that the Kaduna we knew, loved, and lost, wasn't really gone.
pcm: Some of us wey notice know say, di Kaduna wey we know, love and don lose, neva really destroy.

eng: It couldn't be gone, for the simple reason that it actually resided in our hearts, and so was hard to kill.
pcm: E no fit go bikos say nah for our heart im reside, so e go hard to kil patapata

eng: The almost two decades I spent as a journalist after all that, showed me things which many cannot even begin to experience in a whole, robust lifetime.
pcm: Afta all di almost 29 years wey I don spend as a journalist, show me things wey plenty pipo no fit experience for dia life.

eng: I had front row seats to riots, violent attacks, concerts by superstars, movie premieres, and all kinds of generation-defining moments.
pcm: I get front row seat to fight for, gbege attack, concerts by superstars dem, movies premieres and all kin generation-defining moments

eng: I also got to regularly interview some of the biggest newsmakers in Nigeria, during moments when they had the most chutzpah, or none at all.
pcm: I also get to dey interview for some big big newsmaker wey dey Nigeria, during moment wey dem get most chutzpah, or nothin at all.

eng: It was a Nigeria without social justice warriors, virtue-signalers, outrage-peddlers, or cancel culture-purveyors.
pcm: Nah di Nigeria wey no get worrior wey no fit fight for  social justice, virtue-signalers, outrage-peddlers, or cancel culture- purveyor.

eng: It was a Nigeria that, while flawed, still reminded me of my Kaduna of old, even if it wasn't a mirror image.
pcm: Nah di Nigeria wey dey flawed, still dey remind me of my old Kaduna, even though di image different to each oda.

eng: But a body can only take so much for such a long time.
pcm: But bodi no fit take all of dem for too long.

eng: On the bed, I looked around my old room once more, everything just as I left it pre-Coronavirus lockdown.
pcm: On top of bed, I con look around my old room again, evrithin just dey as I leave am before im coronavirus lockdown.

eng: I smiled to myself, as I had at that moment decided on my next steps.
pcm: I com smile to myself, nah from dat moment I begin to dey decide on di kin steps wey I go take.

eng: I twirled the rubber band round the stack of photos twice, and put them back into the longbox.
pcm: I com twist di rubber band round di sack of fotos two times, com put am back for inside longbox.

eng: Maybe one day I will look at the other ones, the colour photos, which carry relatively more recent memories.
pcm: Maybe one day I go look oda ones, di colour foto, wey carry more recent memories.

eng: Maybe I won't.
pcm: Maybe I no go do am.

eng: One thing remains clear: It is my mother, and my father, and the relationships they had or didn't have with me, that made me the kind of kid
pcm: One thing dey clear say: nah my mother, and father, and di kin relationship wey dem get or wey dem no get wit me, nah im make me di kin child wey I be.

eng: I was to the other kids who knew me, as well as the man I grew up to be, to those who know me.
pcm: Wetin I be to oda kids wey know me, also di kin man wey I be, to pipo wey know me.

eng: But I find it unsettling, and relieving mostly relieving that in my stack of black and white photos, I have realized that while my head guides the kind of person I have become, it is my heart that has kept me Nigerian all these years.
pcm: But I find am as wahahla, and e dey relieve more for my sack of black and white fotos, I don realize say while my head guide di kin persin wey I be, nah my heart don dey keep me Nigerian all dis years.

pcm: One of my recent visit of such nature nah to Adamour state, wey dey fascinating for me bikos of im diversity, resilience and outstanding potencial.

eng: I began actively working in Adamawa State a few years ago, with the international organisation, OXFAM, on a project in line with European Union's support to food security and resilience in northern Nigeria where we deployed a mobile solution to integrating the agricultural value chain.
pcm: I begin dey work actively for Adamour state some years ago, wit di international organisation, OXFAM, on top a project wey dey in line wit European Union's support to food security and resilience for Nothen Nigeria were we deployed a mobile solution to integrating di agricultural value chain.

pcm: We don work wit field officers wey dey represent Fufore,Guyuk,Mubi South and Song local goment areas wey dey Adamour state to enhance agriculture and Agricbusiness practices wit tecnology.
