pcm: Nigerians dem don express dia anger ova di proposal of di Nigeria goment Forum (NGF) committees on top fuel subsidy, to push for deregulation of di downstream.

eng: At a virtual meeting on Wednesday, the committee chaired by Kaduna State governor Nasir El-Rufai in a report, recommended a Premium Motor Spirit (PMS) otherwise called petrol price of between N408.5 per litre and N380 per litre while calling for the immediate removal of fuel subsidy.
pcm: for a virtual meeting wey apun for Wednesday, di committee wey di state governor of Kaduna Nasir El-Rufai chaired inside a report, recommended a Premium Motor Spirit(PMS) wey dem dey also call petrol price wey between N408.5 per litre and N380 per litre while dem dey call for immediate removal of fuel subsidy

eng: El-Rufai said the current subsidy regime was unsustainable, and only smugglers and illegal marketers benefit from it.
pcm: El-Rufai tok say dem no fit sustain di current subsidy regime, and only smugglers dem and dem illegal markets dey benefit from am.

eng: He also said Nigeria could not fully benefit from the recent production cut by Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC), which was meant to keep fuel prices high, because of subsidies.
pcm: Im also tok say Nigeria no fit benefit from di recent production wey Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC), which dem suppose keep di fuel price high, bikos of subsidies.

eng: Between N70 billion and N210bn is estimated to be spent every month to keep gasoline price at N162 per litre, this is below the cost price and the remittance to the federation account will shrink to less than N50bn per month or even zero if threats persist, he said.
pcm: Nah between N70 billion and 210 bn dem estimate to be dey spend evri month for di price of gasoline to remain 165 per litre, dis dey below di cost price and di moni wey den give to di federation account go shrink to less dan 50bn per month or even zero if threats persist, im tok.

eng: The committee recommends PMS pump price increment from the current N162per litre to N408.5 per litre
pcm: Di committee don recommend PMS pump price increment from di current N162per litre to N408.5 per litre

eng: Reacting to this on Thursday, Nigerians across the states unleashed their anger on the governors.
pcm: Reacting to dis on Thursday, Nigerians across di states don show dia anger on di governors.

eng: In Anambra state, a civil servant, Mr. Uzoma Okeke said the proposal was unthinkable given the state of the nationâ€™s economy.
pcm: ForAnambra state, a civil servant, Mr. Uzoma Okeke tok say di proposal dey unthinkable if we dey look di state of economy of the nation.

eng: A bus driver, Michael Okafor said he was already struggling to buy petrol at N170/litre in the state.
pcm: A driver wey im name be, Michael Okafor tok say im don dey struggle to buy petrol for N170/litre inside di state.

eng: In Jos, Plateau State, Malam Nura Alhassan, a tailor, expressed dismay over the development.
pcm: Inside Jos for Plateau State, Malam Nura Alhassan wey be tailor, don express im disappointment on top di development.

eng: If the proposal becomes reality, the poor in this country will suffer a lot because whatever figure is increased, the effect will fall on the ordinary Nigerian.
pcm: If di proposal don turn reality, di poor inside dis kontiri go suffer plenty bikos say whateva figure dem don increase, nah ordinary Nigerian go feel am.

eng: More persons reacted to this in Kaduna, Port Harcourt, Abeokuta, Jos and Kano.
pcm: More pipo dem don react to dis inside Kaduna, Port Harcourt, Abeokuta, Jos and Kano.

eng: For instance, in Kano, Buhari Abba Rano, 36, said, With this level of insecurity around Nigerian governors are busy commissioning fake projects and loitering around Abuja and overnight agitating for complete deregulation.
pcm: For instance, inside Kano, Buhari Abba Rano, 36, tok say Wit dis kin level of insecurity wey dey around Nigerian governors dem dey busy dey start fake projects dem and loitering around Abuja and overnight agitating for complete deregulation.

eng: This this shows that our crude oil has become useless and they don't care about the lives of the common man.
pcm: Dis don show say our crude oil don dey useless and dem no care about di dem lives of di common man.

eng: Fatima Baba Kura said: I believe this proposed price will set back the country to a worse state than it is.
pcm: Fatima Baba Kura tok im believe say dis price wey dem propose go kos set back for di kontiri to a worse state than wetin im don be.

eng: In Lagos, many Nigerians expressed shock over the proposed fuel price increment from the governors who are supposed to defend their people.
pcm: Inside Lagos, many Nigerians dem don express shock ova di don already propose fuel price increment from di governors dem who suppose to dey defend dia pipo.

eng: A student, Miss Onyekachi Emeka said the price increase would trigger a hike in transportation fare.
pcm: A student, Miss Onyekachi Emeka tok say di price increase go fit trigger increase inside transportation fare.

eng: Across Akwa Ibom, Abia and Edo states, the residents corroborated the views of other Nigerians as they described the proposal as unfair to the Nigerian populace who have already had enough of the inflation rate, high cost of food and fuel and the deteriorating security situation.
pcm: For inside Akwa Ibom, Abia and Edo states, di residents dem don corroborated di view of oda Nigerians dem as dem dey described di proposal as unfair to di Nigerian pipo dem who don already have enough of di inflation rate, high cost of food and fuel and di security situation wey don dey spoil.

eng: Discard proposal, experts, union tell FG
pcm: Experts dem don tell FG say make im don discard proposal

eng: Experts who reacted to this development have urged the federal government to discard the governors proposal in the best interest of Nigerians.
pcm: Experts wey react to dis development don bin urge di federal goment make dem discard di governors dem proposal for di best interest of dem Nigerian.

eng: A petrol industry commentator, Siraju Oyewale said arbitrary fixing of fuel price is antithetical to the principle of deregulation.
pcm: Di pesin wey dey for in charge petrol industry, Siraju Oyewale tok say  arbitrary fixing of fuel price dey diffirent to di principle of deregulation.

eng: I have a problem with people sitting down and fixing prices of petrol.
pcm: I get problem wit pipo wey dey sit down dey sit down dey fix prices for petrol.

eng: That is not deregulation.
pcm: Dat one no dey deregulation

eng: That is still price regulation.
pcm: Dat one still be price regulation.

eng: Politicians, or even government agencies fixing prices is antithetical to the principle of deregulation.
pcm: Politicians dem, or even dem goment agencies wey dey fix prices dey different to di principle of deregulation.

eng: Although he supports deregulation, Oyewale said the price would initially rise above the current price but not up to N380.
pcm: Even though say im support deregulation, Oyewale tok say di price go rise above di current price but e no go reach N380.

eng: Oyewale also said Nigeria must refine its crude oil locally to tackle the rising petrol import cost by NNPC.
pcm: Oyewale also tok say Nigeria must to refine im crude oil for locally level to tackle di petrol import cost  wey dey rise by NNPC.

eng: An Abuja based economic expert, Samson Simon Galadima said selling petrol at more than twice the current price would further exacerbate inflationary pressure, hence, impoverishing Nigerians even more as purchasing power is diminished.
pcm: An economic expert wey dey stay for Abuja, Samson Simon Galadima tok say selling petrol for price wey dey twice di current price go further exacerbate inflationary pressure, hence, impoverishing Nigerians dem even more as purchasing power don reduce.

eng: Galadima said a lasting solution to Nigeria's fuel price instability will be a deeply diversified energy-mix because our overdependence on petrol is quite unhealthy.
pcm: Galadima tok say lasting solution to Nigeria's fuel price wey no stable go dey deeply diversified energy-mix bikos our overdependence on petrol no dey healthy.

eng: President of the Independent Marketers Association of Nigeria (IPMAN), Chinedu Okoronkwo said it was wrong for the NGF to fix fuel price.
pcm: President of di Independent Marketers Association of Nigeria (IPMAN), Chinedu Okoronkwo tok say e dey wrong for di NGF to dey fix fuel price.

eng: He said full deregulation would encourage more local and foreign investors to invest in the sector and grow the economy but that the governor's proposal should not be honoured.
pcm: Im tok say full deregulation go encourage more local and foreign investors dem to invest inside di sector and grow di economy but dat di governor's proposal should not be honoured.

eng: Only FG can tell us how much to sell fuel NNPC
pcm: NNPC tok say nah only FG fit tell us how much to dey sell fuel

eng: The Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) has said it will not go with the proposal by NGF that a litre of petrol should be sold at N380.
pcm: Di Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) don tok say e no go go wit di proposal by NGF dat make dem sell a litre of petrol for N380.

eng: NNPC's spokesman Dr Kennie Obateru who disclosed this to Daily Trust on Thursday said fuel price as it is now is a policy issue and only the federal government could direct the corporation to sell at specific price.
pcm: Persin wey dey speak for NNPC Dr Kennie Obateru wey torchlight dis to Daily Trust on Thursday tok say as di fuel price be now, e don dbikom policy issue and nah only di federal goment fit direct di corporation to sell for a specific price.

eng: We are still waiting for the conclusion of the ongoing meeting between the organised labour and the Federal Government.
pcm: We still dey wait for di conclusion of di meeting wey dey go on  between di organised labour and the Federal Goment.

eng: It is after the outcome of the meeting that we can say the price can be announced.
pcm: nah afta di outkom of di meeting we fit announce di price

eng: NNPC said the NGF only made a proposal which could be accepted or discarded by the federal government.
pcm: NNPC don tok say di NGF only made a proposal wey fit be accepted or discarded by di federal goment.

eng: PDP govs lack moral standing to demand for restructuring APC chieftain
pcm: PDP goment lack moral standing to dey demand for restructuring APC chieftain

eng: A chieftain of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) and Director General of the Progressives Governors Forum (PGF), Salihu Mohammed Lukman has said governors elected on the platform of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) lack the moral standing to demand for executive bill and restructuring of the country.
pcm: A chieftain of di ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) and Director General of the Progressives Governors Forum (PGF), Salihu Mohammed Lukman tok say dem governors wey dem elect on di platform of di pipos Democratic parti (PDP) don lack di moral standing to demand for executive bill and restructuring of di ogbodo.

eng: PDP governors had a few days ago after their meeting in Ibadan, asked President Muhammadu Buhari to send an executive bill to the National Assembly to amend the countrys Constitution to devolve more powers to the states among others.
pcm: Few days ago afta PDP governor dem don do dia meeting for inside Ibadan, dem ask President Muhammadu Buhari make im send executive bill to di National Assembly make dem amend di kontiri's Constitution to devolve plenty powers to di states among odas.

eng: But reacting in a statement yesterday, the PGF Director General said there was nothing new in the resolutions as progressive governors in line with recommendations contained in the APC Committee on True Federalism, have already taken a position on the matter and since communicated it to the top echelon of the National Assembly.
pcm: But reacting in a statement yesterday, di PGF Director General tok say nothing dey new inside di resolutions as progressive governors in line wit recommendations wey dem contain for di APC Committee on top True Federalism, don already take a position on top di matta and since don communicate am to di top echelon of di National Assembly.

eng: Having mismanaged opportunities to initiate all the recommendations being proposed by the PDP governors between 1999 and 2015, how can anybody in PDP claim any moral standing to demand for any executive bill?
pcm: Has dem don mismanage dem opportunities to initiate all di recommendations dem wey dem bin don propose by di PDP governors dem between 1999 and 2015, how anybodi for inside PDP go dey claim any moral standing to dey demand for any executive bill?

eng: If the issue is as simple as getting the President to transmit executive bill, what stops all the PDP Presidents from initiating it for sixteen years?
pcm: If to say di issue is dey as simple as getting di President to transmit executive bill, wetin stop all di PDP President dem from initiating am for sixteen years?

eng: Lightning kills 18 elephants in India
pcm: Nah 18 elephants dem lightning kil for India.

eng: A herd of 18 wild Asiatic elephants were found dead in India's eastern state of Assam, possibly because of a massive lightning strike, local officials said on Friday.
pcm: Dem see herd of 18 wild Asiatic elephants wey die for inside India's eastern state of Assam, di fit apun bikos of a massive lightning strike, local officials tok am for Friday.

eng: Fourteen adult elephants were found dead by villagers on Thursday.
pcm: some village pipo dem see fourteen adult elephants on Thursday

eng: Another four bodies were found scattered on the foothills of the Kundoli reserve forest area of Assam, 160 kilometres from the state capital of Dispur, local wildlife official, M.K Yadava, told Reuters.
pcm: dem see anoda bodies dem wey dem dey scata on top di foothills of di Kundoli reserve forest area of Assam, wey dey 160 kilometres from di state capital of Dispur, local wildlife official, M.K Yadava, tell Reuters.

eng: The state government ordered a high-level inquiry into the incident on Friday, Assam's Forest and Wildlife Minister, Parimal Suklabaidya, said.
pcm: Di state goment don order a high-level inquiry wey dey into di incident on Friday, nah Assam's Forest and Wildlife Minister, Parimal Suklabaidya, tok am.

eng: A preliminary report suggests the deaths could be due to lightning although we need to find out through forensic tests if there could be any other reason like poisoning or disease, the minister added.
pcm: A preliminary report reason say di deaths fit be due to lightning even though say we need to find out through forensic tests if im possible say somethin else fit be di reason like poisoning or disease, nah wetin di minister talk be dat.

eng: Locals, who found the elephants, said the animals could have been killed by a lightning strike late on Wednesday, a local forest ranger said, adding that he had seen burnt trees in the area.
pcm: Di pipo dem wey find di elephants dem, tok say im possible say nah lightning kil di animals dem on Wednesday, nah a local forest ranger tok am, im add say im see trees wey dey burn for di area.

eng: The ranger declined to be named as he was not authorised to speak to the media.
pcm: Di ranger no tok im name as im no suppose tok to di media.

eng: A former deputy national publicity secretary of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Comrade Timi Frank, faulted the appointment of Major- General Farouk Yahaya as the Chief of Army Staff.
pcm: Di former deputy for national publicity secretary of di All Progressives Congress (APC), Comrade Timi Frank, im fault di appointment of Major- General Farouk Yahaya as di Chief of Army Staff.

eng: Frank, in a statement in Abuja, noted that President Muhammadu Buhari's penchant to elevate junior officers in the security establishments to superintendent over their seniors was against the much-cherished military tradition of seniority and subordination.
pcm: Frank tok for inside a statement for inside Abuja, dat President Muhammadu Buhari's penchant wan elevate junior officers inside di security establishments to superintendent ova dia seniors dem dey against di much-cherished military tradition of seniority and subordination.

eng: He said the elevation of Yahaya above his seniors was a direct hit against the military, which will see senior, capable officers being purged through compulsory retirement as seen in the past.
pcm: Im tok say di elevation of Yahaya above im seniors dem nah direct hit against di military, wich go see senior, capable officers dem wey dem purge through compulsory retirement as we dey see am for di past.

eng: The development, he said, was capable of breeding widespread distrust, discontent, disloyalty, low morale and lack of motivation in the military and other security agencies.
pcm: Im tok say di development dey capable to dey breeding widespread distrust, discontent, disloyalty, low morale and lack of motivation inside di military and oda security agencies dem.

eng: The All Progressives Congress (APC) has expressed excitement over the recent appointment of Ahmed Mustapha Habib as the new Director-General of the National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA).
pcm: Di All Progressives Congress (APC) don express im excitement ova di recent appointment of Ahmed Mustapha Habib as di new Director-General of di National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA).

eng: The appointment was announced earlier by the presidential spokesman, Garba Shehu.
pcm: Nah di Presidential tok tok persin, Garba Shehu, nah im announce di appointment

eng: In a congratulatory letter signed by the National Secretary, Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC), Sen. John James Akpanudoedehe, the ruling party thanked President Muhammadu Buhari for considering the new appointee worthy of the position.
pcm: Inside a congratulatory letta wey dey signed by dem National Secretary, Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC), Sen. John James Akpanudoedehe, wey dey di ruling parti don thank President Muhammadu Buhari for considering di new appointee wey dey worthy of di position.

eng: I write to convey the felicitation of the National Chairman Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC), H.E (Hon)
pcm: I write to convey di jolification of di National Chairman Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC), H.E (Hon)

eng: This particular appointment is a demonstration of reward for party loyalty and recognition of selfless service to the country, attributes which clearly describe your persona.
pcm: Di particular appointment nah demonstration of reward say im dey loyal to di parti and say dem recognise im selfless service to di kontiri, attributes wey fit clearly describe your persona.

eng: We trust in your capacity to acquit yourself creditably well in your new assignment.
pcm: We trust say you get di capacity to do well well for dis your new assignment.

eng: The party is quite appreciative of this gesture of Mr President and wishes you the very best in this endeavour, APC said.
pcm: APC tok say di parti dey appreciative of dis gesture of Mr President di best in dis endeavour.

eng: The new NEMA boss has extensive experience that spanned about 25 years across various sectors, he sits on the Board of various corporate, political and youth organisations, and was the national chairman of Progressive People's Alliance between 2010 and 2011.
pcm: Di new oga for NEMA  get extensive experience wey don span about 25 years across different sectors, im sits on top di  Board wey get various corporate, political and youth organisations, and im be di national chairman of Progressive pipo's Alliance between 2010 and 2011.

eng: An active player in the organisational and policy drives of the APC government, Habib was a member of the Presidential Campaign Council in 2019 and national chairman of the National Committee of Buhari Support Groups since 2015, and also the vice-chairman of the federal government-run State Selection Committee on the Extended Special Public Works Programme in Jigawa State.
pcm: A player wey dey active inside di organisational and policy drives of di APC goment, Habib bin dey di member of the Presidential Campaign Council inside 2019 and national chairman of di National Committee of Buhari Support Groups since 2015, and also the vice-chairman of di federal goment-run State Selection Committee on di Extended Special Public Works Programme in Jigour State.

eng: Abia gov rejects IPOB's strategy, demands apology over war crimes against Igbos
pcm: Abia goment don reject IPOB strategy, dey demand for apology ova di war crimes wey dem hold against Igbos

eng: The Abia State Governor, Dr. Okezie Ikpeazu has explained why he differed with the strategy of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) secession and violence strategy.
pcm: Di Abia State Governor, Dr. Okezie Ikpeazu don explain why im differed wit di strategy of di Indigenous pipo of Biafra (IPOB) secession and dia strategy for gbege.

eng: He spoke on Friday when he visited the digital pan-African news network, the TOS TV network, led by Ms. Osasu Igbinedion in Abuja.
pcm: Im tok on Friday wen im visit  di digital pan-African news network, di TOS TV network, wey Ms. Osasu Igbinedion led for inside Abuja.

eng: The governor who faulted the strategy being deployed by the IPOB led by self-exiled Nnamdi Kanu, however noted that the Ndigbo has not been fairly treated in the country.
pcm: Di governor wey fault di strategy wey IPOB deployed led by self-exiled Nnamdi Kanu, dem howeva note dat dem no dey treat di Ndigbo fairly inside di kontiri.

eng: According to him, the destructive strategy of IPOB was a recipe for the breakdown of law and order in the South East geopolitical zone.
pcm: According to im, di destructive strategy of IPOB bin di recipe for di breakdown of law and order inside di South East geopolitical zone.

eng: Listing other reasons for differing with IPOB, the governor said, But some of us do not agree with his (Nnamdi Kanu) style because I do not understand where he is going, when he intends to pull the brakes and when it is going to stop.
pcm: As dem bin dey listen to oda reasons why im differ wit IPOB, di governor bin tok, But some of us no agree with im (Nnamdi Kanu) style bikos I no understand wia im dey go, wen im intend to pull di brakes and wen im go stop.

eng: If I have a way of conveying my view to the leadership of the group what I will say is they should find the way to enter into conversation and let people know.
pcm: If to say I get a way wey I fit convey my view to di leadership of di group wetin I go tok be say make dem find di way to enter into conversation and let pipo know.

eng: I don't understand their strategy and purpose.
pcm: I no understand dia strategy and purpose.

eng: I don't understand why they are attacking institutions of civil rule.
pcm: I no understand why dem dey attack institutions of civil rule.

eng: A lot of people who are apologetic to some of these strategies don't even know they are riding the tigers tail.
pcm: Plenty pipo dem wey dey apologetic to some of dis dem strategies no even know say dem dey ride for tigers tail.

eng: If the police and military withdraw and then brigands become enforcers of the law and order, if you have a quarrel with your brother, how do you resolve it?
pcm: If di police and military withdraw and den brigands becom enforcers of di law and order, if you get quarrel wit your broda, how you wan take resolve am?

eng: While demanding a national apology for the treatment meted to the Igbos during the nation's three-year civil war, Governor Ikpeazu said, Our national orientation should be willing to say sorry.
pcm: While we still dey demand for national apology for di kin treatment dem dey meted to di Igbos during di nation's three-year civil war, Governor Ikpeazu tok say our national orientation suppose dey willing to say sorry.

eng: No person can be right 100 percent all the days of his life.
pcm: No persin fit dey 100 percent korekt all in life

eng: Even in dealing with our children if we do things that are not right, we should have the courage to stoop low and say sorry but to create a utopian aura that all is well is either nothing is wrong
pcm: Even wen we wey deal wit our pikin dem if we do things wey no dey right, we suppose get di courage to come down to dia level and tell dem sorry but to create a utopian aura dat all dey well is either nothing is wrong

eng: or I have done it, what can you do?
pcm: or I don do am, wetin you fit do?

eng: Who is going to tell us what happened during the civil way, who did what and why?
pcm: Who fit tell us wetin apun for civil war, who do wetin and why dem do am?

eng: Why can't some people come and tell us we are very sorry for what we did?
pcm: why be say say some pipo no fit kom tell us say dem sorry for we dem do?

eng: You can't sweep certain things under the carpet.
pcm: you no fit sweep somethings under di carpet.

eng: The tension is palpable and this is the time for us to open up as those who love the country.
pcm: Di tension dey palpable and dis nah di time for us to dey open up up as pipo wey love dem kontiri.

eng: I speak this way because I spent seven years in the University of Maiduguri.
pcm: I dey speak like dis bikos say I spend seven years inside di University of Maguduri.

eng: I have gone through all part of northern Nigeria
pcm: I don waka through all part of northern Nigeria

eng: and I understand this country.
pcm: and I don sabi dis kontiri

eng: I feel sad that the strings that hold us together are gradually giving way.
pcm: I feel bad say wetin dey bring us togeda don dey gradually go oury.

eng: The NYSC has collapsed.
pcm: Di NYSC don collapse

eng: We have to call a spade a spade no matter whose ox is formed.
pcm: We suppose dey tok di truth no matta whose o dem form.

eng: Some of the issues raised by Nnamdi were issues of injustice, marginalisation, inequality whether it is gender, generational whatever.
pcm: Some of di issues wey Nnamdi raise nah issues of injustice, marginalisation, inequality weda nah gender, generational whateva.

eng: Any particular arm of the society excluded in any way has a right to feel cheated or unwanted.
pcm: Any particular arm of di society wey dem exclude in any way get di right to feel say dem cheat am or dey unwanted.

eng: So, some of those things Nnamdi says are valid.
pcm: so, some of di things Nnamdi tok dey valid.

eng: Some of us can see it.
pcm: some of us fit see am.

eng: We cannot continue to run away from the facts.
pcm: we no fit dey continue to dey run oury from di facts

eng: The Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN) has accused the FCT police command of harassment and intimidation.
pcm: Di Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN) don accuse di FCT police command of harassment and intimidation.

eng: The group which protested over the continued detention of its leader, Ibraheem El-Zakzaky at Wuse Market, Abuja, yesterday, alleged that the police threw teargas and shot at the protesters.
pcm: Di group wey protest ova di continued detention of im leader, Ibraheem El-Zakzaky at Wuse Market, Abuja, yesterday, claim say di police throw teargas and shot at di protesters dem.

eng: A statement signed by Abdullahi Musa, on behalf of the Academic Forum of the IMN,  said the police harassed so many innocent people including passers-by, mostly women while attempting to disperse the protesters.
pcm: A statement wey Abdullahi Musa sign, on behalf of di Academic Forum of di IMN, tok say the police bin dey  harass so many innocent pipo dem including passers-by, especially  women while dem dey attempt to scatta di protesters.

eng: We came out as usual on the streets of Abuja calling on the Nigerian authorities to respect the rule of law and free our leader unconditionally and also remind the general public that in 2015 within 48hrs  over 1000 of his followers were mercilessly killed by the officers and soldiers of the Nigerian Army as they officially launched attack on him in his own residence, killing almost every soul in the house and setting their corpses ablaze.
pcm: We kom out as usual on di streets of Abuja dey halla on di Nigerian authorities make dem respect the rule of law and make dem free our leader unconditionally and also to remind di general public dat in 2015 within 48hrs d kil ova 1000 of im followers mercilessly by the officers and soldiers of the Nigerian Army as dem don officially launch attack on im inside im own residence, dem kil almost evri soul wey dey inside di house and com set dia corpses ablaze.

eng: Musa added that the protest started around 3:00pm peacefully from Sky Memorial but just as they were to disperse  at Wuse Market, the police arrived and started shooting teargas and life ammunition on the peaceful and unarmed protesters.
pcm: Musa don add say dat di protest be don start for around 3:00 for afternoon and dey go serere from Sky Memorial but just dem wan scatta for Wuse Market, di police arrive and start to dey shoot teargas and life ammunition on di peaceful and unarmed protesters.

eng: The police harassed so many innocent people including passeraby mostly women and they removed their hijabs,he further said.
pcm: Di police harass plenty innocent pipo including pipo wey dey pass by wich plenty of dem be women and dem removed dia hijabs, im tok further.

eng: Reacting, the FCT police command spokesperson, ASP Maryam Yusuf, said the group disturbed public peace with their protest.
pcm: di FCT police command spokespesin, ASP Maryam Yusuf, tok say di group dey disturb public peace wit dia protest.

eng: NAPTIP arraigns suspect, reunites 5 trafficked children with parents
pcm: NAPTIP arraigns, dem reunite five trafficked children wit dia parents.

eng: The National Agency for the Prohibition of Trafficking in Persons (NAPTIP) has arraigned one Musa Abdulrahman in court over kidnapping of five children.
pcm: Di FCT police command spokespesin, ASP Maryam Yusuf, tok say di group dem dey disturb public peace wit dia protest.

eng: NAPTIP, at a press briefing  at the weekend, said Abdulrahman, a 32-year-old man,  allegedly abducted the children aged four to seven and sold them to unsuspecting women in different parts of the country under the guise of adoption.
pcm: NAPTIP, for di press briefing  at di weekend, tok say Abdulrahman, a 32-year-old man, him abducted children wey dem dey di age of four to seven and sell dem to some women wey dey different parts of di kontiri wey dey under di guise of say im adoption dem.

eng: The Director General, Mrs. Imaan Sulaiman-Ibrahim, while handing over the children to their parents said, the suspect issued the would be parents adoption papers purportedly from the Niger State Government.
pcm: Di Director General, Mrs. Imaan Sulaiman-Ibrahim, wen im dey hand ova di children to dia parents im say, di suspect tell di would be parents adoption papers purportedly from di Niger State Goment.

eng: He was caught red handed whem he was helping his clients fill adoption application forms, she said.
pcm: She tok say, dem catch am red handed wen im dey help im clients fill dia adoption application forms.

eng: She warned parents to guard their children to avoid incidences of kidnapping, trafficking and other crimes against humanity, adding that they should not expose them to criminally mind people.
pcm: She warn say make parents dem dey guard dia children dem  to avoid kidnapping wey dey apun, trafficking and oda crimes dem wey dey against humanity, she add say make dem no expose dem to pipo wey get criminal intention.

eng: She said the surveillance followed an intelligence report that Abdulrahman  kidnapped children from Niger State and sold them to in different parts of the country.
pcm: She tok say di pesin wey dey investigate di matta don follow an intelligence report dat Abdulrahman  kidnapped children from Niger State and com sell dem into different parts of di kontiri.

eng: The DG also said the intelligence report revealed that the suspect had been doing that claiming to be a staff of the Ministry of Social Development of Niger State in charge of adoption matters.
pcm: Di DG also tok say di intelligence report don reveal that di suspect bin don dey do dat claiming to be a staff of di Ministry of Social Development of Niger State wey dey in charge of adoption dem matta.

eng: She said Abdulrahman confessed that he collected the sum of N100,000 for each of the children.
pcm: She tok say Abdulrahman don confess say im don collect di sum of N100,000 for each of di children.

eng: The parents have lauded the federal government and NAPTIP management for rescuing their children and promised to take adequate care of them.
pcm: Di parents dem don laud di federal goment and NAPTIP management for rescuing dia children and don promise to take proper care of dem.

eng: Governors elected on the platform of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) have warned the Economic and Financial Crime Commission (EFCC) against witch-hunting its party officials.
pcm: Governors dem wey dem elect on di platform of di pipos Democratic parti (PDP) don warn di Economic and Financial Crime Commission (EFCC) make dem no dey witch-hunt im parti officials dem.

eng: The governors were responding to the invitation of three officials of the party by the antigraft agency over alleged misappropriation of N10 billion, which the Secondus-led National Working Committee (NWC) had already denied.
pcm: Di governors dem don dey respond to di invitation of three officials of di parti by di antigraft agency ova alleged misappropriation of N10 billion, which the Secondus-led National Working Committee (NWC) wey dem don already deny.

eng: The forum, in a statement by its Director-General, Hon CID Maduabum, said the invitation of the officials overa spurious petition by a disgruntled former member of PDP raised questions on the seriousness and impartiality of the anti-graft agency to do its work.
pcm: di forum, for di statement by im Director-General, Hon CID Maduabum, tok say di invitation of di officials ova a spurious petition by a disgruntled former member of PDP don raise quesion on di seriousness and impartiality of di anti-graft agency to do im work.

eng: The statement read: While PDP as a political party is accountable to its members and the general public for its actions, we are, however, concerned that the old tactics of using the EFCC to silence political opposition is creeping into our polity once again.
pcm: Di statement tok: While PDP as a political parti dey accountable to im members dem and di general public for im actions, we dey, howeva, concerned dat di old tactics of using di EFCC to dey silence political opposition don dey entre into our polity again.

eng: We had expected that the EFCC under new leadership will learn from the mistakes of its predecessors.
pcm: we think say di EFCC wey dey di new leadership go learn from di mistake of pipo wey dey before am.

eng: It is a misplaced priority for EFCC to abandon revelations of monumental fraud by various officials and agencies of the Federal Government to pursue the PDP which is the main opposition party doing a yeoman's job of preventing the descent into chaos and anarchy in Nigeria.
pcm: Nah misplaced priority e be for EFCC to dey abandon revelations of big big fraud wey many officials and agencies of di Federal goment dey do  to pursue di PDP wey be di main opposition parti doing a yeoman's job to dey prevent di descent into chaos and anarchy for inside Nigeria.

eng: Perhaps certain interests in government are worried about the increasingly assertive role the PDP is playing in calling out corruption in government and wants to weaken and silence it.
pcm: Maybe some interests inside goment dey worried about di increasingly assertive role di PDP dey play in calling out corruption inside goment and wan to weaken and silence am.

eng: Even the petition in question did not make a single allegation of misuse of government funds, or cheating of any individual or public authority by the PDP.
pcm: Even di message wey dem dey tok about no make any allegation of misuse of goment funds, or cheating of any persin or public authority by di PDP.

eng: It is surprising that EFCC wants to use its scarce human and other resources to begin investigation into PDP finances.
pcm: E dey surprising dat EFCC wan use im scarce human and oda resources to begin investigation into PDP finances.

eng: If EFCC are even-handed and they are non-partisan, they ought to conduct investigation into other political parties including APC, the ruling party
pcm: If EFCC dey even-handed and dey non-partisan, e suppose conduct investigation into oda political parties including APC, wey be  di ruling party.

eng: PDP is up to date in making financial returns as required by the Constitution to INEC
pcm: PDP dey up to date for making financial returns as di required by the Constitution to INEC

eng: and we are not aware that INEC made any complaints to EFCC on PDP's returns.
pcm: We no know say INEC don make complaints to EFCC on PDP's return.

eng: We face existential threats as a nation and PDP shouldn't be distracted from its main role as a political watchdog on behalf of Nigerians.
pcm: We dey face existential threats as a nation and PDP suppose remain focus on im role as a watchdog on behave of Nigerians.

eng: The Senator representing Kaduna Central, Uba Sani, has lamented that children are the hardest hit of the countrys recurring economic and security challenges.
pcm: Di Senator wey dey represent Kaduna Central, Uba Sani, don lament say children be di one wey dem dey suffer most for di kontiri recurring economic and security wahala dem.

eng: In a Children's Day message, Sani noted that children have been subjected to unbelievable deprivations due to the insecurity bedeviling many communities.
pcm: For di children's day message,  Sani note say children don dey face di deprivation bikos of di insecurity wey dey many kontiri.

eng: Some of them are stuck in Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) Camps.
pcm: some of dem don dey stuck for inside Internally Displaced Persins (IDPs) camps.

eng: Their education has suffered.
pcm: dia education don suffer

eng: Most of them have little or no access to healthcare.
pcm: plenty of dem no get access to healthcare.

eng: There is no recreation for them.
pcm: Dem no get any recreation for dem

eng: The girls are sometimes subjected to abuses.
pcm: Dem dey abuse some of di girls.

eng: They live in fear of the unknown.
pcm: Dem dey live inside di fear of di unknown.

eng: Let us therefore reflect on our childrens loss of innocence and our duties and obligations as leaders and as a people.
pcm: Make we dey reflect on top our children loss of dia innocence and our duties dem and obligation wey we don lose as leaders and pipo.

eng: Most of them died due to lack of health care.
pcm: plenty of dem die bikos say dem no get health care

eng: The economic impact of COVID-19 on their parents affected children in a very negative way.
pcm: Di economic impact of COVID-19 on dia parent dey affect di children in a nagative way.

eng: Quality of their feeding dropped and some of them were withdrawn from schools, he said.
pcm: Di quality of food wey dem dey chop don reduce to and some of dem no fit go school again, nah wetin im tok be dat.

eng: The lawmaker therefore called for effective implementation of policies and programmes aimed at providing quality education and healthcare to children.
pcm: Di lawmaker don call for effective implementation of policies and programmes wey go aim at providing betta education and betta health care for di children

eng: Investment in our children is investment in the future of our country.
pcm: Di investment wey put for our children nah di investment wey we put for di future of our kontiri.

eng: We must not fail in this regard, he added.
pcm: Im add say, make we no fail for dis regards.

eng: What fuels an insurgency?
pcm: Wetin dey fuel insurgency?

eng: If a clump of uninformed people has an ideology they can die for, they will do the illogical for it.
pcm: Wen a group of pipo wey no dey informed get an idealogy wey dey fit die for, dem go do di illogical for am.

eng: The intercourse of ideology and ignorance does not follow logic.
pcm: Di kind intercourse wey dey between ideology and ignorance no dey follow logic.

eng: (murder) is considered the most deadly sin in Igbo land.
pcm: Dem consider murder as di sin wey dealy pass for Igbo land.

eng: Cultists and street lords have assumed control of interest areas in the region.
pcm: In fact, for di old days if dem committe murder, di community go proceed on many days of cleansing of di land and atonement for di crime.

eng: But what changed?
pcm: Wetin change now?

eng: It is also popularly assumed that the Igbo are natively non-belligerent and that they cannot in any circumstances resort to taking innocent lives violently.
pcm: plenty pipo don assume dat di Igbo are natively no dey violence and dat dey cannot in any circumstances dey take innocent lives violently.

eng: Really, the Igbo are a peaceful people, but recent events in the south-east have cast a doubt on this assumption.
pcm: Di Igbo pipo dey very peaceful, but wetin dey apun recently inside South-east don make us to dey doubt di assumption

eng: All the regions in the country are marginalised as regards the equitable distribution of resources to the people.
pcm: All di regions inside di kontiri don dey marginalise as regards say di equitable distribution of resources to di pipo.

eng: To put it clearly, every region is marginalised.
pcm: To dey clear, nah evri region don dey marginalise

eng: But a more factual statement will be all Nigerians at the bottom rung of the social ladder are marginalised.
pcm: Di statement wey dey more factual go be all Nigerians wey dey di bottom rung of di social ladder dey marginalise.

eng: Nigerians are victims of the carnivory of the elite.
pcm: Nah Nigerians be victims of di carnivory of di elite.

eng: It does not matter whether they come from the north or the south.
pcm: E no mata say dem com from di North or di south.

eng: We are all victims of elite conspiracy regardless of where we come from.
pcm: Nah all of us be victims of elite conspiracy e no mata wia we kom from.

eng: It is agonising that the scions of the south-east are turning their region into Aleppo in Syria.
pcm: E dey so agonising say di scion of di south-east don dey turn dia region into Aleppo inside Syria.

eng: Who brings violence and war to his own home?
pcm: Nah who bring war and violence into im own home?

eng: As of 2019, the south-east was reputed to be the safest region in Nigeria.
pcm: As of 2019, di south-east dey reputed say e dey very safe pass any oda region for inside Nigeria.

eng: It was also buoyant and fared well on the development index.
pcm: E dey very buoyant and dey well fared on top di development inside index.

eng: All of that is tumbling down.
pcm: All of dat don dey tremble down.

eng: The killing of police officers some of them Igbo the targeting of northern residents; the destruction of property and arsoning of police stations are tragedies that should have never been allowed to happen.
pcm: Di kilin of police officers some of dem Igbo di targeting of northern residents; di destruction of property and arsoning of police stations dem be di tragedies wey no suppose apun.

eng: This cancer was fed and allowed to metastasise.
pcm: Dem dey fed di cancer and dem allow am spread throughout di bodi.

eng: The Igbo nourished this beast that is now gnawing at their groin.
pcm: Di Igbo dem nourish dis beast wey dey gnawing at dia groin.

eng: When the serial murder of police officers began, some applauded the effort of their killers on the inscrutable assumption that the police are in cahoots with criminals to destroy Igbo land.
pcm: Wen dem start di serial murder of police officers, some clap for di effort of dia kilers on di inscrutable assumption say di police dey inside cahoots wit criminals to destroy Igbo land.

eng: Now, the destruction of the region is not by the hands of some herdsmen or bandits, but by the might of the sons of the land.
pcm: Now, di destruction of di region no dey for di hands of some herdsmen or bandits, but for di might of di sons of di land.

eng: How is irony defined?
pcm: How you wan take define irony?

eng: Igbo citizens who hold contrary opinions to the group sentiments are threatened with violence.
pcm: Dem dey threaten di Igbo pipo wey get different opinions to di group sentiments wit violence.

eng: The Igbo have never been known to be herded or conscripted into a tyranny of opinions and actions.
pcm: Dem no know di Igbo to get strong head or conscripted into tyranny of opinions and actions

eng: The Igbo are known to be republican; open to robust arguments and subjecting every thought to scrutiny.
pcm: Dem know Igbo to be republican; dem dey open to robust arguments and dem dey subject evri thought to scrutiny.

eng: But what changed?
pcm: Wetin com change?

eng: The killing of police officers in the south-east has been unmitigated and security agencies appear to have left the people to their own fate.
pcm: He be like say di kilin of police officers inside di south-east bin don dey unmitigated and security agencies don appear to don leave di pipo to dia own fate.

eng: Armed robberies have returned at scale.
pcm: Armed robber dem don return at scale.

eng: There are lamentations everywhere.
pcm: Nah dis be pipo lamentation evriwia.

eng: A lady shared an experience of how a mechanic she paid upfront to fix her car in Anambra absconded with the money and automobile, and even threatened her while bragging,there is no more police in the south-east.
pcm: A lady wey share her experience of how a mechanic wey she pay upfront to fix her car inside  Anambra runaway wit di moni and automobile, and even threatened her while im dey brag, police no dey inside di south-east again.

eng: Cultists and street lords have assumed control of interest areas in the region.
pcm: Jaguda don take control of interest areas inside di region.

eng: There is fear and chaos everywhere.
pcm: Fear and wahala dey evriwia.

eng: Life has become nasty, brutish and short in a once peaceful region.
pcm: Life don bikom nasty, brutish and short inside a region wey dey peaceful before.

eng: As a matter of fact, we are on a familiar path albeit a treacherous one.
pcm: As a mata of fact, we dey on a familiar path albeit dey dangerous

eng: The signs are ominous.
pcm: Di signs dey very tragic

eng: A Nigerian born in 2000 can tell how Boko Haram started in the north-east.
pcm: Pikin wey dem born for Nigeria in 2000 fit tell how Boko Haram take start inside North-east.

eng: Security agents and formations are often the first to be targeted by militant groups.
pcm: Di militant groups dey ourys target di security agents and formations eviritime.

eng: When they are taken out, the people become defenceless and a new order of violence by armed gangs reigns.
pcm: Wen dey take dem out, di pipo no go fit defence demselves and di armed gangs go start a new order of violence.

eng: Security operatives are being killed and security facilities destroyed in the south-east now.
pcm: Dem don kill securities and dem destroy security facilities in di South-east now

eng: After the security scaffold is decimated, innocent residents and even those gloating over the revelry of blood may become the next victims.
pcm: Afta di security scaffold don dey decimated, innocent pipo wey dey live di area and even those wey dey satisfied ova di revelry of blood fit bikom di next victims.

eng: Already, there are displaced persons living in IDP camps in parts of Ebonyi state displaced as a result of internecine clashes among communities.
pcm: Dem be displaced persins wey dey live inside IDP camps for inside part of Eboyi state displace, dis apun as a result of interncine clashes among communities.

eng: And with the prevailing savagery by the secessionist group, there is bound to be more refugee problems in the south-east if the attacks persist.
pcm: Wit di kin prevailing savagery wey di secessionist group, there go be more refugee problem inside south-east if dem continue wit di attack.

eng: Where does that leave a people whose preoccupation is buying and selling?
pcm: wia dey wan put pipo wey be say wetin dem dey do nah buying and selling?

eng: We cannot end this barbarity if we do not agree.
pcm: we no fit end dis barbarity if we no agree

eng: If some choose to keep native sympathies for those taking innocent lives, how then can the bloodletting stop?
pcm: If some pipo choose to keep native sympathies for pipo wey dey take innocent lives, how go fit stop di bloodletting stop?

eng: It is all in our hands.
pcm: E dey for our hand.

eng: Marwa meets IGP, says Buhari demanded mopping up of illicit drugs
pcm: Marwa don meet wit IGP, tok say Buhari don demand mopping up of dugs wey no dey legal.

eng: President Muhammadu Buhari has ordered the National Drug Law  Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) to mop up all illicit drugs and substances in the country to make Nigeria a drug-safe haven.
pcm: President Muhammadu Buhari dan order di National Drug Law  Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) make dem mop up all drugs wey no dey legal and substances inside di kontiri make Nigeria bikom a drug-safe haven.

eng: Mohammed Buba Marwa (Retd) said on Wednesday in Abuja when he hosted the acting Inspector General of Police, Alkali Baba Usman.
pcm: Mohammed Buba Marwa (Retd) tok for Wednesday inside Abuja wen im host di acting Inspector General of Police, Alkali Baba Usman.

eng: This is as he urged the police to hand over confiscated drugs and suspects arrested in connection with drug trafficking to the NDLEA for prosecution as it does not fall within Police jurisdiction.
pcm: dis dey as im urge di police to hand over drugs wey dey no dey  legal and make dem arrest suspects wey dey in connection wit drug trafficking to di NDLEA for prosecution as e no fall under Police jurisdiction.

eng: He also said that within three months, the agency seized over two million kgs of assorted drugs valued at N80bn.
pcm: Im also tok say dat within three months, di agency don seize ova two million kgs of assorted drugs wey be say the value at N80bn.

eng: According to him, the agency had arrested 2,100 criminals associated with the illicit trade and have secured over 350 convictions so far.
pcm: According to wetin im tok, di agency don arrest 2,100 criminals wey dey associated wit di illicit trade and dem don secure ova 350 convictions so far.

eng: So far, we know that about 15 million Nigerians use drug, it is a very high number and working on the mandate given to us by the President to mop up all illicit substances and make Nigeria a drug-safe haven, the NDLEA has remained upstanding by radiating up our activities.
pcm: So far, we know say about 15 million Nigerians dey use drug, number dey very high and we dey work on di mandate wey di President give us to mop up all illicit substances and make Nigeria bikom a drug-safe haven, di NDLEA don remain upstanding by radiating up our activities.

eng: Within three months, we have been able to seize over 2 million kilogrammes  of assorted drugs.
pcm: within three months, we don seize ova 2 million kilogrammes of assorted drugs.

eng: We have seized these drugs to the value of N80bn, we have arrested 2,100 criminals associated with this illicit trade and have secured over 350 convictions so far.
pcm: We don seized dis drugs to di value of N80bn, we do arrest 2,100 criminals wey dey associated wit dis illicit trade and we don secure ova 350 convictions so far.

eng: We are still counting by the grace of God.
pcm: We stil dey count by di grace of God

eng: Some of our police officers get involved in seizures of drugs which is quite okay.
pcm: Some of our officers dem dey involve in seizures of drugs wich dey okay.

eng: But they should hand over to NDLEA after that.
pcm: But dem suppose hand over to NDLEA afta dat.

eng: A few actually proceed with prosecuting those cases, they ought not since it is NDLEA's charge, Marwa said.
pcm: Marwa tok say nah very few pipo proceed wit prosecuting those cases, dem no suppose do am since nah NDLEA dey in charge.

eng: While seeking the collaboration of the police in the next phase of flushing out drug barons, he expressed optimism that more of these barons are going to come into the agency's net.
pcm: While dem dey seek make dem join bodi wit di police for di next phase of flushing out drug barons, im express optimism say more of dis barons dem go kom into di agency net.

eng: We believe the NPF will support us with intelligence tracking, these are probabilities that the NPF has.
pcm: We belive say di NPF go support us wit intelligence tracking, e dey possible say di NPF don alredy do am.

eng: We will ask for slots in the Police institutes so that we will be beneficiaries.
pcm: We ask for slot for inside police institutes so we fit bikom beneficiaries.

eng: We should appoint liaison officers between us to ensure definite contact.
pcm: We go appoint liaison officer between us so we go fit ensure  definite contact.

eng: We need renewed collaboration between us because the use of drugs is now confirmed as a major precursor to criminal activities in Nigeria.
pcm: We need to dey renew di join bodi wey dey between us bikos di use of drugs don dey confirmed as a major precursor to criminal activities  wey dey inside Nigerial.

eng: This is really the time for more collaboration,â€ Marwa said.
pcm: Marwa tok say nah dis time dem suppose join bodi more.

eng: Speaking earlier, the acting IGP recalled that he was Borno State Police Public Relations Officer at the time
pcm: As im dey speak ealier, IGP recall say im bin Borno State Police Public Relation Officer for dat time.

eng: Marwa was Military Administrator.
pcm: Nah Marwa be di Military Administrator.

eng: Experience is the best teacher, you have been in the business of crime prevention and control.
pcm: Experience nah im be di best teacher, you don dey for dis business of crime prevention and control.

eng: We are here to declare to you my unalloyed cooperation and collaboration.
pcm: We dey here to declare to you my unalloyed cooperation.

eng: We are going to collaborate and synergize with the agency in order to police this country.
pcm: We go join bodi and synergize wit di angency so we go fit police dis kontiri.

eng: Behind every crime, there is always the issue of drugs.
pcm: For evri crime, we dey always get issue of drug.

eng: If we synergize, cooperate and collaborate, it would be very beneficial to Nigerians and law enforcement as a whole, Usman said.
pcm: Usman tok say if we fit synergize, cooperate and join, e go dey very beneficial to Nigerians and law enforcement as a whole.

eng: My victory ended godfatherism in Edo Obaseki
pcm: Obaseki tok say, nah my victory end godfatherism for inside Edo.

eng: Edo State Governor Godwin Obaseki has said his victory at the Supreme Court signals an end to godfatherism in the state.
pcm: Edo State Governor Godwin Obaseki tok say nah im victory at di Supreme Court signals an end to godfatherism inside di state.

eng: The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed the certificate forgery suit filed against Obaseki by the APC, thereby affirming his victory in the September 19, 2020 governorship election in the state.
pcm: Di Supreme Court on Friday cancel di certificate forgery suit wey APC filed against Obaseki, dis make dem affirm im victory in di September 19, 2020 governorship election in di state.

eng: Addressing party supporters at the Benin airport yesterday, Obaseki said his victory also meant freedom for Edo people.
pcm: As im dey address parti supporters dem at di Benin airport yesterday, Obaseki tok say im victory also dey for freedom for Edo pipo.

eng: For us in Edo, this victory means freedom and emancipation; it means that we must rededicate ourselves to our people because democracy is all about the people.
pcm: For us wey dey inside Edo, dis victory means freedom and emancipation; e means say we must rededicate ourselves to our pipo bikos democracy dey all about di pipo.

eng: Democracy is not about an individual or godfather.
pcm: Democracy no dey for individual or godfather.

eng: We have defeated the godfather finally in Edo, in our quest to take Edo to where it should be,he said.
pcm: We don already defeat di godfather finally for inside Edo, so we fit  to take Edo to wia e should be, im tok.

eng: According to him, they have gone through many hurdles in the last two or three years in the effort to reposition the politics of the state.
pcm: Im  believe say, dey don go through plenty hurdles in di last two or three years in di effort to reposition di politics of di state.

eng: On the congratulatory messages by the candidate of the APC, Osagie Ize-Iyamu and a former national chairman of the party, Adams Oshiomhole to him, Obaseki said he was yet to receive original copies of the letters signed by the duo.
pcm: Inside di congratulatory messages by di candidate of di APC, Osagie Ize-Iyamu and a former national chairman of the parti, Adams Oshiomhole to im, Obaseki tok say im neva receive original copies of di letterswey di duo sign.

eng: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) on Saturday said it will convert the 3,148 Voting Points (VPs) in Kano State to full-fledged Polling Units (PUs).
pcm: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) for Saturday tok say e wan convert di 3,148 Voting Points (VPs) for inside Kano State to full-fledged Polling Units (PUs).

eng: He said the decision was to help decongest PUs and to give voters a healthy environment to exercise their civic responsibilities during elections.
pcm: Im talk say di decision nah to help decongest Pus and to give dem volters a healthy environment wey dey fit exercise dia civic responsibilities durring election

eng: Prof Shehu said, There are over five million registered voters in Kano State, with 8,074 PUs and 3,148 VPs.
pcm: Prof Shehu tok say, There bin ova five million registered voters for inside Kano State, with 8,074 PUs and 3,148 VPs.

eng: If approved, Kano will now have a total of 11,222 PUs.
pcm: if dem approve am, Kano go have a total number 11,222 pus.

eng: INEC has created Voting Points, Baby Polling Units and Voting Polling Settlements in PUs with more than 500 voters, but that has still not solved the hardships voters face on election days, he said.
pcm: im tok say, INEC don create points wia pipo fit Vote, Baby Polling Units and Voting Polling Settlements inside PUs wit voters wey pass 500, but e still neva solve di hardships  wey voters dey face for election days.

eng: The INEC REC said all the new PUs would be stationed in public places, adding that none will be situated in individual residences, palaces, houses of politicians or places of worship.
pcm: Di INEC REC tok say all di new PUs go dey stationed inside di public places, dem don add dat no one go dey situated for  individual residences, palaces, houses of politicians or places of worship.

eng: Okoye said, The last time INEC created new PUs was in 1996 when we had only 50 million registered voters.
pcm: Okoye tok say, di last time INEC created new Pus nah for 1996 wen we get only 50 million voters wey dey registered

eng: But, as of 2019, the number has exponentially grown to over 84 million.
pcm: But for 2019, di number don increase to ova 84 million.

eng: He, however, clarified that the exercise is not in any way going to add any number to registered voters in each state.
pcm: Im clare am say di exercise no go fit add to number of voters wey dey registered.

eng: The INEC Commissioner also said, with the Continuous Voter Registration Exercise slated to resume on June 28, the commission had introduced an innovation where voters who are technology-savvy could begin their registration online, then proceed to their respective registration areas to have their biometrics and pictures captured.
pcm: Di INEC Commissioner also don tok, wit di Continuous Voter Registration Exercise wey go begin for June 28, di commission don introduce innovation wey be say voters who be technology guru go fit do dia registration online, com go to dia respective registration areas to do dia biometrics and pictures captured.

eng: This, according to him, is to further decongest the centres as well as make the process easier.
pcm: Im believe say dis go reduce di kin crowd wey go dey di  centres, e go also make di process dey easy.

eng: Daily Trust reports that the meeting had in attendance representatives of political parties in the state, heads of all security agencies in the state, traditional and religious leaders and non-governmental organisations.
pcm: Daily Trust don report say di meeting wey dem do in attendance representatives of political parties inside di state, heads of all security agencies inside di state, traditional and religious leaders and non-gomental organisations.

eng: As part of the processes of nomination of the All Progressives Congress (APC) candidates for the forthcoming Federal Capital Territory (FCT)
pcm: As part of di processes of nomination of di All Progressives Congress (APC) candidates wey go dey for di forthcoming Federal Capital Territory (FCT)

eng: Minister of sports, Sunday Dare, has been honoured by the Association of National Olympics Committees of Africa with the Highest Order of Sports Administrator Award.
pcm: Minister of sports, Sunday Dare, don dey honour by di Association of National Olympics Committees of Africa wit di Highest Order of Sports Administrator ourrd.

eng: ANOCA president, Mr. Mustapha Berraf who conferred the award on him yesterday in Abuja said it is for the Ministers immense contributions to the growth of the Olympics Movement and sports in Africa.
pcm: ANOCA President, Mr. Mustapha Berraf wey carry di ourrd give im yesterday inside Abuja tok say nah for di Ministers immense contributions to di growth of di Olympics Movement and sports inside Africa.

eng: He said ANOCA is happy with the role you played in ensuring the completion of our headquarters in Abuja.
pcm: Im tok say ANOCA dey hapi wit di role you played in ensuring the completion of our headquarters in Abuja.

eng: We are very proud of all that you have done for sports Development in Nigeria and Africa.
pcm: We dey very proud for wetin you don do for sport Development inside Nigeria and Africa.

eng: We, hereby, present this award to you for your great work and contributions to sports Development.
pcm: We present dis ourrd to you for di great work wey you don do and di contributions you don put for di sport Development.

eng: We are very proud of you and look forward to an enduring relationship for the future of our sports
pcm: We dey very proud of you and dey look forward to an enduring relationship for our sports wetin you don do for sports

eng: Responding, Dare said Thanks for this honour and award which is quite special.
pcm: Dare say thanks for dis honour and ourrd wich dey special.

eng: Some leaders of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) say the President Muhammadu Buhari-led government has recorded more achievements within six years than the previous governments under the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) between 1999 and 2015.
pcm: Some leaders of di ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) tok say di President Muhammadu Buhari-led goment don record plenty achievements for inside six years dan di goment wey don dey before under di pipos Democratic parti (PDP) between 1999 and 2015.

eng: This is contained in a statement signed by a former National Publicity Secretary of the APC, Mr. Lanre Issa-Onilu, who is the current Chairman of the Progressive Governors Forum (PGF), Salihu Mohammed Lukman; the Senior Special Assistant on National Social Investment Programme to President Buhari, Barr.
pcm: Dis dey contain inside a statement wey di former National Publicity Secretary of the APC, Mr. Lanre Issa-Onilu sign, wey be di current Chairman of di Progressive Governors Forum (PGF), Salihu Mohammed Lukman; di Senior Special Assistant wey dey for National Social Investment Programme to President Buhari, Barr.

eng: Political parties worry over rising insecurity
pcm: Political parti dem dey worry ova di wahala of insecurity

eng: The United Political Parties for Good Governance (UPPG), an umbrella organisation of some registered political parties in Nigeria has expressed worry over the spate of insecurity across the country as the 2023 elections approach.
pcm: Di United Political Parties for Good Governance (UPPG), an umbrella organisation of some political parties wey don dey registered inside Nigeria don express worry ova di spate of insecurity across di kontiri as di 2023 elections approach.

eng: According to the group, the worsening insecurity situation raised concerns and doubt in the minds of many about the future unity and survival of a corporate Nigeria.
