pcm: We go use kpako or cardboard do bats wey we go use play di game.

eng: Balls were always available for us to play.
pcm: Ball dey always dey wey we go paly.

eng: I think that is where I derived my inspiration for the game of table tennis.
pcm: I dey think maybe na where I see ginger to take play tennis

eng: I had the opportunity to play golf but I think it is for rich people.
pcm: I get chance to play golf.
but e be like say na for rich pipo.

eng: So I settled for table tennis due to its simplicity and effectiveness in terms of exercise.
pcm: So I face table tennis bicos say e dey simple and e good for exercise.

eng: Table tennis is one of the safest games one can play.
pcm: Table tennis na one of di game wey dey safe pass wey pesin fit play.

eng: Would you say enough effort is being made by the appropriate authorities to develop the game of table tennis in Nigeria?
pcm: Shey you go tok say dem dey try to dey develop di game of table tennis for Naija?

eng: I am not a fan of Big Brother Nigeria, BBN, but I can see that in their last edition, they promoted table tennis.
pcm: I no too like Big Broad Naija, BBN, but I see say dem dey promote table tennis for do last one wey dem do.

eng: Anytime they were free they played table tennis.
pcm: Any time wey dem dey free na table tennis dem dey play.

eng: It is wrong for the ministry of sports at both the federal and state level to concentrate only on football.
pcm: E dey wrong for ministry for sport for di state and di federal level to put eye for only football.

eng: I think it is wrong because it is not everybody who can play at the highest level.
pcm: I think say e dey wrong bicos say no be evri bodi fit play for di high level.

eng: But table tennis can keep so many people engaged.
pcm: But table tennis fit make plenti pipo dey busy.

eng: Paying too much attention to football is wrong but it has become a tradition.
pcm: To too dey put eye for football wrong but e don be normal tin.

eng: And where we copied football from, there is so much pool betting in Europe, especially in the UK.
pcm: And di place wey we from copy football, dem too dey bet for Europe, especially for UK.

eng: There is so much betting around the game that is why it is so popular.
pcm: Betting dey too much for di game and na why evri bodi sabi am.

eng: Here in Nigeria, we are so blessed with talented youths in table tennis
pcm: Here for Naija, we dey bless witi youth dem wey sabi table tennis well well.

eng: so we should be able to domesticate it.
pcm: So make we try dey do am for our house.

eng: It is easy to start.
pcm: E dey easi to begin.

eng: And we can engage so many people at any time.
pcm: And we fit put plenti pipo for dia for any time.

eng: This is my appeal.
pcm: Na wetin I dey beg for be dis.

eng: Would you say there are enough tournaments to keep the players busy?
pcm: Shey you go tok say tournament dey plenti to make di player dem dey dey busy?

eng: We should pay more attention to hosting more competitions at regular intervals.
pcm: Make we put eye for how to dey host competition evri time

eng: It doesnt have to be so big like bringing together all the states like Aso Table Tennis Club is doing.
pcm: E no must to dey big but make we dey carry all di state come like wetin Aso Tennis Club dey do.

eng: It can be local but let it be a constant thing like every month or every two months, there is a competition.
pcm: E fit be local but make we dey do am like that for evri month abi evri two month, competition go dey.

eng: Among other benefits, this will help keep the kids away from social vices.
pcm: Inside other benefit, dis one go help comot di eyes of dem pikin for things wey no good

eng: How much is Aso Table Tennis club contributing to the growth of the sport in the FCT?
pcm: Na how much di Aso Tennis Club dey contribute give say make sport grow for FCT?

eng: Before we involved other states, this competition was exclusively for the FCT.
pcm: Before we kari dioda states join, dis competition dey only for FCT.

eng: After some time, we began to involve neighbouring states.
pcm: Afta time don pass small, we start to dey call di states wey dey near us put.

eng: At the moment, what we do is to get a coach in the FCT to go round the secondary school to publicise this competition.
pcm: For did time, wetin we go do be say we go find one coach for FCT wey go dey go all di secondary school to tell dem about di competition.

eng: Ajoke Ojomo and three of her mates graduated from a secondary school here in the FCT.
pcm: Ajoke Ojo and three pipo wey be her mate gada finish from one secondary school here for FCT

eng: They were discovered through this tournament.
pcm: Na witi dis tournament we dem sabi dem.

eng: So the Aso table tennis championship is for the FCT and Abuja people should take full advantage of it.
pcm: So di Aso table tennis championship na for di FCT, make di pipo wey dey Abuja use am well.

eng: The tournament is not going to leave Abuja.
pcm: Di tournament no go comot for Abuja.

eng: Are there any concrete plans to ensure that this tournament is held annually?
pcm: Any plan dey wey go make am dey sure say dis tournament go be evri year?

eng: What I know for sure is that it will continue to hold because we are getting more and more people who are interested and have the means to support us.
pcm: Wetin I sabi be say e go dey continue bicos say we don dey see plenti pipo wey don like am and get power to support us.

eng: They are willing to give.
pcm: Dem dey readi to give.

eng: It may also interest you to know that what we use in hosting this competition, big as it may sound, is not so much.
pcm: E go do you for bodi say to sabi say  wetin we dey use do dis competition, as e be like say e big, no reach any tin.

eng: Our budget is below N5m.
pcm: Our budget no reach N5m.

eng: And I am sure one year is enough to raise N5m.
pcm: And I dey sure say one year reach to garther N5m.

eng: So there is every assurance that the Aso table tennis championship will continue to hold every year.
pcm: So e dey sure say di Aso table tennis championship go dey hapun for evri year.

eng: At the moment, how many corporate organisations are sponsoring Aso table tennis tournament?
pcm: As e dey so, na how many company dey put money down for di Aso table tennis tournament?

eng: For the 2021 edition, we got a big sponsor but we are not mentioning his name.
pcm: For di 2021 own, we get one big sponsor but we no go tok him name.

eng: Hopefully, we would get more sponsors so that we wouldnt have to worry when the competition is near.
pcm: We dey hope say we go see plenti pipo wey go support us make we no go dey worry if di time don dey reach.

eng: We are also hoping that if the economy improves, we would bring on board more corporate sponsors.
pcm: We dey also hope say if di economy dey beta, we go kari plenti company come make dem sponsor us join.

eng: Three years ago, we were hopeful but the economy has been bad so anywhere we go, they say
pcm: For three years ago, we dey get hope but di economy dey too bad so if we go any wia dem go say.

eng: well you know what is happening.
pcm: You sabi wetin dey hapun.

eng: However, we hope to get corporate sponsorship that will be constant.
pcm: But we still dey hope say we go get company wey go dey dey with us.

eng: How much support is Aso table tennis and the game in general enjoying from the FCT Sports Council?
pcm: Na how much help FCT and di sport Kansu dey give table tennis and all di game?

eng: I think they can do a little better because the players that went to the recently concluded National Sports Festival in Benin City didnt have enough support from the FCT Sports Council.
pcm: I think say dem fit do beta bicos say all di player dem dey go luk National Festival wey just finish for Benin City no see help kolet like dat from FCT Sports Council.

eng: I think we can do better.
pcm: I think say we fit do pass di one wey we don do.

eng: There are so many talented players in the FCT waiting to be discovered and nurtured.
pcm: E get plenti player wey get talent for FCT wey dem dey wait to discover dem and train dem.

eng: Police arrest 4 over murder of groom-to-be in Kwara
pcm: Police don arrest 4 pipo say dem kill one man wey be wan do wedding for Kwara.

eng: Police in Kwara have arrested four people suspected to be involved in the killing of Olokose Ojo, a staff of University of Ilorin Teaching Hospital, six days before his wedding.
pcm: Police for Kwara don arrest four pipo wey dem think say dem kill Olokose Ojo, pesin wey dey work for di University of Ilorin Teaching Hospital, six days before him wedding.

eng: Ojo, in his early 30s, worked in the National Health Insurance Scheme unit of the hospital.
pcm: Ojo wey just be 30 years plus, dey work for di National Health Insurance Scheme unit for di hospital.

eng: It is believed the attack was orchestrated by the kingpin of the gang and the deceased next-door neighbour named as Kazeem Mohammed who lured him to a bush in Patigi on the guise of helping him purchase three cattle to be used for the event at the rate of N350,000.
pcm: Dem tok say na di pesin nebo wey dey live beside him house kill am and na him be di oga for di pipo wey kill am, say, e take sence kari am enta one bush for Patigi say im wan help am buy three cow wey im go use for di wedding for N350,000.

eng: He was however murdered and his body dismembered by the gang after withdrawing over N1.2m from his account with his ATM and demanding N12 million ransom from his wife-to-be, Ilori Oluwakemi.
pcm: Dem kill am kon cut him body afta dem don collect money wey pass N1.2m for him account witi him ATM and dem dey ask for N12 million to free di man from di wife wey e wan marry Ilori Oluwakemi.

eng: His body was exhumed by the police and taken to the UITH mortuary for autopsy.
pcm: Di police don comot im body for ground and kari am go for UITH mortuary wia dem go test am.

eng: The police gave the names of the other three suspects as Mohammed Chatta, Jimoh Abdulateef and Madi Jeremiah all of whom are now in custody adding that they will be charged to court once judiciary workers call off their strike.
pcm: Di police don tok di name of di three pipo wey remain, Mohammed Chatta, Jimoh Abdulateef and Madi Jeremiah, and dem don dey police custody say dem go kari dem go court if di Judiciary pipo finish dia strike.

eng: Speaking on the development, Police PPRO, Ajayi Okasanmi, said the suspects confessed in their statements that the victim was lured into the remote part of Patigi where he was told the cattle he paid for were tethered but was shot on approaching the spot.
pcm: Di police PPRO, Ajayi Okasanmi, wen im bin dey tok about where mata reach, tok say di suspects don confess for dia statement say dem kari am go inside one bush for Patigi say na dia dem tie all di cow wey im don pay money for say dem con shoot am as e wan reach di place.

eng: The deceased was said to have been buried in a shallow grave inside the bush and his head and arm severed to be used for alleged money ritual.
pcm: Dem say dem bury di pesin wey dem kill for di grave wey no deep for inside di bush and dem don comot him head and arm for mini ritual.

eng: Food, beverage companies fast collapsing — TUC
pcm: Company wey dey do food and beverages don dey fall down quick quick, TUC.

eng: The Trade Union Congress (TUC) has decried the negative effects of federal government policies and the COVID-19 pandemic on the food, beverage and tobacco sector, saying the sector has suffered several factory closures and redundancies.
pcm: Di Trade Union Congress (TUC) don tok say how di government policy and Covid-19 take affect di food, beverage and tobacco sector for di country no good, di sector done suffer close close and bad market.

eng: TUC President, Quadri Olaleye, who doubles as the outgoing President of the Food Beverage and Tobacco Senior Staff Association (FOBTOB), stated this in Abuja during the 14th National Delegates Conference of the association.
pcm: Di presidio for TUC, Quadri Olaleye, who still be di Presido for di Food, Beverage and Tobacco Senior Staff Association (FOBTOB), na him tok am for Abuja for di 14th National Delegates Conference for di association.

eng: It is no news that the COVID-19 pandemic spotlighted the food, beverage and tobacco industry as an engine room for boosting the Gross Domestic Product (GDP).
pcm: Na evri bodi sabi say di COVID-19 put eye for di food, beverage and tobacco industry as na dem be di main tin wey dey make di Gross Domestic Product (GDP) dey rise.

eng: The hardworking members of the Association defied all odds to ensure that food items were made available to Nigerians during the lockdown.
pcm: Di pipo for di association wey dey work well well na dem make sure say food dey inside di time of lockdown.

eng: It was very unfortunate that despite the vantage position of this industry to our economical sustenance, it has not received 10 percent of the attention given to other sectors of the economy.
pcm: Na di bad tin be say as dis industry dey important for di economy, dem neva dey even give am 10 percent of di attention wey dem dey give oda sector for di economy.

eng: The production cost has gone up but nothing has been done in terms of financial support and tax relief by the government to cushion the effects of this.
pcm: Di moni wey dem dey take produce don cost but di government neva do any tin to take help dem witi money of to cut rice for tax.

eng: Rather, we are subjected to different bans ranging from accessibility of forex to import of raw materials to forced backward integration.
pcm: Instead na block dem block us witi  make we no fit buy any tin from anoda country and dem kon force us make we go back go dey buy dem for inside di country.

eng: We are not opposed to backward integration in any form but its implementation was ill-timed as it has led to massive redundancy in our industry, Olaleye said.
pcm: Olaleye tok say, no be say we no want to dey do togeda for di country, but di time wey dem tok am don make plenti industry no too get mouth again.

eng: He explained that companies under FOBTOB had sacked not less than 1,478 workers between 2015 and 2021, which had diminished Nigerias revenue.
pcm: He tok say all di company wey dey under FOBTOB don sack like 1,478 worker from 2015 reach 2021 say e don even make di revenue for Naija come down.

eng: He further said, It is our hope that the government would wake up from the snail speed approach to governance since governance is a serious business for serious-minded people.
pcm: He tok am again say na our hope make di government go wake up from how dem dey  waka  like snail come lead well as to lead well be for pipo wey dey serious.

eng: The government must urgently start addressing the issue of the growing unemployment rate, insecurity, and the general infrastructural decay in our nation.
pcm: Di government must start to dey face di problem wey dey make pipo dey get work for hand, sekuriti problem  and make dem settle evri tin wey don dey spoil for we country.

eng: Ekiti police nab 2 serial burglars
pcm: Ekiti Police don catch 2 big tif.

eng: The Ekiti State Police Command Rapid Response Squad (RRS) has arrested two persons, Abbar Wasiri and Aribisala Timileyin, for burglary along Adebayo area of the state capital.
pcm: Di Rapid Response Squad (RRS) for Etiki Police Command don arrest two pipo, Abbar Wasiri and Aribisala Timileyin, say dem go thief for Adebayo area wey dey di capital of di state.

eng: The suspects stole N210,000 and other valuables, when they burgled three different houses on Monday, at about 1:30 am.
pcm: Dem tif N210,000 and some plenti things wey dey valuable, as dem enta three house for Monday around dat kain 1:30am.

eng: The police said on May 9, 2021, at about 1:30pm, one Barrister Ayo Oguntuase, in Ado-Ekiti, came to the RRS office, Ado-Ekiti, and reported that some unknown persons burgled his office and two other houses at night in Adebayo Area, Ado-Ekiti, on May 8, and made away with N210,000 cash, two sets of computer system and many other items.
pcm: Di police tok say for May 9, 2021, around 1:30pm, one pesin wey be Barrister Ago Oguntuase for Ado-Ekiti, kom di RRS office wey dey Ado-Ekiti kom repot give dem  say some pipo wey im no sabi kon tif for im office and dem tif for two house join for dat night for Adebayo area for Ado Ekiti, for May 8 and dem carry N210,000, two computa and plenti tins go.

eng: The police command said upon the receipt of the information, the RRS operatives immediately moved into action and arrested the two suspects based on intelligence gathered.
pcm: Dem Police  as dem hear di information, di RRS go arrest di two pipo wey dem dey think say na dem do am as per wetin dem don hear before.

eng: The Police Public Relations Officer (PPRO), ASP Sunday Abutu, said during interrogation, the two suspects confessed to the crime and led operatives to their houses where items such as 265 different types of children and adult clothes, 14 pairs of children and adult canvas shoes, two complete sets of computers, one ceiling fan, and two law report books belonging to different complainants were recovered.
pcm: Di PRO for Police (PPRO), ASP Sunday Abutu, wen dem dey follow am took, tok say di two pipo don gree say na dem do di tin and dem carry di police go dia house wey dem see 265 cloth wey be for pikin and adult dem, 14 canvas wey be for pikin and adult, two computa wey dey complete, one ceiling fan and two law report book wey be for different different complain pipo kolet back

eng: Abutu added that a further investigation revealed that one of the suspects, Abbar Wasiri, is one of the security guards employed to guard one of the places burgled.
pcm: Abutu still tok say as dem touch line di mata more more dem kom see say one of di pipo wey dem catch na be sekuriti wey dem kolet to dey guard wia  dem go thief.

eng: According to the PPRO, investigation is ongoing and when concluded, the suspects shall be charged to court.
pcm: As di PPRO don tok, dem still dey touch line di mata and wen dem do finish, dem go carry di pipo go court.

eng: Meanwhile, the Ekiti State Commissioner of Police, Mr. Tunde Mobayo, has called on everyone in the state to be security-conscious and promptly report any strange and suspicious persons found in their environs to the police.
pcm: Mellawella, Di Oga Commissioner for di Police for Ekiti State, Mr.Tunde Mobayo, don call evribodi for di state to dey sekuriti conscious and make dem dey tell di police if dem see pesin wey dem no sabi for dia area.

eng: Five matches that won Atletico Madrid La Liga title
pcm: Five match wey make Atletico Madrid win La Liga.

eng: Atletico Madrid won the La Liga for the second time in eight years on Sunday as a 2-1 victory over Real Valladolid crowned them Spanish champions.
pcm: Atletico Madrid don win di LA Liga for di second time for inside eight years on Sunday as dem win 2-1 over Real Valladolid wey make dem be di Champion for Spain.

eng: Here are five matches that secured Atletico the title: Atletico Madrid 1-0 Barcelona, November 21
pcm: Na di five match wey make Atletico be Chapoion for Spain be dis:Atletico Madrid 1- 0 Barcelona, for November 21

eng: Yannick Carrasco scored the winner as Atletico registered their first La Liga win over Barcelona in more than a decade and stretched their unbeaten run to 24 matches.
pcm: Na Yannick Carrasco score wey make Atletico win Barcelona for di first time for more dat ten years and push dia unbeaten enta 24 matches.

eng: It would be this result that eventually gave Atletico a better head-to-head record over Barca, who were left 10th in the table and without the injured Gerard Pique for three months.
pcm: E go be dis result wey give Atletico beta head to head record pass Barca, wey dey number 10 on top table without Gerard Pique wey don get injury for three months.

eng: The internet has brought about a fundamental shift in national economies that are isolated from each other by barriers to cross-border trade and investment, isolated by distance, time zone and languages and isolated by the national differences in government regulations.
pcm: Di internet don bring fundamental shift enter economy dem wey no near each oda bikos of brier enter ross-border trade and investment, wey distance far, time zone and language and wey national goment regulation different.

eng: E-commerce equally fosters direct access to distant markets and promotes globalisation and commercial activities and blur many of the current distinctions between domestic and foreign companies to an extent that it becomes practically impossible to determine the origin of the products.
pcm: E-commerce dey foster direct access to market wey no near and e dey promote globalisation and commercial activities plus e dey komot distinction between domestic and foreign companies to di extent wey e no go possible to know wia di product from kom.

eng: E-commerce is not limited to the purchase of a product, it includes e-mail, and other communications platforms, all information or services that a company may offer to customers over the net, from pre-purchase information to aftersale service and support.
pcm: E-commerce no dey limited to buying of product alone, e include e-mail, plus oda communication platform dem, all di informate or service wey company fit offer customer on top net, from pre-purchase information to aftasale service and support.

eng: The major significance of E-commerce thus lies in the fact that it encourages a single world trading system, which is facilitated by access through electronic means to goods and services from different parts of the world.
pcm: Di major significance wey e commerce get dey for di fact say e dey encourage system of tradin wey be single world, wey access through electronic means to take get good and services dem dey facilitate from different parts of di world.

eng: Most of the existing statues in Nigeria lag behind towards the development and growth of e-commerce in particular and ICT as a whole.
pcm: Most of di statue wey dey for ground for inside nigeria dey lag behind toward di development and growth of e-commerce in particular and di whole ICT.

eng: So many legal researches and studies on e-commerce in Nigeria have been conducted.
pcm: For Nigeria, plenty legal research and study don dey conducted.

eng: Most of these studies are of the opinion that the Nigerian legal system lags behind ICT-based legislation and that the existing statutory laws are quite inadequate to address some of the legal issues affecting e-commerce.
pcm: Plenty for inside di study dem carry opinion say di legal system for Nigeria ey lag behind for legislation wey involve ICT and say di statutory law dem wey don dey ground no dey adequate to take address some of di legal issue wey dey affect e-commerce.

eng: These issues include electronic evidence cybercrimes, security and data production, e-payment system and inevitably trans-border issues, and many more.
pcm: Dis issue dem include electronic evidence cybercrimes, security and data production, e-payment system and inevitably trans-border issues, plus plenty oda ones.

eng: There is, therefore, the need to map out appropriate legal and regulatory measures, to govern the emerging regime.
pcm: Therefore, need dey to bring out legal and regulatory measure wey dey proper, to take govern di regime wey just dey kom.

eng: It has been stated severally that in Nigeria, significant efforts at the regulation of e-commerce-related activities are still at the stage of Draft Bills before the National Assembly.
pcm: Dem don tok plenty times say for inside Nigeria, significant effort to take regulate e-commerce-related activity demstill dey di stage of Sraft Bill before di National Assembly.

eng: It is important to note that, even where these bills are passed into law, Nigeria may still face new legal issues in this area that will call for legislative intervention.
pcm: E dey important to know say, even wia dem pass dis bill into law, Nigeria fit still face new legal issue for dis area wey go call for legislative intervention.

eng: Given the speed with which the internet is permeating commercial transactions in Nigeria, especially in the banking and telecommunications sectors of the economy, the best that can be suggested is that the legal issues and problems presently confronting e-commerce in the country should be addressed directly and expeditiously, in the interests of the teeming population of Nigerian consumers.
pcm: Wit di speed wey di internet dey take work on top commercial transaction for Nigeria, especially for inside banking and communication sector of di economy, di best wey dem fit suggest be say di legal issues and problems dem wey dey confront e-commerce presently for di kontri should be addressed directly and espeditiously, for di interest of di teeming population of Nigeria customer dem.

eng: To achieve this, the National Assembly should be pressuriSed into passing bills concerning electronic commerce, a top priority so that they can be enacted into law as quickly as possible.
pcm: To achieve dis, make dem pressure di National Assembly to take pass bill concerning electronic commerce as top priority so dat dem go enact dem into law as quick as possible.

eng: In the interim, our courts should take a giant stride by interpreting the existing traditional laws liberally so as to bridge the gaps therein in order to make such laws amenable to electronic transactions, particularly in the emerging trend of the present-day information age.
pcm: For small time, make awa court take giant step to interprete di traditional law dem wey dey ground in a liberal way make dem take cut gap in order to make di laws dem get ammend to electronic transaction, particularly for di emerging trend of dis information age wey we dey.

eng: Indeed, it was argued that legislation is not the only means by which electronic transaction and attendant documentation may be facilitated legally.
pcm: Indeed, dem argue say legislation no be di only means wey electronic transaction and attendant documentation fit dey legal.

eng: The courts may also adapt to recognise electronic transactions in the absence of legislation or private contract.
pcm: Di court fit also adapt to recognise electronic transaction for di absence of legislation or private contract.

eng: As the then Justice Bingham once put it thus:  the common law has in the hands of judges the same facility [as the law merchant] for adapting itself to the changing needs of the general public; principles do not  alter, but old rules of applying the change, and new rules spring into existence.
pcm: As former Justice Bungham don tok am before: di common law dey di hand of judges di same kind facility [as law merchant dem] make e fit adapt to di need of di general public, principle no dey alter, but old rules to dey apply di change, and new rules go begin exist.

eng: It is hoped that this judicial activism would be adopted by other Nigerian judges, Supreme Court justices inclusive, especially in the areas where our existing legislation are grossly inadequate, comprehensive or elaborate enough to address legal challenges of the emerging technological advancements.
pcm: We dey hope say goment go adopt dis activism wey Nigerian judges de do for inside judiciary, Supreme Court judges sef dey involve, expexially for area wia awa existin legislation dey grossly inadequate, comprehensive or elaborate enough to take address legal challenges for inside new technological advancements.

eng: This will certainly set a good precedence to ensure the protection of e-commerce consumers, entice investors and above all bring about economic development and sustainability in the country.
pcm: Dis one go set better precedence to make sure say e-commerce consumer dem get protection, to bring investor dem and bring economic development plus stability inside di kontri.

eng: The germane issues with regards to contracts in E-commerce are documentation and signature.
pcm: Di koko issue for contract inside e-commerce na documentation and signature.

eng: The provision of section 4 of the Statute of Fraud, 1677 or Lagos State Law Reform (Contract) Law and our various statutes on real property and landed instruments, all of which require certain contracts to be in writing and be duly executed .The
pcm: Di provision for inside section 4 of di statute of Fraud, 1677 or  Lagos State Law Reform (Contract) Law and awa various statute on real property and landed instrument dem, all of which require make dem write certain contract dem and execute dem duly.

eng: question then is would an electronic mark or sign constitute a valid sign-off of a contract by email and be binding?
pcm: Di question now be say shey electronic sign-off dey constitute valid sign-off contract by email or by binding?

eng: Many of these issues are still not quite settled even in the UK although some  decisions incline favourably towards interpreting electronic signature
pcm: Dem still neva settle many of dis issues dem even for inside UK although some decision dey favour toward to interprete electronic signature

eng: so marks in emails as satisfying the traditional requirement of writing and due execution.
pcm: So marks for inside email wey ey satisfy di tradional requirement of writing and due execusion.

eng: E-commerce transactions are paperless transactions made through magnetic materials such as tapes or disks.
pcm: E-commerce transaction na transaction wey no involve paper wey dem dey do through magnetic material like tapes or disk.

eng: These are in contradistinction to the paper-based transactions that are embodied in a permanent form and typically expressed in words and figures usually authenticated by signatures.
pcm: Dis one dem be contradiction to di transaction wey be say na paper dem dey take do am wey dey embodied for permanent form and typically expressed in words and figures wey dem dey use signature authenticate.

eng: Such transactions can therefore not be altered without an alteration on the face of the document.
pcm: Dem no fit alter dat kind transaction without say dem alter di face of di document.

eng: With respect to signatures, by the provision of section 93(2)(3), evidence act 2011, an electronic signature in relation to a data message conveniently satisfies any requirement for a handwritten signature in so far as it sufficiently identifies an electronic record to the individual.
pcm: As e concern signature, di provision for inide section 93 (2)(3), evidence act 2011, electronic signature wey relate to data message go conveniently satisfy any requirement for signature wey dem take hand sign as long as say e dey sufficient to take identify an electronic record to di person.

eng: The provision of article 7 of the United Nations Commission on International Trade Law (UNCITRAL) model law on e-commerce 1996 is equally trite on this issue.
pcm: Di  provision for inside article 7 of di United Nations Commission on International Trade Law (UNCITRAL) model law for e-commerce 1996 dey equally trite on top dis issue.

eng: Thus, for the purpose of establishing proof of electronic signatures.
pcm: Thus, for di purpose of establishing proof of electronic signatures.

eng: The use of a password, identification, user names etc may suffice.
pcm: To dey use password, identification, user names etc fit suffice.

eng: Hence one may safely posit that electronic signatures for the purpose of execution are admissible in evidence provided it is certified and incorporated in an electronic communication in the course of an e-transaction.
pcm: Hence one fit safely tok say electronic signature for purpose of execution dey admissible for evidence provided say dem certify and incorporate am for electronic communication during any e-transaction.

eng: Also, other legal challenges affecting e-commerce include the formation of contracts.
pcm: Also, oda legal challenge dem wey dey affect e-commerce include di formation of contracts.

eng: The element for a valid formation of contract includes an offer, acceptance, consideration, intention to enter into legal relation.
pcm: Di element for better formation of contract include offer, acceptance, consideration, intention to enter inside legal relation.

eng: The question is at what point can an offer be made with regards to an electronic business transaction or how to differentiate between invitation to treat and offer an electronic transaction, at what point can it be said that an intention to enter legal relation is made?
pcm: Di question be say, for which point dem fit make offer wit regard to electronic business transaction or now to differentiate between invitation to treat and offer electronic transaction, at which point we fit tok say dem make intention to enter legal relation?

eng: E-commerce requires confidence and trust the satisfaction that transmitted orders or invoices have not been altered and emanate from whoever they appear to be from.
pcm: E-commerce require confidence and trust di satisfaction wey dey transmit order or invoice neva get any matter and e dey kom from whoever e appear to kom from.

eng: There is a need for a guaranteed level of privacy /confidentiality with respect to information.
pcm: Need dey for guarantee concerning level of privacy/confidenciality for information matter.

eng: Lastly, the alarming rate of cybercrimes in Nigeria, high level of illiteracy.
pcm: Lastly, di alarming rate of cybercrime for inside Nigeria, plus high level of illiterate.

eng: Electronic commerce is no doubt an aspect of commercial transaction in Nigeria and it has come to stay in this time.
pcm: No doubt say electronic transaction na aspect of commercial transaction for Nigeria and e don kom to stay dis time.

eng: The government should go beyond creating laws, to activate utilisation of the electronic delivery platforms in its commercial interactions and for delivery of government services.
pcm: Make di goment go pass to dey make law, make dem activate as dem go take dey use di electronic platform for dem commercial interaction and for delivery of goment service.

eng: Abanikanda Happiness Wuraola can be reached via twitter
pcm: you fit reach Abanikanda Happiness Wuraola  via twitter

eng: Chad passes new charter naming Deby's son president
pcm: Chad don pass new chartes as dem call Deby son president

eng: Chad has passed a charter declaring Mahamat Idriss Deby president, despite rumours of his death trending on social media.
pcm: Chad don pass charter wey declare Mahamat Idris Deby as President, even as rumour dey social media say he don die.

eng: Mahamat takes over in place of his father, Idriss Deby, who was killed this week.
pcm: Mahamat don take over to take replace im papa, Idriss deby wey dem kill dis week.

eng: The charter said the 37-year-old son of the late war veteran, who on Tuesday was swiftly named transitional leader as head of a military council following his father's death, will occupy the functions of the president of the republic and also serve as head of the armed forces.
pcm: Di charter tok say di 37-year old wey be son to late war veteran, na im dem name transitional leader quick quick on Tuesday as head for military council afta im papa death, e go dey do work of president for di republic and head of di armed forces dem.

eng: The charter repeals the preceding constitution and will be implemented as the basic law of the republic, according to its terms.
pcm: Di charter repeal di preceding constitution and dem go implement am as di basic law of di republic, according to di temrs wey dey inside am.

eng: The younger Deby has also been named supreme head of the armed forces, it said.
pcm: Dem also don name di young Deby as supreme head for armed forces, as e tok.

eng: Deby's son had overseen his father's security as head of the elite presidential guard and had often appeared alongside him.
pcm: Deby son don oversee di security of im papa when im be head of di elite presidential guard and he dey appear along wit im papa often.

eng: Mahamat Deby is best known as a top commander of the Chadian forces assisting a United Nations peacekeeping mission in the restive north of neighbouring Mali.
pcm: Di best wey dem take know Mahamat Deby na as top commander of di forces inside Chad wey dey help United Nation peacekeeping mission for inside di restive north of neighbouring Mali.

eng: He signed a decree Tuesday setting out a military council with 15 generals, including himself and 14 others known to have been part of the late president's circle of loyalists.
pcm: Im sign one decree for Tuesday as he set out one military council wey get 15 generals dem, including imsef and 14 odas wey dem know say dey loyal to late president.

eng: The council is tasked with an 18-month transition toward free and democratic elections.
pcm: Di task wey dem give di council na to move enter free and democractic election withing 18 months.

eng: Mahamat Idriss Deby also chairs the military transition council, the council of ministers, the councils and superior committees of national defence, according to the charter.
pcm: Mahamat Idris Deby na chair for di military transition council, di council of ministers, di counil of superior committees of national defence, as di charter take tok.

eng: The new head of state will promulgate legislation adopted by the 69 members of the national transition council, who are named directly by Mahamat.
pcm: Di new head of state go dey declare legislation wey di 69 members of di national transition council adopt, wey Mahamat name directly.

eng: The Transition Charter, which contains 95 articles, also guarantees freedom of opinion, conscience and worship.
pcm: Di Transition Charter wey get 95 articles, e also guarantee freedom of opinion, conscience plus worship.

eng: A transition government has been set up, whose members are named by the new president.
pcm: Dem don set transition goment, wey di new president go name di members.

eng: The members of the army who are called to the transition government are discharged from all military duties, the charter said.
pcm: Di charter tok say dem don free all member of army wey dem call to di transitional goment from all military work.

eng: Chadian law
pcm: Law for Chad

eng: The slain leader, who ruled with an iron fist for nearly 30 years, succumbed to wounds suffered during a visit to the battlefield in the country's north where Chadian soldiers fought against a rebel group, the military announced on Tuesday.
pcm: Di leader wey dem kill, im rule wit strong hand for lmost 30 years, he give to wound wey im get wen im visit battlefield wia Chad soldier dem dey fight rebel group for di north, as di military announce for Tuesday.

eng: Calling for calm, the army also announced a 6pm curfew and shut the country's borders, while suspending the constitution and dissolving the National Assembly.
pcm: Calling for calm, di army also announce curfew for 6pm and dem close di border for di kontri, as dem suspend di constitution and dissolve National Assembly.

eng: However,  opposition politicians in Chad have rejected the army's appointment of President Idriss Dby's son to take over in the wake of his death.
pcm: However, politician wey be opposition for inside chad don reject di army appointment of President Idris deby's son to take over fter im papa die.

eng: Experts say that under Chadian law, the speaker of parliament should have taken power after Deby;s death and not his son.
pcm: Expert dem tok say under di law for inside Chad, di speaker of parliament suppose don kolekt power aftr Deby die, no be im son.

eng: What the constitution says is that in the absence of the president or in case he dies, then the speaker of the parliament takes charge of the country for 40 days and so a transition is put in place until elections are held, Al Jazeera's Hiba Morgan, reporting from the capital, Ndjamena, said earlier on Tuesday.
pcm: Wetin di constitution tok be say if di president n dey abi e die, then di speaker of di parliament go take charge of di kontri for 40 days and so dem go put transition in place until dem do election, Hiba Morgan wey dey Al Jazeera dey report from capital, Ndjamena tok for ealy Tuesday.

eng: [But] the military announced that the legislative assembly has been dissolved and that the constitution also has been dissolved, so what they are doing is that they replaced the constitution with their own set of rules.
pcm: [But] di military announce ay dem don dissolve di legislative assembly and dem don dissolve di constitution, so wetin dem do be say dem replace di constitution wit dem own set of rules.

eng: Chelsea face possible points deduction after brawl with Leicester
pcm: Dem fit komot Chelsea points afta di brawl wit Leicester

eng: Chelsea are facing possible points deduction by he FA for the team's failure to control their players, Mirror reports.
pcm: Chelsea dey face deduction of point from FA for di team as dem fail to kontrol dem players, as Mirror report.

eng: In seven years, the team have been found pants down in seven hot-tempered rows with opponents.
pcm: Inside seven years, dem don catch di team dey show hot temper to opponents seven times.

eng: The recent brawl during a clash on Tuesday night with Leicester marked the  seventh encounter Chelsea had with Premier League teams.
pcm: Di recent brawl for inside one match on Tuesday night Leicester mark di seven encounter wey Chelsea get wit Premier League teams.

eng: Last week match between Chelsea and Leicester was marred by skirmishes between the players of both teams.
pcm: Na katakata mark di match wey apun last week between Chelsea and Leicester among players of both teams.

eng: Citing similar offenses in the past, the FA decided to punish Chelsea.
pcm: Wit di same kind of offence for di past, di FA decide say dem go punish Chelsea.

eng: Leicester have also been charged for their role in the brawl that involved players and coaching staff following Ricardo Pereira's challenge on Ben Chilwell.
pcm: Leicester sef dey face charges for dem role inside di brawl wey involve players and coaches as Ricardo Pereira take challenge Ben Chilwell.

eng: In 2016, Chelsea were also charged for indiscipline that they had to be warned, after appealing against 375,000 dollar levy for their part in  a mass bust-up during a match against Tottenham.
pcm: For 2016, dem also charge Chelsea for indiscipline wey make dem warn dem, afta dem appeal against 375,000 dollar fine for di part wey dem play for one burst-up during match against Tottenham.

eng: If affected, the points deduction will significantly affect their season as they head into a final campaign for a top four spot.
pcm: If e affect dem, di point wey dem go komot go affect dem season very well as dem dey enter final campaign to take get spot for top four.

eng: US Africom in Nigeria? Heck No!
pcm: US Africom for Nigeria? Heck No!

eng: Overpaid, oversexed and over here.
pcm: Overpaid, oversexed and over here.

eng: That was the resentful and contemptuous opinion many British people came to have of the thousands of American GIs stationed in several military bases in Britain during the Second World War.
pcm: Dat na di resentful and contemptuous opinion many British pipo get for di thousands of American GIs wey station for inside several military bases for Britain durin di Secon World War.

eng: The gum-chewing, brash, hard-drinking and womanising American soldiers frequently got into pub brawls and dangerous knife fights which built up a feeling of disdain for the yanks among the locals.
pcm: Di gum-chewing, brash, hard-drinking and womanising  soldier dem wey from America comedey frequently get into pub fight and knife fight weu dey dangerous wey dey kos bad feeling for di yanks among di locals.

eng: And this has been the pattern of behaviour among American soldiers everywhere in the hundreds of American military bases overseas from Okinawa in Japan, Stuttgart in Germany, Incirlik and Diyarbakir in Turkey and Pampanga in the Philippines.
pcm: And dis don be di pattern wey America soldiers dem dey take behave evriwia for di hundred of America military base oversea from Okinawa for inside Japan, Stuttgart inside Germany, Incirlik and Diyarbakir for Turkey and Pampanga inside  Philippines.

eng: That is why I am perturbed, like many Nigerians, that in a virtual meeting last week with the Secretary of State of the United States of America, Antony Blinken, President Buhari was reported to have asked that the United States considers relocating the African Command (Africom) of its military presently based in the southern German city of Stuttgart to Africa.
pcm: Na why i dey upset, like plenty Nigeria pipo, say na for virtual meetin last week wit di di Secretary of State of di United States of America, Antony Blinken, na dem report say president Buhari ask United States to consider as dem go take relocate di African Command (Africom) of im military wey dey for Stuttgart for inside southern German city of presently kom Africa.

eng: It is presumed that with this call, President Buhari is making a pitch for Nigeria to host Africom.
pcm: We dey thingk am say wit dis kin call, president Buhari dey make way for Nigeria to host Africom.

eng: In the first place, it was a breach of protocol for President Buhari to hold that meeting with the American Secretary of State.
pcm: For di first place, na breach of protocol for  President Buhari to do dat meeting wit di American Secretary of State.

eng: The meeting should have been with Blinken's Nigerian opposite number, Geoffrey Onyeama, who would then transmit the details afterwards to the president.
pcm: Dem suppose do di meetin wit Blinken's Nigerian opposite number, Geoffrey Onyeama, who o kom carri di detail go meet president later.

eng: Yes, America is a superpower and all that, but protocol is protocol and should be followed strictly in all circumstances.
pcm: Yes, America na superpower and all, but protocol na protocol and dem soppose follow am strictly  for evri circumstance.

eng: Understandably, Nigeria is currently faced with gargantuan internal insecurity issues which seem to defy the best efforts of government and the nation's security establishment in tackling it.
pcm: We understand say Nigeria dey face big internal security wahala wey be like say e pass di best effort wey goment and security establishment for inside di nation dey make to take tackle am.

eng: Unrelenting terrorist insurgency in the North East, banditry, kidnapping in the North West, farmers/herders clashes all over the country and the targeted killing of security and law enforcement personnel and other Nigerians coupled with the destruction of institutional buildings in the South East, constitute the cocktail of insecurity now ravaging the country.
pcm: Terrorist insurgency wey no dey tire for di North East banditry, kidnapping inside di North West, farmers/herders clash dem all over di kontri and as dem dey target and kill security and law enforcement personnel dem and oda Nigeria pipo plus di destruction of institutional building for di South East, na dem join take be di cokctail of insecurity wey don dey ravage di kontri.

eng: But even at that, the call for the hosting of the Africom on Nigerian soil when considered against the various issues and implications of this move to Nigeria is hardly justified.
pcm: But even at that, di call to take host Africom on top Nigeria siol when we consider m against various issues and implications of dis move to Nigeria difficult to justify.

eng: Africom is one of nine such commands by the American military establishment to exclusively serve American strategic interests around the world.
pcm: Africom na one amng nine of dat kind command wey di America military establish say make e dey serve America strategic interest around di world.

eng: By their doctrine and operational modus, these commands, particularly those outside America like Africom, are not set up primarily to concern themselves with the security and law enforcement issues of their area of coverage.
pcm: By dem rule and way of operation, dis commands, particularly di ones wey dey outside America like Africom, dem no set dem up primarily to concern demselves wit security and law enforcement issuefor dem area of coverage.

eng: They only do so when such issues directly affect American interests in the area and in such situations, they are not mandated to yield their modus operandi and share intelligence with the local security and law enforcement agencies.
pcm: Dem only do so when such issue dey affect di interest of America directly for di area and for such situation, dem no dey mandated to yield dem modus operandi and share intelligence wit di local security and law enforcement agancy dem

eng: If Africom is set up in Nigeria for instance, it will be an island of its own restricting access to Nigerians of all categories and establishing a jurisdiction within the territorial area of the base that will be virtually off limits to Nigerian security and law enforcement agencies.
pcm: If dem set Africom up for Nigeria for instance, e go be island on im ownas e go restrict access to Nigerians of all category and establishing a jurisdiction withing di teritorial area of di base wey go dey virtually off limit to Nigerian security and law enforcement agancy dem.

eng: As it always happens with American military bases outside America, Africom will be a forward operating base for disruptive intelligence operations and source of acts of sabotage and destabilisation against the host country.
pcm: As e dey always apun wit America military base wey dey outside America, Africom go be forward operating base for disruptive intelligence operations and e go source for act of sabotage and destabilisation against host kontri.

eng: In the particular case of Africom, part of its original concept was actually to contain the growing strategic influence of Nigeria in West Africa and Africa following our successful peace enforcement efforts in Liberia and Sierra Leone and our sterling records of peace keeping around the world.
pcm: For dis particular case of Africom, part of im original concept na to kontrol as di strategic influence of Nigeria dey grow for West Africa and Africa as we get successful peace enforecement efforts for Liberia and Sierra Leone and awa beta record of peace keepin around di world.

eng: Africom's precursor was the Africa Crisis Response Initiative (ACRI) set up by the Clinton administration to counter Nigeria's strategic interests in Africa.
pcm: Di one wey dey before Africom na di Africa Crisis Response Initiative (ACRI) wey di Clinton administration set up to take counter di strategic interest of Nigeria for inside Africa.

eng: President Clinton's Secretary of State, the dour-faced California attorney, Warren Christopher, made many secret and open visits to a number of African countries to sell the idea.
pcm: Di Secretary of State for president Clinton, di dour-faced California attorney, Warren Christopher, be visit a nomba of African countries secretly to sell di idea.

eng: But because Nigeria was the target, he pointedly left it out from his itinerary.
pcm: But bikos Nigeria na di target, he pointedly komot am from im itinerary.

eng: Senegal, which is not far from Liberia and Sierra Leone, was to be the coordinating base of the ACRI and though it was touted as an initiative to facilitate American assistance to African humanitarian issues, its secret protocols were unmistakably military and strategically targeted at Nigeria.
pcm: Senegal, wey no far from Liberia and Sierra Leone, na im suppose be di coordinating base of di ACRI and though dem see am initiative to facilitate assistance of America to African humanitarian issues, im secret protocol dem mistake for military and dem target Nigeria strategically.

eng: Due mainly to undisguised hostility to the idea from France, which was averse to seeing the Americans trying to butt into an area it considers its exclusive sphere of influence, the ACRI concept was reviewed.
pcm: Due mainly to undisguised hostility to di idea from France, which was averse to seeing di Americans trying to butt into an area it considers its exclusive sphere of influence, dem review di concept of di ACRI.

eng: In the review, which drew the expertise of American military, intelligence, political and academic personalities and institutions midwifed by the American congress in secret sessions, the Americans considered and realised the need to set up an African command to add to the other commands already in place covering the various continents of the world.
pcm: For di review, wey draw di expertise of america Military, intelligence, political and academic personalities and institutions wey di America congress carry kom for dem secret sessions, di Americans dem consider and realise di need to set up one AFrican command to add to di oda command wey don dey already and dey cover oda continent for inside di world.

eng: Thus based on recommendations of these assemblage of experts drawn from all facets of American political and security establishments, Africom was set up by the Bush Junior administration with a wider mandate not just to contain Nigeria but also to keep an eye on the growing Chinese strategic penetration of Africa.
pcm: Thus, to follow on di reccomendation of experts wey gather, wey dem kom form all angle of political and security establishments for inside America, na di Bush Junior administration set Africom up wit mandate wey wide pass to contain Nigeria but also to keep eye on top di strategic penetration wey Chinese pipo dey do for inside Africa.

eng: Africom will be to Africa what US Central Command (USCENTCOM), based in Florida, is to the Middle East and Asia, European Command (EUCOM), based in Stuttgart, Germany, is to Europe and Southern Command (SOUTHCOM), also based in Florida, is to Latin America and the Caribbean.
pcm: Na as US Central Command (USCENTCOM) take be to Middle East and Asia, na so Africom go be to Africa, as e base for Florida, European Command (EUCOM), as e base for Stuttgart, Germany, is to Europe and Southern Command (SOUTHCOM), also based in Florida, is to Latin America and di Caribbean.

eng: Nigeria is already surrounded by French military presence in Niger, Cameroon, Chad, and Benin.
pcm: Di presence of French military don surround Nigeria already as dem dey for Niger, Cameroun, Chad and Benin.

eng: The Americans also have a drone base in Niger.
pcm: Di America pipo also get drone base for inside Niger.

eng: Adding Africom to the mix in Nigeria will amount to a complete capitulation of our strategic interest to both France and America.
pcm: To add Africom to di mix for inside Nigeria go amount to a complete capitulation of awa strategic interest to both France and America.

eng: Bearing in mind that our strategic interests and profile in Africa do not always cohere with those of France and America, the hosting of Africom in Nigeria will be the equivalent of letting in the wolf into the chicken coop.
pcm: As we get am for mind say awa strategic interest plus profile for Africa no dey always follow wit di one for France and America, to host Africom for Nigeria go be di same thing like make we allow wolf enter chicken cage.

eng: There is nothing in the present insecurity challenges facing the country that our armed forces cannot cope with.
pcm: Notin dey inside di insecurity cahllenge wey dey face di kontri wey awa armed forces no fit cope wit.

eng: This is after all the military force that eventually secured Liberia and Sierra Leone against a well-entrenched and organised army of insurgents in those countries from a long logistical supply line thousands of miles; the army of Joshua Dogonyaro, Victor Malu and Maxwell Khobe, to mention but a few of the many gallant Nigerian soldiers who distinguished themselves in those operations.
pcm: Dis one na afta di military force wey eventually secure Liberia and Seirra Leone against army of insurgents wey dey well-entrenched and organised for inside di kontri dem from a long logistical supply line thousands of mile;  di army of Joshua Dogonyaro, Victor Malu and Maxwell Khobe, to mention few of di plenty gallant Nigeria soldier wey distinguish demsef for di operation dem.

eng: It is regrettable that the military of Nigeria, having fallen from the high standards known of it, is struggling now to cope with the activities of non-state actors internally.
pcm: E dey regretable say di Nigeria military, don fall from high standard wey dem take know dem, dem dey struggle now to cope wit di activity of non-state actors internally.

eng: But intrinsically and essentially, the Nigerian military retains the capacity and capability to defeat these threats to our national security given the right leadership, doctrine and motivation.
pcm: But intrinsically and essentially, di military for Nigeria still carry di capacity and capability to defeat dis threat to awa nationl security if dem get di correct leadership, doctrine plus motivation.

eng: We need all the assistance and cooperation that the Americans can give us if they are so willing.
pcm: We need all di assistance and coopration wey di America pipo fit give us if dem wan give us.

eng: But despite our circumstances be arm-twisted into hosting the Africom in view of its antecedents and implications to our strategic interests, on our soil.
pcm: But as dem don hold us for hand to take host Africom with awa circumstance in view of im antecedent and implication to awa strategic interest, for awa soil.

eng: Despite challenges, Plateau targets 7m metric tons of Irish potato
pcm: Upon say dem dey face challenge, Plateau target 7m metric tons of Irish potato

eng: Plateau State is Nigeria's number one grower of Irish potato with the tuber currently produced in nine of the state's 17 local government areas.
pcm: For Nigeria, na Plateau state be nomba one wey dey plant Irish potato as dem dey produce am for nine of di 17 local goment area wey dey di state.

eng: The Potato Value Chain Support Project of the African Development Bank (AfDB) initiative pegs Plateau as accounting for 90 per cent of the potato production in the country with countries like Chad, Ghana, Niger, Benin among others receiving large supplies of potato from Nigeria.
pcm: Di Potato Value Chain Support Project of di African Development Bank (AfDB)initiative don Plateau as state wey get 90 per cent of di potato production for inside di kontri as kontri like Chad, Ghana, Niger, Benin and oda ones dey get large supply of potato from Nigeria.

eng: The large potato production from Plateau State, according to PotatoPRO.com, a leading information source for the global potato industry, has made Nigeria the fourth biggest producer in sub-Saharan Africa.
pcm: Di large potato production for inside Plateau State, according to PotatoPRO.com, wey be leading source for informate for global potato industry, don make Nigeria di nomba four big kontri for inside sub-sahara Africa.

eng: However, farmers say inadequate dams and road networks, and high cost of fertilizer and other farming inputs continue to pose a major setback in the production of sufficient potatoes for the nation and for export.
pcm: However, farmer dem tok say dam wey no good reach and bad road network, plus as di cost of fertilizer and oda farmin input kontinu to dey stand as major setback for di production of potatoes for inside di nation and to export.

eng: Other challenges contributing to low yields and harvest losses to the potato value chain include diseases such as blight and bacterial wilt as well as poor seedlings.
pcm: Oda challenge wey dey contribute to low yield and loss for harvest to di potato value chain include disease like blight and bacterial wilt, plus poor seedlings.

eng: According to the National Bureau of Statistics, Plateau State is among the 10 poorest states in Nigeria with over 70% poverty rate.
pcm: According to di National Bureau of Statistics, Plateau State dey among di ten poorest state for Nigeria as dem poverty rate pass 70%.

eng: The state, however, has a comparative advantage to boost economic activities by improving the competitiveness of the potato commodity value chain.
pcm: However, di state get comparative advange to take boost economic activities by improving di competitiveness of di potato commodity value chain.

eng: The Project Coordinator for the Potato Value Chain Support Project, Thomas Muopshin, said though the viability of the tuber crop is evident in nine local government areas of Plateau, Bokkos and Mangu LGAs are the state's potato hub.
pcm: Di project Coordinator  for di Potato value Chain Support Project, Thomas Muopshin, tok say though di visibility of di tuber crop dey evident for nine local goment area inside Plateau, Na Bokkos and Mangu LGAs be di hub for potato.

eng: They produce more potatoes than any LGA in the country.
pcm: Na dem dey produce potato pass any LGA fir di kontri.

eng: Muopshin, however, said adaptability research indicates that the state's remaining eight LGAs are equally viable to produce potato; making all of Plateau's 17 LGA potentials to produce the tuber, especially during the dry season.
pcm: However, Muopshin tok say adaptability research indicate say di remainin eight LGA for inside di state also fit plant potato, dat one go make all 17 LGA wey dey for Plateau fit produce tuber, especially for inside dry season.

eng: The Association of Potato Farmers (APF) in the state, however, says unless challenges affecting the value chain are addressed squarely, increased production and export in potato would continue to elude the nation.
pcm: However, di Association of Potato Farmers (APF) for inside di state, tok say unless dem address di challenge wey dey face di value chain, increase production and export of potato go continue to pass di national.

eng: Plateau State Chairman of APF, Lazarus Makut, in an interview with Daily Trust, said inadequate smaller dams, especially in remote areas where potato farming is viable as well as poor roads and high cost of farm inputs, continue to affect potato outputs.
pcm: Chairman of APF for inside Plateau state, Lazarus Makut, for one interview wey he do wit daily Trust, tok say di inadequate small dam, especially for remote area wia dem dey plant potato, and bad road plus high cost of farm input kontinu to dey affect potato output.

eng: He said the cost of mechanised farming which could rapidly increase productivity has become expensive with the majority of farmers who are small scale producers unable to afford mechanization.
pcm: He tok say di cost of mechanised farmin wey fit increase production quick quick don dey expensive as di majority of farmers na small scale producer wey dey unable to afford mechanization.

eng: Another farmer, Martha Mamgup, who grows potatoes in Ampang town in Mangu LGA, said inadequate water during the dry season affects potato farmers and leads to annual low yield.
pcm: Anoda farmer, wey be Martha Mamgup, wey dey plant potatoe for inside Ampang town for Mangu LGA. tok say water wey no reach durin dry season dey affect potato farmer and harvest dey low evri year.

eng: Because of this, she said, the majority of farmers search for borehole locations to farm to access irrigation water for their farms.
pcm: Bekos of dis, she tok say, di majority of farmers dem search for location of borehole to farm to take access irrigation water for dem farm.

eng: Martha explained also that the high cost of fertiliser prevents many farmers from improving quantity and quality of yield, adding that insufficient fertiliser affects the crops output.
pcm: Martha also explain say di high cost of fertilizer dey prevent plenty farmers from improvin quantity plus quality of yield, she add say wen fertilizer no reach, e dey affect di crop output.

eng: The cost also prevents many of us from expanding the business.
pcm: Di cost dey also prevent many of us from expandin di business.

eng: So, getting fertiliser has not been easy for us.
pcm: So, to get fertilizer no be dey easy for us.

eng: She said the construction of more dams and boreholes for irrigation would lead to mass production of potatoes.
pcm: She tok say di construction of more dam plus borehole for irrigation go lead to plenty production of potatoes.

eng: If the water is not sufficient for the crop, it would dry and eventually die and that is why some farmers who have the resources prefer to dig boreholes in Mangu purposely for irrigation because, without it, dry season farming becomes difficult, she said.
pcm: If di watre no reach for di crop, e go dry and e go later die and day na why some farmer wey get di resources dey prefer to dig boreholes for Mangu for irrigation bikos, without am, season farmin go bekom difficult, as she tok.

eng: Irish potato at a market in Jos
pcm: Irish potato for one market inside Jos

eng: Production to reach 7million metric ton after lab completion
pcm: Production to reach 7million metric ton afta dem complete lab

eng: With Plateau State's potato production jumping from 1,656,650 metric tons in 2017 to 2,359,890 metric tons in 2020, the establishment of the Potato Value Chain Support Project and the construction of the tissue culture lab are expected to cause the tripling of production to over seven million metric tons by the end of 2021.
pcm: Wit potato production inside Plateau State wey don jump from 1,656,650 metric tons in 2017 to 2,359,890 metric tons in 2020, di establishment of Potato Value Chain Support Project and dem expect make diconstruction of tisue culture lab kos make production triple pass seven million metric tons by di time wey 2021 go end.

eng: The Monitoring and Evaluating officer of the state's Potato Value Chain Support Project, Baleri Yakubu, told Daily Trust that the state is expected to commence production of six million metric tons of potato annually after the tissue culture lab is completed at the end of 2021 but expressed optimism that production could exceed seven million metric tons annually.
pcm: Di officer wey Monitor and Evaluate state's Potato Value Chain Support Project for di state, Baleri Yakubu, tell Daily Trust say dem expect make di state start production of six million of potato evri year afta dem complete di tissue culture lab at di end of 2021 but e dey optimistic say production fit pass seven million metric tons evri year.

eng: Yakubu, however, said the state government should tackle other challenges faced by farmers especially those of fertiliser as well as more dams and road networks while farmers are expected to properly apply potato farming regulations to achieve the expected target.
pcm: However, Yakubu tok say mak di state goment tackle oda challenges wey farmers dem dey face, especially di one of fertilizer as well as dam and road network as dem dey expect make farmers dem apply proper potato farming regulation to take achieve expected target.

eng: Our correspondent gathered that the tissue culture lab, which is intended to improve potato yields in the state by providing clean seed which is resistant to pests and other potato-related diseases, is expected to commence operation fully in a few months.
pcm: Our correspondent hear say di tissue culture lab, wey dem intend to take improve potato yield for di state by providing seed wey clean wey dey resist pest and oda disease dem wey relate to potato na im dem expect say go commence full operation in few month dem.

eng: Yakubu said the advent of the lab would certainly improve income for farmers and revenue for the state government while also aiding food security effort in the country.
pcm: Yakubu tok say e dey certain say di advent of di lab go improve income for farmers and revenue for di state goment and e go also help food security for inside di kontri.

eng: Farmers in Plateau State, however, believe that the tissue lab, if fully equipped, would largely reduce the cost of treatment for the crops when they were affected by any disease.
pcm: Farmer for inside Plateau State, however, believe say di tissue la, if e dey fully equipped, go reduce di cost of treatment for di crop when disease affect dem.

eng: They also hope that better quality seed would be available at an affordable price.
pcm: Dem also hope say better quality seed go dey available for affordable price.

eng: FG yet to return £4.2m Ibori loot to Delta Accountant General
pcm: FG neva return £4.2m Ibori loot to Delta Accountant General

eng: The Office of the Accountant General of the Federation (OAGF) revealed Wednesday that the Federal Government has not returned the £4.2 million loot recovered from former Governor James Ibori to Delta Government.
pcm: Di Office of di Accountant General of di Federation (OAGF) reaveal for Wednesday say di Federal Goment neva return di £4.2 million loot wey dem recover from former governor James Ibori to delta Goment.

eng: The money is still being awaited after which the issues around it will be resolved before further action is taken.
pcm: Dem still dey wait for di money afta dat dem go resolve di issues dem wey wit am before dem take any further action.

eng: For now, no money has been returned to Delta State, a statement from the Office, signed by the Director of Information, Press and Public Relations, Henshaw Ogubike, revealed.
pcm: For now, dem neva return any moni enter Delta state,as one statement from di office reveal, wey di director of information, Press and Public Relations, Henshaw Ogubike sign.

eng: The statement said that the issue of the £4.2million Ibori loot has not been properly resolved.
pcm: Di statement tok say dem neva resolve di issue of di £4.2million wey Ibori loot.

eng: On the previous comment of the Accountant General to the National Assembly that the loot had been returned to the Delta government, Henshaw Ogubike said: The AGF was only making general comments about recoveries relating to State Governments.
pcm: For di previous comment wey Accountant General for di National Assembly make say dem don return di loot to di goment of Delta, Henshaw Ogubike tok say: Di Agf dey only general comment about money wey dem rcorver as e relate to state goment dem.

eng: Hardcore Super League trio defiant against UEFA coercion
pcm: Di three Super League stronghead no gree against UEFA coercion.

eng: Super League trio Real Madrid, Barcelona and Juventus insisted on Wednesday they œremain committed to modernising football despite UEFA's threats of disciplinary action.
pcm: Super League three Real Madrid, Barcelona and Juventus insist for Wednesday say dem remain committed to take modernise football even as UEFA dey threating to discipline dem.

eng: UEFA on Tuesday opened formal disciplinary proceedings against the three clubs which are still refusing to give up the aborted Super League project.
pcm: UEFA don open formal disciplinary waka on Tuesday against di three clubs dem wey no gree to give up on di Super League project wey dem don abort.

eng: In a joint statement, Italian's Juventus and the two Spanish sides said they remain committed to modernising football through an open dialogue with UEFA.
pcm: For one joint statement, Juventus for Italy, and di two Spanish side tok say dem remain committed to take modernise football through open dialogue with UEFA.

eng: FC Barcelona, Juventus FC and Real Madrid CF wish to express their absolute rejection of the insistent coercion that UEFA has been maintaining towards three of the most relevant institutions in the history of football, the statement read.
pcm: FC Barcelona, Juventus FC and Real Madrid CF wish to express dem absolute rejection of di insistent coercion wey UEFA don dey mentain towards di three institution wey relevant pass for di history of futbol, as di statement tok.

eng: This alarming attitude constitutes a flagrant breach of the decision of the courts of justice, which have already made a clear statement warning UEFA to refrain from taking any action that could penalise the founding clubs of the Super League while the legal proceedings are ongoing.
pcm: Dis attitude wey reach to raise alarm dey constitute breach of di decision wey courts of justice dem make, wey don make clear statement to warn UEFA to stop to take any action wey fit punish di clubs dem wey found di super League when dem still dey on top di legal matter.

eng: Therefore, the opening of disciplinary proceedings by UEFA is incomprehensible and is a direct attack against the rule of law that we, the citizens of the European Union, have democratically built up, while constituting a lack of respect toward the authority of the courts of justice themselves.â
pcm: Therefore, as UEFA take disciplinary proceedings dey incomprehensible and na direct attack against di rule of law wey us, wey be citizen for European Union, don build up with democracy, e still be lack of respect toward di authority of di courts of justice sef.

eng: China administers nearly 140 million COVID-19 vaccines
pcm: China don give reach 140 million COVID-19 vaccines

eng: China has administered 139.97 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines as of April 4, 2021, said the country's National Health Commission (NHC).
pcm: China don administer 139.97 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines as of April 4, 2021, as di National Health Commission (NHC) of di kontri tok.

eng: China is working to ensure its vaccination efforts in major areas and key industries based on the overall plan of the country, inoculating the eligible population as widely as possible and progressing in stages, said Wu Liangyou, deputy director of the NHCs Disease Prevention and Control Bureau.
pcm: China dey work to make sure say dem vaccination effort for major area and key sector industry as e base on di overall plan of di kontri, inoculating di eligible population as wide as dem fit reach and to make progress in stages, as Wu Liangyou, wey be deputy director of di NHCs Disease Prevention and Control Bureau.

eng: The country is gathering resources to ensure inoculation in large- and medium-sized cities, port cities, and border areas with high risks of infection, and priorities are given to key groups including public sector employees, students and faculty of colleges and universities, as well as service staff of large supermarkets, Wu said, adding that vaccination for other groups is also in progress.
pcm: Di kontri don dey gather resources to ensure inoculation for city wey get large and medium size, city wey get prot, area wey get border wey get high risk of infection, plus dem give priority to key group wey include employee for inside public sector, student dem and faculty for inside college and universities, plus service staff for inside big supermarket dem, as Wu take tok, and e add say vaccination for oda group sef don dey for progress.

eng: At present, Beijing, Shanghai and some other places in China have administered COVID-19 vaccines to senior citizens above the age of 60 and patients with chronic diseases who are willing to be vaccinated and in good physical conditions.
pcm: For present,  Beijing, Shanghai plus some oda places for inside China don give senior citizenswey wan kolekt di vaccine, wey dey above di age of 60 and patients wey get chronic diseases COVID-19 vaccines, wey get beta physical condition.

eng: He Qinghua, an official with the NHC, noted that the commission will advance the vaccination campaign in an order of priority, following the principle of informed consent, voluntary participation and free inoculation.
pcm: He Qinghua, wey official for di NHC note say di commission go advance di vaccination campaign with order of importance, dem go follow di priciple of informed consent, voluntary participation and free inoculation.

eng: The country is coordinating regular prevention and control with its vaccination efforts, ensuring that the regulatory responsibility of local governments and the oversight responsibility are fulfilled, and advancing its vaccination campaign in a more secured, orderly and forceful manner, he said.
pcm: Di kontri dey coordinate regular prevention and kontrol wit im vaccination efforts, to make sure say di regular responsibility of local goment dem and di one wey dem don komot eye dey fulfilled, and to dey advance dem vaccination campaign in manner weu dey more secured and orederly and forceful, as e tok am.

eng: Besides, China is also taking steps to include more people in its vaccination campaign to ensure their health, the official added.
pcm: Besides, China don take step to take include more pipo for dem vaccination campaign to ensure dem health, di official add.

eng: So far, China has approved COVID-19 vaccines produced by five enterprises for conditional marketing or emergency use.
pcm: So far, China don approve COVID-19 vaccines wey five enterprises produce for conditional marketing or for emergency use.

eng: Phase III clinical trials of three inactivated vaccines and one adenovirus vaccine showed that their efficacy met the requirements of China's National Medical Products Administration and the World Health Organization.
pcm: Phase III of three vaccines dem wey dem neva activate and one adenovirus vaccine show say dem efficacy meet di requirement of National Medical Products Administration for China and di World Health Organization.

eng: Phase II trials of the recombinant protein subunit vaccine approved for emergency use showed the vaccine is safe and can induce a strong immune response.
pcm: Phase II trial for di recombinant protein subunit vaccine wey dem appove for emergency use don show say di vaccine dey safe and e fit cause strong immune response.

eng: COVID-19 vaccines adopted by China have all gone through clinical studies in accordance with relevant standards, approved by national drug regulatory organisations and put into use after passing a strict examination, said Li Bin, deputy head of the NHC.
pcm: All di COVID-19 vaccine wey China adopt don go through clinical studies wey follow relevant standard, wey national drug regulatory organization dem approve and dem begin dey use am afta e pass strict examination, as Li Bin wey be deputy head for NHC take tok.

eng: All vaccines must be monitored and have their temperatures recorded at regular intervals to ensure that they meet the requirements regarding temperature environment and transportation.
pcm: All vaccines suppose dey monitor and make dem temperature get record from time to time to make sure say dem meet requirement on temperature environment and transportation.

eng: China's health regulators also enhanced efforts on the training of health workers, requiring them to strictly obey operating instructions, so as to guarantee the efficacy and safety of the vaccines, Li added.
pcm: Li add say Health regulator for inside China don also enhance effort for di training of health worker dem, require say make dem obey operating instructions, so dem go fit guarantee di efficacy and safety of di vaccine.

eng: Wema Bank holds essay contest for kids
pcm: Wema Bank dey do essay contest for pikin dem

eng: Wema Bank Plc is hosting a creative essay competition for children that will test the creative writing abilities of young school children aged five to 12 years.
pcm: Wema bank Plc dey host creative essay competition wey go test di creative writing ability of young children wey dey age of five to 12 years.

eng: The 2021 Royal Kiddies Essay Competition tagged Write & Win, aims to develop writing skills, promote creativity, imagination capabilities, reward creativity, and drive them towards excellence in their learning process.
