eng: A couple of days after that happened, we heard in the news that Buhari stopped some weapons acquisition he wanted to make from Dubai through third parties.
pcm: Some few days afta dat apun, we hear di news say Buhari be stop some weapon acquisition wey he wan make from Dubai through third parti dem.

eng: The report put Monguno in bad light and sought to expose his hypocrisy.
pcm: Di report put Monguno for bad light and e wan expose im hypocrisy.

eng: Will we ever find a way out of our insecurity maze?
pcm: Shey we go ever get way to komot for inside dis insecurity maze?

eng: We are no longer hearing from the leadership of the DSS.
pcm: We no longer dey hear from di leadership for inside DSS.

eng: Since the initial gra-gra and controversies they've fallen silent.
pcm: Afta di initial gra-gra and controversy dem don silent.

eng: No one sees or hears from Yusuf Bichi anymore, but we sometimes see smart DSS chaps in dark suits and goggles performing their bodyguard services to the high and mighty.
pcm: No one dey hear or dey see Yusuf Bichi anymore, but we dey see smart DSS chaps dem inside dark suits ad goggle wey dey do dem bodiguard service to di high and mighty.

eng: We even see them on few occasions heavily kitted up like ninjas, complete with balaclavas and some out-of-this-world machine guns.
pcm: We even dey see dem on top few occasion wey dem go dress like ninja, dem go complete like balaclavas plus some out-of-this-world machine guns dem.

eng: But that is where it ends.
pcm: But na there e for end.

eng: It seems that the president does not care about the efficacy of the DSS and so they too have jejely withdrawn to their cocoon.
pcm: E be like say di president no care about di efficacy of DSS and so dem sef don jejely withdraw enter dem cocoon.

eng: There is some politics going on there.
pcm: Some politics dey go on for there.

eng: The police, we know their problem; that one is agelong.
pcm: Di police, we sabi dem problem; that one don tey.

eng: I am writing not to draw the attention of these bodies to myself
pcm: I  don dey write so I no go draw attention of dis bodi dem kom my side

eng: but well I am available for their attention if they take this personal.
pcm: But well I go dey available for dem attention if dem take am personal.

eng: I am writing as a concerned Nigerian citizen.
pcm: I dey write as concerned citizen of Nigeria.

eng: I'm afraid that there is no intelligence in this country anymore.
pcm: I dey fear say intelligence no dey for dis kontri anymore.

eng: I am prompted to write specifically because the nation is totally adrift and even if we accuse the politicians of being asleep at the wheels, it is inexcusable for our intelligence services to also be snoring.
pcm: I dey prompted to write specifically bikos di nation don drift totally and even as we accuse politician say dem don sleep, no excuse for awa intelligence services dem to dey snore too.

eng: There looks to be a deliberate abandonment of Nigeria into the hands of the elements  kidnappers, secessionists, fake news agents, online terrorists, and other forms of terrorists.
pcm: E dey be like say dem don abandon Nigeria for di hand of element like kidnapper, secessionist, fake news agent dem, online terrorist, plus oda form of terrorist.

eng: Who does not know that security is won and lost at the level of intelligence?
pcm: Who no know say security for di level of intelligence don loss?

eng: Whereas Nigeria has come to disrespect the police force, but many still hold the intelligence services in awe as we see them as elite corps.
pcm: wiaas Nigeria don kom disrespect di police, but many still dey fear di intelligence service dem seek of say we dey see dem as elite corps.

eng: At least they cannot be seen on the roads collecting money from bus drivers.
pcm: At least dem no fit see dem for road dey kolekt money from bus drivers dem.

eng: However, one can conclude that with the rifeness of crime, and general disintegration of society, the intelligence services have lost their bite and famed prowess, especially under this government.
pcm: However, pesin fit confirm say wit di rifeness of crime, di way di society don dey fall apart, di intelligence service don loss dem bite and famed prowess, especially for inside dis goment.

eng: How can a faceless group named FUNAM be sowing so much discord in the Nigerian society and we have intelligence services feigning ignorance?
pcm: How one group wey no get face wey dem name FUNAM dey plant dat kind plenty wahala for inside Nigeria society and we get intelligence service wey dey komot eye?

eng: Whoever is putting out statements on behalf of FUNAM is certainly playing a childish game on the minds of Nigerians but even professors believe them.
pcm: Whoever e be wey dey put statement out for FUNAM dey play small pikin play for inside di mind of Nigeria pipo but even professor dem dey believe dem.

eng: This is because at the end, we are very emotional people in this country.
pcm: Dis one na bikos, for di end, for dis kontri we dey very emotional.

eng: However, the intelligence services have deliberately looked away while all this has been going on.
pcm: However, di intelligence service don komot eye as if say dem no see as all dis things dem dey go on.

eng: I googled statement by FUNAM just to be able to get some direct quotes for this article and up popped a statement from 2018
pcm: I google statement by FUNAM so I go fit get some direct quote for dis article and one statement from 2018 pop komot

eng: wherein this same FUNAM claimed that Nigeria is their only inheritance and that the whole of Nigeria up to the Atlantic belongs to them, that Plateau is their indigenous territory, even as they claimed responsibility for some gruesome killings.
pcm: wiain na dis same FUNAM claim say Nigeria na dem only inheritance and say di whole of Nigeria go reach di Atlantic na dem get am, say Plateau na dem indigenous territory, even as dem dey claim say na dem do some bad bad kilin dem.

eng: In recent times, the same group claimed that it attacked Benue Governor Ortom, and only missed killing him because of some slight technical communications error.
pcm: For recent times, di same group claim say na dem attack Benue Governor Ortom, and only dem no see am kill bikos of some kind small error for communication.

eng: The group went further to say Our intention is unequivocal: TO KILL HIM.
pcm: Di group further tok am say dem intension no get doubt: TO KILL AM.

eng: The mission will one day be fulfilled and very soon too.
pcm: Dem go fulfil di mission one day and e go dey very soo too.

eng: Furthermore, We warn collaborators working against Fulani people across Nigeria: WE SHALL GET YOU irrespective of your hidden place
pcm: Furthermore, we warn pipo wey dey collabo to take work against Fulani pipo for inside Nigeria: WE GO GET YOU NO MATTER WIA YOU HIDE

eng: We state clearly, any state or individual that opposes RUGA will be confronted.
pcm: We tok am clearly, we go confront any state or individual wey dey oppose RUGA

eng: Any State or individual that opposes ranching, we shall get you.
pcm: Any State or individual that opposes ranching, we shall get you.

eng: Speak against ranching and RUGA even on the internet: Our Noiseless fighters shall find and fix you
pcm: Speak against ranching or RUGA even for internet: awa fighters dem wey no dey make noise go find you and dem go fix you

eng: In the next few months, FUNAM will carry out attacks on strategic human and material assets of States and Non State groups or individuals known for their anti-Fulani campaigns¦ We shall hunt you down in your houses, in your work places, in your car, in your streets.
pcm: For di next few month wey go follow, FUNAM go attack some strategic human and material assests for inside states and non state group dem or individual wey we know say dem dey do anti Fulani campaign. We go hunt you down for your house, for your wrk place, inside your car, for your street.

eng: It's a matter of time.
pcm: a matter of time.

eng: People sign these documents but no one has been apprehended, neither has the statements been declared fake by our intelligence services.
pcm: Pipo sign dis document but dem neva catch any person, and awa intellingence serveice dem neva declare say na fake.

eng: From my own humble perception these statements are childishly written by someone who wants to foment trouble and arouse public anger and disunity in general.
pcm: From my own humble perception dis satement dem be like pikin tok, wey pesin wey dey look for wahala, wey wan make pipo vex, wey wan cause disunity write.

eng: The statements also deflect from focusing on real perpetrators.
pcm: Di statement also take eye away from di real pipo wey dey do di bad.

eng: I have been on many WhatsApp groups trying to calm people down by bringing attention to the fact that their minds are being manipulated.
pcm: I be don dey on top plenty WhatsApp group dem wey I dey try to calm pipo down and bring dem attention say dem dey manipulate dem mind.

eng: But why am I doing DSS job?
pcm: But why I dey do work wey DSS suppose do?

eng: Even Ortom had earlier called a press conference at which he read another statement that this group put online to the extent that Benue State belongs to them and that it was their pleasure to kill Tiv people!
pcm: Even Ortom don call press conference before wia im for read anoda statement wey di group put for online to di extent say Benue state na dem own and dey e dey sweet dem to kill Tiv pipo dem!

eng: A lot of Nigerians have been hailing Ortom for being a governor who loves his people for these public shows.
pcm: Plenty Nigeria pipo don dey hail Ortom say im na governor wey love im pipo on top im public show dem.

eng: However, those who attacked him must be found.
pcm: However, dem must catch pipo wey attack am.

eng: We hear that the police have arrested some fishermen in the area.
pcm: We hear say police don catch some fishermen for inside di area.

eng: I have become a bit wary as every crime in Nigeria is now attributed to herders.
pcm: I don dey careful as dem put evri crime for Nigeria on top herders dem.

eng: Are we not leaving the space open for other criminals to ride on our sentiments?
pcm: Shey no be say we dey give oda criminals dem space to ride on top awa sentiment?

eng: Are we saying with all the resources at the behest of our intelligence services, no one can fish out those dumping things online, stewing up the minds of Nigerians, causing mayhem all over the place and even getting people primed to the idea of war and national disintegration?
pcm: Shey wetin we dey tok be say with all resources dem wey awa intelligence service dem get, pesin no dey wey fit find di pipo wey dey dump things for online, wey dey stew up di mind of Nigerians, wey dey kos wahala evriwia and wey dey get pipo prepare for war or make nation scatter?

eng: Is this the best that we can do really gentlemen?
pcm: Shey na di best wey we fit do be dis gentlemen?

eng: Harry-Meghan interview: Queen is sad, says Buckingham Palace
pcm: Interview wey Harry-Meghan do: Queen dey sad, as Buckingham Palace take tok am

eng: Queen Elizabeth II has expressed sadness over the interview granted by her grandson, Prince Harry, and his wife Meghan.
pcm: Queen Elizabeth II don show say she sad concerning di interview wey her grandson, Prince Harry, and im wife Meghan do.

eng: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex had in the interview narrated the conversations around about
pcm: Di Duke and Duchess of Sussex for di interview narrate di conversation wey dey for air about

eng: how dark Archies
pcm: how dark Archies

eng: (their newborn child) skin might be and how the child would not be given a royal title and police protection.
pcm: (pikin wey dem just born) skin fit be and how dm no go give di pikin royal title plus police protection.

eng: However, Buckingham Palace said in a statement on Tuesday that the Palace is saddened by the challenges faced by her grandson Prince Harry and his wife Meghan, and takes their allegations of racism in the royal family seriously.
pcm: However, Buckingham palace tok for inside one statement on Tuesday say di palace no dey hapi with di challenge wey di grandson Prince Harry and im wife Meghan dey face, and dem go take di allegation of racism for di royal family seriously.

eng: The whole family is saddened to learn the full extent of how challenging the last few years have been for Harry and Meghan.
pcm: Di whole family no hapi to hear di full extent of how challenging things don dey for Harry and Meghan for di last two years.

eng: The issues raised, particularly that of race, are concerning, the palace said in a statement released on the queen's behalf.
pcm: Di issues dem wey dem raise, especially di one wey concern race, dem conmcern di palace, as di palace tok for inside one statement wey dem release on Queen behalf.

eng: While some recollections may vary, they are taken very seriously and will be addressed by the family privately.
pcm: While some kind recollection dem fit vary, dem atke all of dem very serious and di family go chook eye put for private.

eng: Harry, Meghan and Archie will always be much-loved family members.
pcm: Harry, Meghan and Arcie go always be family member wey we love very much.

eng: More than 12 million viewers viewed the British broadcast of Oprah Winfrey's interview with Meghan and Prince Harry on Monday night.
pcm: E pass 12 million viewers wey view di British broadcast of di interview wey Oprah Winfrey do with Meghan na d Prince Harry on top monday.

eng: The interview also attracted a 54 percent share of the television audience at the time.
pcm: Di interview be also attract 54 percent share for di television audience as at dat time.

eng: Fury vs Joshua will be in Saudi Arabia in August  Hearn
pcm: Hearn tok say Fury vs Joshua got apun for inside Saudi Arabia for August

eng: Saudi Arabia will host the world heavyweight boxing title unification fight between Tyson Fury and Anthony Joshua in August, promoter Eddie Hearn said on Tuesday.
pcm: Saudi Arabia go host di world heavyweight boxing title unification fight between Tyson Fury and Anthony Joshua for August, as promoter Eddie haern tok am on Tuesday.

eng: Joshua holds the IBF, WBO, WBA and IBO titles while fellow Briton Fury is the WBC belt holder.
pcm: Joshua dey hold di IBF, WBO, WBA, and IBO title dem as fellow British pesin Fury na holder of di WBC belt.

eng: August the seventh, August the 14th.
pcm: Na August seventh, August fourteen.

eng: I think it's a very bad secret that the fight is happening in Saudi Arabia, Hearn told Sky Sports television.
pcm: I thingk say no be secret say na for Saudi Arabia di fight go apun, as Hearn tell Sky Sports television.

eng: It's the same people we did the deal with for Andy Ruiz, that event was spectacular.
pcm: Na di same pipo wey we follow deal for Andy Ruiz, di event dey spectacular.

eng: As partners they were fantastic as well, he added.
pcm: As partner dem do fantastic as well, he added.

eng: Joshua won back his belts from Mexican-American Andy Ruiz Jr in Diriyah, on the outskirts of the Saudi capital Riyadh, in December 2019.
pcm: Joshua be win im belt back from Joshua won back his belts from Mexican-American Andy Ruiz Jr for Diriyah, for di  outskirts of  Saudi capital Riyadh, for December 2019.

eng: Why secession is not the silver bullet to Nigeria's challenges (II)
pcm: (II) Why secession no be di silver bullet to di problem wey Nigeria get (II)

eng: The proponents of Nigeria's break up hinge their reasons on three main pegs; the 1914 amalgamation of the northern and southern protectorates which gave birth to Nigeria, the United Nation's charter on self-determination and allegations of lack of representation and marginalisation in the affairs of the country.
pcm: Di pipo wey dey do say make Nigeria break up put am on top three main reason dem; di amalgation of northern and southern protectorate for 1914 wey born Nigeria, di charter of sef determination for inside United Nation plus lack of representation and marginalisation for inside di affairs of di kontri.

eng: The notion that the 1914 amalgamation which secessionist groups say was the foundational move from which most of the current challenges facing the Nigerian nation emanated need to be vigorously challenged and totally debunked.
pcm: The mind say na di amalgamation of 1914 wey secessionist group dey say be di foundamental move wey cause plenty inside di current challenge dem wey dey face Nigeria need make dem challenge welwel and debunk am totally.

eng: In this regard, it will benefit us to know that there was an earlier amalgamation in 1906 where the Lagos colony which had been in existence in 1862 was merged with the southern protectorate.
pcm: For dis regard, e go benefit us to know say amalgation be don apun earlier for 1906 wia dem merge di Lagos colony wey don dey since 1862 wit southern protectorate.

eng: Like the subsequent 1914 amalgamation which seems to enervate the secessionists, the 1906 amalgamation too was a forced one between unwilling entities which had little or no cultural similarities.
pcm: Like di 1914 amalgamation wey follow wey dey enervate di secession pipo dem, di amalgamation wey apun for 1906 too na force dem take do am between entity dem wey no dey willing and dem get little or no cultural similarity.

eng: Pray what did the peoples of the coastal states in the Niger Delta region have culturally and historically with the Yorubas of the Southwest?
pcm: Wetin di pipo of costal state for inside Niger Delta region get culturally and historically wit Yoruba pipo of southwest?

eng: What links historically and culturally do the Igbos in the eastern hinterland have with Yorubas for that matter?
pcm: Wetin be di historical and cultural link wey di Igbo wey dey for east hinterland get wit Yoruba for dat matter?

eng: As far as can be deduced, the reasons for rejecting the 1914 amalgamation also suffice for the one of 1906 in that they were both a forcible measure against peoples of different historical and cultural backgrounds.
pcm: As far as we fit see am, di reason to take reject di amalgamation of 1914 go reach for di one of 1906 on top say na force dem force di two against pipo wey get different history and culture.

eng: Why then do the secessionists harp only on the 1914 amalgamation to press home their demands neglecting conveniently the 1906 amalgamation?
pcm: Why secession pipo dey only tok about di 1914 amalgamation to take press dem demand and dem dey neglect di one wey apun for 1906?

eng: The reasons are simply because for their own narrow political narratives and ends which seek to justify a North versus South secessionist agenda the 1914 amalgamation narrative is more suitable.
pcm: Di reason dem dey simple bikos for dem own narrow political tok wey dey try justify North vs South secessionist agenda na di 1914 amalgamation enter am pass.

eng: It would not make good strategy if they also have to cite the 1906 amalgamation which essentially, by import and effect, was similar to the one of 1914.
pcm: E no go form beta strategy if dem dey also tok about di amalgamation wey dey essential, by import and effect, and e dey similar to di one wey apun for 1914.

eng: How would it look for instance if Oduduwa secessionists say that the 1906 amalgamation was the reason why Igbos who are of different historical and cultural background have come to  dominate the economic and commercial life of Lagos and as such the Oduduwans are seeking out of this marriage with the Igbos forced on them by the British?
pcm: How e go take look for instance if Oduduwa secessionist tok say na bikos of si amalgamation for 1906 di Igbo wey get different history and culture don kom dominate di economic and commercial life inside Lagos and as such di Oduduwa dey seek to komot for di marriage with Igbo wey di British pipo be force on top dem.

eng: Or the Igbos claiming that the 1906 amalgamation was responsible for the skewered nature of economic infrastructure being concentrated in the Southwest which compels them (Igbos) to have to invest in the Lagos economic zone rather than the East at great inconvenience?
pcm: or di Igbo dey say na di amalgamation of 1906 kos the bad nature of economic infrastructure wey dem concentrate put for Southwest wey dey carry dem (Igbo) kom invest for Lagos economic zone rather than di East wey go dey convienient pass?

eng: Another fallacy being peddled about the 1914 amalgamation which was purportedly signed by representatives of Nigerian entities, was that it was to expire after a hundred years meaning by 2014.
pcm: Anoda falacy wey dem carry concerning di 1914 amalgamation be wey Nigerian entity dem represent sign be say e supoose expire afta hundred years wey mean say na 2014.

eng: That Nigeria is still existing after the expiry date of 2014 is something the secessionists are trying to instigate other Nigerians to agitate against and ensure the end of this expired contraption as they call Nigeria.
pcm: Say Nigeria still dey exist afta im expiry date na somethingg wey secessionist dem still dey try to instigate oda Nigeria pipo against and make sure say dem end of dis joinjoin wey don expire as dem dey call am.

eng: Again this is as near a namby pamby narrative as it can get.
pcm: Again dis one na near tok wey no get leg.

eng: By 1914 the British had established full and total control of the territory we now call Nigeria as all pre-existing entities such as they were had become subsumed under British rule.
pcm: By 1914 di British don get full and total kontrol of di territory wey we dey cal Nigeria now and all di entities as dem be don dey under British rule.

eng: British colonial rule over Nigeria had been unquestionably established which made the amalgamation a purely administrative measure by a colonial overlord for which he did not need the permission of his subjects to carry out.
pcm: Dem don establish di British colonial rule on top Nigeria and na dat one make di amalgamation pure administrative measure by colonial overload wey im no need permision from im subject to carry am out.

eng: In this regard the amalgamation could not have been time bound as claimed, and it was not.
pcm: For this regard di amalgamation no fit get time to expire as dem dey claim, and e no get.

eng: If ever there was a time for the amalgamation to expire as claimed, it had to be at the end of the British colonial enterprise which at the time was not in the reckoning of the British.
pcm: If time ever dey for di amalgamation to take expire as dem dey claim, e suppose be for di end di British colonial enterprise wey be say at di same time no be British go determine am.

eng: If there was a genuine document that contained the terms and condition of the 1914 amalgamation including the signatories representing various pre-existing Nigerian entities as well as clause stating the date of expiry, the onus is on those peddling such as basis for the break-up of Nigeria to present it as proof to us of their justification.
pcm: If any genuine document dey wey carry di terms and condition of di 1914 amalgamation wey include pipo wey represent various pre-existing Nigerian entities plus clause wey dey state di clause for di expiry, na di work od di pipo wey dey pray for Nigeria to break up to present am as proof.

eng: In any case, even if such a document existed, with Nigeria's independence in 1960 it ceased to be valid because all entities in Nigeria at the time partook through their elected representatives to discuss and agree on terms to be part of the new country.
pcm: For any case, even if such document dey, as Nigeria take get independence for 1960 e no go dey valid again bikos na evri entity for Nigeria dey take part wit di representative wey dem elect to take discuss and agree on top di new kontri.

eng: If an agreement such as being bandied about on the amalgamation existed and if the parties that took part in the independence talk agreed for its retention and inclusion in the independence constitution, it would have become a relevant constitutional and legal case for the secessionists to cite in their agitations.
pcm: If di kind agreement wey dem dey carry about di amalgamation dey anywia and if di parti dem wey follow tok about di independence agree to retain am and dem include am inside di independence constitution, e for don bikom relevant constitution and legal case for di secession entity to take cite dem agitation.

eng: On the issue of the UN provision on self-determination as cited by the secessionists for their action, it is important to bear two important points in mind.
pcm: On top di issue of di UN provision on sef-determination as dem take cite am for dem secession action, e dey important make dem get two important point for mind.

eng: The UN is not a world government with executive powers to superimpose its will on national governments.
pcm: Di UN no be world goment wey get executive power to take stamp dem will on top national goment dem.

eng: A country can invoke the principle of sovereignty to block the implementation of any UN resolution it considers in conflict with its national interests.
pcm: Kontri fit use di principle of sovereignty to take block any resolution wey UN make if dem see say e no follow dem national interest.

eng: Although Nigeria is signatory to the UN charter including the provision on self-determination, it can and has the right to block any attempt by any group within it to break-up the country by latching on to that provision.
pcm: Although Nigeria follow sign to di UN charter wey di provision of sef-determination follow, e fit and dem get right to block attempt from any group withing wey wan break di kontri if dem use dat provision.

eng: Thus even in the unlikely event of any break-away group in Nigeria securing UN support, Nigeria can within its sovereign rights stand against such a move.
pcm: Thus even as e dey unlike say any group break away from Nigeria and UN support am, Nigeria fit use dem sovereign right to stand against such move.

eng: But what is more significant is that although the UN charter provides for self-determination, the UN places a great onus on seeking such to prove their credentials and case comprehensively.
pcm: But di thing wey dey more significant be say although di UN charter dey providde sef detrmination, di UN don place great onus to take seek dem credential and case comprehensively.

eng: The process of seeking and eventually getting UN support for a self-determination bid is a very complicated and convoluted one which will take years to come to fruition and may not result in success ultimately.
pcm: Di process to take ssek and to eventually get di support of UN for sef-determination bid dey very complicated and covoluted one wey fit take year to set and e still fit no get success at di end.

eng: Those seeking to invoke the UN principle of self-determination for their secessionist bid must first of all prove that they have the mandate of the people of the area they seek to represent through popular elections or referendum and not through the media or internet.
pcm: Those seeking to invoke di UN principle of sef-determination for dia secessionist bid must first of all prove say dem get di mandate of di pipo of di area dey seek to represent through popular elections or referendum and not through di media or internet. Di pipo wey dey try to evoke UN principle of sef-determination for dem secessionst bid must firts prove say dem dey do wetin pipo for di area wey dem dey represent want wit popular election or referendum no be through media or internet.

eng: They must also show proof that the area seeking to secede has been denied or does not have adequate representation at local, state and national levels of the government of the country.
pcm: Dem must to show proof say di area wey want do secession dem don dey deny dem or say dem no get adequate representation for local, state and national level of di goment of di kontri.

eng: (To be concluded next week)
pcm: We go conclude am next week

eng: Lebanon starts its COVID-19 vaccination drive, PM says will wait his turn
pcm: Lebanon don start dem COVID-19 vaccination drive, PM tok say im go wait for im turn.

eng: Lebanon started its COVID-19 vaccination drive on Sunday by inoculating the head of critical care at its biggest public hospital, followed by 93-year-old celebrated Lebanese actor and comedian Salah Tizani.
pcm: Lebanon be start dem COVID-19 vaccination drive for Sunday as dem take inoculate di head for critical care unit for dem public hospital wey big pass, na di 93-year old Lebanese actor plus comedian wey pipo celebrate Salah Tizani follow am.

eng: Battling a sharp spike in infections in recent weeks which has overwhelmed its healthcare system, Lebanon took delivery of 28,500 doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine on Saturday, the first batch of 2.1 million doses set to arrive in stages throughout the year.
pcm: As dem dey fight rise of infection for recent weeks wey pass wey don pass di power of dem healthcare system, Lebanon kolekt 28,500 doses of di Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine on Saturday,na di first set inside 2.1 million dose wey go dey kom stage by stage throughout di tear.

eng: Delays in signing a deal to purchase a vaccine and the rollout of an inoculation programme had caused frustration in Lebanon.
pcm: Di delay to take sign deal to buy vaccine and di to take rollout inoculation program don cause fraustration inside Lebanon.

eng: The World Bank, which helped fund the first batch of doses, has said it would monitor the inoculation drive to ensure the shots go to those most in need.
pcm: Di World Bank, wey help wit money to buy di first batch of doses, don tok say dem go monitor as dem dey do di inoculation drive to ensure di shot go reach pipo wey need am pass.

eng: I will not be receiving the vaccine today, for today is not my turn and the priority is for the medical sector that has done its duty and presented big sacrifices,
pcm: I no dey kolekt vaccine today bikos today no be my turn and di priority na for di medical sector wey don do dem duty and present big sacrifice,

eng: caretaker Prime Minister Hassan Diab told reporters at the Rafik Hariri hospital, where Lebanon's first coronavirus case was quarantined about a year ago.
pcm: Hassa Diab wey be caretaker Prime Minister tell reporters dem for inside di Rafik Hariri hospital wia dem for put di first coronavirus case inside Lebanon for quarantine about one year ago.

eng: Tizani, who is better known by his stage name Abou Salim, encouraged everyone to get the vaccine.
pcm: Tizani, wey dem sabi pass with im stage name Abou Salim, encourage evri pesin to go get di vaccine.

eng: For those who are afraid to get vaccinated, I swear by God, it is protection for them, he said.
pcm: For pipo wey dey fear to kolekt di vaccine, I swear on top God, na protection for dem, as e tok.

eng: The country has also booked 2.7 million doses through the global COVAX scheme for poorer countries and officials
pcm: Di kontri don also book 2.7 million dose through di global COVAx scheme for kontri dem wey poor and official

eng: say talks are underway for some 1.5 million doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine.
pcm: say dem don dey tok for some 1.5 million doses of di AstraZeneca vaccine.

eng: The total number of doses ordered so far would cover about half of Lebanon's population of more than six million, which includes at least a million Syrian refugees.
pcm: Di total nomba of dose wey dem don order so far go cover about half of di pipo wey dey inside Lebanon wey pass six million, wey include at least one million refuge from Syria.

eng: Lebanon has been under a 24-hour curfew for nearly a month, although the government began lifting some restrictions this week.
pcm: Lebanon don dey under 24-hour curfew for almost one month, di goment begin to dey lift some kind restriction dis week.

eng: BIC launches 2021 Art Master contest
pcm: BIC don launch 2021 Art Master contest

eng: BIC has announced the launch of its continent-wide art competition that will see to a grand prize of $2,000.
pcm: BIC don announce dem don launch dem art competition wey dey for di whole continent wey go see to grand prize of $2,000.

eng: The stationery giant is searching for talented ball pen artists to submit their exceptional artwork for an opportunity to be named the Art Master of Middle East and Africa, a statement by the company indicated on Sunday.
pcm: Di giant on top station sellin dey serach for ball pen artist wey get talent say make dem submit dem exceptional artwork for opportunity to take name dem as ARt Master for inside Middle Eats and Africa , on statement wey di company do for Sunday indicate am.

eng: The BIC Art Master competition was first held in South Africa in 2017 and, following its success, it grew to include all of Africa in 2019.
pcm: Di BIC Master competition na im dem first do for inside South Africa for 2017, and as e dey follow di success, e grow reach all of AFrica for 2019.

eng: Deputy General Manager, Lucky Stationery Nigeria Ltd and Senior Sales Manager West & Central Africa, Mr Guillaume Grou, said, With our diverse Nigerian culture, we are excited to be launching this year's edition of the BIC Art Master Competition that acts as a platform to recognize and showcase African talents.
pcm: Deputy General Manager, Lucky Stationery Nigeria Ltd and Senior Sales Manager West & Central Africa, Mr Guillaume Grou tok say wit awa culture for Nigeria wey dey diverse, we dey excited to dey launch di edition of BIC Art Master Competition for dis year wey dey act as platform to take showcase African talents dem.

eng: The grand prize for the competition is $2,000, a personalized online gallery and an opportunity to be featured as part of the BIC Art Collection.
pcm: Di grand prize for di competition na $2,000, one personal gallery online and opportunity to feature as part of di BIC Art Collection.

eng: The second prize winner will walk away with a $1,000 cash prize, and the 2nd runner-up will win a $500 cash prize.
pcm: Di second prize winner go carry $1,000 cash prize komot, and di second runner-up go win $500 cash prize.

eng: This contest is open for Africa and Middle East residents only.
pcm: Dis contest dey open for pipo wey dey Africa and Middle East alone.

eng: FG gets N392bn tax from companies in 3 months
pcm: FG get N392bn as tax from company dem inside 3 months

eng: The federal government has gotten N392.77 billion as Company Income Tax (CIT) from breweries, telecommunications companies, and others in the first quarter of 2021.
pcm: Di federal goment don get N392bn as Company Income Tax (CIT) from breweries dem, telecommunication company plus odas inside di first quarter of 2021.

eng: According to data on CIT published yesterday by the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS), the amount was higher than the N295.72bn generated in the fourth quarter of 2020.
pcm: According to data wey National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) publish on top CIT yesterday, di amount pass di N295.72bn wey dem generate inside di fourth quarter of 2020.

eng: Daily Trust also observed that it was higher than the N295.68bn generated in the first quarter of 2020.
pcm: Daily Trust be also observe say e high pass di N295.68bn wey dem generate inside di first quarter of 2020.

eng: The tax revenue growth in the first quarter of 2021 further represented 32.82 percent quarterly increase and 32.84 percent yearly increase.
pcm: Di growth on top tax revenue inside first quarter of 2021 dey further represent 32.82 percent quarterly increase and 32.84 percent yearly increase

eng: Breweries, bottling and beverages generated the highest CIT of N23.26bn and closely followed by professional services that includes telecoms with N18.17bn.
pcm: Breweries dem, bottling and beverages generate di highest CIT wey reach N23.26bn and professional services wey include telecoms dey close to follow am  with N18.17bn.

eng: State ministries and parastatals generated N17.35bn
pcm: State ministry and parastatals dem generate N17.35bn

eng: while textile and garment industry generated the least of N13.49 million.
pcm: As textile and garment imdustry generate di one wey low pass wey be N13.49 million.

eng: Mining was higher at N34.40m while Automobiles and Assemblies generated N73.57m.
pcm: Mining dey higher at N34.40m as Automobiles and Assembles generate N73.57m.

eng: The report showed that out of the generated amounted in the first quarter, N152.33bn was from local industries while N184.59bn was generated as foreign CIT payment.
pcm: Di report show say di amount wey dem generate inside di first quarter, 152.33bn na from local industries dem as dem generate N184.59bn as foreign CIT payment.

eng: NBS reported that the balance of N55.85bn was generated as CIT from other payments.
pcm: NBS report say di balance of N55.85 na im dem generate as CIT for oda payments dem.

eng: Trump impeachment article heads to U.S. Senate
pcm: Di impeachment article of Trump don head to U.S.

eng: A second impeachment trial of former U.S. president, Donald Trump is set to come a step closer.
pcm: A second impeachment trial for former U.S president, Donald Trump don almost carry one step close.

eng: The U.S. House of Representatives prepares to forward the article of impeachment to the Senate.
pcm: Di House of Representative for inside U.S dey prepare to forward di article of impeachment to di senate.

eng: Carrying the charge of incitement to sedition, the article is to be read before the second chamber of Congress at 7 p.m. on Monday evening (
pcm: Carrying di charge of incitement o sedition, dem go read di article for inside di second chamber of congress at 7 p.m on monday evening (

eng: Trump is facing an unprecedented second impeachment trial based on a charge of incitement of insurrection over the deadly storming of the Capitol by pro-Trump rioters on January 6.
pcm: Trump dey face unprecedented second impeachment trial base on charge say im incite pipo make pro-Trump rioters for stand up and storm Capitol for January 6.

eng: According to impeachment rules, the arrival of the indictment article at the Senate formally triggers the start of the impeachment trial, which will be the first faced by a president after leaving office.
pcm: According to wetin dey inside impeachment rule dem, as di indictment article dey arrive na im go trigger di start of impeachment trial, na im go be di first wey president wey don komot for office go face.

eng: However, Senate leaders have agreed to modify the rules by having the impeachment article delivered on Monday evening and then delaying the actual start to Feb. 8.
pcm: However, senate leader dem agree to modify di rule to take deliver di impeachment article for Monday evening and dem go delay di actual start to Feb. 8.

eng: The Capitol attack
pcm: Di attack for Capitol.

eng: A violent mob of his supporters attacked the Capitol just after he used fiery rhetoric at a rally to promote baseless claims of election fraud.
pcm: Violent pipo for im supporters be attack di Capitol just afta im use fiery rhetoric for rally to take promote election fraud wey no get base.

eng: The attack, which sought to halt lawmakers certification of now-President Joe Biden's victory in the November election, left at least five people, including a police officer dead.
pcm: Di attack wey wan hold di certification of di president now Joe Biden win for di November election, kill at least five pipo including police officer.

eng: In the Senate, a two-thirds majority is needed to convict.
pcm: For inside di senate, dem need two-thirds majority to convict.

eng: It is unclear how many Republicans might join the Democrats in such a vote, which could also bar Trump from holding office again.(dpa/NAN)
pcm: E dey unclear how Republicans fit join di Democrats for dat kind vote, wey fit also bar Trump from holding any office again. (dpa/NAN)

eng: Court convicts 39 tricycle, bike riders without permit
pcm: Court convict 39 tricycle, bike riders without permit

eng: A mobile court sitting in Benin has convicted 39 people for operating tricycles and motorcycles without rider's permit.
pcm: One mobile court wey dey sit for inside Benin don convict 39 pipo say dem dey operate tricycle and motorcycle and dem no get permit.

eng: The prosecutor, Mrs P O. Ovbiagele, had told the court that the 39 people were apprehended within Benin-Agbor road axis, riding their bikes and tricycles without permit.
pcm: Di prosecutor, Mrs P O. Ovbiagele don tell di court say dem catch di 39 pipo around Benin-Agbor road side, wey dem dey ride bike and tricycle without permit.

eng: According to Ovbiagele, the offence is punishable under section 9(4) and 27 of the Second Schedule of the Edo Traffic Control and Management Agency Law, 2010.
pcm: According to Ovbiagele, di offence get punishment under section 9(4) and 27 of di second SChedule of di Edo Traffic Control and Management Agency Law, 2010.

eng: The accused persons pleaded guilty to the offence and asked for leniency.
pcm: Di pesin dem wey dem accuse beg say dem dey guilty and make dem dey soft wit dem.

eng: The Chief Magistrate, Mutairu Oare, thereafter, convicted the 39 persons and ordered them to pay N5,000 fine each, and obtain the rider's permit within 24 hours.
pcm: Di chief Magistatrate, Mutairu Oare, thereafta, convict di 39 persons dem and he order dem say make dem pay N5,000 fine per person, and make dem go get di rider permit withing 24 hours.

eng: According to him, if they fail to obtain the permit, parking fees of N1,000 would be charged on their impounded bikes and tricycles on a daily basis.
pcm: According to am, if dem no gree get di permit, dem go charge parking fee of N1,00 on top di bike and tricycle dem wey dem impound on daily basis.

eng: Oare also said that after six weeks of non-compliance, the tricycles and bike would be forfeited to the state government.
pcm: Oare be also tok say six week dem and dem no comply, dem go forfeit di tricycle and bike to di state goment.

eng: Gunmen kill traditional ruler, 3 others in Benue
pcm: Gunmen dem don kill traditional ruler plus 3 oda pipo inside Benue

eng: Gunmen on Wednesday killed a traditional ruler, Chief Hyacinth Ajon and three other people in separate incidents in two Local Government Area of Benue State.
pcm: Gunmen for Wednesday be kill traditional ruler, chief Hyacinth Ajon plus three oda pipo for separate incident inside two local goment area for Benue State.

eng: The deceased traditional monarch was said to have been killed alongside one, Benjamin Anakula in Tse Zoola community of Makurdi LGA while two others whose names were not given were also killed in Guma area of the state.
pcm: Di traditional  monarch wey die say dem kill wit one person, Benjamin Anakula for Tse Zoola community of Makurdi LGA as dem take kill two oda pipo wey dem no give dem name for Guma area of di state.

eng: Eldest man in the community, Aho Zoola, alleged that gunmen suspected to be herders attacked the villagers at about 2:00am, shot sporadically and killed the two people.
pcm: Person wey old pass for di community, Aho Zoola, allege say gunmen wey dem suspect say dem be herders attack di village around 2:00 am, dem dey shoot anyhow, and dem kill di two pipo.

eng: according to the report of one of Governor Samuel Ortom's media aide, narrated that the attack on their rural abode came to them as a surprise because they never had any issues with herders.
pcm: According to report from one among media aide of Governor Samuel Ortom, im narrate say di attack dem do for dem rural abode na surprise for dem bikos dem no get any issue wit herder dem.

eng: The media aide, Jimmin Geoffrey, had stated that the governor was returning from a burial in the area when he had a stop over to sympathise with the villagers who are already displaced from their homes and assured them that he would do everything possible to get security agencies to the area.
pcm: Di media aide wey be  Jimmin Geoffrey, don state say di governor be dey return from one burial inside di area when im stop by to take pity wit di villager dem wey no get place to stay again and e assure dem say e go do evritin wey dey possible to take bring security pipo to di area.

eng: Similarly, the Chairman of Guma LGA, Caleb Aba, told newsmen in Makurdi by telephone that the two other people were killed on Wednesday in Mbayer-Yandev council ward of Guma.
pcm: Similarly, di chairman for inside Guma LGA, Caleb Aba, be tell newsman dem for inside Makurdi on to telefone say na Wednesday dem kill di two oda pipo for inside Mbayer-Yandev council ward of Guma.

eng: Aba however fingered suspected herders behind the killings in his domain.
pcm: Aba however be point finger to herder wey im suspect behind di killin for im domain.

eng: Dr Mahmud Tukur: Tribute to distinguished accomplishment
pcm: Dr Mahmud Tukur: Tribute to distinguished accomplishment

eng: In the end, it is not the years in one's life that count, but the life in one's years Abraham Lincoln
pcm: For di end, no be year for pesin life count, but di life wey dey inside pesin years   Abraham Lincoln

eng: The limited space available here is certainly not enough to describe the late Dr Mahmud Muhammad Tukur, a Nigerian politician and former Minister for Commerce and Industry during the administration of General  Muhammadu Buhari.
pcm: Di small space wey dey here no reach to describe di late Dr Mahmud Muhammad Tukur, politician for inside Nigeria and former minister on top commerce and industry matter  for di administration of General  Muhammadu Buhari.

eng: Tukur, who belonged to a small clique of policy advocates in Northern Nigeria, died on April 9, 2021, at the age of 82 years.
pcm: Tukur wey follow among one small clique of policy advocates for Northern Nigeria, die for April 9, 2021, for 82 years old.

eng: He has since been buried in Yola, Adamawa State.
pcm: Dem don bury since for Yola, inside Adamawa State.

eng: Dr Tukur was the 1st indigenous Director of the Institute of Administration, Kongo, Zaria.
pcm: Dr Tukur na di 1st indigenous Director of di Institute of Administration, Kongo, Zaria.

eng: He took the mantle from Prof. S.S. Richardson in 1967 until 1975 when he became the first Vice-Chancellor of the Bayero University Kano.
pcm: He kolekt di mantle from Prof. S.S. Richardson for 1967 go reach 1975 when im bekom first vice-chancellor of di Bayero University for Kano,

eng: Now recall it was the late Sir Ahmadu Bello, the Sardauna of Sokoto, who upon attaining independence of Northern Nigeria, declared before Sir Garwin Westray Bell the last Governor-General in 1957 at the Lugard Hall Kaduna, that the commitment of training the manpower in the North, which according to him On them, we will rely on the attainment of improving the health, prosperity and happiness of our people without discrimination on grounds of tribe or creed of which Dr Tukur and a few distinguished others were the foundation recruits.
pcm: Now recall say na  late Sir Ahmadu Bello, di Sardauna of Sokoto, who when im attain independence of nothern Nigeria, declare for front of Sir Garwin Westray Bell wey be di last Governor-General for 1957, for di Lugard Hall inside Kaduna, say di commitment to train di manpower for di north, which according to dem, we go rely on top di attainment of improving di health, prosperity, hapines of awa pipo wey discrimination no ge dey on ground of tribe or creed of which Dr. Tukur and small oda nomba wey dey distinguished be di  pipo wey dem first recruit.

eng: Some have said the journey of President Muhammadu Buhari into politics is incomplete without Tukur.
pcm: Some don tok di journet of Presido Muhammadu Buhari into politics no go complete without Tukur.

eng: Yes, no doubt, the description of Tukur as being among the intellectual powerhouse of the president is true since his contemporaries included Mamman Daura, Liman Ciroma, Adamu Ciroma, and Hamza Rafindadi Zayyad.
pcm: Yes, doubt no de, di description wey dem give Tukur say im dey among di intellectual powerhouse na true since im na contemporary wit pipo like Mamman Daura, Liman Ciroma, Adamu Ciroma, and Hamza Rafindadi Zayyad.

eng: Mahmud Tukur was a firm, tenacious and resolute man who led an impactful life, a man of deep conviction and inner strength, who served the North incorruptibly and enhanced the betterment of the country's democracy.
pcm: Mahmud Tukur be firm, tenacious and resolute man wey lead life wey get impact, man wey get deep conviction and inner streght, wey serve North without corruption and e enhance di betterment of democracy for di kontri.

eng: Under his tutelage as Director, Institute of Administration, Zaria, he supervised and superintended the building of a crop of the intelligentsia in the North and was deeply committed with a strong sense of duty to the building of a Nigeria that is equitable.
pcm: Under am as Director, Institute of Administration, Zaria, im supervise and superintend di building of di intelligentsia fo North and e be dey deeply committed wit strong sense of duty to take build Nigeria wey dey equitable.

eng: We can safely deduce then, that an entire genre of the past and current civil servants, private sector executives and political elites in the North passed through the hands of the late scholar who affected every facet of education and saw to the manpower upliftment of not only his the region but Nigeria at large.
pcm: E dey safe to deduce then, say entire genre of civil servants dem past and current, executives dem for private sector and political elite for di North be pass through di hand of di late scholar wet affect evri facet of education and see to di upliftment of manpower no be only for im region but for Nigeria in general.

eng: President Muhammadu, in a tribute to Tukur, said Dr Mahmud Tukur's service to the nation will be remembered by generations.
pcm: President Muhammadu, for inside tribute to Tukur, tok say geberation dem go remember  Dr Mahmud Tukur service to di nation.

eng: He had a passion for a prosperous, economically strong and united Nigeria.
pcm: E get passion for Nigeria wey go dey prosper, get strong economy and dey unite.

eng: He was a proud nationalist.
pcm: Na proud nationalist e be.

eng: Buhari recalled that as Minister of Trade in his first coming as military Head of State, Dr Tukur introduced a lot of schemes that revived the local industry, boosted exports and gave real meaning and effect to import substitution in regenerating the indigenous manufacturing sector of the economy.
pcm: Buhari remeber say as Minister of Trade for im first comin as Head of States, Dr Tukur be introduce plenty scheme wey revive di local industry, e boost export and give real meanin and effect to import substitution to regenerate di indigenous manufacturin secor for di economy.

eng: He prayed to Almighty Allah to accept him in Aljannah Firdaus and give the family, friends, the Adamawa Emirate Council and the people of the state the strength to bear this great loss.
pcm: He pray give Almighty Allah to accept am for Aljannah Firdaus and give im family, friends, di Adamawa Emirate Council and di pipo for inside di state di strenght to bear di great loss.

eng: Indeed Tukur's enviable position and competence increased his public profile in Nigeria.
pcm: Indeed, di enviable position and competence of Tukur be increase im public profile for Nigeria.

eng: It indeed takes many good deeds to build a good reputation, therefore the contributions of Tukur in the development of the education sector during his stint at Bayero University and his tireless efforts in the peacebuilding process and socio-economic development of Northern Nigeria can never be forgotten.
pcm: Indeed e go take to do plenty good things to take build good perutation, therefore di contribution wey Tukur put to take develop di education sector durin im time for Bayero University and im tireless effort on top peacebuilding process and socio-economic development of Norther Nigeria no sometin wey dem fit forget.

eng: Late Tukur, born in 1939 in Yola, Adamawa State, obtained his First Degree in International Affairs and Political Science at the University of Wales (where he was the recipient of the Elizabeth Morris Memorial Prize for graduating first in his class).
pcm: Late Tukur, wey dem born for 1939 inside Yola, Adamawa State, get im first degree for International Affairs and Political Science for di University of Wales  (wia im receive Elizabeth Morris Memorial Prize as im graduate first for im class).

eng: He also obtained a Master's Degree in Public International Affairs at the University of Pittsburgh and a PhD. in Public Management at Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria, Kaduna.
pcm: He also obtain Master's Degree in Public International Affairs for di University of Pittsburgh and  PhD. in Public Management for Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria, Kaduna.

eng: He also studied at Northwestern and Oxford Universities.
pcm: He also study for Northwestern and Oxford university dem.

eng: The deceased was a Fulbright-Hays Fellow, senior I.U.C. Fellow and associate member of St. Anthony's College, Oxford (1974).
pcm: Di deceased be Fulbright-Hays Fellow, senior I.U.C. Fellow and associate member of St. Anthony's College, Oxford (1974).

eng: He goes into history as the first Vice-Chancellor of Bayero University, Kano.
pcm: He enter history as di first Vice-Chancelor for Bayero University, for Kano.

eng: In his career as a public servant, the prominent scholar of worldwide fame served on the Adebo and Udoji National Wage Reviews and the Constitution Drafting Committee of 1976, he was also a member of the sub-committee on Citizenship Rights, Fundamental Rights, Political Parties and Electoral System under the chairmanship of Alhaji Aminu Kano.
pcm: For im career as public servant, di scholar wey dey prominent and get fame worldwide be serve for di  Adebo and Udoji National Wage Reviews and committee wey dratf Constitution of 1976, he also be member of di sub-committee on top citizenship right,  fundamental right, Political Parties and Electoral System wey Alhaji Aminu Kano be Chairman for.

eng: He was a member of the National Constitutional Conference (1994\1995) and the Vision 2010 Committee (1997).
pcm: E be member of di National Constitutional Conference (1994\1995) and di Committee for vision 2010 (1997).

eng: In 1984, during the military regime of Major General Muhammadu Buhari, he was appointed Minister of Commerce and Industries by the Federal Government.
pcm: For 1984, when Major General Muhammadu Buhari be dey do military regime, Federal goment appoint am as Minister for Commerce and Industries.

eng: A business executive, the late Tukur chaired the activities of Fukarabe Industries Limited, Kaduna, and fulfilled the obligations of many corporate directorships.
pcm: A business executive, late Tukur be chair for di activities of Fukarabe Industries Limited, Kaduna, and e fulfill di obligation of plenty corporate dictatorship dem.

eng: He was a Coordinator of Policy Analysis Limited and authored and co-authored many books, of which the most prominent is: Leadership and Governance in Nigeria:
pcm: Leadership and Governance in Nigeria: He be Coordinator for Policy Analysis Limited and write and join pipo to write plenty book dem, wey di one wey prominent pass na:

eng: The Relevance of Values, published in 1999.
pcm: Di Relevance of Values, wey dem publish for 1999.

eng: He is survived by three wives, nine children and many distinguished brothers, including the prominent global industrialist and world-renowned business mogul, Alhaji Bamanga Tukur, former Governor of the defunct Gongola State, one time Minister of Industries and ex-chairman of the People's Democratic Party (PDP) and Late Engr Hamman Tukur a former Director-General Federal Ministry of Petroleum Resources and Pioneer Chairman, Revenue Mobilization and Fiscal Commission.
pcm: Na three wives dem survive am, nine children and plenty broda dem wey dey distinguished, wey include di prominent global industrialist and business mogul wey dem worldwide Alhaji Bamanga Tukur, wey be former Governor for inside Gongola State wey no dey again, one time Minister of Industries and  past chairman for di People's Democratic Party (PDP) and Late Engr Hamman Tukur former Director-General for Federal Ministry of Petroleum Resources and di first Chairman, Revenue Mobilization and Fiscal Commission.

eng: We commiserate with Nigerians on the demise of this courageous academic, who, contrary to being also a match-maker, had a  more distinguished career in the service to the nation.
pcm: We dey commiserate with Nigeria pipo on top di quench of dis courageous academic, who apart from say na match-maker, be get more distinguished career for service give di nation.

eng: Nigeria would surely miss the statesmanship of the Adamawa born Dr Mahmud Tukur, an enigma during his lifetime, who displayed genuine magnanimity and moral courage, and who always put national interest above ethnic or group interests.
pcm: Nigeria go surely miss di statesmanship of Dr Mahmud wey dem born for inside Adamawa, na enigma durin im lifetime, he display genuine magnanimity and moral courage, and e always dey put interest of nation above di one of ethnic or group.

eng: Reputed for his uncompromising adherence to due process, he was indeed a bridge builder, ever ready to deploy his wisdom and knowledge garnered over the years for the good of his country.
pcm: Im reputation na say e dey follow due process, im na indeed bridge builder, e dey always readi to use im wisdon plus knowledge wey im don gain over di years for di good of im kontri.

eng: Dr Tukur was a man of peace and unquestionable diligence and professionalism whose death is a great loss to Nigeria.
pcm: Dr Tukur be man of peace and im deligence and professionalismno dey questionable wey im death na great loss for Nigeria.

eng: He lived an impactful life and contributed immensely to Nigeria and has etched his name on a platter of gold in the country's history.
pcm: He be live life wey get impact and contribute plenty to Nigeria and e don put im name for platter of gold for inside di history of di kontri.

eng: We all have a collective duty to keep alive his service patriotic duty for a peaceful and secured country.
pcm: All of us must to keep im service patriotic duty for peaceful and secure kontri.

eng: The federal government should immortalise him by naming any of any educative or renaming the Institute of Administration ABU Zaria in his remembrance.
pcm: Make di federal goment immortalise am as per make dem name anything wey dey follow education or di Institute of Administration ABU Zaria as im remebrance.

eng: Nigeria has indeed lost a rare gem, patriotic Nigerian par excellence, an academic extraordinaire and great author, who had served this nation meritoriously, a man of strong character and conviction who led one of the most impactful lives anyone would have wished to live, going by his well-defined roles in the growth of humanity and his untiring commitment to nation-building.
pcm: Indeed Nigeria don loss rare gem, na patriotic Nigerian par excellence, na academic extraordinaire and na great author, wey don serve dis nation wit merit, man wey get strong character and convistion wey live life wit impact wey any pesin fit wish for, as e follow im well defined role for di growth of humanity and im untiring commitment for inside nation-building.

eng: His contribution to the history of our nation and continent will never be forgotten
pcm: we no fit forget im contribution for di history of awa nation and continent

eng: In the end,  as Abraham Lincoln succinctly asserts, it is not the years in one's life that count, but the life in one's years.
pcm: For di end, as Abraham Lincoln don assert, no be year inside pesin life count, di life wey dey inside pesin years.

eng: May Allah SWT uplift his works and grant him Aljannar Firdaus.
pcm: Make Allah SWT uplift im work and grant am Aljannar Firdaus.

eng: Muhammad Gombe, a media practitioner, writes from Abuja
pcm: Muhammad Gombe, wey be media practitioner, dey  write from inside Abuja

eng: Benue warns of imminent food crisis
pcm: Benue dey warn say food crisis dey kom.

eng: The Benue State Government at the weekend raised an alarm over imminent food crisis unless the challenges of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) in various camps across the state were urgently addressed.
pcm: Di state goment inside Benue be raise alarm for weekend concernin food crisis wey fit apun unless dem address di challenge of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) dem for inside di state.

eng: Executive Secretary of State Emergency Management Agency (SEMA), Dr. Emmanuel Shior, made the observation during an interactive session with newsmen in Makurdi.
pcm: Executive Secretary for State Emergency Management Agency (SEMA), Dr. Emmanuel Shior,  be make di observation for one toktok session wit newsmen for inside Makurdi.

eng: Shior said it became necessary to sound the alarm as most of the IDPs are farmers who have been chased out of their ancestral lands occasioned by herders attacks for over two years now.
pcm: Shior tok e don bekom necessary to sound di alarm as many for inside di IDP be farmer wey dem don chase komot for dem ancestral land wey attack of herder dem kos for more than two years now.

eng: The herders are the reason why the IDPs are in camps and till date, there are still pockets of attacks around Torkula and Idyer in Guma, Moor in Kwande, as well as some communities in Agatu and Logo, he said.
pcm: Na di herders be di reason why di IDP dey for camp till date, small small attack still dey apun for Torkula and Idyer inside Guma, Moor for Kwande, and some community for inside Agatu and Logo, as e tok am.

eng: The SEMA boss said it was worrisome that the state has over 500,000 IDPs in eight designated camps across the state alongside others scattered in makeshift shelters in relatives homes while the state government continues to spend so much to fend for them.
pcm: Di oga for SEMA tok say e dey worrisome say di state get pass 500,000 IDPs for inside eight camp across di state along wit odas wey scatter for dem relative house as state goment kontinu to spend big to take care for dem.

eng: He explained that, we have spent billions of naira in taking care of the IDPs since 2018.
pcm: He explain say, we don spend billions of naira to take care of IDP since 2018.

eng: We have eight official camps housing over 500,000 IDPs in those camps.
pcm: We get eight official camp dem wey be house for over 500,000 IDP dem.

eng: He however added that Governor Samuel Ortom had put in place the IDPs disengagement plans to ensure the safe return of the IDPs to their homes, noting that with the high number of IDPs in the state, it would be difficult to just close down the camps, especially as there were still pockets of attacks and their deserted homes not safe for return.
pcm: He however add say Governor Samuel Ortom don put di IDP disengagement plan down make sure say IDP dem return to dem house safe, e note say wit di kind high nomba of IDP for inside di state, e go dey difficult to just close camp down, especially as smallsmall attack dem still dey apun and dem house neva safe to return.

eng: Elche 0-1 Atletico Madrid, May 1
pcm: Elche 0-1 Atletico Madrid, for May1.

eng: Atletico were inches away from surrendering victory and their lead at the top of the table to Real Madrid as Elches
pcm: E don remain small make Atletico surrender say dem no fit win Elchessay and dia lead ontop table give Real Madrid

eng: Fidel Chaves missed a dramatic 91st-minute penalty.
pcm: Fidel Chaves miss one penalty for 91 minutes.

eng: Fidels shot struck the post as Atletico held on for a 1-0 win that kept them two points ahead of Real Madrid and also in front of Barcelona going into a crunch meeting at Camp Nou.
pcm: Fidel shot hit post wey make Atletico hold dat 1-0 wey give dem two point pass Real Madrid and dem still dey front of Barcelona wey dem go meet for Camp Nou.

eng: Barcelona 0-0 Atletico Madrid, May 8
pcm: Barcelona 0-0 Atletico Madrid for May 8.

eng: Barcelona had the chance to shift the dynamic of the title race on their home turf but Atletico dominated the first half and Barca never did quite enough in the second.
pcm: Barcelona get chance to comot di title for Atletico hand as dem dey home but na Atletico dey carry di first half and Barca no even try for di second half.

eng: The stalemate ended up being an even better result for Atletico after Real Madrid were held by Sevilla a day later, Atletis two-point lead preserved at the end of what many had circled as a pivotal weekend.
pcm: E kon dey beta for Atletico afta Sevilla beat Real Madrid for di second day, di twopoint wey Atletico dey dey lead kon still dey like dat for di weekend.

eng: Atletico Madrid 2-1 Osasuna, May 16
pcm: Atletico Madrid 2-1 Osasuna, for May16.

eng: With nine minutes left, Atletico trailed Osasuna 1-0 at the Wanda Metropolitano and Real Madrid
pcm: As e remain nine minute, Atletico score Osasuna 1- 0 for di Wanda Metropolitano and Real Madrid.

eng: were going top of La Liga, the title in their hands, with a win against Athletic Bilbao.
pcm: Dey go ontop for LA Liga, di title for dia hand as dem win Athletic Bilbao.

eng: But Atletico pulled off an incredible turnaround, Renan Lodi equalising in the 82nd minute and Suarez scoring the winner in the 88th, with hundreds of fans celebrating outside in the stadium car park.
pcm: But Atletico kom change evrithing  as Renan Lodi equalise for 82 minutes and Suarez score for 88 minute and plenti fans dey joli outside for di car park for di stadium.

eng: The victory kept Atleti top and left them one more win away.
pcm: Na dis one make Atletico dey on top and e kon remain only one game wey dem go win.

eng: Real Valladolid 1-2 Atletico Madrid, May 22 Atletico knew victory would win them the title regardless of how Real Madrid fared against Villarreal
pcm: Real Valladolid 1-2 Atletico Madrid, for May 22, Atletico sabi say na to win go give dem di title even if to say Real Madrid win Villarreal or dem no win.

eng: but they did it the hard way, coming from behind after Valladolid took a shock lead through Oscar Plano.
pcm: But dem do am for di way wey dey hard, dem from back kom win afta Valladolid don dey win before as Oscar Plano score.

eng: But Angel Correa equalised and then Suarez scored the winner, a nervy title race decided by a nail-biting victory.
pcm: But Angel Correa kon equalise and Suarez score di winning goal, na strong race wey kon finish wit winning wey tight.

eng: Wanted Abia major drug supplier arrested with 100kg cocaine, cannabis
pcm: Dem arrest Abia big drug supplier wey dem dey find since wit 100kg of cocaine and weed.

eng: The National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) has arrested Chibuike Apolos, a notorious major supplier of illicit drugs in Abia State, during an early morning raid on his hideout at Mbawsi in Isialangwa North area of the state.
pcm: Di National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) don catch Chibuike Apolos, wey be one of di main pipo wey dey always dey supply drugs for Abia state, for one early mono raid for di place wey im dey always hide for Mbawsi for Isialangwa North area for di state.

eng: Spokesman of the agency, Femi Babafemi, said on Wednesday in Abuja that Apolos has been on the wanted list of the Abia State Command of the NDLEA since February following the arrest of one Chima Ukeleonu, the suspect behind the video that went viral in January 2021, showing a young man hawking illicit drugs on the street.
pcm: Di pesin wey tok for di agency, Femi Babafemi, tok for Wednesday for Abuja say dem don dey find Apolos for NDLEA Abia State Command since February afta dem catch one China Ukeleonu, wey dey for di video wey dey evriwia for January 2021 wey show one man wey dey sell drug for di street.

eng: According to him, it was due to the development that the 38-year-old Apolos was put on the wanted list.
pcm: As e take tok, na bikos for di development dem kon dey find Aplos wey be 38 years.

eng: Following his arrest in the early hours of Wednesday, the Abia State government has already marked his house which serves as his hideout for demolition, Babafemi said.
pcm: Afta dem don catch am, di goment  for Abia state don mark him house wey e dey hide say dem go break am down, na Babafemi tok am.

eng: He also quoted the Commander Abia State Command of the NDLEA, Bamidele Akingbade, as saying that The command has been on his trail since February this year.
pcm: He still tok say di Oga commander for di Abia State Command NDLEA, Bamidele Akingbade, dey tok say dem don dey follow am since February for dis year.

eng: Fortunately, we got a tip-off that he just received some quantities of cannabis from Edo State.
pcm: As God dey do tins, we kon hear say e just collect plenti weed for Edo state.

eng: Notwithstanding the tense security situation in the South East, especially Abia State, the command still embarked on the operation which culminated in the arrest of one Chibuike Apolos with 10 bags of cannabis weighing 100kg, 1.6 grammes of cocaine, one gramme of heroin and five grammes of methamphetamine.
pcm: Even as sekuriti wahala dey for di South East especially for Abia, State, di command still go for di operation wey make dem arrest Chibuike Apolos wey get 10 bags of weed wey weigh 100kg, dem see 1.6 grams for cocaine, one gram of heroine and five gram for methamphetamine.

eng: In a similar development, the Taraba State Command of the Agency has arrested 61-year-old Lawan Gambo Umar for trafficking 58.50kg of Cannabis Sativa.
pcm: Inside dis kain one, di Command for di Agency for Taraba State don catchcatch one Lawan Gambo wey be 61 years old say e carry 58.50kg of Cannabis Sativa.

eng: According to the state Commander of NDLEA, Suleiman Ajadi, The suspect was taking the skunk concealed inside sacks of beans chaff used to feed animals to Fune in Yobe State when our men intercepted him.
pcm: As di state commander for NDLEA, Suleiman Ajadi take tok, di pesin dey carry skunk wey dem put inside plenti sack of beans doti wey dey dey give animals chop inside Yobe state wen awa  men catch am.

eng: Rep lauds NDLEA over illicit drugs seizures
pcm: Di rep dem dey greet NDLEA say dem well done for di drugs wey dem seize.

eng: The member representing Ado/Ogbadibo/Okpokwu Federal Constituency, Dr Francis Ottah Agbo, has commended the chairman of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency, NDLEA, Brig-Gen.
pcm: Di pesinwey dey represent Ado/Ogbadibo/Okpokwu Federal Constituency, Dr. Francis Ottah Agbo, don greet di chairman for di National Drug Law Enforcement Agency, NDLEA, Brig-Gen say e well done.

eng: Mohammed Buba Marwa (rtd) for his renewed anti-drugs fight which has led to large scale seizures across the country.
pcm: Mohammed Buba Marwa (rtd) for di new way wey e dey take fight drug wey don help am seize plenti drug for di country.

eng: The lawmaker, who is also the Chairman of the Narcotic Drugs Committee, particularly praised Marwa for sanitizing the health sector by intercepting large quantities of narcotic and substandard drugs across the country.
pcm: Di lawmaker, who still be di Chairman for di Narcotic Drug Committee, don praise Marwa as e dey clean di health sector as e dey stop plenti narcotics and drugs wey no reach standard for di country.

eng: The lawmaker, in a statement by his Media Aide, Andrew Agbese, on Wednesday, said the NDLEA boss had in less than six months of assuming office, succeeded in getting the agency back on track by busting many drug rings and syndicates, as well as seizing and destroying large quantities of illicit drugs.
pcm: Di lawmaker inside one tok wey im media pesin, Andrew Agbese, tok for Wednesday, tok say di NDLEA Oga, before e reach six month wey e enta office, don carry di agency leg put for track to dey burstburst plenti place wey dem dey sell drug and to sieze and destroy plenti bad drug.

eng: Agbo, who is also the spokesman of the Minority Caucus, said NDLEA, under the leadership of the former Military Administrator of Lagos State, is reminiscent of the days of Prof Dora Akunyili in NAFDAC when fake, expired drugs and substandard food brands were reduced to the admiration of all and sundry.
pcm: Agbo, wey be di tok pesi for di Minority Caucus, tok say NDLEA for di leadership of di foma Military Administrator for Lagos State, dey remember di time wey Prof. Dora Akunyili dey NAFDAC wey fake medicine, di one wey don expire and di food wey no reach standard no plenti.

eng: I have been an advocate of optimum, staffing, equipping and funding the NDLEA to achieve its statutory mandate due to the menace of substance abuse and drug addiction in the country.
pcm: I don dey always tok say make dem do beta, carry plenti pipo join, and put moni ontop NDLEA to fit do wetin im suppose do to tanda wit drug abuse and pipo wey like drug for di kontri

eng: I have said several times that the NDLEA needs all the support to carry out its mandate
pcm: I don tok am plenti time say di NDLEA go nid plenti support to fit do dia work.

eng: but Im surprised that even with the little on the ground, the agency, under the able leadership of Gen. Buba Marwa, has been able to achieve a lot by taking the fight to the criminals and this has given me the confidence as chairman of the Narcotic Drugs Committee to further push for the necessary incentives for the agency to function at an optimal level.
pcm: But I dey surprise say even wit di small we dey ground, di agency, as e dey under di leadership of Gen. Buba Marwq, don achieve plenti time as dem dey carry fight criminals and dis one don give me strong chest as di Chairman for di Narcotic Drugs Committee say make I still dey push for wetin go make di agency fit work wella

eng: It is very clear that Marwa is the new Sheriff in town and he has proved this by clearing the doubt of drug barons, syndicates and traffickers, he said.
pcm: E dey very clear say Marwa na di new Sheriff for town and e don prove am as e dey comot all di drug baron, syndicate and di traffickers dem, Na so e tok.

eng: Daily Trust reports that the agency had in recent times made large scale seizures and arrested suspects across the country.
pcm: Daily Trust tok say d agency for recent time don sieze plenti drug and dem don catch plenti pipo for di kontri.

eng: Bayelsa vigilantes arrest 4 for buying stolen phones
pcm: Di vigilante for Bayelsa don catch 4 pipo wey go buy phone wey dem tif.

eng: Bayelsa Vigilante Security Service has nabbed a phone repairer and three others for allegedly buying phones snatched at gunpoint in the state.
pcm: Di Vigilante for Bayelsa don catch one pesin wey dey repair phone and anoda three pipo wey dey buy phone wey dem collect wit gun for pipo for di state.

eng: The state government-owned security outfit, led by its chairman, Doubiye Alagba, over the weekend, arrested four suspects, including a popular phone repairer, for buying a phone that was allegedly stolen at gunpoint in Yenagoa.
pcm: Di sekuriti wey be for di state follow di Chairman, Doubiye Alagba, for weekend, catch four pipo and one repairer wey pipo sabi wella, say dem dey buy phone wey dem thief wit gun for Yenagoa.

eng: It was gathered that men of the vigilante were acting on a tip-off that one Mr. Lawrence Oworodo was robbed of his phone and other belongings at gunpoint, when they traced the mobile phone to one Audu John in Biogbolo axis of the state capital.
pcm: We hear say di vigilante dey work as dem don hear say dem rob one Mr. Lawrence Oworodo and dem collect him phone and sometins wit gun, and as dem trace di phone reach one Audu John for Biogbolo for di state capital.

eng: Investigation by the security body also led to the arrest of three other suspects who are said to be involved in buying stolen phones in the state.
pcm: As di sekuriti don look ground, na why dem arrest three pipo wey dem dey suspect who dem tok say dem dey among di pipo wey don dey buy phone wey dem thief for di state.

eng: Alagba, in a statement made available to newsmen in Yenagoa, gave the names of the arrested suspects as Audu John, Dominic Diezibe, James Believe and David Emmanuel.
pcm: Alagba, as e dey yarn di news pipo for Yenagoa, tell dem di name of di pipo wey dem catch, Audu John, Dominic Diezibe, James Believe and David Emmanuel.

eng: We picked interest in this case because the owner of the phone was robbed at gunpoint.
pcm: We kon like dis mata bikos say na gun dey take rob di for di pesin wey get di phone.

eng: One of the challenges we face in the streets of Yenagoa today is pocket crime like this.
pcm: One of di problem wey dey Yenagoa today na pick pocket crime like dis one.

eng: I call it a pocket crime because these criminals go about with these locally made pistols to steal valuables from innocent citizens who go about their normal daily hustles.
pcm: I call am pocket crime bikos say all dis criminal go dey waka about wit gun wey dem do for Nigeria and dem go use am thief beta tin from pipo wey just dey go dia work dey hustle evriday.

eng: These four suspects were arrested through the help of a phone tracking device.
pcm: Na one phone tracker dem use arrest all di four suspect.

eng: The phone was tracked to one Audu John, who resides at Biogbolo, Yenagoa, who led us to arrest other suspects including a popular phone repairer in Amarata, Mr. David Emmanuel.
pcm: Dem track di phone reach one pesin wey be Audu John, wey dey live for Biogbolo for Yenagoa, and na im carry us go arrest di remaining pipo wit one phone repairer Amarata, Mr. David Emmanuel.

eng: Police spokesman in Bayelsa State SP Asinim Butswat confirmed the arrest, saying they are in police custody and investigation was on.
pcm: Police tok pesin for Bayelsa State, SP Asinim Butswat, confam say dem don arrest dem say dem dey police custody and dem bin dey do investigation.

eng: Ministry, CODE to track N6bn Kaduna projects
pcm: Ministry, CODE wan track Kaduna N6bn project.

eng: The Ministry of Budget and National Planning will partner with Follow The Money of the Connected Development (CODE) to track constituency projects in Kaduna valued at N6 billion in the 2020 and 2021 budgets.
pcm: Di ministry for budget and di National Planning go join bodi wit Follow di moni for di Connected Development (CODE) to track di constituency project for Kaduna wey be N6 billion for di 2020 and 2021 budget.

eng: The Minister of Budget and National Planning, Prince Clem Agba, who is also co-chair of the Open Government Partnership (OGP), said this while receiving Follow The Money activists in his office recently.
pcm: Di minister for Budget and Planning, Prince Clem Agba, who still be co-chair for di Open goment  Partnership (OGP), nah in tok dis one as dem Follow di moni kom im office.

eng: He said The Eye Mark App, a secured web and mobile-based application will be launched by the ministry to enable citizens to update information about community projects and their status.
pcm: E tok say di Eye Mark App, one website and application for phone go soon comot wey go dey make citizen dem dey write any tin wey consine di project of dia community and wia di work reach.

eng: Programmes Associate, Mr Kingsley Agu, who led the team said CODE in collaboration with the MacArthur Foundation was setting the pace to initiate governance and budgeting reforms through a campaign to deepen citizens interest in governments spending and address accompanying corrupt practices.
