pcm: Di Programmes Associate, Mr. Kingsley Agu, wey lead di team tok say CODE join bodi wit di MacAurthur Foundation dey set di pace wey go start governance and budgeting reforms from one campaign to take deep citizen interest for goment spending and tackle any tiin wey corrupt.

eng: Agu added that collaboration with the ministry was a strategic move to collectively combat corruption, illicit financial flows and track to completion, development projects in rural areas so people can have access to potable drinking water, standard healthcare and even primary education.
pcm: Agu add join say di colabo wit d ministry dey good for to joinbodi fight corruption, illict financial flow and to dey track  to finish, development of projects for village make di pipo fit dey see good water, standard health care and primary education sef.

eng: WikiLeaks founder Assange denied bail despite US extradition block
pcm: Di pesin wey get WikiLeaks, Asange don dey deny for bail even as di US extradition block.

eng: WikiLeaks founder, Julian Assange must remain in custody in Britain, while the US appeals a court decision to block his extradition to face charges there for leaking secret documents, a judge in London ruled Wednesday.
pcm: Di pesin wey get WikiLeaks, Julian Asange, must to dey custody for Britian as di US dey appeal say one court decision wey fit block im extradition to face di charges say e leak secret document, na one Judge tok am for Monday.

eng: Judge Vanessa Baraitser, who on Monday refused to grant his extradition, told Westminster Magistrates Court that if released there were substantial grounds to suspect Assange would fail to surrender for future appeal hearings.
pcm: Judge Vanessa Baraistser, wey no gree give am extradition for Monday, tell di Magistrate wey dey Westminster Court say if dem am, Assange no go wan surrender for di gearing for future.

eng: Mr Assange still has an incentive to abscond from these as yet unresolved proceedings, she said.
pcm: Mr. Assange still get how im go run comot before all di hearing process go finish, she tok.

eng: As a matter of fairness the United States must be able to challenge my decision.
pcm: Make mata no too bad, di United States suppose fit change my mind.

eng: If Mr Assange absconds during this process then they will have lost the opportunity to do so.
pcm: If Mr. Asange run comot before dem finish to dey hear, dem go don loose di opportunity wey go make dem do am.

eng: Outside court, lawyer Stella Morris, Assanges fiancee and the mother of two of his children, called the decision a huge disappointment and urged the US Justice Department to drop the charges.
pcm: For outside di court, Laywer Stella Morris, wey be Asange fiancee and pesin wey don born two pikin, tok say di decision na big disappointment say make di US Justice Department comot di charges.

eng: A lawyer for the US government earlier urged Baraitser not to release the controversial Australian publisher, and detailed how it planned to challenge her decision to block his extradition on mental health grounds.
pcm: One lawyer for di US goment  don begged Baraitser before say make im no release di Australian publisher, kom tell am how e take plan to challenge im decision to block block im extradition on top mental problem.

eng: We respectfully submit on behalf of the United States that there are insurmountable hurdles to Mr Assange being granted bail, Clair Dobbin said.
pcm: We don submit on behalf of di United States say som tins dey wey dey stop bail for Mr. Asange, na Clair Dobbin tok am.

eng: She added there were no conditions that could guarantee his surrender in future.
pcm: She kon tok say no condition fit guarantee im surrender for future.

eng: The history of his attempts to evade extradition to the United States demonstrate that he is capable of going to any length to avoid that possibility, Dobbin said.
pcm: Im history to  dodge di extradition go United State don show say e fit do any tin to see say e no apun. Na so Dobbin tok.

eng: The court should be under no doubt about his resources to abscond and pointed to offers of political asylum, notably from Mexico, she added.
pcm: Di court suppose dey under no doubt say im wan run comot and say e point finger to go political asylum, wey be bigfish from Mexico, she add join.

eng: Motive to abscond
pcm: Mind to run comot.

eng: Assange attended court wearing a suit and mask over his mouth, two days after the unexpected decision to deny his removal to the United States on the basis the risk of his suicide there was too great.
pcm: Asange wear suit and mask for him mouth go court, two days afta dem don deny say make dem carry am go United State on to say e fit kill him sef for dia.

eng: Edward Fitzgerald, his lawyer, argued he should be freed after spending 15 months in custody awaiting the extradition proceedings.
pcm: Edward Fitzgerald, wey be him lawyer, tok say dem suppose free am afta im don use 15 months to dey wait for di extradition proceedings.

eng: Baraitsers decision on Monday certainly changes any motive to abscond, he added.
pcm: Baraitser decision on  Monday don change any mind wey im get to run comot. E add join.

eng: The court has given a decision and the decision has been that he should be discharged.
pcm: Di court don tok and wetin dem tok be say make dem free am.

eng: Assange is wanted in Washington to face 18 charges relating to the 2010 release by WikiLeaks of 500,000 secret files detailing aspects of military campaigns in Afghanistan and Iraq.
pcm: Dem dey find Asange for Washington wia e go face 18 charges wey consine di 500,000 secret file wey dey tok about dem military campaign for Afghanistan and Iraq for 2010.

eng: The US claims he helped intelligence analyst Chelsea Manning steal the 2010 documents before exposing confidential sources around the world.
pcm: Di US dey claim say nah im help di intelligence analyst, Chelsea Manning, tif di 2010 document before im put di confidential sources outside for di world.

eng: He faces a possible 175-year sentence if convicted but Assange and his lawyers have long argued the case against him is politically motivated.
pcm: E dey risk 175 years be dat, if dem send am to prison, but Asange and im Lawyer dem don tok am say politics don enta di mata

eng: He has been held at the high-security Belmarsh prison in southeast London.
pcm: Dem don keep am fordi high sekuriti prison for SouthEast London.

eng: A previous request for bail in March on the grounds he was vulnerable to Covid-19 behind bars was rejected.
pcm: Dem no answer dem one time wey dem tok say make dem give am bail say e fit go catch Covid-19

eng: Assange sought sanctuary in Ecuadors embassy in 2012, after Sweden issued an arrest warrant in connection with sexual assault allegations.
pcm: Asange don see wia im go hide for di Ecuador embasi for 2021, afta Sweeden don tok say make dem arrest am say im get case for sexual assault.

eng: He spent seven years at the South American countrys London mission until the government in Quito revoked his citizenship.
pcm: E don spend seven years for di South American countrys London mission before di governmoemt for Quito tok say im no be dia citizen again.

eng: British police dragged him out and arrested him in 2019.
pcm: Di British Police drag am comot con arrest am for 2019.

eng: He was then sentenced to 50 weeks in jail for breaching his bail terms in connection with the Swedish case, which was later dropped due to lack of evidence.
pcm: Dem put am for prison for 50 weeks say e don breach im bail term as e take consine di case for Sweeden, wey dem later drop bikos say beta evidence no dey.

eng: The UN called the sentence disproportionate.
pcm: Di UN tok say di sentence no good.

eng: Unnecessarily cruel
pcm: E dey wicked for no reason.

eng: Assanges long-running legal woes have become a cause celebre for media freedom, even though the judge hearing the case said he did have a case to answer.
pcm: Di enemy dem for Asange don cause make célèbre dey for media freedom even as di Judge wey dey hear di case don tok say e no get case to answer.

eng: Baraitser on Monday said he would have been well aware of the effects of his leaking of secret documents, and his actions went well beyond the role of a journalist.
pcm: For Monday, Baraitser tok say e go don sabi wetin fit hapun before e leak di secret document kom outside, and wetin e do pass di work of a journalist.

eng: But she said extradition would be oppressive as his mental health would probably deteriorate in the US penal system, causing him to commit suicide.
pcm: But she tok say di extradition go dey oppress am and e fit affect im brain for di US penal system, wey fit make am kill him sef.

eng: She rejected US experts testimony that Assange would be protected from self-harm, noting that others such as disgraced US financier Jeffrey Epstein had managed to kill themselves in custody despite supervision.
pcm: She no gree wit wetin di US experts tok say dem go keep Asange make e no do any tin to im sef say oda pipo like di US financier, Jeffrey Epstein, wey dem disgrace, don manage kill dia sef even as dem dey always dey watch dem.

eng: UN rapporteur on torture
pcm: Dem dey torture one UN reporter.

eng: Nils Melzer applauded the decision to block his extradition, and said he should be freed and compensated for his ordeal, which amounted to arbitrary detention.
pcm: Nils Melzer dey clap as dem block im extradition, e kon tok say make dem free am and give am som tin for wetin im eyes don see, wey make dem put am for detention wey no get any reason.

eng: But he said Baraitser had effectively confirmed the rationale behind the US case, which effectively amounts to criminalising national security journalism.
pcm: But e tok say Baraitser don confam wetin dey for di US mata wey be say dem dey make di national journalist be like criminal.

eng: The United States has called the ruling extremely disappointing and has faced calls from WikiLeaks, as well as rights and media freedom groups to drop the appeal.
pcm: Di United States don tok say di ruling no dey good say dem don dey receive call from WikiLeaks and di right and media freedom group say make dem drop di appeal.

eng: Media advocacy group Reporters Without Borders said Wednesdays denial of bail was unnecessarily cruel.
pcm: Di group wey dey always fight for di media pipo, Reporters Without Borders, tok say as dem no give am bail for Wednesday na wickedness.

eng: Wikileaks editor-in-chief Kristinn Hrafnsson urged outgoing US President Donald Trump and his successor Joe Biden to pardon Assange, while expressing confidence justice will prevail.
pcm: Di editor-in-chief for WikiLeaks, Kristinn Hrafnsson, tok say make di president  for US wey dey go, Donald Trump, and di pesin wey go dey dia afta, Joe Biden say make dem release Assange, as im dey sure dem say justice go prevail.

eng: Ahmed Musa set to make NPFL return against Adamawa Utd
pcm: Ahmed Musa wan make di NPFL kom back against Adamawa Utd.

eng: Kano Pillars have said their new signing, Ahmed Musa will make his debut against relegation bound Adamawa United on Sunday, May 16.
pcm: Kano pillars don tok say dia new signing, Ahmed Musa, go play im first match against Adamawa Utd wey don dey relegation for Sunday, May 16.

eng: This was disclosed on Sunday in a statement by Pillars Spokesman, Alhaji Idris Rilwanu Malikawa immediately after their 1-1 draw against Warri Wolves in Ozoro.
pcm: Na wetin tok pesin fot Pillars, Alhaji Rilwanu Malikawa,  tok for Sunday as dem play draw draw wit Warri Wolves for Ozoro.

eng: Pillars who were reduced to 10-men in the first half of the match took the lead through Auwalu Malam Ali in the 58th minute before Mark Daniel scored the equaliser for the hosts from the spot in the 86th minute to force the former Nigerian champions to a 1-1 draw.
pcm: Di Pillars wey dem reduce to 10 player dem for di first half carry di lead wit Auwalu Malam Ali for 58 minute before Mark Daniel kom score di equalizer for di host for 86 minute wey make di forma Nigeria Champion carry 1-1 draw.

eng: Malikawa said Pillars have since returned to Kano where they would intensify preparations for their next match against Adamawa United.
pcm: Malikawa tok say di Pillars don go back Kano wia dem go go prepare wella for di next match wey dem get wit Adamawa United.

eng: The Spokesman also quoted the Technical Adviser of Pillars, Ibrahim Musa as saying The next thing for us is to go and concentrate on match day 21 against Adamawa United FC at Ahmadu Bello stadium kaduna next week.
pcm: Di tok pesin tok wetin di Technical Adviser for Pillars, Ibrahim Musa tok, say di tin wey remain for us na to go focus on top di match wey we get wit Adamawa United FC for day 21 for Ahmadu Bello Stadium for wey dey Kaduna next week.

eng: Playing against a relegated team is not easy but we would do our best to win the maximum points in order to consolidate on our position and target for the season.
pcm: To dey follow relegatin team play no dey easy but we go try say make we win plenti point so we go fit stay for wia we dey and watin we dey targer for di season.

eng: Varsity workers to FG: Campus security men need guns
pcm: Pipo wey dey work for University tell di FG say: Campus sekuriti men nid gun.

eng: The president of the Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities (SSANU), Mohammed Ibrahim Haruna, says his members are no long safe on campuses.
pcm: Di Oga pata pata for di Senior Staff Association for Nigeria Universities (SSANU), Mohammed Ibrahim Haruna, tok say im pipo no dey safe for campus again.

eng: He called on the Federal Government to license the use of guns for local security men on various campuses to protect the institutions.
pcm: E call di Federal goment  make dem register gun for di sekuriti men wey dey all di campus to dey protect di school.

eng: He was addressing newsmen in Abuja at the weekend after the National Executive Council (NEC) meeting of the association.
pcm: E dey follow di nes pipo tok for Abuja for di weekend afta dem finish di Natioanl Executive Council (NEC) meeting for di association.

eng: He said this would help all the established security agencies already overwhelmed with security challenges.
pcm: E tok say e go help all di sekuriti agency wey work don dey choke.

eng: Were here to deliberate on a wide range of issues.
pcm: We dey here to tok mata wey plenty.

eng: Topmost among those issues is the security of our members who work in the university environment.
pcm: Di mata wey big pass na di sekuriti mata for we pipo who dey work for inside di university.

eng: Our members cant travel freely, they cant move around with ease, anytime they do so, they get kidnapped.
pcm: Our pipo no fit travel as dem like, dey no fit waka around as dem like, anytime wey dem do am, dem dey kidnap dem.

eng: This is unacceptable!
pcm: E no dey acceptable!

eng: Were calling on the federal government to license our security men on campuses who are our members, train and re-train them from time to time and monitor them.
pcm: We dey call di Federal goment  make dem put license for awa  sekuriti pipo wey dey for campus, make dem dey train dem evri time and dey monitor dem.

eng: By doing this, security challenges in our institutions will reduce, Haruna said.
pcm: If dem do dis tin, di sekuriti problem for awa  school dem go reduce, na wetin Haruna tok.

eng: He cautioned the government against paralyzing academic activities in tertiary institutions again with its lackadaisical attitude towards the implementation of the Memorandum of Action (MoA)
pcm: E warn di goment  make dem no kill di academic activities for di tertiary institution again as dem dey do like say di Memorandum of Action (MoA)  no consine dem.

eng: both parties signed.
pcm: Na di two of dem sign.

eng: He explained only three of their eight demands had been addressed partially by the government.
pcm: E tok say na only three tin out of di eight tin wey dem don ask n aim goment don do small for inside.

eng: He said the association might resume its suspended strike soon if the issues that had continued to make members poorer than expected were not quickly addressed.
pcm: E tok say di association fit continue di strike wey dem stop if dem no settle di mata wey dey make dia pipo dey  bikom  poorer as we no expect.

eng: Biden makes history, declares century-old killing of Armenians genocide
pcm: Biden don make history as he tok say di kilin, wey don be like one century, of di Armenians na genocide.

eng: President Joe Biden has formally recognized the Ottoman Empires killing and deportation of Armenians over a century ago as a genocide.
pcm: Presido Joe Biden don recognize di Ottoman Empire kilin and as dem deport di Armenians like one century ago say na genocide.

eng: The declaration is a break from his predecessors and risking inflaming tensions with Turkey, a NATO ally.
pcm: Di declaration na break from hin predecessors and be  risking inflaming tensions wit dem Turkey, natoally

eng: Biden had pledged as a presidential candidate to recognize the Armenians treatment, which took place in modern-day Turkey, as genocide.
pcm: Biden don tok say aspesident candidate him go recognize di Armenian treatment, wey take place for modern day Turkey, as genocide

eng: Armenian-Americans have long called on U.S. presidents to do so, but Turkey, a key NATO ally, has warned the U.S. against it, long maintaining that the violence was part of bloody clashes during World War I.
pcm: Americans don long call U.S president make him do am so, but  Turkey, wey be key natoally,don warn U.S against am,long maintaing say di violence dey part of bloody clashes during world war I

eng: The Turkish government of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has not yet responded to Bidens designation, but its foreign minister warned earlier this week a declaration would make relations worse.
pcm: DI  Turkish goment wey be President Recep Tayyip Erdogan neva respond to Biden designation, but hin foreign miniters don warn before for dat week say declaration go make relation worse

eng: for dia first call for Biden tenure and convey him interest for constructive bilateral relationship wit expanded area of cooporation and effective management and disagreementBidens tenure ” and conveyed his interest in a constructive bilateral relationship with expanded areas of cooperation
pcm: Ties wey dey between di two allies don increase for recent years, although Biden don finally tok to Erdogan on Friday

eng: Biden used the word genocidein a statement to mark Armenian Remembrance Dayon Saturday ” 106 years after the events that the Armenian diaspora considers the start of the genocide.
pcm: Biden don tok say aspesident candidate him go recognize di Armenian treatment, wey take place for modern day Turkey, as genocide

eng: Previous presidents had avoided using the label even as they made the traditional, annual proclamation honouring the anniversary.
pcm: Previous presidents don avoid to dey use di label even as dem don make di traditional,annual proclamation honawaing anniversary

eng: Each year on this day, we remember the lives of all those who died in the Ottoman-era Armenian genocide and recommit ourselves to preventing such an atrocity from ever again occurring,Biden said in the statement.
pcm: each year on dis Friday, we remember di lives of all those ho kpeme for Ottoman era Armenian genocide and recommit awaselves to prevent dat kind atrocity from apuning again Biden tok am for him statement

eng: Beginning on April 24, 1915, with the arrest of Armenian intellectuals and community leaders in Constantinople by Ottoman authorities,
pcm: Beginning on April 24, 1915, wit di arrest of Armenian intellectual and community leader for Constantinople by Ottoman authories

eng: one and a half million Armenians were deported, massacred, or marched to their deaths in a campaign of extermination.
pcm: One and half million Armenians na hin dey deport, massacre, or marched to dia death for one campaign of examination

eng: The statement was expected, especially after then-candidate Biden marked last years remembrance day by saying, Silence is complicity.
pcm: Di statement dey expected, especially afta wen before candidate Biden mark last year remembrance day by saying silence na complicity

eng: If we do not fully acknowledge, commemorate, and teach our children about genocide, the words never again lose their meaning,he wrote, pledging to back a congressional resolution that recognized the Ottoman Empires actions as genocide.
pcm: we no too fully acknowlege, commemorate, and teach awa pikin about genocide, di word neva again lose dia meaning him write, con pledge to back congressional resolution wey recognise di Ottoman Empireal action as genocide

eng: Resolutions to recognize the genocide passed the House and Senate in 2019, but
pcm: Resolution to recognize di genocide pass di house and senate for 2019, but

eng: former President Donald Trump, like his predecessors, never joined them.
pcm: Former President Donald Trump, like him predecessors,neva join am

eng: On Wednesday, over 100 bipartisan members of Congress sent a letter to Biden calling on him to use his proclamation to officially label what happened a genocide.
pcm: On Wednesday, na over 100 bipartisan members for congress send letter to Biden wey dem dey call on am make him use him proclamation to officailly label atin apun for genocide

eng: The Ottoman Turks deported around 2 million Armenians starting in 1915.
pcm: Di Ottoman Turks deport around 2 million Armenians wey start for 1915

eng: Around 1.5 million Armenians are estimated to have been killed.
pcm: Around 1.5 million Armenians na hin dey estimate wey dem don kill

eng: The Turkish government has agreed that fighting during the war killed many, but it has long denied that the treatment of the Christian Armenians by the Muslim Ottomans amounted to genocide and says that the death toll was lower.
pcm: Di Turkish goment agree say fight during di war kill many, but e don long denie say di treatment of di christian Armenians by di Muslim Ottomans amount to genocide and tok say di death toll dey lower

eng: Over two-dozen countries have recognized the atrocities as genocide, according to the Armenian National Institute, a Washington-based group that advocates for the genocide designation.
pcm: over two dozen kontri don recognise di atrocities as genocide , according todi Armenian National institute, wan Washington base group ey advote for di genocide destination

eng: Bidens statement carries no legal implication, and even if the State Department were to follow up with a formal declaration, there are no automatic sanctions or other penalties that kick in.
pcm: Biden statement carry no legal implication, and even if di state deparment dey follow up wit a formal declaration, automatic sanction or oda penaltie ey kick in

eng: On its final day with former President Donald Trump in office, the Trump administration declared the Chinese governments treatment of Uighurs and other Muslim ethnic minorities as genocide, without implementing sanctions.
pcm: For hin final day wit former President Donald Trump for office, di Trump administration declare di Chinese goment treatment of Uighurs and oda Muslim ethnic minority as genocide, witout implementing sanctions

eng: But the comments will rattle U.S.-Turkish relations, already on ice over a litany of disagreements, and could damage relations between Biden and Erdogan, who had a warm relationship with Trump.
pcm: But di comment wey shake U.S Turkish relation already dey on ice over litany of disagreement, and wey fi damage relations between Biden and Erdogan, wey get good relationship wit Trump

eng: Trump often touted his friendshipwith the strongman president and repeatedly pulled punches against his government until his hand was forced by political pressure, including from congressional Republicans.
pcm: Trump dey always tout hin friendship wit di strong president and repeatedly pull punches against hin goment until hin hand dey force by political pressure,includin from congressional Republicans

eng: Minneapolis reaches $27m settlement with Floyd family
pcm: Minneapolis don reach $27m settlement wit Floyd family

eng: The family of George Floyd, the Black man who died while being arrested by a white police officer in Minneapolis, has reached a $27 million settlement with the Minnesota city, lawyers for the family announced Friday.
pcm: Di family of George Floyd, di Black man wey kpeme wen white police officer for Minneapolis arrest am, don reach $27 million settlement wit di Minnesota city, di family lawyer dem announce am on Friday

eng: The settlement is the largest pre-trial settlement in a civil rights wrongful death case in US history,the family lawyers said in a statement.
pcm: Di settlement na di largest pre trial settlement for one civil right wrongful death case for US history; na di family lawyer tok di statement

eng: Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin is currently on trial facing murder and manslaughter charges in connection with Floyds
pcm: Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin dey currently face trial wey dey face murder and manslaugher charges wey dey get connection wit Floyd

eng: Three other officers also face charges.
pcm: Three oda officer dey also face di charges

eng: Prince Philip interred in royal vault of St Georges Chapel
pcm: Dem bury Prince Philip for royal vault wey dey St Georga chapel

eng: Prince Philips coffin has been interred in the royal vault of St Georges Chapel.
pcm: Prince Philip cofffin na hin inter for di royal vault of St Georga chapel

eng: It was placed on a catafalque on a marble slab and lowered into the vault by an electric motor.
pcm: Na on top catafalque on top marble slab sey put am and  eletric motorput am inside di vault.

eng: The vault was created between 1804 and 1810 for George III, who died in 1820 and is one of three kings buried there.
pcm: Di vault na hin dem create between 1804 and 1810 for George III, wey kpeme for 1820 and hin dey one of di three king wey dem bury der.

eng: The other two are George IV and William IV.
pcm: Di order two na George IV and William IV

eng: Horns were played as his coffin was lowered down.
pcm: Dem play horn as hin coffin dey go down

eng: A blessing was given by the Archbishop of Canterbury before the choir sang the national anthem, God Save the Queen.
pcm: Archbishop of Canterbury give blessin before di choir sing di national anthem, make God save di Queen

eng: The members of the royal family looked up as the choir sang while the queen bowed her head.
pcm: Di member of di royal family look up as di choir sing wen di queen bow her head

eng: The 94-year-old monarch was then led out of the church by the archbishop and followed by her family members.
pcm: Dey con lead di 94 year old king comot for di church, by di archbishop di family member kom follow

eng: Prince William, her grandson, was seen glancing back at the vault as he left his pew.
pcm: Prince William, her grandson na hin dey see dey glance back for di vault as him leave hin pew

eng: In the funeral procession which departed Windsor Castle to the chapel was Queen Elizabeth II, who was driven in a car.
pcm: For di funeral procession wey comot from Windsor Castle do di chapel na hin Queen Elizabeth II, wey dem carry wit car

eng: It was her first appearance in public since the death of her husband.
pcm: Na her first appearance for public since di death of her husband

eng: Philips coffin had been draped with his personal standard and was driven in a green military Land Rover Defender.
pcm: Philip coffin na hin dey drap wit hin personal standard and dey con drive for one green military Land Rover Defender

eng: The children of Queen Elizabeth and Prince Philip “ Prince Charles, Prince Andrew, Princess Anne and Prince Edward “ walked behind the Land Rover.
pcm: Di pikin of Queen Elizabeth and Prince Charles, Prince Anne and Prince Edward waka for di back of di Land Rover

eng: Also in the procession were the Earl of Wessex, Prince Harry, Peter Phillips, Prince William, Vice Admiral Tim Lawrence, and the Earl of Snowdon.
pcm: Earl of Wessex, Prince Harry, Peter Philips, Prince William, Vice Admiral Tim Lawrence, and di Earl of Snowdon sef follow for di procession

eng: Queen Elizabeth II followed behind in a car.
pcm: Queen Elizabeth II follow dey back of di car

eng: For the eight-minute procession, a gun was fired by the Kings Troop Royal Horse Artillery from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle.
pcm: For di eight minute procession, na hin di king Troop Royal Horse Artillery wey dey East lawn of Windsor Castle dey fire gun

eng: Farmer murdered in FCT community
pcm: Dem farmer wey dem kil for FCT community

eng: A 32-year-old farmer, Yusufa Adamu, has been hacked to death by at Gada-Biyu village in Kwali Area Council of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT).
pcm: 32 years old farmer, Yusufa Adamu, na hin dem hack to death for Gada Biyu village for Kwali Area Council for di Federal Capital Territory FCT

eng: A resident of Gada-Biyu, Abdullahi Yahaya, said the incident happened on Friday evening when the Adamu was returning from his farm and was attacked with a machete.
pcm: Wan resident of Gada Biyu, Abdullahi Yahaya tok say di incident apun for Friday evenin wen di Adamu dey com from hin farm wey dey kom attack am wit machete

eng: According to him, the family of the deceased raised alarm after he was not seen at home on Friday and that members of the vigilante mobilised to the farm on Sunday where they discovered the decomposing body of the farmer with machete cuts.
pcm: Accordin to am, di family of di decease raise alarm afta wey dem see am for house for Friday and say member of di vigilante mobilise go di farm for Sunday wia dem discover di bodi of di farmer wit machete cut

eng: The spokesperson of the FCT Police Command, ASP Maryam Yusuf, was yet to reply to a text message sent to her phone to confirm the incident.
pcm: Di tok tok pesin wey dey FCT Police Command, ASP Maryam Yusuf, neva reply to di text message wey dem send to confirm di incident

eng: Another INEC office set ablaze in Imo
pcm: Anode INEC office na hin dey throw fire for Imo

eng: Another office of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) have been set ablaze in Imo State.
pcm: Anode office wey be Independent National Electoral Commission INEC own na hin dey set ablaze for Imo state

eng: Daily Trust gathered that the located at Okwudor in Njaba Local Government Area of the state was burnt down on Sunday morning.
pcm: Daily Trust gather say di location wey dey Okwudor for Njaba Local goment Area for di state na hin dey burn down for Sunday mornin

eng: The incident is coming less than 24 hours after Atta police station, customary and high courts were burnt down in the same local council.
pcm: Di incident dey apun less dan 24 hours afta dey burn Atta police station, customary and high court down for dat same local council

eng: INEC Public Relations Officer in the state, Mrs. Emmanuella Opara, confirmed the development.
pcm: INEC Public Relation officer for di state, Mrs Emmanuel Opera, confirm di development

eng: Last week, INEC had raised an alarm over the burning of its offices nationwide, saying the action might undermine the conduct of future elections.
pcm: last week, INEC raise alam ova di burnin of dia office nationwide, dey tok say di action fit undermine di conduct of future election

eng: The commission said no fewer than 41 INEC offices have been burnt this year alone.
pcm: Di commission tok say no fewer dan 41 INEC office na hin dey burn for only dis year

eng: How support tools, others can uplift 41.5m MSMEs
pcm: How support tool, order fit uplift 41.5m MSMEs

eng: Nigerias Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) industry is not being optimised as it should be in spite of its critical role in national development.
pcm: Nigeria Micro, small and Medium Enterprises MSMEs industry no dey optimise as e suppose be upon dia critical role for national development

eng: Although MSMEs contribution to the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) has not been clear because of the lack of structure and data, the narrative is fast changing.
pcm: although MSMEs contribution for di Gross Domestic Product GDP neva clear bikos of lack structure and data, di narrative dey change fast

eng: According to data by the Small and Medium scale Enterprises Development Agency of Nigeria (SMEDAN) and the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS), there are about 41.5 million MSMEs in Nigeria.
pcm: Accordin to data wey di small and Medium scale Enterprises Development Agency of Nigeria SMEDAN and di National Bureau of Statistics NBS, e dey about 41.5million MSMEs for Nigeria

eng: Collectively they account for about 50 percent of Nigerias GDP.
pcm: Togeda, dia account na about 50 percent for Nigeria GDP

eng: There is growing consciousness of the critical role MSMEs play in economic development.
pcm: To dey grow  consciousness na critical role MSMEs play for economic development

eng: Beyond job creation, MSMEs are critical to improving the living standards of citizens as well as important local capital formation.
pcm: Afta job creation, MSMEs dey critical to dey improve di livin standard of citizen  wey local capital formation

eng: They also help drive innovation and competition in developing economies.
pcm: Dey kom hep drive innovertion and competition for developin economies

eng: Towards boosting the growth of MSMEs, there have been several MSMEs-supported programmes by the federal government through the Development Bank of Nigeria (DBN), Bank of Industry (BOI), Bank of Agriculture (BOA), SMEDAN and the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) which has been the biggest enabler of small businesses.
pcm: As dey wan boost di growth of MSMEs, plenti MSMEs-supported programmes don dey from di federal goment thru di Development Bank of Nigeria (DBN), Bank of Industry (BOI), Bank of Agriculture (BOA), SMEDAN and di Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) wey don be di  biggest enabler of small small business dem.

eng: The CBN intervenes with soft loans disbursed through the deposit money banks and the microfinance banks, especially the NIRSAL Microfinance bank.
pcm: Di CBN intervene wit di growth of MSMEs,

eng: Aside from the public sector-sponsored initiatives, there are private sector entities striving to support MSMEs sector.
pcm: Apart from say public sector sponsor initiative, private sector entities dey wey dey strive to support MSMEs sector

eng: One of these is the MTN Revv programme which helps small businesses rethink and re-learn their operations to enable them to mitigate the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic.
pcm: One of dis na di MTN Revv programme wey dey hep small business think well, make learn dia operation well join so e go allow dem mitigate di effect of COVID-19 pandemic.

eng: This year, 200 MSMEs were selected to be a part of MTNs accelerator programme, Yello 200, from across the country.
pcm: Dis year, 200 MSMEs na hin dey select make e be part of MTN accelerator programme, yello 200, from across di kontri

eng: The participants had a series of 11 master-classes by seasoned facilitators across various subsectors of the economy.
pcm: Di participant don get series of 11 master class by season facilitator pass various subsector for di economy

eng: At the graduation ceremony recently, some beneficiaries and the coordinators spoke about the programme.
pcm: For di graduation ceremony recently, some beneficiaries and coodinator speak for di programme

eng: Olubukola Ogunmola, CEO of Wanbuk and Device which produces pap, said he has benefited immensely.
pcm: olubukola Ogunmola wey be di CEO of Wanbuk and Device wey dey produce pap, tok say him get plenti benefit

eng: Our workforce has also grown to enable us to meet the demands of our growing customers.
pcm: awa workforce don dey grow to allow us meet di demand of awa growin customers

eng: Another beneficiary, Daniel Ikwong, CEO of Future IDEAS said: I have been well equipped with best practices and thoroughly enjoyed every bit of the Yello 200 onboarding experience; the business has not been the same again.
pcm: Anoda beneficiary, Daniel Ikwong, CEO of Future IDEAS tok say: I been dey well equipped wit best practices dem and I enjoy every bit of the Yello 200 onboardin experience wella; di business no go be di same again.

eng: Also, Raheem Yusuff Olatunji, CEO, Yutex Entertainment said for him, the programme was a rewarding experience.
pcm: Also, Raheem Yusuff Olatunji wey be di CEO, Yutex Entertainment tok say for am, di programme na for rewardin experience

eng: Im now a better manager of my business.
pcm: now I be beta manager for my business

eng: It couldnt have happened at a better time because the effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on my company was enormous.
pcm: E fit don apun for beta time bikos di effect of Covid 19 pandemic  wey dey on top my company plenti

eng: The Chief Enterprise Business Officer, MTN Nigeria,
pcm: Di chief Enterprise Business Officer, MTN Nigeria

eng: Lynda Saint-Nwafor, said, With MSMEs accounting for 94% of all businesses in Nigeria and 84% of employment.
pcm: Lynda Saint Nwafor tok say wit MSMEs wey go dey account for 94% for all business for Nigeria and 84%  for employment

eng: So our goal is to empower MSMEs with the tool to make them thrive in the economy.
pcm: awa goal na to empower MSMEs wit di tool to make dem thrive for di economy

eng: Modupe Kadri, Chief Financial Officer, MTN Nigeria, said: We have always believed SMEs are the wheels that drive any economy and that positioning them for growth means empowering and enabling them with the right digital solutions.
pcm: Modupe Kadri, Chief Financial Officer, MTN Nigeria, tok say: We don always believe SMEs as wheels wey dey drive any economy and if you position dem for growth, e mean say you dey empower and you wan enable dem wit di right digital solutions.

eng: Equally, Coca-Cola Nigeria Limited and the Whitefield Foundation recently empowered over 20,000 individuals with business skills across the 36 states of Nigeria through the Special Intervention Programme (SIP).

pcm: Malam Kwangwama tok say,we no get any fertiliser from goment truout di season, and na dat one make am difficult for plant grow early

pcm: Di  small bag wey we fi buy for market for N12,000 per bag kom late and e no fi help grow high reach chest, wey e dey normally high reach so tey e go fit produce plenti seed

pcm: Na bikos say buyers dey always wait for produce, and wey dey to do well

pcm: Di roselle seed coat or cover na hin dem dey use produce d popular zobo juice for Nigeria, wey dey consider use for di treatment of stomach pain, high blood pressure, weight loss, among odas

pcm: For some kontri, dem dey use am for tea production, colourin, dyein, drug production and bicosmetic

pcm: Wen CBN launch di Anchor Borrower programme ABP for five year wey we don use comot, e no for true anticipate di scale of success di programme go record and di impact across di kontri

eng: But five years down the line, Nigerias agricultural landscape has changed for good and no one single region or state is left behind.
pcm: Five years wey we don use pass, Nigeria agricultue landscape don change from good and e no get region or state wey dey behind

eng: Also, it is significant to note that the benefits have been almost evenly distributed from the north to the south from the about N700 billion released for the targeted crops and animals, and their value chains.
pcm: E dey significant to note say di benefit don almost distribute from di north to di south pass N700 billion wey dey don release for di target crop and animal, and dia value chain

eng: Speaking recently in Ado Ekiti at the public unveiling of the Ekiti rice pyramid project and flag-off of the wet season rice cultivation, the CBN Governor, Mr Emefiele, said over N300bn of the about N700bn already distributed for agriculture, has been disbursed to the southern part of country including Lagos, Edo, Ekiti, and Ondo states.
pcm: As he dey tok recently for Ado Ekiti for di public unveilin of the Ekiti rice pyramid project and flag-off of di wet season rice cultivation, di CBN Governor, Mr Emefiele, tok say ova N300bn of di moni wey almost reach N700bn wey dey don already distribute on top agriculture, dey don share am for di southern part of country includin Lagos, Edo, Ekiti, and Ondo state dem.

eng: He said 21 agricultural commodities have been the most targeted, among which included rice, maize, wheat, oil palm, cocoa and several others.
pcm: Hin tok say 21 agriculture commodity na e dey target pass di rest wey be Rice, maize, wheat, oil palm, cocoa and di rest

eng: From inception till date, we have financed 3,107,890 farmers for the cultivation of 3,801,397 hectares across 21 commodities through 23 Participating Financial Institutions in the 36 States of the Federation and FCT,he said.
pcm: He tok say;From di beginnin till date, we don give 3,107,890 farmers moni for di cultivation of 3,801,397 hectares across 21 commodity through 23 Participatin Financial Institutions for di 36 State of the Federation and FCT.

eng: Emefiele noted that the positive impact of the Anchor Borrowers Programme can be seen in all our agrarian communities as it has brought hope to the farming population through the timely delivery of agricultural inputs and the provision of a guaranteed market for their outputs at a market determined price.
pcm: Emefiele tok say dem fit see di positive impact of di Anchor Borrower Programme or all ourr agrarian community as e don bring hope kom di farmin population through di timely delivery of agricultural inputs and di provision of  market wey get guarantee for dia outputs for price wey di market go determine.

eng: He said the ABP has been able to support some of our macroeconomic objectives by enabling more employment opportunities, driving financial inclusion and improving access to finance in our rural communities.
pcm: Hin tok say ABP don fit support some of awa macro economic objective as to dey allow employment opportunity wey dey drive financial inclusion and to dey provide access to finance for awa rural community

eng: Under the 2020 wet season RIFAN-CBN partnership, he said CBN financed 221,450 farmers for the cultivation of 221,450 hectares in 32 States.
pcm: For under 2020 wet season RIFAN CBN partnership, hin tok say CBN finance 221, 450 farmer for di cultivation of 221,450 hactare for 32 state

eng: The pyramids being unveiled today are part of the harvest from the various fields from the South-West and other neighbouring States to demonstrate the spread of the movement and provide evidence that rice production is viable in all States of the Federation.
pcm: Di pyramidswey dem open today dey part of di harvest from di different field from di South-West and oda neighbourin States to demonstrate di spread of di movement and provide evidence say rice production dey viable for all di State wey dey di Federation.

eng: He said beyond RIFAN, the CBN supported a number of prime/private anchors.
pcm: hin tok say pass RIFAN, CBN support number of prime/private anchor

eng: Omoluabi Farms (Ekiti), Time Sellers (Ogun), Truechem (Ogun), Wems Agro (Ondo) and many more awaiting disbursements for the 2021 wet season.
pcm: Omoluabi farm( Ekiti), time seller(Ogun), Wems Agro(Ondo) and di rest dey wait disbursement for 2021 season

eng: Thus, CBNs huge support for agriculture is ensuring food sufficiency, empowerment of peasant farmers and helping to save foreign exchange for Nigeria as less food imports happen.
pcm: CBN big support for agriculture na to ensure say food dey sufficient, empowerment for dem small farmer and to dey help save foriegn exchange for Nigeria as small food import dey apun

eng: The CBN has continued to rev up investments in the agricultural space.
pcm: CBN don continue to carry up investment for di agriculture space

eng: It has commenced the 2021 wet season farming investments.
pcm: E don start di 2021 wet season farm investment

eng: Emefiele said: We have a very optimistic outlook for the 2021 wet season.
pcm: Emefiele tok say we get optimistic outlook for di 2021 wet season

eng: We will bring to bear our learning experiences over the past years, adoption of hybrids and high yielding varieties, timely supply of inputs to take advantage of the planting seasons, and good market linkages to sustain our effort at increasing production.
pcm: We go bring to bear our learnin experience ova di past years, adoption of hybrids dem and high yieldin varieties dem, supply of inputs wey go dey on time to take advantage of di plantin seasons dem, and good market linkage use sustain our effort to dey increase production.

eng: We have planned a minimum one million hectares of rice through a combination of RIFAN farmers and prime/private anchors for each planting season in 2021.
pcm: We don plant minimum one million hactares of rice through combination of RIFAN farmer and prime/private anchors for each plantin seeason for 2021

eng: Our backward integration drive with rice millers is also gaining momentum as we intend to finance some millers to grow their own paddy during this wet season.
pcm: awa backward integration dey drive wit rice millers e dey also gain momentum as we intend to finance some millers to grow dia own paddy for dis wet season

eng: We also have aggressive production plans for maize, wheat, soybeans, cassava, sorghum and cassava,he said.
pcm: He tok say; We get aggressive production plans for maize, wheat, soybeans, cassava, sorghum and cassava,

eng: The governor also indicated that the CBN will be helping states with funds to clear land as land clearing is a huge problem to farming.
pcm: Di governor sef indicate say di CBN go dey hep states wit moni to clear land as land clearin na big problem for farmin.

eng: Land clearing, access to irrigation, and availability of high yielding seeds have remained the greatest challenge to increased agricultural production in the South and we have provided long term financing options targeted at unlocking more land for agricultural production nationwide.
pcm: Land clearin, access for irrigation, and availability of high yieldin seeds don remain di greatest challenge to increase agricultural production for di South and we don provide long term finance option dem wey go dey give more land for agricultural production nationwide.

eng: The Accelerated Agricultural Development Scheme (AADS) and the Private-Sector Led Accelerated Agricultural Development Scheme (P-AADS) were established to address this concern for the State Government and Private Sector players respectively.
pcm: Dem create di Accelerated Agricultural Development Scheme (AADS) and di Private-Sector Led Accelerated Agricultural Development Scheme (P-AADS) say make dem solve dis issue for di State Goment and Private Sector players respectively.

eng: The provision of other farm related infrastructure like irrigation facilities, rural access road, mechanization services, logistics and post-harvest handling activities can be accommodated under these interventionshe stated.
pcm: He tok say; Di provision of oda farm wey relate to di infrastructure like irrigation facilities, rural access road, mechanization services, logistics and post-harvest handlin activities fit dey under dis intervention.

eng: He also said if farmers pay their loans, the CBN could intervene in more areas thus urging the farmers who benefited from the loans to pay back.
pcm: He tok sef say if farmers pay dia loans, CBN fit put hand for more areas thus urgin di farmers wey benefit from the loans make dem pay back.

eng: Loan repayment is the hallmark of every credit cycle and the sustainability of the programme is hinged on farmers ability and willingness to repay their loans, and we are constantly engaging with them to enhance their trust in the system.
pcm: Loan repayment na di hallmark of every credit wey pipo collect and the sustainability of di programme dey on top farmers ability and willingness to repay dia loan, and we dey engage dem wella wit dem to increase dia trust for di system.

eng: The pyramids being unveiled today are harvests from the financed fields that have been submitted as part of loan repayment by farmers under the RIFAN-CBN programme.
pcm: The pyramid dem wey dey unveil  today na harvests from di financed fields dem wey dem been submit as part of loan repayment by farmers dem under di RIFAN-CBN programme.

eng: To further create value and transfer these gains across the value chain, we have mapped rice millers to off-take the paddies, and we will track the release of their outputs to the market, as we strive to manage inflation and grow the rice value chain in Nigeria,he said.
pcm: He tok say;To further create value and transfer dis gain across di value chain, we don map rice millers wey go dey off-take di paddies, and we go track di release of dia outputs to di market, as we dey strive to manage inflation and grow di rice value chain in Nigeria.

eng: In support of the growth recorded in this drive to attain self-sufficiency in food production and to moderate prices of agricultural commodities, Mr President has approved the resuscitation of the Nigeria Commodity Exchange (NCX).
pcm: To support di growth wey dem record for dis drive to attain self-sufficiency for food production and to moderate price dem of agricultural commodities, Mr President don approve di resuscitation of di Nigeria Commodity Exchange (NCX).

eng: A vibrant commodity exchange will significantly enhance post-harvest handling, guarantee effective pricing for farmers, minimize the adverse effect of middlemen and commodity hoarders and ultimately transfer the gains from primary production to other nodes of the value chain.
pcm: A vibrant commodity exchange enhance post-harvest handlin, guarantee effective pricin for farmers dem, minimize di adverse effect of middlemen and commodity hoarders and ultimately transfer to gains from primary production  oda nodes of di value chain.

eng: Considering the huge market and high population of Nigeria with the urgent need to eradicate poverty, it has successfully demonstrated the need to look inwards by taking advantage of the available fertile land, perennial river bodies and human resources for the production of rice.
pcm: Considerin di kind huge market and high population of Nigeria wit di urgent nid to end poverty, it don successfully demonstrate di nid to luk inside by takin advantage of di available fertile land, perennial river bodies and human resource dem for di production of rice.

eng: The first two years of the programme (2015 to 2017) recorded significant increase in rice production with resultant decrease in rice importation.
pcm: Di first two year of di programme(2015 reach 2017) record significant increase for rice production wit decrease for rice importation

eng: For instance, rice importation from Thailand fell from 644,131 metric tonnes in September 2015 to 20,000 metric tonnes in September 2017, which accounts for a drop of over 90%.
pcm: For example to dey carri rice kom kontri from Thailand fall 644,131 metric tone for September 2015 to 20,000 matric tone for September 2017, wish account for drop pass 90%

eng: The success so far recorded was made possible because of the Anchor borrowers program introduced by the Federal government in conjunction with the Rice Farmers Association of Nigeria (RIFAN) that has not only improved rice production but has also enhanced the quality through de-stoning.
pcm: Di success so far record dey possible bikos of di Anchor borrowers program wey Federal goment introduce for conjunction wit di Rice Farmers Association of Nigeria (RIFAN) dat one no not only improve rice production but don also enhance di quality through de-stoning.

eng: It has also seen the increase in the number of local rice mills,he stated.
pcm: hin tok say; E don see di increase for di number of local rice mills

eng: He said the federal government disbursed money to the Anchor and in conjunction with the participating States, for land clearing, provision of seeds for planting, inputs such as knapsack sprayers, tube wells, pumping machines, ploughs, combined harvesters, rice milling machines and production lines, packaging were also provided.
pcm: He tok say federal goment share di moni to di Anchor and in conjunction wit di participatin States, for land clearin, provision of seeds for plantin, inputs like  knapsack sprayers, tube wells, pumpin machines, ploughs, combined harvesters, rice millin machines and production lines, packagin na hin dey provide.

eng: Furthermore, analysis of the ABP programme indicates that funds provided at low interest made possible: easy access to rice farmers; economies of scale as large clusters of farmers are enlisted into the programme; enhanced the rice value chain in the form of finance to primary producers to processors “ handlers “ wholesalers “ storage “ marketing (branding) “ export; improvement in farmers fortunes; and employment generation.
pcm: Furthermore, analysis of di ABP programme show say funds wey dem provide for low interest make am possible: easy access to rice farmers dem; economies of scale as plenti of farmers na hin dem enlist into di programme; enhance di rice value chain in form of finance for primary producers go processors “ handlers “ wholesalers “ storage “ marketin (branding) “ export; improvement of farmers dem fortunes; and employment generation.

eng: The others are food sufficiency, thereby banishing poverty and insecurity; generation of revenue as farmers will now pay taxes; and improvement in the economy as naira gains value.
pcm: Di remainin na food sufficient, so tey poverty banish and insecurity, generation of revenue as farmer go pay tax and improvement for economy as naira gain value

eng: He also noted that this ease of production of rice -the most valued staple in Nigeria- has been successfully practiced and celebrated in some states like Kebbi, Jigawa, Sokoto, Niger, Kwara, Ebonyi etc.
pcm: Hin kom note say di ease of production of rice wey be di staple wey get value pass for Nigeria don successful practice and celebrate for some state like Kebbi, Jigawa, Sokoto, Niger, Kwara, Ebonyi

eng: It is gratifying that today, Ekiti State is now joining the train as a participant in the Anchor Borrowers Programme of the CBN, in partnership with the National body of Rice Farmers Association of Nigeria led by Alhaji Goronyo.
pcm: E dey grate say today , Ekiti State don now join di train as participant for di Anchor Borrowers Programme of di CBN, wey dey partnership wit National bodi Rice farmer Association of Nigeria wey Anchor Borrower lead

eng: Bode George describes Constitution review as a charade
pcm: Bode George describe constitution review as charade

eng: Former Deputy National Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Chief Olabode George, has described the ongoing constitutional review by the National Assembly as a charade.
pcm: former Deputy National Chairman of di pipo Demcratic paryi (PDP)Chief Olabode George, don describe di constitution review wey dey go  by di National Assembly as charade

eng: He said the unanimous position of the Nigerian people is the total overhaul of the present constitution, adding, Nothing else will do.
pcm: Hin tok say di position wey dey unanimous of di Nigeria pipo na total overhaul of di present constitution addin, nothin else go do

eng: According to him, a genuineremedy would be to revisit the report of the 2014 Constitutional Conference which he noted has been generally applauded for the sweeping breadth of its equity and democratic balance in rectifying the prejudicial and unworkable structures that are on the ground now.
pcm: Accordin to am, genuine remedy make dem go check di report of di 2014 Constitutional Conference again, wey he note say dey don generally applaud sake of di sweepin breadth of hin equity and democratic balance to correct di prejudicial and unworkable structures wey dey ground now.

eng: In an open letter to the Senate President, George also faulted the process of the ongoing constitution review, especially the public hearing held last week, noting that many people were deliberately denied the openness of democratic contributions.
pcm: For one open letter to  Senate President, George fault di process of di constitution review wey dey go on, especially di public hearin wey apun last week, as he note say plenti pipo na hin dey purposely deny di openness of democratic contributions.

eng: He said, The hearing was stage-managed, anchored in prejudice, framed in puppeteering identification.
pcm: Hin tok say di hearing dey stage manage, anchored for prejudice, frame for puppeteerin indentification

eng: Alternative views were cast aside, flung into the pits.
pcm: Alternative view na e dey cast aside, fling inside pit

eng: This is not right.
pcm: Dis one no correct

eng: This is not just.
pcm: Dis no dey just

eng: It is obvious that the Committee is not interested in true and thorough representation of the will of the Nigerian people.
pcm: e really dey show say di Committee no dey ready  for true and thorough representation wey be di will of Nigeria pipo

eng: It appears to be working with a script towards a predetermined end.
pcm: e appear say to dey work wit script near predetermined end

eng: The contributions were narrow, overtly partisan, one-sided, lacking in plural contributory logic.
pcm: di contribution dey narrow, over partisan, one side, lackin for plural contribution logic

eng: This is not acceptable to the Nigerian people.
pcm: Nigeria pipo no dey gree am

eng: The structure of the present constitution is so biased, so flawed and so mangled with inequities that a mere review will not be sufficient to correct all the glaring wrongs afflicting the Nigerian state.
pcm: Di structure of di present contitution too get ojoro, e get flaw and e dey mingle wit inequities, he say mare review no go dey enough to correct all di glarin wrong wey dey afflict Nigeria state

eng: The PDP leader said as a believer in the unity of the Nigerian state, he stated that the nation can emerge stronger and better only when all the component units that make up our nation have a sense of belongingness and general accommodation regardless of tribe or sectarian belief, when everyone is treated equally without ethnic bias, when merit is the sole determinant of public positions.
pcm: PDP leader tok say as a believerfor di unity of di Nigerian state, he tok say di nation fit emerge stronger and better only wen all di component units form our nation fit get sense of belongingness and general accommodation wey em no go dey look tribe or sectarian belief, wen evribodi  go be di same witout ethnic bias, wen merit na di sole determinant of public positions.

eng: This can only be achieved with a peoples constitution.
pcm: We fit only achieve am wit dem pipo and constitution

eng: This is indeed what we should work for rather than the charade and the present jamboree that is chaired by Senator Ovie Omo “ Agege.
pcm: Na wetin we suppose work for be dis instead charade and present jamboree wey Senator Ovie omo Agege

eng: Enough of this false and misleading engagement.
pcm: E don do for all dis false and misleadin engagement

eng: Lets renew our nation through the pursuit of the truth and the resolve on the fairness doctrine.
pcm: Make we renew awa nation through as we dey pursuit di truth and resolve on di fairness doctrine

eng: Their-in resides the national salvation,he added.
pcm: Dia in reside di national salvation; hin add

eng: A love letter to Mallam Nasir el-Rufai (I)
pcm: Wan love letter wey dem write give Mallam Nasir el-Rufa

eng: I had made up my mind to write to you openly before I saw the viral video by Dr Shadi Sabeh in which he appealed to you passionately to temper your actions with a human facewith regard to the proposed sacking of 20,000 staff of the Kaduna State Government.
pcm: I been don make my mind up to write give you openly before I see di viral video by Dr Shadi Sabehwey dey beg you do wetin you wan d wit human feelins regardin di 20,000 staff of the Kaduna State Goment wey you propose to sack.

eng: I do not quite agree with Dr Sabeh that people should be kept in service just to pay them as a social service.
pcm: I too agree wit Dr Sabeh say pipo say make dem kip pipo for service just to play dem as social service

eng: Nigeria cannot afford that for now.
pcm: Nigeria no fit afford am now

eng: Our economy is not a 10th as developed as the US economy
pcm: awa Economy no dey develop 10th as US economy take be

eng: was in the 1930s when it went through the Great Depression.
pcm: Na 1930s wen e go through di Great Depression

eng: However, Dr Sabeh is right to the extent that Keynesianism is back world over and a government must necessarily think about the impact of its policies on the people it serves.
pcm: Howeva, Dr Sabeh dey right to extend say Keynesianism don back world ova and goment must necessary think about di impact of hin policy on di pipo wey hin dey service

eng: We know that in Nigeria, governments unfortunately do not believe they are here to serve the people, but it is our duty to work together to change that unfortunate misunderstanding and disconnection.
pcm: We know say for Nigeria, goment unfortunately no  believe say dey kom here kom serve di pipo, but na awa duty to work togeda to change dat unfortunate misunderstandin and disconnection

eng: There are other issues coming up in Kaduna State presently.
pcm: E get oda issue wey dey kom from Kaduna state presently

eng: Indeed, the state under your governance has again been mentioned as one of the best governed and we hear of your achievements in infrastructural development.
pcm: For true di state under your goment dey don again mention am as one of di best governed and we hear of your achievement for infrastructural development

eng: The dangers of travelling to Kaduna has hampered many of us from coming to see those achievements, but most people know that El-Rufai is a man of achievement and a stickler for standards.
pcm: Di danger to dey travel to Kaduna don hamper many of us to kom see dem achievement, but most pipo know say El-Rufai na man of achievement and stickler for standards

eng: The Federal Capital Territory (FCT) cannot forget you in a hurry.
pcm: Di Federal Capital Territory(FCT) no fit forget you in hurry

eng: Many people rue your absence as minister.
pcm: plenti pesin rue your absence as minister

eng: A lot more remember you in dread.
pcm: plenti go remember you for dread

eng: Unfortunately, many of the villages you cleared and many of the shanties you demolished are back “ this time with a vengeance.
pcm: Unfortunately, plenti of di village wey you clear and plenti of di shanties wey you demolish don kom back dis time wit vengeance

eng: Why?
pcm: wetin?

eng: The governments over time have made no plans for these poor folks, and human beings “ like water “ must find their levels.
pcm: Di goment over time don make no plan for dis poor folks, and human being  like water and must find dia level

eng: If you are flying into Abuja at any point in time, look down from the window of your aeroplane and you will see just how badly shanties have metastasized since youve been gone.
pcm: If u dey fly go Abuja for any point for time, make you look down from di window of your aeroplane and u go see how bad shanties don metastasize since you don comot

eng: Any minister who will try and correct this anomaly will have millions of refugees on his hands.
pcm: Any minister wey go try and correct dis anomaly go get millions of dem refugees for hin hand

eng: In your time, it was 500,000 refugees we had.
pcm: for your time, na 500,000 refugees we don get

eng: As at 2006, Nigeria had the second highest number of displaced people in the world “ after Iraq “ due to your actions.
pcm: For 2006, Nigeria get di second highest number of displace pipo for di world afta wey Iraq due to hin action

eng: I recall writing to you then through my Daily Trust column, and appealing for the same thing that Dr Sabeh is now calling for; human face.
pcm: I remember say I write give you den through my Daily Trust column, dey appeal for di same thin wey Dr Sabeh dey call for human face

eng: I quoted timeless Chinese wisdom by reminding you If your vision is one year, cultivate flowers.
pcm: I quote timeless Chinese wisdom as dey remind you your vision na one year, kom cultivate flowers

eng: If it is 10, cultivate trees.
pcm: If na 10, cultivate trees

eng: But if it is eternity, cultivate humans.
pcm: But if na eternity, cultivate human

eng: The idea then was that you should go easy on you hard rhetoric that anyone earning less than N50,000 should return to their village, because Abuja is not for the poor.
pcm: Di idea den na say make e go easy on you hard rhetoric say anyone wey dey earn less  dan N50,000 make e return to village, bikos Abuja no dey for di poor

eng: You said this on national TV and it was most unfortunate and unfeeling.
pcm: You tok say dis na national TV and e dey unfortunate and unfeelin

eng: It was perhaps the most bourgeoisie thing ever said by someone in office.
pcm: Na for sure say most bourgeoisie thin wey pesin don eva tok for office

eng: If anybody was to lay claim to Abuja as their inheritance, it should have been those Gwaris displaced from their ancestral land, many times without compensation.
pcm: If anybodi wan lay claim say Abuja be dia inheritance, e for be dose Gwaris wey dem displace from dia ancestral land, plenti time witout compensation

eng: At what point did Abuja become a playground/inheritance for the nouveau riche?
pcm: For what point Abuja bikom playground/inheritance for di nouveau riche

eng: While we watched on TV in 2006, whole families displaced in the thick of the rainy season, with their mattresses on their heads and their little toddlers in their hands, we heard of stories of people who committed suicide because both their homes and their businesses were demolished same day.
pcm: As we dey watch TV for 2006, families wey no get place to stay inside rainy season, wit dia mattress on dia head and dia little pikin for dia hand, we hear di storie of pipo wey kil diasef bikos both dia house and dia business na hin dey destroy di same day.

eng: I learnt from one lady, who acted as secretary to some of your meetings back then, how much you took delight in displacing those poor folks and that in one instance, the appeals from Drs Oby Ezekwesili and Okonjo-Iweala could not dissuade you and you were jokingly called a sadist even as you departed the meeting to go and have another demolition.
pcm: I learn from one lady, who dey act as secretary to some of your meetin dem dat time , how you take enjoy displacin dose poor pipo at once, how Drs Oby Ezekwesili and Okonjo-Iweala dey beg you no change your mind and dem use style call you sadist as you comot for di meetin go demolish anoda place.

eng: It sounded much like those folks in the south of the USA who used to take delight in hanging themselves another negro.
pcm: E sound much like di folks dem for di south of di USA wey dey take joy to dey hang demsef anoda negroa

eng: Kaduna not only has a bloated civil service (as is), but also a problem with indiscriminate building of all sorts of structures where they shouldnt be “ like everywhere else in Nigeria.
pcm: Kaduna no only get bloat civil service but also problem wit indiscriminate buildin of all kind structure wia dey suppose be like Evri wia for Nigeria

eng: Abuja claims to have a master plan which no one is supposed to see, thus making it a political plan not a geographical one.
pcm: Abuja claim to get master plan which no one suppose see, derfore making am political plan no be geographical one

eng: Kaduna is NOT Abuja, and the people there may not have the mettle to withstand Hurricane Nasir, as we did here in Abuja up till 2007 under your iron grip.
pcm: Kaduna no be Abuja, and di pipo wey dey der fi no get di mettle to sand Hurricane Nasir, as we take do here for Abuja till 2007 under your Iron grip

eng: You know you can easily get crazy once turned on.
pcm: You know say u fit easily craze wen dey turn you on

eng: You confess to this yourself.
pcm: You confess am yoursef

eng: You dont care whose ox is gored and this can be a good attribute to turn around a country such as ours, but it could also be deadly to a great many poor folks, especially in a Kaduna which is basically an agrarian and civil service state.
pcm: You no care which pesin ox dem kill and dis fit be good attribute to turn like our kontri around , but e fit dey deadly for plenti plenti poor folks, especially for Kaduna wey be simply agrarian and civil service state.

eng: Is there any compensation for example, for those whose houses and shops you will demolish?
pcm: Compensation go dey for example dose one wey u go demolish dia house and shop

eng: Is anyone listening to their stories of how they came about the land or spaces or have they been told to go to hell and back?
pcm: Anyone dey hear dia tor iof how dey kom about di land or space or dey don tell dem to go back hell?

eng: Is it true that we should strive to achieve a glistening city in order to achieve accolades from far and near, not minding the human costs?
pcm: Na True say make we strive to achieve glistenin city in in oda to achieve accolades from far and near, no to mind di human coasts

eng: Should governance be calibrated solely to appeal to the whims and fancies of the monied class?
pcm: Make goment calibate solely to appeal to di whim and fancies of di moni class

eng: Look at Banana Island and Turnbull Street in Ikoyi.
pcm: look Banana Island and Turnbull Street for Ikoyi

eng: The other day, the well-fed owners of properties there pushed a video wherein they filmed how their pristine space has been encroached by poor invaders.
pcm: Di oda day, di well feed owners of property der push one video wia dey fiilm how dia pristine space don encroach by poor invader

eng: They almost labeled the poor people as vermin.
pcm: E remain small make dem call di poor pipo as vermin

eng: The problem is not the invaders but a lack of integrated, inclusive planning.
pcm: Di pipo no be di invader but lack of integrated, inclusive plannin

eng: As educated as we claim to be, we choose not to learn the nuanced lessons from the places we visit abroad.
pcm: As educated wey we claim be, we no choose to learn di nuance lessons from di place wey we visit for abroad

eng: How can anyone think that the model of Banana Island will work forever when there is no provision for how the servants, drivers, gardeners and other dregs of the earth who serve these Lords of the Manor will get around; how they will eat their lunch, how they will survive and sleep close to where they are supposed to resume at 4am every day?
pcm: How anybodi fit think say di model of Banana Island go work foreva wen provision no dey on how servants, drivers, gardeners and oda low pipo weey dey dis oga for mansion dem go survive; how dem go eat dia lunch, how them go live and sleep close to wer dey suppose resume for 4am evri day?

pcm: Dis na high tech electic SUV wit 310 mile range

pcm: E kom wit stylin wey no change dramatically from 2019

eng: concept car of the same name.

pcm: Nissan join di SUVs market segment for 2016 wit di launch of di Qashqai

pcm: Make we say one of di notable shifts for di movement for woman right na di Women Strike for Equality for August 26, 1970

pcm: Di strike wey take place for di United State to celebrate di 50th anniversary of di passin of di 19th Amendment, wey effectively give women for America di right to vote

pcm: For today, movement wey dey respoonsible for political rights for women na hin dey use view ham, social equality for relationship and inkom equality for di United State and for di world

eng: UPDATED: Bayern win ninth Bundesliga title in a row

eng: Bayern Munich have been confirmed as Bundesliga champions for the ninth straight season Saturday after England winger Jadon Sancho netted twice in Borussia Dortmunds 3-2 win over second-placed RB Leipzig.
pcm: Bayern Munich na hin dey don confirm say na dem be Bundesliga champion for di ninth straight season for Saturday afta wey England winger Jadon Sancho score twice for Borussia Dortmund wit 3-2 win wey dey win for di second place for RB Leipzig

pcm: Di result for Dortmund mean say Bayern be champion before dia home game wey dem go play against Borussia Moenchengladbach for Saturday evenin.

pcm: Before dey even start wella, Bayern don get unassailable 71 point to Leipzig 64

pcm: Dortmund head coach Edin Terzic congratulate Bayern

pcm: Dortmund get hope to get Haaland kom back from thigh injury before di cup final and even wit dia top-scorer wey dey watch for wia hin sit down, di host still race inside di lead afta only seven minute

pcm: Reus span out Lukasz Piszczek pass, sprint for back of defence and take beautiful back-heel ball from Thorgan Hazard before hin sweep hin shot past Leipzig goalkiper Peter Gulacsi

pcm: Dortmund goalkiper Marwin Hitz no comot for di second half afta wey hin get injury wen hin collide wit hin centre back Manuel Akanji before di break wey dem replace am wit Roman Buerki

pcm: Howeva, Sancho grab di winner wen hin flick di ball give Guerreiro, take return pass and tap house to give Bayern di title

pcm: Ndidi, Iheancho Leicester City win dia first FA Cup afta wey Tieleman scream

pcm: Na di biggest gatherin of dem supporters for inside stadium since coronavirus pandemic don start and dey treat dem kon show some kind drama for di 140th FA Cup final

pcm: Leicester fans don get perfect view as Tielemans fire brilliant shot inside top corner of di goal for dia end for 63 minute

pcm: Na goal wey worth winnin any final cap superb performance from Belgian

pcm: Na game of small clear chances up e be until dat point but dey kom force  Kasper Schmeichel into two fantastic saves at di oda end, pushin a Chilwell header onto di post and then pullin off anoda wonderful stop to deny Mason Mount, as Chelsea dey desperate to find response

pcm: Former Leicester defender Chilwell think say hin don do am, wen Caglar Soyuncu clearance go comot am, but VAR rightly sort di Chealsea man don stray marginally offside for di build up
