pcm: Leicester, wey lose key defender Jonny Evans sake of injury midway thru first half, still dey and, 52 years afta dia last appearance one FA Cup final, dey able to carri di trophy up for di first time, as dey add anoda remarkable chapter join dia story, followin dia 2015/16 Premier League triumph.

eng: Pakistan blocks social media amid anti-France protests
pcm: Pakistan don block social media amid anti-france protest

eng: Pakistan on Friday blocked social media platforms amid fears that activists of a radical Islamist group might use the technology to stoke violent protests against last years depiction of the Prophet Muhammad in France.
pcm: Pakistan on Friday block social media platforms dem sake of fear say activists of one radical Islamist group fit use di technology kos violent protests against last year depiction of di Prophet Muhammad in France.

eng: Followers of far-right Tehreek-e-Labaik Pakistan (TLP), a group that supports the countrys controversial blasphemy laws, have blocked roads and chocked streets at deadly protests that started on Monday.
pcm: followers of far- right Tehreek-e-Labaik Pakistan(TLP) one group wey support di kontri controversial blasphemy law, don block road kom choke streets for deadly protests wey start on Monday

eng: The protesters were demanding that the government fulfill an earlier promise to expel the French ambassador by April 20, over the publication of a cartoon depicting the prophet last year.
pcm: di protesters wey demand say di goment fulfil early promise to expel di French ambassador by April 20, ova di publication of cartoon wey dey show di prophet last year

eng: At least five people including two police officers have been killed in the protests, which have prompted the France embassy in Islamabad to urge French nationals to leave Pakistan temporarily.
pcm: At least 5 pipo wit two police officer don kpeme inside di protest, wey don prompt di France embassy inside Islamabad make French nationals comot for Pakistan for some time

eng: Social media has been blocked for a few hours so that troublemakers cannot use it during Friday prayers congregations,an official told dpa.
pcm: Dem don block social media for few hours make troublemakers no use am for Friday prayer wey pipo go gather, one official tell dpa

eng: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, WhatsApp and TikTok are inaccessible across the country, including the capital Islamabad.
pcm: Facebook, twitter, Instagram, WhatsApp wit TikTok dey inaccessible for inside di kontri, wit Islamabad di capital join

eng: Political parties, Islamist groups and militant organisations like Pakistani Taliban heavily rely on social media platforms to connect with their followers.
pcm: Political parties, Islamist groups wit militant organisation like Pakistan Taliban wey rely on social media platform use connect wit dia followers

eng: How young farmer grew 350 chickens into N750m farm
pcm: How young farmer use 350 fowl take make N750m farm

eng: Popularly called Farmer in Suit,his story tells how hard work, innovation, passion and determination can make one break away from the loop of poverty.
pcm: As dem take dey call am Farmer in suit, him tori tell us as hard work, innovation, passion, wit determination fit make person break comot from inside poverty

eng: The story of Usman Ali Lawan, who also suffered from daunting challenges confronting most Nigerian youths, is an inspiration for others.
pcm: Di tori of Usman Ali Lawan, wey suffer plenty challenge wey dey face  most Nigerian youth, na inspiration for odas

eng: Last week, our reporter visited Lawans farm on the outskirts of Keffi, Nasarawa State, and his story explained his journey so far.
pcm: Last week, awa reporter visit Lawan farm for di outskirts of Keffi, Nasarawa State, him tori explain him journey as e don be

eng: After his first degree in Business Administration from the Ahmadu Bello University (ABU), Zaria, and a stint in oil and gas, Lawan used his savings to go for a masters degree in Energy Studies in the United Kingdom (UK), with the hope that a job would be waiting for him whenever he returned home; but that did not happen.
pcm: afta him first degree for Business Administration from di Ahmadu Bello University (ABU), Zaria, kom start stint for inside oil and gas, Lawan use him savings take do master degree for Energy Studies for di United Kingdom (UK) wit hope say job go dey wait for am

eng: I was broke, broken, homeless and indebted.
pcm: dey broke, broken, no get house con dey owe join

eng: It was hard to look for a good job, so I started applying for every opening.
pcm: E been hard to find beta job, so I start dey apply for all jobs

eng: Within the first six months after my return from the UK, I applied for 500 jobs in Nigeria.
pcm: Inside di first six months afta I return from (UK), I apply for 500 jobs inside Nigeria

eng: I asked people for help.
pcm: I been ask pipo for help

eng: I was looking for any job,he said.
pcm: I been dey find any job, him tok

eng: Within the period of joblessness, this grandson of a peasant farmer remembered that he could actually do something in agriculture.
pcm: Inside di period of joblessness, dis grandson of one peasant farmer remember say him fit do somethin for agriculture

eng: That was when I started making efforts and preparing myself to become a farmer.
pcm: Na dat time I start to make efforts kom dey prepare mysef bikom farmer

eng: And I wanted to be a farmer that would be able to support other smallholder farmers to engage in sustainable and profitable farming.
pcm: and I wan be farmer wey go fit support oda small small farmers join hand for sustainable wit profitable farmin

eng: That was what informed the establishment of my farm, USAIFA Agro-Allied Limited, which started operations on April 3, 2013, with 350 birds,he narrated.
pcm: Dat na wetin inform di establishment of my farm, USAIFA Agro-Allied Limited, wey start operation on April 3, 2013, wit 350 fowl, him tok

eng: Today, the farms capacity has grown from 350 birds to 28,000.
pcm: Today di farmer capacity don grow from 350 fowl enter 28,000

eng: On fishery, it has the capacity for 100,000 of 1.5kg fish, 45 tonnes of processed fish and 200,000 fingerlings monthly.
pcm: For fishery, e get di capacity for 100,000 of 1.5kg fish, 45 tonnes of fish wey dem process wit 200,000 fingerlings monthly

eng: Facilities for goat farming, heliciculture (snails) and cuniculture (rabbits) are under construction.
pcm: facilities wey dem use do goat farmin, heliciculture (snails) wit cuniculture (rabbits) dey under construction

eng: The farm has modern meat and fish processing facilities, with substantial structures for offices, feed mills, meeting rooms, cold room and a warehouse.
pcm: di farm get modern meat wit fish processin facilities, wey get substantial structures for office, feed mills, meetin room, cold room wit warehouse

eng: The farm has developed a circle where the waste product of one process serves as an input for another.
pcm: di farm don develop circle wey di waste product of one process fit do input for anoda

eng: For instance, when the poultry and fish use feed, all the wastes from them are collected and used to make organic fertiliser.
pcm: for instance, wen di poultry and fish use feed, dem go collect all di waste take do organic fertiliser

eng: By this, we ensure that every waste product on the farm is used as input for another process to create an ecosystem where waste is reduced to the barest minimum,Lawan explained.
pcm: dis, we ensure say Evri waste product for di farm dem go use am as input for anoda process to use create ebikosystem wey waste go dey reduced pata pata, Lawan explain

eng: Lawan also has another plan for the farm: We are now not only a commercial farm but also an agri-business institute so that other young farmers will be able to have access, not only to see how a farm works but also learn and be able to have the knowledge they need.
pcm: Lawan get anoda plan for di farm sef. We don ready no be for only commercial farm, for agric-business institute so oda young farmer dem go fit get access to see as farm dey work, kom learn get di knowledge join

eng: When asked the worth of the farm, he said, We did evaluation recently and the business as a whole is valued at a little over N700million.
pcm: wen dem ask di farm worth, him tok say, we do evaluation recently and di business get worth wey pass N700million

eng: The assets and the facilities are valued at N350m.
pcm: Di asset of di facilities get value of N350m

eng: Of course when you put the goodwill, our experience, brand, all the validation, and of course, our turnover in the last seven or eight years, plus the projected turnover in the next five years, then the business is valued at N750m.
pcm: wen you put di goodwill, awa experience, brand, all di validation and awa turnover for inside seven or eight years, plus di turnova wey dem project inside di next five years, den di business get value of N750m

eng: He further said, Money is important in business, but I never actually saw it as a key driver because I knew from the beginning that if I put that in mind I would not be able to go far.
pcm: him further tok say, moni dey important for di business, but I neva actually see am as key driver bikos I sabi from di beginnin day if I put dat for mind I no go fit go far

eng: That you think you need money to do everything
pcm: say you think say you need moni do Evrithin

eng: and you dont have
pcm: and you no get

eng: it is a spirit killer.
pcm: na spirit killer

eng: Entrepreneurship is a lonely journey, so you dont want anything that will discourage you.
pcm: enterpreneurship na lonely journey, so you no go want anythin wey go discourage you

eng: You want to be able to keep moving.
pcm: you go wan dey move ahead

eng: So I thought my snag for problem-solving was the most important factor and hinged on that.
pcm: so I think say my snag for problem solvin na him important pass so I hold am tight

eng: I tried to look at alternative means of getting money.
pcm: I try look for alternative means use get moni

eng: Although he did not get funding from any bank, he was able to use other means like bootstrapping.
pcm: Although him no get any fundin from any bank, hin been use oda means like bootstrappin

eng: He explained, Bootstrapping simply means using the resources you have to create something of value “ whether it is getting invoice sales from suppliers or advance payment from customers.
pcm: him explain Bootstrappin as simply means wey you go use di resource you get to use create somethin wey get value weda na to get invoice sale from suppliers or advance payment from customers

eng: Those are some of the methods we use to be able to make sure our cash flow stays strong.
pcm: those na some of di methods we use to make sure say cash flow stay strong

eng: And we are able to grow the business, but most importantly, leverage on fellowships and grant opportunities.
pcm: and we been grow di business, but di one wey important pass, na levarage onntop fellowship and grant opportunities

eng: In the next 10 years, Lawan wants to have a 10,000-hectare farm estate for growing maize, soybeans and groundnut, to prove to young people that they can actually make a living and decent income from farming.
pcm: inside di next 10 years, Lawan wan get 10,000-hectare farm estate to use grow maize, soybeans and groundnut, take prove say young pipo fit actually make livin wit decent inkom from farmin

eng: You can wear a suit in a farm instead of the banking hall,he said.
pcm: you fit wear suit for farm instead of for banking hall, him tok

eng: Nigeria to partner Egypt for youth and sports development

eng: The Minister who made this known yesterday on the sidelines of the

pcm: Dis meetin dey timely bikos e dey kom for time wey we dey prepare for di Olympics, Dare tok

pcm: Di future dey youths hand so dem must dey get proper trainin to use meet di challenge of new world orders, him tok

pcm: Dare use opportunity use introduce di DEEL, wey be digital skil programme, dey assure say di two countries fit collaborate to use benefit for di initiative

eng: Food security: Expert canvases urban farming
pcm: Food security; Egypt canvas urban farmin

eng: The country coordinator, Open Forum for National Biotechnology in Africa, Nigeria chapter, Dr Rose Gidado, has appealed to the federal government to promote urban agriculture to mitigate food scarcity.
pcm: Di kontri coordinator, Open Forum for National Biotechnology for Africa chapter, Dr Rose Gidado don beg federal goment make dem promote urban agriculture to use mitigate food scarcity

pcm: she tok say urban agriculture go address issues wey dey surround insecurity for plenti part of di kontri

pcm: Gidado tok say hydroponics, aeroponics and aquaponics na all new urban agriculture techniques wey dem suppose promote

eng: According to her, hydroponics is a technology for growing plants in nutrient solutions that supply all nutrient elements needed for optimum plant growth.
pcm: as she take tok, hyfroponics na technology dem dey use grow plants for inside nutrient solution wey dey supply all nutrient elements for plant to take grow

eng: It is done with or without the use of an insert medium, such as gravel, vermiculite, rock wool, peat moss, sawdust, coir dust and coconut fiber.
pcm: dem dey do celt weda dem use or dem no use insert medium, like gravel, vermiculite, rock wool, peat moss, sawdust, coir dust wit coconut fiber

eng: Aeroponics is an innovative technique of misting the roots, which are suspended in the air, with hydroponic solution.
pcm: Aeroponics na innovertixe technique dem dey use mist roots, wey dem go suspend for air wit hydroponia solution

eng: Plants are supported by tailor made holes in Styrofoam panels.
pcm: plant get support wit hole dem make inside styrofoam panel

eng: Aquaponics means raising fish and plants in the same water source.
pcm: Aqia[pmocs, mean say make dem raise fish wit plant for di same water source

eng: The fish actually provide the fertiliser for the plants and the plant roots filter the water for the fish.
pcm: Di fish dey provide di fertilizer for di plant and di plant root dey filter di water for di fish

eng: Greenhouse is a type of farming in which crops are cultivated under protected and enclosed environment.
pcm: Greenhouse na type of farmin wey crops dem dey cultivate crop inside place wey dem protect con cover

eng: Its advantage is to keep out pests and diseases.
pcm: di advantage of celt na to pursue pest and disease

eng: It also has a comparable yield advantage to open filed cultivation of crops.
pcm: e get comparable yield advantage to crop dem grow for open

eng: Urban agriculture will enable people practise farming within their homes and environment, thereby increasing food production.
pcm: Urban agriculture go allow pipo dey practice farmin for inside dem house and enviroment and dat one go increase food production

eng: We have urban agriculture, and it should be promoted by the government.
pcm: We get urban agriculture, and goment suppose promote am

eng: Urban agriculture will mitigate against issues of herdsmen, Boko Haram, banditry and the likes.
pcm: Urban agriculture go mitigate against issue of herdsmen, Boko Haram, banditry and di remainin one

eng: All we need is to promote urban agriculture.
pcm: wetin we go need do na to promote urban agriculture

eng: People need to be taught how to farm on top of their rooftops, in containers and polythene bags,she said.
pcm: Dey need  teach pipo how to farm for on top dia rooftop,for container and polytine bag; na wetin she tok be dat

eng: Sallah: Edo traders make brisk business
pcm: Sallah wey be Edo trader dey make brisk business

eng: Despite the economic downturn occasioned by COVID-19, traders at the Benin Eid praying ground along the Benin-Auchi Road made brisk business as Muslims celebrated Sallah.
pcm: Even as di economy  don downturn wey COVID-19 kos, trader wey dey Benin prayin ground for Benin-Auchi Road dey make brisk business as dem Muslims dey celebrate Sallah

eng: The traders who sold caps, clothing, mats, beverages and other items said business was good and that they did not regret coming to the area to sell their items.
pcm: Di trader wey dey sell cap, clothin mats, beverages and oda items tok say business dey good and say dem no regret to kom di area to sell dia item

eng: One of the traders, Muhammed Kabir, said he made good money within a short period.
pcm: One of di trader  wey be Muhammed Kabir, tok say hin  make plenti moni for short time

eng: Kabir, who sells prayer garments (jallabiya), said, Within a short period I sold 10 pieces of them.
pcm: Kabir, wey dey sell garment wey dem dey use for prayer tok say for short period him  10 pieces of dem

eng: This was what I usually battled to sell in a day.
pcm: Na wetin I dey usually battle to sell for di day be dis

eng: Another trader, Abdullaihi Abubakar, who sells caps, said, If every other day were today, I would never complain of a bad market.
pcm: Anoda trader wey be Abdullahi Abubakar, wey dey sell cap, tok say if evri oda day be like today, I no go complain of bad market

eng: Today is an Eid day and people do come to the prayer ground without caps, so I seized the opportunity to make good business.
pcm: Today na Eid day and pipo dey kom to di prayer ground wey dem no go wear cap, so I use di opportunity to make good business

eng: Before the commencement of the prayers, I sold 17 caps which ranged from N1,500 to N3,000.
pcm: Before dey start prayer, I sell 17 cap wey range from N1,500 go N3,000

eng: According to him, he barely managed to sell 10 caps any other day, adding that he would have money to celebrate the Sallah.
pcm: Accordin to am, him barely manage to sell 10 cap for any oda day, addin say hin go get moni to celebrate Sallah

eng: On an ordinary day, I manage to sell 20 caps or so, he said.
pcm: For Ordinary day, I dey manage to sell 20 caps or so him tok

eng: On his part, Musa Koro who sells mats thanked Allah for the Eid el-Fitr, saying, I made good sales today.
pcm: For him part, Musa Koro wey dey sell mats thank Allah for di Eid el-Fitr, him tok say him make good sale today

eng: Many worshippers didnt come to the prayer ground with mats, so they ended up buying from us.
pcm: Plenti worshipper no kom di prayer ground wit mat so dey kom end up to buy from us

eng: I made a profit of over N5,000 within a short period.
pcm: I make profit wey dey over N5,000 for short period

eng: Many other traders such as ice cream, sachet water and beverages sellers said the market was good and that they were smiling home.
pcm: Oda trader wey dey sell ice cream,  sachet water and bevarages  tok say di market dey good and say dem dey smile go house

eng: They had also wished the Sallah would be every day for their businesses to thrive with such a high rate of turnover.
pcm: Dey also wish say e go be evri day for dia business to thrive wit  for dat kind high rate of turnova

eng: CBN tasked on funding road transport devt
pcm: CBN don task to dey fund road transport

eng: The Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) and the Ministry of Finance, Budget and National Planning, have been tasked on creating a special intervention fund to develop road transportation infrastructure.
pcm: Di Central Bank of Nigeria(CBN) and di Ministry of Finance, Budget and National Plannin, dey don task dem to dey create special intervention wey dem find to develop road transportation infrastucture

eng: Speaking on Monday at the Nigeria Transportation Commissioners Forum and Federal Ministry of Transportation Annual Retreat 2021, the Minister of State, Transportation, Sen. Gbemisola Saraki, said, We understand the difficulties involved in accessing funding, especially given the high-interest rate regime.
pcm: As e dey tok on Monday for di Nigeria Transportation Commissioners Forum and Federal Ministry of Transportation Annual Retreat 2021, di Minister of State, Transportation, Sen. Gbemisola Saraki, tok say, We understand how e difficult to involve to dey access fund, especially wit di high-interest rate regime.

eng: We are exploring with the CBN and the Ministry of Finance an intervention fund dedicated to the road transport sector similar to what obtains for Aviation and other sectors of the economy.
pcm: We dey explore wit CBN and di Mnistry of  Finance intervention fund dedicate  to road transport sector wey dey similar to wetin obtain for Aviation and oda sector of di economy

eng: She also said the ministry with relevant stakeholders are working to have an environmentally sustainable transport sector.
pcm: She kom tok say di ministry wit relevant stakeholder dey work to get environmental sustainable transport sector

eng: She also said the ministry is aggressively promoting the use of technology within the road transport sector.
pcm: She kom tok say di ministry dey aggressive to promote di use of technology wey dey road transport sector

eng: The minister also said the NITT this year embarked on a National Transport Databank project, which will be the beginning of developing our national intelligent transport infrastructure.
pcm: Di minster kom tok say di NITT dis year  dey embark for National Transport Data bank project, wey go dey di beginnin to dey develop awa national intelligent trasport infrastructure

eng: The acting Chairperson of Transportation Commissioners Forum, Rahmatu Mohammed Yaradua said the Forum was necessary due to the need to effectively implement various resolutions of the National Council on Transportation, coupled with the desire to coordinate activities of various groups of the Nigerian Transport Sector.
pcm: Di actin Chairperson of Transportation Commissioners Forum, Rahmatu Mohammed Yar'adua tok say di Forum dey necessary dat time bikos of di nid to effectively implement various resolutions of di National Council on Transportation, coupled wit di desire to coordinate activities of plenti groups of Nigerian Transport Sector.

eng: She also said there is a need to adopt technology in road transport operations to reduce accidents.
pcm: She kom tok say e need to adopt technology for road transport operation make e reduce accident

eng: Why Nigeria must adopt proposed dairy policy “ Agric minister
pcm: Why Nigeria go need adopt dairy policy wey dem proposeAgric minister

eng: The Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development, Alhaji Muhammad Sabo Nanono, has said that high dependence on imported dairy products necessitated the urgent need for farmers to adopt the proposed diary policy when implemented.
pcm: Di Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development, Alhaji Muhammad Sabo Nanono, don tok say high dependence on top dairy products wey dem import na hin make di urgent need for farmers make dem adopt di proposed diary policy dey necessary wen dey implement am.

eng: During a stakeholders meeting organized by Sahel Consulting through the Advancing Local Dairy Development in Nigeria (ALDDN), Nanono noted that with 60 per cent of the dairy products consumed in the country imported, the proposed dairy policy would unlock the sectors potential and induce renewed interest in its development.
pcm: For one stakeholder meetin wey Sahel Consultin organize thru di Advancin Local Dairy Development for Nigeria (ALDDN), Nanono note say wit 60 per cent of di dairy products wey pipo consume for di kontri na imported, di dairy policy wey dem propose go unlock di sector potential and e go put renewed interest for hin# development.

eng: A statement by Sahel Consulting stated that the event, which was held late last month, was to ensure a wider stakeholder engagement in the Nigerian dairy sector to critically review and provide recommendations to the draft national dairy policy.
pcm: One statement wey Sahel Consultin tok for dat event wey apun last month na be say, make dem ensure a stakeholder engagement wey wide wella for di Nigerian dairy sector to critically review, make dem provide recommendation to di draft national dairy policy.

eng: It stated that the ALDDN programme implemented by the group is utilizing a systematic approach to catalyze a vibrant local dairy sector by improving the productivity of local breeds while promoting local sourcing of milk.
pcm: hin state di ALDON programme implement wey di group dey utilize systematic approach to catalyze vibrant local dairy sector to dey improve di productivity of local breeds wen dem dey promote local source milk

eng: Issues highlighted by Mrs Winnie Lai-Solarin, the Acting Director, Department of Animal Husbandry Services (DAHS), Federal Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development are the reflection of the strategic areas the ALDDN programme is working on to unlock the potentials in the dairy sector.
pcm: Issues wey Mrs Winnie Lai-Solarin highlight, di Actin Director, Department of Animal Husbandry Services (DAHS), Federal Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development na di reflection of di strategic areas di ALDDN programme dey work on top to use unlock di potentials for di dairy sector.

eng: During the breakout sessions with various stakeholders, extensive discussions and recommendations were provided to improve the proposed dairy policy.
pcm: For di breakout session wit various stakeholder, extensive discussion and recommendation wey dem provide to improve di propose dairy policy

eng: It was pointed out that commercial feed and fodder production in Nigeria is essential in intensifying and facilitating the development of the value chain through strengthening the demand and supply along the value chain.
pcm: Dey point am out say commercial feed and fodder production for Nigeria dey essential to intensify and facilitate di development of di value chain thru how dem go strengthen di demand and supply along di value chain.

eng: The Sahel Consulting statement noted that the programme has engaged 140 commercial fodder producers to cultivate 400 hectares of land through farming of several kinds of cereal, grasses and legumes to produce silage and hay.
pcm: Di Sahel Consultin statement note say di programme done engage 140 commercial fodder producers dem to cultivate 400 hectares of land through farmin of plenti kind of cereal, grasses and legumes to use produce silage and hay.

eng: This policy, when implemented, will encourage farmers to adopt commercial production of fodder and market it at affordable price to smallholder dairy farmers for the improvement of animal health, productivity and household income.
pcm: Wen dey implement diis policy, e go encourage farmers dem make dem adopt commercial production of fodder and make dem dey sell am for affordable price give smallholder dairy farmers to dey improve di animal health, productivity and household income.

eng: This dairy production component of the policy also aligns with one of the targets of the ALDDN programme “ to increase the milk yield of at least 75,000 cows from 15,000 dairy households by at least 30 per cent through genetics and breeding improvement, increased access to animal health services and training of smallholder dairy farmers on improved dairy farming practices.
pcm: Dis dairy production component of di policy dey also align wit one of di targets of di ALDDN programme “ to increase milk yield of at least 75,000 cows from 15,000 dairy house dem wit like 30 per cent thru genetics and breedin improvement, increase access to animal dem health service dem and to dey train smallholder dairy farmers on dairy farmin practices wey dey improved.

eng: Turaren Wuta: A booming trade for the northern woman
pcm: Turaren Wuta: trade wey dey boom for di northern woman

eng: The art of making incense, popularly known as Turaren Wuta, is no new tradition to those who come from the Northern region of Nigeria.
pcm: Di art to dey make incense, wey dem popularly know as Turaren Wuta, na di new tradition to dose wey kom from di Northern region of Nigeria

eng: However, turaren wuta has now become a popular household item and is used by people of different tribes across the country.
pcm: Howeva, turaren Wuta don bikom popular household item wey pipo from different tribe for di kontri dey use

eng: In this report, Daily Trust Saturday x-rays how profitable the business of selling Turaren Wuta has become.
pcm: For dis report, Daily Trust Saturday show how profit dey di business to dey sell Turaren Wuta don bikom

eng: Although incense is mostly used for freshening homes and neutralising odours, it also serves other different purposes.
pcm: Although incense na dem dey too use to dey freshen house and neutralise odours, e also serve oda different purpose

eng: Some traditions believe that the smoke from the incense fortifies the home against evil spirits “ like the ones used in the Catholic church, while others believe its scents can be used to attract men or women.
pcm: Some tradition believe say di smoke from di incense dey fortify di house against evil spirit like di one wey dem dey use for Catholic church, wen odas believe say hin scent na hin dey fi use attract man and woman

eng: Some women also believe that the consistent use of Dhukkhan (a particular type of incense) serves as an aphrodisiac and can help in sexual exploits.
pcm: Some woman kom believe say di consistent use of Dhukkhan ( one type of incense) serve as aphrodisaic and e fit help for sexual exploit

eng: The popularity of the use of incense has grown to the extent that is it not only appreciated by the northern tribe but by almost all tribes around the country.
pcm: Di popularity wey dey use of incense don grow reach di extent wey dem no dey appreciate by di northern tribe but na almost all di tribe wey dey di kontri

eng: Locally made incense or turaren wuta as it is popularly known in the northern region of Nigeria has become a very profitable business in Nigeria, especially for those in the northern region as some of the ingredients needed are naturally grown there.
pcm: Incense or turaren wuta wey dem make locally

eng: Turaren wuta is used in aromatherapy and as fragrance for the home, body or clothes.
pcm: Dem dey use Turaren wuta as aromatherapy and as fragrance wey dem dey use for house, bodi or cloth

eng: Aromatherapy is the use of holistic healing treatment that uses natural plant extracts to promote health and well-being.
pcm: Aromatherapy na hin dem dey use for holistic healin treatment wey dey use natural plant extract to promote health and well being

eng: They are different types of turaren wuta available and they are made from a variety of different materials.
pcm: E get different type of turaren wuta wey dey available and na from  variety of different material dem use make am

eng: In Nigeria, the most common scents are sandal oud, grounded Kajiji, Hawee balls, sandal sticks, etc.
pcm: For Ngeria, di scent wey common pass na sandal wod, Kajiji wey dem ground, Hawee ball, sandal stick

eng: The grounded Kajiji is a plant that grows in Maiduguri, while Hawee sticks can be gotten from Kano.
pcm: Di Kajiji wey dem dey ground na plant wey grow for Maiduguri, wen Hawee stick na hin dem dey get from Kano

eng: Asides from smelling good, the business side of turaren wuta has been part of human existence for ages.
pcm: Apart say dem dey smell good, di business side of turaren wuta don dey aprt of human existence  for ages

eng: Fatima Kannike is an indigene of Maiduguri and specialises in the making of turaren wuta.
pcm: Fatima Kannike na indigene of Maiduguri and hin specialise to dey make of turaren wuta

eng: She tells Daily Trust Saturday how profitable the business is in Nigeria.
pcm: She be tell Daily Trust Saturday how di business take get profit for Nigeria

eng: In Maiduguri, out of ten houses on the street, its most likely that 6 or 7 families are involved in the turaren wuta business,says Fatima.
pcm: Fatima tok say; For Maiduguri, out of ten house wey dey street, e dey likely say 6 or 7 family dey involve for di turaren wuta business.

eng: When making her turaren wuta, Fatima mentions that some of her ingredients are locally sourced and some come from Senegal, India, Pakistan, etc.
pcm: Wen dem dey make turaren wuta, Fatima tok say some of di ingredient na hin dem dey locally source and some dey kom from Senegal, India, Pakistan like dat like dat

eng: She further explained that the most expensive turaren wuta are the ones which contain sandalwood and firche which is gotten from crocodile skin.
pcm: She kom further explain  say di turaren wuta wey dey expensive pass na di one  wey get sandalwood and  firche wey dem dey get from crocodile skin

eng: Oftentimes, people believe that Prophet Mohammed (SAW) stepped on the very ground where the sandal wood tree grows, therefore it is considered sacred by many,she said.
pcm: she tok say; plenti time , pipo believe say Prophet Mohammed(SAW) step on top very good ground wey di  sandal wood tree dey grow, therefore dey consider say e dey holi

eng: When making her turaren wuta, Fatima prefers using exquisite scented oils in order to make the scents from the turaren wuta last for a longer period of time, which could be between 6-8 hours and most of her oils are sourced from Dubai.
pcm: Wen she dey make her turaren wuta,Fatima prefer to use exquisite scented oils so e go make dey scent for di turaren wuta last for long time, wey fit be like 6-8 hours and most of her oil na from dubai

eng: After mixing my turaren wuta, I like to seal it and leave it for weeks to allow the ingredients marinate and become more potent.
pcm: afta wen dey don mix my turaren wuta, I like to dey seal ham and kom leave ham for weeks to allow di ingredient marinate kom bikom more potent

eng: When asked what the process entails, Fatima narrates: Making turaren wuta is easy for me.
pcm: Wen dem ask me how di process dey be, Fatima tok say to dey make turaren wuta dey very easy for am

eng: As far as all my ingredients are available, I can do it in the comfort of my home.
pcm: So far say all my ingredient dey available, I fit do am for di comfort of my house

eng: It involves making a sugar syrup and frying the incense woods before adding the oils needed for the fragrance.
pcm: To dey make sugar syrup and to dey fry di incense woods e involve  before we go kom dey add di oil wey go need for di fragrance

eng: However, Fatima mentions that when making turaren wuta, its often better to use firewood and the local frying pans in order to perfect the mixture.
pcm: Howeva, Fatima don tok say wen dem dey make turaren wuta, e dey good to dey always use firewood and di local fryin pan in oda to perfect di mixture

eng: She also advises to put on a face mask to avoid catching a cold and hand gloves to avoid your hands from being burnt.
pcm: She kom advise make dem dey wear face mask to avoid catchin cold and hand glove so di hand no go burn

eng: When asked how she gets her customers, she explains that, often times, when burning her incense at home, her neighbours are always interested in knowing where she gets such incense that smells good, same thing also happens when she burns it at her shop.
pcm: Wen ask her say how she dey get her customers dem, she tok say, most times, as she dey burn her incense for house, her neighboursdey get interest on top say dey wan know wer she dey buy incense wey dey smell good, di same thin dey apun for her shop.

eng: Fatimas customer base is mostly women from the North as most times they believe that turaren wuta gives off the scent of a wealthy Arabian and also believe that it helps to attract men.
pcm: Fatima customer base be mostly women from di North as plenti time dey believe say turaren wuta dey give di scent of Arabian wey get moni and dey kom believe say e dey help to dey attract man

eng: Where I come from, turaren wuta is considered an important gift on your wedding for the women, even more important than getting a fridge or TV,she said.
pcm: she tok say for di place wey I kom from, turaren wuta na hin dey consider say e be important gift for women dem weddin, e even dey important pass to dey get fridge or TV

eng: However, Fatima notes that in recent times, she has also received a lot of female customers from the eastern part of the country.
pcm: Howeva, Fatima note say for recent time, she don receive female customers wey plenti wey dem kom from di eastern part of di kontri

eng: Although her customer base is mostly women, she also has male customers who buy the body oils and incense for their cars.
pcm: Make we say dem her customer na woman, she get male customer too wey dey buy di bodi oil and incense for dia car

eng: Turaren wuta (sandal oud, grounded kajiji and halut)
pcm: Turaren wuta(sandal wood, kajiji wey dem ground and halut)

eng: Fatima has turaren wuta of different price range and sizes, depending on the ingredients used.
pcm: Fatima get turaren wuta for different price and size, dependin on di ingredient wey dem use

eng: Fatima also sells her turaren wuta in litres for those who may like to join the business and not want to go through the stress of making it themselves.
pcm: Fatima dey sell her turaren wuta sef for litre for di pipo wey fit like join di business  and no go wan go through di stress to dey make am demsef

eng: Depending on how big you want to start, getting into the business doesnt need that much capital.
pcm: E depend on how big you wan start, to dey do di business no too nid plenti capital

eng: For instance, with 100,000 naira you can get two to three varieties of turaren wuta in litres to resale, with another sum of 400,000
pcm: for example, wit like 100,000 naira you fi get two or three varities wey be turaren wuta for litres to reselk, wit anoda moni wey be like 400,000

eng: you can purchase three to five varieties of scents.
pcm: If you go fit buy three to five varieties of di scent

eng: Asides the turaren
pcm: Apart say di turaren dey there

eng: wuta, Fatima also makes humrah which is the body oil and can be used on clothes.
pcm: wuta, Fatima too dey make hurah wey be di bodi oil and di one wey dey fit use am for cloth

eng: Often times, because of how good the smell is, customers are always indecisive about what scent they want.
pcm: Plenti time, bikos of how di smell good, customer dey always dey indecisive about di kind scent wey dem want

eng: When issues like that arise, we like to burn each scent and allow the customer to decide which scent they like the most,Fatima said.
pcm: Fatima tok say wen issues like dat arise, we go like burn each scent kom allow di customer to decide di kind scent wey dem like pass

eng: She also advises her customers to use a charcoal burner instead of an electric burner because from experience, the electric burner wastes the turaren wuta and doesnt burn as effectively as the charcoal.
pcm: She kom advise dem her customer to dey use charcoal burner instead di wan wey dem go dey use electric burner bikos of experience, di electric burner dey waste di turaren wuta and e no dey burn well like charcoal

eng: Fatimas most patronised scents are the sandal Oud, grounded kajiji and Halut.
pcm: Fatima wey dem dey patronise hin scent pass na di sandal wood, kajiji wey dem ground and Halut

eng: She notes that these particular scents get sold out the minute her customers are aware of its availability.
pcm: She no say dis particular scent  na hin dem dey sell finish di minute wey her customer no say e don dey

eng: Fatima also mentioned that her sales peak season is the rainy season, this is because the smoke that comes from the incense burner aides in keeping the house warm so customers are always willing to purchase more.
pcm: Fatima kom tok say di season she dey sell pass na rainy season, na bikos di smoke wey dey kom from di incense burner apart to dey kip di house warm so customer fi always wan buy more

eng: Mrs Amina Kogi, an ardent lover of turaren
pcm: Mrs Amina Kogi, wey be ardent lover of turaren

eng: wuta told Daily Trust Saturday that she spends at least N20,000 monthly purchasing different fragrance of turaren wuta for her house.
pcm: wuta tell Daily Trust Saturday say she dey spend at lease N20,000 evri month  to get different fragrance of turaren wuta for her house

eng: Whenever I wake up in the morning, I tell the maid to burn incense round the house and doing that makes the house smell good and homely.
pcm: If I wake for mornin, I dey tell di maid to burn incense round di house as dem dem dey do dat e dey make di house smell good and homely

eng: Mrs Amina also told Daily Trust Saturday that most of her guests express delight over the pleasant scent in her home and insist on getting the contact of the person she purchased the incense from.
pcm: Mrs Amina kom tell Daily Trust Saturday say plenti of her guests dey express joy on top di pleasant scent for her house and dey insist say dey wan get di persin connect wey she buy di incense from

eng: However, another turaren wuta seller Rahanatu Ahmad in Abuja told Daily Trust Saturday that she doesnt believe that turaren wuta has any spiritual benefits asides it
pcm: Howeva, anoda persin wey dey sell turaren wuta  Rahanatu Ahmad for Abuja tell Daily Trust Saturday say she no believe say turaren wuta get any spiritual benefit aside am

eng: sweet scent and its potency in clearing or diffusing bad/offensive odour.
pcm: scent wey sweet and e dey potent to dey clear or to dey diffuse odour wey dey bad/offensive

eng: She noted that the business is more profitable when sold in larger quantities.
pcm: She add say di business get profit wen dey sell am for large quantity

eng: Her cheapest turaren wuta goes for N3500 and the most expensive N23,000.
pcm: Her turaren wey cheap pass na hin be N3500 and di one wey expensive pass na N23,000

eng: The prices all depends on the size of jars.
pcm: Di price dey depend on top di size of jar

eng: She also produces Durot “ a special kind of turaren wuta that is sometimes considered medicinal.
pcm: She dey produce Durot one special kind of turaren wuta wey sometime na medicine

eng: She advises her female customers to purchase this particular turaren wuta to help fight minor infections and leave them feeling fresh and good.
pcm: She kom advise her female customer to dey buy turaren wuta to dey help dem fight infection and make dem to dey dey fresh and good

eng: She told our reporter that her most patronised scents are the Desired orbs and Thirteen scents.
pcm: She tell awa reporter say pesin wey dey patronise her scent na di Desired orbs and Thirteen scent

eng: Kano farmers trained on seed multiplication
pcm: Dem train dem Kano farmer on seed multiplication

eng: The Sasakawa Africa Association (SAA), in collaboration with the Kano State Government and the Islamic Development Bank, has conducted a pre-dry season training of seed multiplication for farmers.
pcm: Di Sasakawa Africa Association (SAA) wey dey collaborate wit di Kano State goment and di Islamic Development Bank, don conduct pre-dry season trainin of seed multiplication for dem farmer

eng: According to Sasakawas senior crop productivity enhancement officer, Mr Benjamin Adamu Shamaki, the training is aimed at ensuring a healthy circulation of improved seeds to the farmers.
pcm: Accordin to Sasakawa  wey be senior crop productivity enhancement officer, Mr Benjamin Adamu Shamaki, di trainin dey aim to ensure say healthy circulation of improve seed to di farmer

eng: He added that 20 seed multiplication farmers had been supported to breed improved rice and maize seeds.
pcm: Hin add say 20 seed multiplcation farmer don support to dey breed improve rice and maize seed

eng: He also said the project was targeting dry season farming activities in local governments that have access to irrigation facilities.
pcm: Hin kom tok say di project dey target dry season farming activity for local goment wey don get access to irrigation activity

eng: According to him, the project is for all the 44 local government areas of the state for an enhanced crop production, marketing and farm management techniques.
pcm: Accordin to m, di project na for all di 44 local goment area wey dey di state to enhance crop production, marketin and farm management technique

eng: We have 20 farmers from 20 local government areas with irrigation facilities.
pcm: We get 20 farmers wey kom from 20 local goment area wit irrigation facility

eng: The project is aimed at all the 44 local governments in the state.
pcm: Di project dey aim for all 44 local goment for di state

eng: We hope to continue with the other local governments when the wet season begins, he said.
pcm: Hin tok say; We dey hope to dey continue wit di oda local goment wen di wet season start

eng: A beneficiary of the training from Warawa Local Government, Malam Rabiu Bello, said he had learnt a lot of new innovations he believed would change not only the way he farmed but the whole farmers of Warawa irrigation, especially those dealing in rice production.
pcm: One beneficiary of di trainin wey kom from Warawa Local goment, Malam Rabi Bello, tok say e don learn plenti on top new innovation, him believe say him go change no be only di way him dey farm but di rest of farmer dem wey dey Warama irrigation especially di one wey dey do rice production

eng: LG polls: Our primaries successful despite violence, says Lagos APC
pcm: LG polls:Lagos APC tok say awa primaries dey successful even if violence dey .

eng: The Lagos State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC), has said its primaries on Saturday ahead of the July local government elections, was successful.
pcm: Di Lagos state chapter of di All Progressive Congress(APC)  don tok say hin primary for Saturday wey dey ahead of di July local goment election dey successful

eng: It, however, called on the security agencies to probe incidents of violence in some local government areas and fish out the perpetrators.
pcm: Dey call security agency to probe incident of violence for some local goment area and fish out di pipo wey dey do evil

eng: Daily Trust reports that pockets of violence were recorded in some local government areas including Surulere where two people were feared dead.
pcm: Daily Trust report say di pocket of violence na hin dey record for some local goment area wey include Surulere wey dem fear say two pesin die

eng: The election could not hold in Surulere following the violence even as the local government area was allegedly under siege on Saturday as thugs and cultists loyal to some party leaders took control.

pcm: But APC regret di violence, dey kom call security agency make dem go afta di perpetrators

eng: Spokesman of the partys Interim Committee, Hon Seye Oladejo, in a statement, congratulated the party members on the successful conduct of the primaries to elect candidates for the forthcoming Local Government elections to elect Chairmen, Vice-Chairmen and Councilors into the 20 Local Government Councils, 37 Local Council Development Areas and 377 wards.
pcm: Tok tok pesin of di party Interim Committee, Hon Seye Oladejo, inside one statement, congratulate di parti members dem on di primaries wey dem do wit success to elect candidates for di Local Goment elections to elect Chairmen, Vice-Chairmen and Councilors dem into di 20 Local Goment Councils, 37 Local Council Development Areas and 377 wards.

pcm: Oladejo tok say d exercise wey dey statewide see plenty members wey cast dem vote for dia aspirant wey dem prefer pass through d open secret ballot mode as di guidelines tok

pcm: him tok say; we acknowledge wit regrets di case dem wey dem report about skirmishes for few wards wit di fallouts of attendants

eng: We empathize with the victims of the unfortunate incident.
pcm: we feel for di victims of di incident

pcm: as we dey wait di formal reports of di electoral officials, we wish tell di security agencies make dem conduct beta investigation make dem fit bring di culprits kom face di book so dem go maintain law and order

pcm: di statement add say;about di same mata, di parti want join aspirant wey dey provoke, make dem approach electoral Appeal Committee wey Mr Lawal Pedro (SAN) dey head to lodge formal complaints.

pcm: As dem dey shoot diasef, two members of di gang wound serious wound and some escape wit bullet wound join inside nearby bush, statement tok

eng: Odah said one locally-made shotgun, one locally-made revolver pistol with five live cartridges, one jack knife, one axe and some charms were recovered from them.
pcm: Odah say dem recorver one shortgun wey dem make locally, one revolver pistol wit five live cartridges, one jackknife, one axe wit juju

eng: A Toyota Picnic was set ablaze by the gang, including five motorcycles of different brands.
pcm: dem burn one Toyota Picnic wit five motorcycles wey get different brands

pcm: dem attack innocent citizens bikos dem no obey di stay-at-home order wey IPOB give

pcm: Di victims wey get traumer don dey respond to treatment for Alex Ekwueme Federal Teaching Hospital, she tok

eng: One locally-made double barrel short gun with four cartridges were recovered from them,Odah said.
pcm: Dem recover one locally-made double barrel short gun wit four cartridges, Odah tok

pcm: She tok say dem kill one oda suspect afta polce and dem fellow security agency been engage him gang for gun fight for di Ikwo/Abakaliki expressway, Ikwo Local goment Area, as odas escape wit bullet wound

pcm: Adejobi tok am tok say durin most of di attack, di suspect don allegedly dispossess innocent pipo wey be dia belongin for di state

eng: In furtherance of the commands anti-crime measures, the police operatives attached to the Strike Team of the Command, on May 1, 2021, at 2 pm, arrested 11 suspected cultists and traffic robbers who were attacking and dispossessing innocent people of their belongings at Railway Crossing, Ikeja, along, Ikeja-Lagos.
pcm: To further di command anti-crime measures, di police operatives join di Strike Team of the Command, on May 1, 2021, for 2 pm, dem arrest 11 cultists wey dem suspect and traffic thief dem wey dey attack and dispossessin innocent pipo of dia belongins for Railway Crossin, Ikeja, along, Ikeja-Lagos.

eng: The operatives who responded to a distress call from one of the victims (name withheld), raced to the area and arrested some of the suspects in action while others were arrested at their hideouts.
pcm: Di operative wey respond to one distress call from one of di victim(dey no tell di name) run go di area and hin arrest some of di suspect for action wen dey kom arrest di oda for dia hideout

pcm: Dey don confess to di crime

pcm: Di suspect also reveal say dem attack dia target wit iron rod, gun, cutlass and charm wen dem dey operate

pcm: Wen dem police dey do investigation, di suspect identify one of dia receiver wey be Idris Adamu, wey be 42

pcm: Dem immediately arrest am for Alade Market, for Lagos

pcm: Na hin dey collect from hin hand him tok

eng: The suspects are Sadiq Masaki, 22, Oladimeji Olatunbosun, 24, Adam Hassan, 21, Tunde Afolayan, 24, Michael Ademola, 22, Olamide Johnson, 20, Abiodun Opeyemi, 22, Oluseyi Agbaje, 21, Daniel Ayomide, 20 and Adebayo Tobi, 21.
pcm: Di suspects dem na Sadiq Masaki, 22, Oladimeji Olatunbosun, 24, Adam Hassan, 21, Tunde Afolayan, 24, Michael Ademola, 22, Olamide Johnson, 20, Abiodun Opeyemi, 22, Oluseyi Agbaje, 21, Daniel Ayomide, 20 and Adebayo Tobi, 21.

eng: The Commissioner of Police, Lagos State, Hakeem Odumosu, has ordered that the Strike Team should profile the suspects and go after their gang members and conspirators as the command will not spare anyone who engages in any act of criminality, no matter its magnitude,he said.
pcm: Di Commissioner of Police, Lagos State, Hakeem Odumosu, has ordered that the Strike Team should profile the suspects and go after their gang members and conspirators as the command will not spare anyone who engages in any act of criminality, no matter its magnitude,he said.

pcm: Adejobi tok again say police oga also direct Commander RRS, di Commander Task force and oda tactical commanders make dem sectorise di state for easy operation and make dem carri all di traffic robbers dem and oda criminals so dem fit deliver di service wella, make securitydey for evribodi wey dey Lagos State.

pcm: Man United Liverpool game na hin dey don rearrange for 13 May

eng: Manchester Uniteds postponed home Premier League match against Liverpool has been rearranged for 13 May, the league said on Wednesday.
pcm: Manchester United postpone home Premier League match against Liverpool na hin dey don rearrange to 13 May, di league tok ham for Wednesday

eng: The match was called off on Sunday after United fans protesting against the clubs American owners, the Glazer family, stormed into the stadium which was closed to spectators due to Covid-19 restrictions.
pcm: For Sunday na hin dey call off di match afta wey United fans protest against di club America owner, di Glazer family, enta inside di stadium wey dem close for dem spectators due to Covid-19 restriction

eng: The rescheduling of the game means United must play two games in the space of two days as their home game against Leicester City has been moved forward a day to 11 May.
pcm: Say dem reschedule di game mean say United go need play two games for di space of two days as dia house against Leicester City na hin dey don move forward a day to 11 May

eng: Liverpools trip to West Bromwich Albion will take place on 16 May as planned.
pcm: Liverpool trip to West Bromwich Albion go take place for 16 May as dey don plan

pcm: Leicester blow Champion  Leaugue chance as Kane sign comot wit Golden Boot

pcm: Leicester blow di chance to qualify for Champion Leaugue for di second time for di club history as dem Foxes lost 4-2 give Tottenham for Sunday

pcm: Jamie Vardy don for second time put Brendan Rodger man ahead from di penalty spot

pcm: But Harry Kane, on top wetin fit be hin final appearance for Spurs, Kasper Scheichel goal and di late double wey kom from Gareth Bale secure dem seven place for di Premier League for Tottenham and kom place for next season for Europa conference leaugue

pcm: Chelsea 2-1 defeat for Aston Villa don open di door for di FA Cup winner to take advantage kom move go fourth

pcm: For plenti drama afternoon, e look like say Leicester go do am as Vardy slot for house hin first plenalty for 18 minute

pcm: Shior be beg federal goment, internation donor partner plus well-meanin individual and corporate organizations make dem kom help di state for dat regard, e stress di need for federal goment to release di N10billion wey dem promise Benue among oda state dem to take resettle IDPs.

eng: 12 killed in fresh Benue attack
pcm: Dem kill 12 for fresh attack inside Benue

eng: Gunmen have reportedly killed 12 people in several communities of Ado Local Government Area in Benue State.
pcm: Report be tok say gunmen don kill 12 pipo for inside several community of Ado Local Goment Area for Benue State.

eng: Witnesses said the attack on the communities was carried out simultaneously between Saturday night and early hours of Sunday in Tologa, Ndi-Obasi, Odoken all in Ekile Council Ward of Ijigban District, Ado Local Government Area.
pcm: Witness dem tok say dem carry out di attack on top di community dem at di same time betwwen nite for Saturday and early morning for Sunday for Tologa, Ndi-Obasi, Odoken all inside Ekile Council Ward of Ijigban District, Ado Local Goment Area.

eng: Chairman of Ado Council, James Oche, told journalists in Makurdi on telephone that 12 people were killed during a coordinated attack on five villages in his area.
pcm: Chairman of Ado Council, James Oche, tell journalist for Makurdi on telephone say dem kill 12 pipo durin one cordinated attack on five village dem for im area.

eng: Oche alleged that the attack was a reprisal by suspected herders after some persons believed to be IPOB members crossed over from Ebonyi State to his Ado Local Government in Benue State and killed one elderly Fulani man identified as Muhammad Isah.
pcm: Oche allege say di attack na reprisal by herders wey dem suspect afta some pipo wey dem belif say dem be IPOB member be cross over from Ebonyi state to im Ado Local Goment for Benue State and dem kill one old Fulani man wey dem tok say na Muhammad Isah.

eng: I suspect that the herders came on reprisal because of one elderly Fulani man known as Isah Muhammad who lived in one of the affected communities that shared boundary with Ohakwu Local Government Area of Ebonyi State and was recently killed by IPOB members, who crossed over to the comunity in Ado, he said.
pcm: I suspect say di herders be kom as reprisal bikos of one old Fulani man wey we konw as Muhammad Isah wey be dey live for one of di community dem wey dey affected wey dem share border wit Ohakwu Local Goment for Ebonyi State wey IPOB member dem just kill, dem cross ova kom di community for Ado, as he tok.

eng: Contacted, the Police Public Relations Officer (PPRO) for Benue Command, DSP Catherine Anene, was yet to reply to calls and text messages put through her telephone at the time of sending this report.
pcm: Dem don contakt am, di Police Public Relations Officer (PPRO) for Benue Command, DSP Catherine Anene, neva reply to call and text message dem put through her telefone at di time wey we dey send dis report.

eng: How local production of COVID-19 vaccine will save Nigeria
pcm: How to dey produce local covid-19 vaccine go take save Nigeria.

eng: The federal government has reiterated the need to have a home-grown COVID-19 vaccine for its over 200 million population, saying local production of the vaccine would save the country the cost of importation as well as make it easily accessible and affordable.
pcm: Di federal goment don tok di need to have home-grown COVID-19 vaccine for im 200 million population, e tok say local production of di production of di vaccine go savedi kontri di cost of importation as well as say e dey easily accessible and affordible.

eng: The Minister of state for Health, Dr Senator Olorunnimbe Mamora said that in order to achieve home-grown COVID-19 vaccines in Nigeria, there is a need to support research institutes.
pcm: DI minister of state on top health matter, Dr Senator Olorunnimbe Mamora tok say to achieve home grown COVID-19 vaccines for Nigeria, need dey to support research institute dem.

eng: He said this on Monday at the Nigeria institute of medical research (NIMR), Lagos during the commissioning of the next generation sequencing as well as a tour of the projects within the institute.
pcm: Na for di Nigeria institute of medical research (NIMR) he tok am for Monday, for Lagos during di commissioning of di next generation sequencing as well a stour of di project withing di institute.

eng: According to the Minister, Although there is a vaccine in the country, we will not stop research institutes from working on the one they are researching on.
pcm: According to di Minister, although vaccine be don dey for di kontri, we no go stop research institute dem from di one wey dem dey do resaerch put.

eng: Having our own home-grown vaccine is the ultimate in which case, we don't have to look to any other country for a vaccine.
pcm: If we get awa own vaccine wey we do for awa home na di ultimate for which case, we no go dey look to any oda kontri for vaccine.

eng: It is in our own interest that we ensure we get to that point where we can lay claim to our own vaccine.
pcm: Na for awa own interest say make we make sure say we reach dat point wey we fit claim awa own vaccine.

eng: Nigeria and 53 other African countries are yet to produce a vaccine for over 1.34 billion people.
pcm: Nigeria and 54 oda kontri dem neva produce one vaccine for dem pipo wey pass 1.34 billion.

eng: The continent is reliant on the vaccine produced from outside the continent.
pcm: Na vaccine wey dem produce outside di kontinent di kontinent dey rely on.

eng: The Director-General/CEO of NIMR, Babatunde Salako, revealed that the institute has been having a collaboration with the Usmanu Danfodiyo University in Sokoto and the National Veterinary Institute in Jos for robust research on vaccine development in Nigeria.
pcm: Di Director-General/CEO of NIMR, Babatunde Salako, reveal say di institute don dey get collaboration with di Usmanu Danfodiyo University inside Sokoto and di National Veterinary Institute inside Jos for robust research on top  vaccine development for Nigeria.

eng: Prof Salako hinted, While NIMR is currently using Gibson assembly cloning in developing multi-valent peptide subunit vaccines against SARS-CoV-2 virus, Usmanu Danfodiyo is employing bioinformatics and nano-technology to make DNA vaccines, and National Veterinary, on the other hand, is using reverse genetics in engineering New Castle Virus to express SARS-CoV-2 spike proteins.
pcm: Prof Salako be hint, as NIMR dey use Gibson assembly cloning for development multi-valent vaccines against SARS-CoV-2 virus  currently,  Usmanu Danfodiyo don dey employ bioinformatics and nanotechnology to take make DNA vaccines, and NationalVeterinary, for di oda hand, dey use reverse genetics for engineering New Castle Virus to express SARS-CoV-2 spike proteins.

eng: This is a serious effort to be supported by the government.
pcm: Dis one na serious effort wey goment go support.

eng: The newly commissioned sequencing machine, he explained, was acquired to serve in the molecular surveillance as well as monitor the variants of SARS-CoV-2 in Nigeria.
pcm: Di new sequencing machine wey dem just commission, im explain, dem buy to work on top di molecular surveillance and e go as well monitor di variant of SARS-CoV-2 for inside Nigeria.

eng: The machine, he insisted, would prepare the country in the fight against other infectious agents such as Lassa fever virus, Yellow fever, Ebola and other infectious agents characterized by the genetic code.
pcm: Im insist say di machine go prepare di kontri to take fight against oda agent dem wey dey carry infection like lassa fever, Yellow fever, Ebola and oda infection agent dem wey genetic code dey characterize.

eng: Gunmen abduct Nasarawa lawmaker, 3 others in Kaduna
pcm: Gunmen dem don carry lawmaker inside Nasarawa and 3 oda pipo for Kaduna

eng: Unidentified gunmen have abducted a member of the Nasarawa State House of Assembly representing Nasarawa Central State Constituency, Mr Ismail Danbaba, his driver and two others to an unknown destination.
